text: Been here many times, service always on point, super friendly staff, amazing food, great selection of beer, don't even let me started on the patio, best beer garden in las vegas. Family friendly and booze friendly too! Lol. Cheesey totz on the secret menu is a must have. Its your everyday american food with a surprising and unexpected twist

The nachos and sweet potato fries were excellent.  The fires had a slight sweet cinnamon taste.  The beef on the crispy nachos was killer, but the cheese was a little processed tasting.  They're not huge portions, but enough for the two of us for a light dinner.  Eating in the outside patio at sunset was nice.

We first visited Umami few months back and loved burger, had a great time.  So when we got a deal from Travelzoo we come for a lunch right away, but we are told they are not open during lunch time !! What a bummer !! We are pretty upset but decided to try week after for the dinner instead.  When we arrived at the restaurant, the hostess told us their kitchen is closed due to slow business !!!  OMG !!!   Our Travelzoo deal expire on 11/ 30.  Why no one took effort to inform us about restaurant hour change when we told them we are there to use Travelzoo deal. We could go on Monday ( they are open FRI - MON  we are told this time,  if they told us that last time, we could come on Monday easily !! ). I liked their food but very dissatisfied about this terrible situation.  Manager, you should do better job managing your restaurant !!
Always request Mandy. Best waitress on the strip. Friendly and professional. Definitely be back.

Amazing burgers,  Cheesy tots (not on the menu) are amazing We have eaten here twice on our vacation and that should speak highly as there are many amazing choices for food. Tried the Manly and Truffle burger and cleaned my plate both times. Our server, Casey, was awesome and provided quick service.  Will be back again

this place would get all five stars if it were based purely on our experience at the bar. we first got here and left due to our game (angels playoff) not being played. but came back to the bar where Liz  went beyond the call of duty to serve us. we will be coming back again because of the Liz and the bar!!! good beer, good company, and GREAT SERVICE!

Food is too small. Used to he bigger. Half off for locals apparently ever other week and we came in on the off week. Better off going to mcdonalds. A whopper is bigger than this burger. Weird sauce flavor. Dislike.
The truffle burger was amazing! My husband loved his throwback burger, we split an order of onion rings and they were super fresh!!
I'm becoming less and less reliant on reviews as I'm seeing the ones already posted.  This place was the horrible, the crazy expensive food sucked and so did the service.  That's all I can say.

A friend and I decided to give Umami at the SLS Casino a try and we were not disappointed. They had great burgers, a nice list of alcoholic drinks and some awesome truffle fries. Our server Courtney was pretty awesome herself. She was very attentive and gave us the scoop about RSVPing if we wanted to get a booth for Sunday's NFL football game to insure we got a booth for it; which each booth has its own personal tv. All in all I have to say we really enjoyed the whole experience. Ate twice in a row there so that has to say something about the place and the staff!

This place was fantastic! We stopped in by chance, and were blown away. My sister and I both ordered the Green Bird veggie burger they had. After a long night of drinking the night before, we wanted something light, that wouldn't upset our hangover. It was incredible, surpassed any expectations! The burger was a bit messy but that's not something I'm willing to call a complaint. Perfect texture, the portions were just what we needed, and friendly service! Very attentive. We are at the bar, so we could play while we ate, and even with drink orders coming in almost non stop, we were still very well taken care of. I never felt forgotten. Defiantly put this on your lists of stops! Just outstanding.

I'm usually against doing reviews online & any type of social media but for this one, I just had to!
Came in to originally check out THE GRIDDLE, just this past Saturday, cause we heard such great things. Stood in line for a while..but you know we thought if the food is that good..wait will be worth it. Sat down and waited quite a while and didn't get greeted. So we left in such anger with empty stomach and decided to go somewhere else. 

On our way out, we saw a burger joint. Only thing I didn't like about it?   It was way too loud! Of course my husband liked it. We got greeted right away but this cute little Asian girl, introduced herself as ANNE. 
She knew everything on the menu and us being hungry we totally took all her recommendation.  She even recommended this drink that I thought I wouldn't like, but she said if I didn't like it, she would take it  off of my check. I ordered 2 of that same drink! 
Now, that's not the only thing I was impressed by. My husband is very adventurous so unique flavors are good for him. As of for me? I'm a plain kind of gal. Told Anne I didn't like their um ami ketchup and I wanted a regular one. And she said we don't offer regular but she'll make it work but give her a couple of minutes. She went to the other restaurant to get us our regular ketchup. She also repeatedly apologized for the griddle even though she didn't work for them, that's more than i got from the restaurant itself! This place definitely won my heart! 

Great extra ordinary food
Excellent friendly staff, what more can you ask for? 
Turkey burger was the best and this one cucumber drink!
Just keep in mind, it's a sports theme restaurant so it can get a little rowdy in there.
Not very diverse staff and horrible service they should try and pick better employees, i will never go back. Food was ok i get better food at red robin
We just had a delicious burger at Umami! Perfect. Simple. Delicious. And our server, Mandy was so helpful and friendly!! Would def return
I was there last Saturday afternoon and not only were the burgers and fries amazing but Mandy was the best server I have had. Very sweet and on top of it and very tentative. Highly recommend!
Of quality/flavorful food, great service, ambiance on point and fantastic sports screen!

This was the worst dining experience I've ever had in Vegas. The food was so-so.  The food is overpriced.  The service was just OK.   I do not recommend going here. However, I do recommend The restaurant bring in Robert Irvine to help them turn things around.
Hands down the best burger I've ever had. Umami burger is so bomb i ordered two! Only $11.95, such a unique tasting burger and the patty was so big too. Highly recommended this!

Regardless of the reviews, wanted to check out the hotel so decided to eat here since we were craving for burgers. Ordered the truffle burger, the ahi burger and the plain fries.  Got seated rt away but weren't approached immediately for orders, kinda got bored waiting....and they weren't packed.  Finally got our order and wasn't too pleased with the taste. I feel like it was missing something....!! Taste! Not worth the price. Beers were good, fries were good, but burgers from this burger joint are not. Needs improvement.

Food is great, though the house ketchup is a little over powering for fries. First time we went they allowed me to get Heinz, second time the woman at the bar says they don't have it.

Both times service was slow and uncaring. 

Get it to go.
Great food and drinks. Great place to catch the game. Our bartender Safa was very attentive and recommended great beers and food from the menu. Would definitely recommend for a relaxed Sunday night!
Awsome food!!! Really liked the truffleburger, it was amazing. We also had the korean fries with goat cheese, and there was so much flavor!

Not my cup of tea. My turkey burger was small and puck-like- for $15 it was pretty anti climactic. Truffle fries were not what I'm used to. Maybe it's different in my region of the country, but I found the truffle, liquid, cheese mess - I found myself trying to eat fries without the truffle goo on them. Staff and service was awesome.

Very friendly staff. Great Burgers. Unique menu for a burger place. Umami stands for savory taste. Savory Taste is one of the five basic taste. The ketchup with truffle is something you don't experience every day. Definitely will come back. This is my 3rd visit, Never disappointed.

We stumbled upon this when we were headed for the pizza place inside the SLS. The pizza place was closed & we didn't have time to go elsewhere. We're so glad we did! 

The burgers were AMAZING! My husband is a burger snob & thinks most burgers aren't that great. He said this was one of the best he's ever had, kids said the same. I had an awesome salad. The service was fantastic, friendly & fast, which we appreciated since we had a flight to catch. The manager stopped by for a bit & chatted, offered a few suggestions of other places to try.

Bottled beer selection is pretty decent, the tap beer selection not very interesting - given the absolutely massive selection of good craft beers around, they could get a few more interesting beers on tap.

Mandy was a fantastic server, and a very sweet, funny and tentative. The burgers definitely had that umami factor. The mix of the sweet, salty, savory was on point. The temp on the food was perfect. The fries were pretty decent.

Eaten at this location and the one in Miami. DELICIOUS. Anything truffle has my name on it. 
Had the Royale burger and truffle fries. Also had the Bloody Mary wasn't impressed but that's okay. Was good service and the food was spot on! #Truffle

The food was ok, the service was great. The manager came out with our food and checked on us twice.  He also brought us a complimentary desert because the food took a little longer than he thought it should have.  We had a coupon from the Starwood Hotel for a free beer.  We were told that it was only good for Rolling Rock... which is fine if that is what you like.  However, the hotel coupon did not indicate the beer type was limited to Rolling Rock so I was somewhat disappointed. I also tried using yelp for a free beer and we were told we would have to spend $40 to use both the yelp and hotel coupons.  When it came time to pay, they gave us credit for both coupons (and I did not drink Rolling Rock). I had a burger and fries which did not sit well with me later in the evening.
Mandy is the atomic bomb of all bomb diggities. Great service, great atmosphere and she never spits in your food. All you could ask for at a restaurant.

Shout out to the bartender Charisma who held it down for super bowl 2016. She served us well and happy all day long. She was super busy with all the bar patrons. I appreciate her patience. Thank you Charisma!
My server yesterday was a sweet girl!  Food was good! Tuna burger and Green veggie one supper yummy!
My hubby loved his burger.  We both liked their onion rings.  I ordered my burger plain with lettuce wrap... so it was ok.
Although the server is nice the service is HORRIBLE.  Lost or forgotten orders from both the kitchen and bar.  For how over priced it is I expect better service.

We really enjoyed the food and the service here. Courtney and Leslie were amazing, funny and very professional.  We were celebrating with our friends and they made it very memorable for us. The Tuna Poke was Delicious! Highly recommend this place.
Great service!!! Unami burger and truffle fries are awesome!!! Will be back for this!!

Umami will remain my favorite burger spot whenever I'm in the area. Stopped by here for lunch with my hubby and there was no wait although the dining room was pretty packed. We ordered a Cali Burger, sweet fries, and two beers from the local brewer. The beer was so cold and so yummy! The burgers were cooked to perfection and service was quick and courteous. Thanks again UMAMI!!!!!
Decent, but didn't meet my expectations. The carmelized onions on my hamburger overwhelmed all of the other flavors(roasted tomato,parmesan crisp,and mushroom). Ketchup was good; on the sweet side.
Truffle fries were salty, burger is not the easiest to eat. But Charlie is the man. So attentive even though it was busy and they were understaffed. Great customer service!

Ok it has cold beer which is a plus ( and you can smoke outside... Sort of) but as far as food goes- place can steady compete with McDonalds...service... Well, what you can expect from McDonalds ? That they will get your order correct ... Well, that was not the case... Taste wise... McDonalds but nothing more
Great place to have a spectacular burger. Loved. Will be coming back!!!! Ask for Mandy, one of Vegas top 10 servers!
Had such a great lunch here today. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the truffle burger, truffle fries and sweet potato fries! Thank you Tashja for the wonderful service!!!
Burgers are very good.  Excellent beer menu.  Service was quick and friendly.  Great place to watch sports and eat.
This place sucks! The burgers suck. The fries suck. The cheese tots suck. Rather go to In-N-Out. At least the service was good.
What is the point of a beer garden on an nfl sunday attached to a sportsbook if you are not going to have a bartender. its like tits on a bull.
Manly Burger fantastic- Safa at the bar is very knowledgeable on menu and beer selection, friendly, and great svc overall from start to finish! Thanks and will come back w friends.
Go to Safa and Natalia. They were the best! The truffle burger is bomb. And the truffle fries are really good also

Another trendy burger joint in an image, fad following Hotel. To say this is another dime a dozen burger joint is spot on.

As a local, and a foodie in Las Vegas I don't usually subscribe to reviews that I read about restaurants until I experienced it myself. Well, apparently the reviews on this place are spot on. All I have to say is save your time and money and go to Bachi burger for a Wagyu burger for the same price as the smaller truffle burger you get here. Minimal flavor, and the portion sizes are very small. Much better quality at Bachi and the truffle fries are much to be desired. Also I could use a little less of the football Mongoloids at the sports bar. If we don't keep them honest they're are just going to keep churning out mediocre burger joints.

I posted the burgers from this restaurant as well as Bachi burger, and you tell me which one looks better.
Overrated, burgers are small and the prices are high. Truffle fries smelled super funky and definitely not that trufflie.

Was curious to try this restaurant, but should have taken the advice of previous reviewers and skipped it.  Service started out a bit slow and went downhill from there.  I had the original burger and hubby had the royale.  He said his was pretty good, but mine had zero flavor.  Thank goodness the fries were salty - at least it was some flavor!  Had to borrow the ketchup from the next table as we could not find someone to bring us any.  Our waitress didn't even come to check on us until we were nearly done.  Wasn't offered a refill on my tea until they brought the check.  The table next to us seemed to have issues with their experience as well.  For the money, there are far better places in Las Vegas.  Sticking to Bachi Burger!
would have stayed to eat but game was so loud couldn't hear waitress talk. no dumb to scream at everyone at table. turn it down!
Tashja was an amazing waitress. She helped us out with the menu and was able to go over everything in terms or ingredients and sauces. Awesome!
Great service by Courtney! Awesome food. Great beer!! Management came by and said hello. Thank you Rachel for saying hello. I will come back for sure and have more!!!

Best part of our stay at the SLS was our experience at Umami. Our waitress Courtney was so lovely and accommodating. We felt so well cared for here, which is NOT what I can claim of our overall stay at this hotel. Manager Joe made sure we were taken care of and even helped us manage a promotion we purchased from the hotel. 
Love Umami, food and their wonderful staff. Thank you for your kind service. Highly recommend.
Great drinks, great food, great service! Amanda was my bartender/server. She was attentive to everyone and looked liked she was having fun. This is my third time here and I will be back.
Delicious burgers!!! and u definitely need to try the cheesy tots!!! They are sooooo good. Service was good! And Mandy was really attentive to everything we needed. We will forsure be coming back.

I recently had dinner at Umami burger in the SLS and had nothing less than a first class experience. Our server Ashley was attentive to our requests and very friendly. Umami's beer garden has great outdoor seating and to compliment that an extensive beer menu to compliment their many appetizers and entrees. I had the Ahi Poke for an appetizer with the in house made chips paired with a burger that Ashely selected. Umami Burger and Beer Garden is a first rate joint and I would strongly recommend friends and family to visit! Thank you Umami Burger staff and management for a great dining experience!

Underwhelming selection of draft beers for a Beer Garden.  Decent burger.  Tablemate ordered a can of beer.  It arrived after his food.  

Had this been March madness and the place jam packed, this would be understandable.  This was a slow late Saturday afternoon.  

Disappointing.

Wonderful team. Very comfortable seating available with a beautiful outdoor patio. Mandy is a wonderful waitress and deserves a raise. She was very attentive and had a great personality. Even the owner stopped to say hello. Pickle platter was our favorite!

This is my first time eating at unami burger and I fell in love with their truffle fries!!! I highly recommend! I also got the unami burger which was very tastey. I am also very impressed with the customer service, Tashja provided us with information about the food and also gave great suggestions!
Dog food would be better.  The nachos served with cheese from a pump.  The burger was dry and weird.  The fries were... fries.  Two stars because they had beer.

We had an awesome corporate dinner at Umami! We didn't have any issues making the reservation on the same day. Mandy was the best, taking great care of the whole party. Burgers, appetizers and drinks were delish! I personally recommend the Hatch burger and the Buffalo wings. The ambiance was great too. We'll definitely return on our next business trip to Las Vegas!
Nicest place to sit and have a beer outside when you're this far North on The Strip.  The Truffle Fries are worth the hype!

Went to the "Big Game" event Yesterday. My experience was amazing. Loved the vibe, food, drinks, and the giant TV screen they have. 

Food: Food was great. My friends and I had a few  orders of wings, which were great. The sauce was really good, we also had some nachos which were amazing. When I ordered them I thought it was going to be an OK amount of nachos, but when we got them I was like "Oh sh*t! That's a lot of nachos." it was a mountain of them. We also had some burgers which were pretty good too. All the food came out to us pretty quick, considering there were a lot of people there. 

Drinks: We had that all you can drinks package which was pretty good, so it was worth it. Got to enjoy a lot of drinks while watching the game. 

Service: Service was excellent! Food didn't take too long, neither did the drinks. Our server's was Eddie, I think. He was good, quick, and very nice, didn't take long to get our drinks. Always checked on us to see if we were okay with food, water, or drinks, which was awesome. The bussers (Joe and Eric) were real nice and attentive as well, we never had a bunch of stuff in the way because the bussers took everything we didn't need right away, so our table wasn't a clutter. 

This place was really cool, I love the amount of TV's they have, they're literally everywhere. No matter where you turned you couldn't miss a part of the game. The vibe was real nice, and hype. Seemed like it was the place to be! Only thing that could have made it better would of been a win for the Seahawks! Will be back.

Nice place in the SLS complex especially if you want to get off the Strip. Free parking in the garage which is getting rarer in Vegas. Loads of TVs with sports of every kind going on. Checked in on Yelp for a coupon of a free beer or fries with a $20 purchase. Wanted the beer but it was Rolling Rock so we got the truffle fries instead--delicious! Also got the wings--the appetizer. They were decent wings. Good deal on buckets of beer.
30-45 minute wait, food didn't live up to the hype. The nice thing about it is that it has sports book

Sunny took care of 8 crazy women... was so on top of it... great food... Sunny made it special! 7/27/15
JANET Veloz
Spent much of the evening outside in the beer garden and Amanda, behind the bar, was great! The beer spot on the North Strip. Came back the next day and had the tuna burger. Amazing. A must have.

This place is SO freakin delicious. We set a record with how fast we devoured everything. Highly recommend the ahi burger. 
And the waiter Kevin was very cool.

We are Las Vegas locals and saw a Groupon for umami burger.  Today is my finances birthday and we did a little running around town and figured it was the perfect day to use that Groupon. We have been to umami before and always have exceptional service and food. Today was no different.  Tashja took great care of us.  Attentive,  never had empty drinks,  chatted with us,  and it was clear she was that way with all her tables.  David who dropped our food off was so wonderful too! Everything came out quick and correct and he was so nice! Even as locals we enjoy this place and will Def.  Be back for the great food and great service!

Horrible service. Word to the manager reading this... If you have a line of people wanting to eat at your establishment, seat them, that's how you make money. Or tell them you have full service at the bar to the left of you. Rant over.

We came here with my friend and the first time costumer service was amazing the second time we went our server was not really good. She wasn't checking on us. We had to be telling the other service because she would disappear. But I really recommended overall everything was good. Food was good, beer was good. I love the atmosphere this place have. For sure I'm going back. On I forgot to mention I try the "manly" burger and it was delicious, I love the bacon the best part.

Best. Service. Ever. Tashja was our server and took super great care of us! Everything she recommended tasted amazing and the food came our very quickly. We were tired after a long day and she really went out of her way to make sure that we had an amazing experience. I will definitely be coming back to try more tasty food!

This is by far the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. We waited one hour prior to getting waters. The manager even came over to the table and all he offered was the measly water that we had been waiting for for more than an hour. The food was subpar the service was ridiculously slow. As being a Vegas local, I thought this was a poor indicator of how service is in this town. Although, I probably will come back again because I live so close I hope the service will be better. We also had to get our own drinks from the bar because they were taking so long to get to our table.

Was served by Jonnie at the bar.  Great food, atmosphere and service.  They also have mini TV's mounted in the wall at each booth which is a nice touch if you want to enjoy the game in the comfort of your own booth.  We had the truffle burger and it was great.

This place was great! Outstanding food and outstanding service! Our server Tashja was amazing! She never let our drinks run dry and had a great personality. Super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend eating here!

All I got was an apple martini so this review is based on just that :)
Apple martinis are my absolute favorite so it's hard to mess it up for me :')
It had the perfect amount of vodka, they didn't skimp out!
It was garnished with a cherry and was sweet enough without being unbearable.
Overall it wasn't EXCEPTIONAL but it was decent
It was $12 in case you were wondering!
I'm so sad I forgot to take a pic :'(
Sorry this review is everywhere I'm tired and I need a drinkkk ;)

With its great reputation and high prices, I expected a little more from the food. There wasn't much flavor going on in the burger or truffle fries. The texture was great, it just seemed that the flavor was watered down. Service and setting was great though.
Great food and great service. Good place to watch sports. Tater tots are good Napoleon dynamite would love these taters.

The restaurant was very nice and clean, while still having a rustic appearance. I ordered the Barvarian pretzel which was very delicious. It was piping hot and made fresh in their bakery. The pretzel was ginormous and was one of the best ones I've ever had.

We also ordered the green burger which was very healthy and made with a turkey patty. It could have used a little more flavor but I appreciated their healthy spin on a burger.

Five stars only because my server, Tashja, was fantastic.  Otherwise prob 3.5 to 4 stars.

I sat for 15 min before flagging down Tashja.  It wasn't her table but idiot that had my table was too busy paying attention to the NFL games than customers.  Managers on duty were not attentive to floor.

Tashja recommended the truffle burger which was fantastic.  Their two big screens are huge but one seemed to stay on the betting odds instead of a game.  Regardless huge screens and no smoking from what I could smell.

I absolutely love this place!!! EVERYTHING you need to watch a game is right here (SportsBook, food, tvs everywhere, hot waitresses, and a comfortable environment). The waitresses, AJ, Tashja, Megan are great. The food is great, and comes out fast! I highly recommend this place!!

10 min wait for seats. Food came pretty fast ....Manly Burgers, Sweet Sweet Potato Fries, Onion Rings and the Kale Salad....but the fries were cold. We informed our server who sent them back and fresh, hot fries appeared 10 min later, along with the manager who apologized and comped us the fries. The server was very friendly and convinced us ( quite easily) to try dessert Snickerdoodle cookie, salted caramel ice cream sandwich from Coolhaus YUMMM!! We ( 4 ladies) enjoyed our meal. The restaurant is in the SLS Hotel on the far end of the strip, but worth checking out!

Local's perspective.

The sunny side burger with the sweet potato fries, WOW! SO. GOOD!  Ask them to make a spicy margarita.  It's not on the menu but the server had the bartender make it (after a little bit of attitude first) but wow did they come out good.  
 
This place has a MASSIVE outdoor patio with ample seating, lots of TVs, and great exposure to the strip.

The service was okay but nothing great.  Hostess walked off without telling us to follow him.  It took much longer than it should have to get our food and drinks.  It was a Saturday morning and hardly anyone in the place.  That's my reason for 3/5 rather than a 4/5. 

Other than that though the food was good, great presentation, decent portion, and a good experience. 

Will be back again in the future.

Great food and waiters but please sort out the grumpy and inefficient staff who make you wait and feel unwelcome whilst waiting to be seated!

The vegetarian options are great and was glad to see they offer to replace all beef with portobello mushrooms. Try the Oscar Blues larger with fried pickles, absolutely delicious!
The atmosphere, food, and staff were amazing.(Ask for Sunny, he was exceptional, J/K..! He's a great server!)I would definitely come here for a big sporting event!

Hands down one of the best burgers I have had in my entire life.. The burgers are a perfect size and they fill you up without being full.. The atmosphere is awesome.. The beer selection is amazing too.. They always take care of locals too.. When you go inside ask for Mandy.. She is my favorite server inside and she takes care of you.. Also try the cheesy tots.. Heaven

Oh dear...the one in Santa Monica is one of the greatest places ever. Not here. I was ignored for 20 minutes before the staff even acknowledged me. And did I get a "hello, how are you? Sorry for the wait, how may I help?" No. I get a surly "Did you want something?" Well yes, obviously, you ignoramus. Anyway, won't be ruturning, I could die of old age waiting for a beer to arrive.

I came to SLS during March Madness to watched all the games and place bets at the sports book. I was lucky enough to come during one of the Umami Beer Tap takeovers. They featured (four Peaks) the Kilt lifter was my favorite. Staff was very knowledge when it came to beer. Food was also great.. I find myself coming in every other week for some good brew and a Manly burger.
Umami is Definitely doing it Right!!

My wife and I tried this brand new LV location for lunch, I ordered the manly burger, honestly I was very disappointed, it was slightly bigger than a slider, not worth $15, taste and quality average, I've had lots better that were less $. The big problem we had was with my wife's order, she got the Korean style brat, as she was digging into this brat she found the casing which was as tough as a rubber glove, couldn't even cut it with a steak knife, our very nice waiter was concerned and helpful and offered her another item, she ordered the Boring salad, not quite boring, after a few bites of this salad she noticed a few leafs and jicama had black gritty dirt on them! Our waiter felt really bad and got the manager. The manager offered to take both items off the bill but was hardly concerned about anything, she was more interested reading her texts on her phone, she didn't even ask us what was wrong and took no initiative to bring my wife's food back to the kitchen and check with their staff, absolutely no concern and no people skills. Not coming back to this place

Great food, juicy burgers with outstanding flavor.  I don't mind paying for top-quality beef, and this place does it up right.  They're not afraid to serve it medium-rare and drippy-good.  We tried a verity of burgers at our table, with the Manly Burger and the Truffle Especiale getting top marks.  MANDY was top-notch, had a solid knowledge of their impressive beer menu, and was passionate about taking the time to recommend pairings.  Great server!

Its a burger joint with the food and atmosphere you'd expect from a burger joint. The burgers do not include fries, which makes your meal pricier than you would expect. They do offer a veggie burger, which was okay but nothing special.
Me and my boyfriend came to Umami for our weekly date night and we LOVED it! Our server Brooke was very helpful and so much fun! I definitely recommend the LOLITA cocktail. AMAZING.

Ordered the green bird burger, ahi poke, maple fries, and a velvet mule...SO MUCH FLAVOR IN EVERYTHING WE ATE. And I wanna say that was one of the best burgers I've ever had. Thanks to our server...I don't remember his name I think Will? Anyways definitely recommend this place!
Yummy! The food was delicious. The service is semi slow but very friendly servers. I recommend sitting outside.

Food, staff, and overall experience was exactly what I was looking for while in The city....casual, sports bar environment, great burgers but fantastic service. Amanda and the crew behind the bar will bring us back every time.

I was excited to come here. Not just for the burgers but for the beer garden as well. We ended up just going to the bar bc there was no hostess seating the half a dozen people standing at the door. We get to the bar and it takes 20 min to sample only 4 beers, which were all pilsner type beers so very limited variety. Their bottle selection was small with only a couple feesible options. The rest of their bottled beers are anywhere between $20-$50. I'm sorry but for just opening, the service sucked and so did their selection of beers :'(

Truffle burger is the best burger there is! Server Carlos did a fantastic job and provided outstanding service. Second time here in my four days in Vegas and plan on making Umami a must visit any time I come to Vegas!
I got the umami burger and my wife the truffle burger. The truffle burger was bananas. Great service also thanks to Tashja!

Had a phenomenal experience here! Our server, Sunny, was super attentive, nice, helpful and a genuine sweetheart. He definitely made our Umami experience a GREAT one! Will definitely be back on our next visit to Las Vegas. Yay SUNNY!!! Thank you for your amazing service.

Original burger is pretty good. Bun is a tad dry. Onion ring is well executed but nothing special. But the house ketchup is a must try.  The pork belly kimchi hot dog is downright disgusting.  It's too salty and tastes like eating week old feet.  (This is coming from someone that loves kim chi.) Service is just so so. It took them a long time to clear my dirty plates and there's hardly anyone in this restaurant.

Very good food. Truffle Fries was amazeballs. My boyfriend managed to get a a 2$ glass of Bud Light. Drinks are pretty good. I ordered the Manly Burger. Service was alright. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Will come back for more next time!

Told a friend about the great tasty burgers at Umami and he said he wanted to try it out. I had the Cali and he had the Umami, both were outstanding. Our server, Tashja, was very good. She was attentive and made a nice beer recommendation. Only minor negative was the sweet potato fries. They were limp and meh. Overall, I still give Umami a positive review. Best Burger in a long time.
Fries were good but the portions are small. Slow service. Not worth the price. Stay on the other side of the strip and don't waste your time on this place.

4 of us ate here for lunch March 6/15. The service was excellent. Mandy made some great recommendations. We had the manly burger medium rare and it was so deliciously  tender. Our friend tried the Ahi Tuna burger and said it was awesome. Try the truffle fries and onion rings. The dips made in house were so amazing. We found the portions to be just right to enjoy.  We did not leave hungry.  Would definitely return and recommend this restaurant. Thanks again to Mandy.

Great place to come for sports viewing and great food. Came during monday night football but I also wanted to watch a certain NBA game. Lucky for me we had the best server ever, Tashja! She made our dining experience very enjoyable. Not only was she extra friendly, attentive and very personable, but she hooked me up with the game I needed to see on our very own tv at our table. Burger and fries were very good and the nachos were bomb! Thank you Tashja for a great evening and we will be returning soon!

Our first time at this Umami burger was so awesome, we came back for round 2. Manly burger is our favorite!! Ahi poke appetizer is addictively delicious. Umami burger is the best burger I've ever had... Ever!! Ask for Sunny to be your server. You won't regret it!! (10 1/2 stars)
Mandy was the best server!! She was awesome. Food drinks all were served very timely and her recommendations were terrific!! Would definitely recommend!!!

Best Hospitality I have ever experienced. After being in a seminar all day my mother and I wanted a good meal. We walked to Westgate nothing open. Then walked to SLS...not a short walk. We get to SLS and are so hungry we are starting to get angry. We find Umami but they are full 20 min wait. 1 seat left at the bar. Liz the bar tender sees our distress and goes and finds us an extra chair to pull up to the bar and brings us fries without us asking because she knows how hungry we are. WOW we went from angry to happy in seconds. The food was great and Liz was caring for us the entire time. I will be back the next time I am in Vegas! See u next year Liz!
Wow. First time @umami and not only was the food unforgettable but A.J our waitress was AMAZING. could not have asked for a better first time.

By far the worse burger I have ever paid for. 
The meat had no flavor and the sauces did not help any. It's cool to watch games and drink there but hold the burgers.

This restaurant has no right to name itself "umami" at all. Please change the name asap. I have dined a few times at LAX location of the same chain restaurant and found their burgers some what "interesting" and don't mind to try them everyone going through LAX. However, the one here in Las Vegas was terrible. Taste is bad, service is bad, and ........  Raw meat in bans are served and don't have any taste to it but just weird feeling to my teeth. I stop eating and waiting for any server to come by. ........ Well, no one come by for another 10 minutes so I decide to leave because I needed to go you know where....... I came back to pay for it but.......

I rarely order my burgers medium rare, but the meat is so fresh I did. The "manly burger" was so delicious! Definitely gourmet! It had caramelized onions and bacon! The tempura battered onion rings and sweet potato fries were really good too! They make all the dips in house. Even the ketchup! Our server, Courtney was incredible! She was fun and easy on the eyes! Also, she recommended the caramel ice cream sandwich! Soooo good. Imagine a snicker doodle caramel ice cream sandwich. Good atmosphere. Outdoor seating is cool too. I'll be back.
I always love coming to Vegas because the food is worth it. Umami at SLS is definitely worth stopping by. From service to drinks and the ultimately; the food, this place rocks!

Stopped by here for lunch about a month ago. Not too busy, we were seated right away. The waitress, Mandy, was very nice and efficient. She recommended the Lolita drink and I ordered two. Very yummy. 

I ordered the Cali burger and my boyfriend ordered the nachos. Both very delicious!! I would definitely recommend this place to friends. A little pricey but that's what happens when you're in Vegas.

Fantastic service by hostess (Ali) the manager(Rachel) and our waitress (Megan) they all where very nice and willing to do anything to help make our experience the best!!  We also love the concept of a sports book and a restaurant put together we can watch the the game, drink eat and be on a comfy couch!! Defiantly a must be place when visiting Vegas!!

We had the best experience at Umami Burger!

Came in town for work and needed to host about 40 coworkers for dinner on our last night in vegas and I am glad we picked Umami. From the moment we called with interest to the time we paid our bill everyone was really nice and accommodating. Josh Ambrose and Rhitzie Legaspi were the waiters for our party. We ended up having a few food allergies that our waiters helped us figure out and get them food they could yet. Our team is a bit rowdy so after dinner was done we turned the tables into beer pong tables and had a blast! All in all this was a terrific event and venue for large parties. We sat out on the patio and the ambiance was fantastic. Book your next event here and ask for our waiters! Our waiters were the best and never made it feel like I had to work the dinner/event planned. 

Thank you!

Came in for an early dinner and watch some of the Stanley Cup final. We were seated quickly and had a great view of the giant screen. Casey took excellent care of us! Super attentive and super helpful when it came to choosing drinks and food! Five stars for Casey!

Great Original burger. Such a great taste. Could come with fries or something. But it is a great burger. The bartender Christine was fantastic. Its not often you find an employee who champions their employers products. I didn't really even want the original burger. She sold me on it and it was fantastic. GREAT BURGER.

On our way to our table the hostess said they were not busy and they sent servers home. 

Based on our service tonight they sent the wrong servers home.  There was only one thing on every tv, basketball. We were watching hockey, but before the third period started it was done. 

I ordered a pear cider which was served luke warm with a warmer glass. 

My husband got the ahi burger that he enjoyed more than my umami burger.  The garlic fries were not worth the title. 

We waited 15 minutes to get the check, then twenty to process the payment. 

Overall,  pretty disappointing.
Great food, the staff was amazing expecially AJ, will definitely be coming back to try the rest of the menue
We ate here at dinner time and were seated quickly. Our server, Lauren, was very friendly. The food arrived fast and it was delicious!  I had the manly burger and thin fries.
Service sucked !13$ soggy so also sucked. Sad I was looking forward to this place wonder why people rave about it. Stick to in and out...and they charge 20% tip so I guess service doesn't matter...
My wife and I were lucky enough to be at the Umami Burger sports book in Vegas.  Great place to watch sports!  If you are there ask for Mandy, she does a great job of taking care of you.
Really good burgers.... but retardadly slow service,  maybe if I dress up in a clown outfit and jump up and down they'll notice me. Flat beer didn't help

Loved everything from the hostess who seated us...to the waitress that served us.  Great variety of food for a sports bar. The beer patio is a great addition to this restaurant.  The onion rings were delicious.  Corona light on tap and they salt the rim so every drink is delicious.  Best service at the SLS is at the Umami burger.  Other areas of the resort fall short.

Bad, bad , bad! The burgers tasted frozen, the fries came out cold . The atmosphere was amazing but the quality of the food is some of the worst I have ever had. The allacart menu runs the ticket up. Which would be perfectly okay if the quality of the food matched it's price tag. 50 dollars later we couldn't believe we were paying for what we just had.
Megan was great. Didn't even punch Homegirl in our crew for sweating her over some ranch

I came in here on a tip from a local.  I just wanted a Cheeseburger, but I got some super cute and fancy burger that lacked cheese, lettuce, tomato, a pickle or fries and had a bun falling apart after two bites. I got the 5$ side of onion rings-some of the greasiest ever. All-in-all, I wish I would've went to in and out burger :( 
not a well spent 20$

This is an easy place to like. 

Food - This place takes its hamburgers seriously.  They are carefully prepared, well cooked, and well presented.  The french fries, sweet potato fries, and the salad we ordered were also all quite good. 

Atmosphere - This is a sports book/beer garden, and yet it was family friendly enough that I could have dinner with my 15 year old son. 

Service - The waiter was very attentive and responsive, and even took the time to explain how the mechanics of the various different kinds of bets that were available on basketball, even though that's a separate company in the same space. 

All in all, it was a very pleasant, tasty, and fun experience.

Seriously the BEST burger I have EVER had.  It was perfectly cooked and soooooo delicious!  Was skeptical at first but the food here had more than exceeded my expectations!   Do NOT doubt AND DO NOT miss!!!  Don't forget to try the cheesy tater tots... they are part of the secret menu and are served wit a jalapeño ranch! SUPER FANTASTIC!

After a long day I was craving a gourmet burger and heard about this place so I decided to give it a try. When I walked in I immediately felt a good vibe and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Hatch burger and it was truly one of a kind. The patty was juicy and filled with Hatch chile flavor. I hadn't had a burger this good in a very long time. I will definitely be returning. Shout out to the staff who was super friendly and very accommodating (hold this ingredient and add that). I am very picky and the staff was attentive to my needs. All in all a very good meal and customer experience. I'll be baaaaaaaaack!

Wonderful experience, we weren't sure what would be open in the middle of the night but I am so glad we ended up here, delicious drinks, burgers, and dessert. Jessica was extremely hospitable as well as the bar tender on staff. Would recommend as a must in vegas.
Our meal was fantastic.   The pickled plate was yummy and interesting,  our burgers and fries were fantastic,  and the service terrific.   Thanks Mandy!  We recommend this place.

As the name says burger beer bets, during any sporting event you can enjoy a great atmosphere inside or outside, great burgers, and great beer/cocktail selection such as union jack ipa or burning mandarin. We sat outside and the atmosphere and service were great as we always had what we needed. The manager on duty Edgar ensured the staff followed up and food quality was good. Keep it up!!!!
Umami Burger sucks. They only have like 4 burgers to choose from, the rest is a drink menu. The Cali burger was so mushy. Garbage. The service was good though.

Ended up at Umami for a friends birthday, and I must admit that I am not a big fan of burgers but this place was mind blowing... I cannot wait to come back and try more stuff. Great place to watch a game while sipping on a beer. Hospitality was beyond incredible. The manager, Edgar,  introduced himself and was constantly checking on us and every table sight. Will be seeing you guys very soon!

Good atmosphere, great burger, and the single greatest waitress of her generation - Abbi. Ask for her. 

I had the manly burger and a mule, but I've never been disappointed by anything on the menu.

Hatch burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had! Not spicy but very flavorful with lots of delicious melt cheese. The truffle fries were also delicious! Cheesy with a good amount of truffle flavor! Got them for free for checking in too! Lots of seating so getting a table is pretty quick as well. Good atmosphere.
BEST BURGER OF MY LIFE! The Manly with an egg was so on point!!! Are server Lauren was incredible,  her bubbly and genuine personality really made it a great experience. She is a ROCK STAR!!!!

CRAP FOOD poor service!!!! waste of money!!!!!
I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody.
Don't waste your money here, you'd get better food at a pizza hut!

I've been to the bar twice, I was met with high beer prices and unfavorable service. I'll never understand why a beer garden has a wall of vodka, but anyhow... We finally gave Umami Burger a try. The Code sent my husband 50% off for his birthday. It seemed like a good excuse to give it a whirl.

Service was attentive. Our waitress got started on our Union Jack ($9) and Mama's Little Yella Pils ($8) while we looked over the menu. We settled on the Manly burger ($12) for him and the Umami aka Original burger ($12) for me. Both prepared medium rare. We ordered two secret menu items: Cheesy Tots ($5) and Manly Fries ($6.50).

Prior to our food coming out, we were given house condiments: jalapeno ranch, mega spicy and garlic aioli. We were warned of the spiciness but didn't believe it would be as hot as it was. We enjoy spicy too. We didn't like the aioli at all, but the jalapeno ranch was the standout. It livened up the original burger and it was good on the tots and fries. Also, better than the housemade ketchup.

The Umami burger is topped with caramelized onions, roasted tomato and one shiitake mushroom, and parmesan frico. The burger to bun ratio is good, the bun was decent. I like the branding of buns - it's a good emphasis of their brand. The patty was of good size. All of which are good things, but why was it so bad? I wondered. It came down to the meat being overdone. It was dry and bland. There was no juiciness at all. The caramelized onions and parmesan frico were the only redeeming qualities. What's with one shiitake mushroom? You better enjoy that single bite.

The Manly burger is topped with beer cheddar, bacon lardons, onion strings and slathered with ketchup and mustard. It was not cooked medium rare, it bordered on medium to medium well. This was, however, the better burger of the two. Still, both were pretty disappointing.

The sides, though, were quite good. The tater tots were salty, potatoey, crisp on the outside and gooey in the center. I really enjoyed them. The manly fries were quickly consumed. Crisp shoestring fried topped with beer cheese, bacon and onion strings, kinda hard to go wrong there. I guess the secret menu is where it's at!?! 

In the future, I'd order a beer and tots for snack, but I'd definitely skip the burgers.

This place served me a generous portion of food but I was here mainly to chill on drinks with some friends. The beer garden is a pretty good spot to hang out but the service sucks in a bad bedside manner kind of way. Our server was attentive and delivered our food and drinks promptly, but this woman had an attitude. She was not friendly and pretty much acted like we were an inconvenience. I'll be honest and say we were a little slow to get our orders in, but more than half of our group consisted of European nationals and half of them with spotty English. You'd think someone who works at a place that caters to tourists would have a little more patience. 

I'd wanted to try this place for a good while. Now that I have, I can say I am unimpressed. I'll give it two stars-- one for prompt service and another because the security guys manning the entrances are helpful and friendly-- but I don't care to spend money here again.

Amazing. Live in the bay area and love the food. Noticed one popped up in Vegas and its 10x better with that vehas feel. Has sports book, full bar, couches, TVs.. etc.
And TASHJA, our waitress, was amazing!

Meh. Two of my friends ordered the man burger aka cheeseburger with bacon, they ordered it medium well and it came out bleeding, asked for new burgers and they were a little better. Didn't give us extra silverware or napkins. I ordered the turkey burger which was messy, it was good, but I was super hesitant because it didn't appear fully cooked either. Super expensive and sides are a la Carte. I'd rather go some place else

Great atmosphere and vibe, attentive and helpful service from Mandy who provided on point recommendations for excellent appetizers, burgers, dessert at a reasonable price for a new establishment within a new fancy hotel at SLS.

Sat at the bar as it was crowded due NCAA football championship game. Burger was ok, but not worth $13. Truffle fries were good. Beer was warm. Waitresses were obnoxious and never left you alone for long until ordered!  Then they wanted to get me a new beer when mine was only half gone, and wanted to take my food before I was done!  Then suddenly when my beer is empty, I couldn't get on to talk to me!  There are better options not far away.

Good sports bar and definately a down to earth place in busy Las Vegas. Umami Burger has a wide selection of local beers and convincing burgers with exceptionally ingredient such as thin tacos, eggs or avocado. The sweet potatoe fries were homemade and crunchy without beeing burned or dry. The burger meat was jucy, the bread had been fresh and the whole burger was  harmonious. Check-in on yelp and you recieve a free portion of fries or a beer.

We had some friends come to town, and they wanted to get burgers from here.  I had the truffle burger with sweet potato fries, OMG, this burger melted in my mouth.  The bun perfectly fit the burger, the cheese was melting on the burger.  It was so good, and the sweet potato fries were amazing.  Sweet and crispy.  If you have never been here, it is a must to visit you will not be disappointed.  We are local, and we will be back.

This is our first visit to Umami and Mandy was our server, she explained the menu very well plus she had bubbly personality that made our meal more enjoyable.  We will definitely come back to Umami for their great food and hope to be seated and served by Mandy.

Umami burger in Hotel is a great spot for an incredible burger, drinks and service.  Lots of TVs to watch any sports games going on, full bar with lots of great drink offerings (mixed drinks, wine and beer).  You can get your burger bundles in a wrap (lettuce leaf).  Sunny, our server, was great in giving recommendations and service.  I strongly recommend Umami (especially if you can get Sunny as your server).  I look forward to going back for a great burger and drink!

The best burgers at the SLS hotel and in my opinion on the planet! The beet salad was amazing as well along with the maple bacon fries! We ate there a few times during our stay and since we were there visiting family as well we took them to lunch there was 7 of us and our waiter sunny was not only pleasant but a pleasure to talk with and seemed to take pride working there! We will be staying at the SLS again in Vegas and they will 100% be our first dinner or lunch spot!

I have been looking forward to this burger experience for quite awhile, and sadly I was let down.  We actually didn't even get our burgers.  Apparently they lost our ticket!?  Seemed disorganized from our arrival...  Twenty minutes waiting for a table in the restaurant, but noticed at least six tables wide open.   They will text you when your table is ready, which I think is cool.   Sat down, got the beverages in a pretty timely manner.  Fried pickles were tasty, full spears served with a garlicky jalapeno ranch sauce (too runny, but flavorful).   Then it just went downhill.  

Our order of Cali Burger, Manly Burger and Manly Fries seems simple enought, right?   Well about 15 minutes after our pickle app, our fries arrived (very delish thin fries with beer cheese and bacon!).    Burgers should come out at the same time or shortly thereafter, right?   Waiting....waiting....fries gone... Have been there for an hour now....no burgers.  Got tired of waiting and just left frustrated.  Staff was apologetic, and Management offered to comp a full meal for us and our friends on the next visit, which I appreciate.   I'm not rushing to get back, maybe give it a month or more to iron out the kinks.

I know it's hard to make a bad burger but it's also hard to make a burger my wife doesn't share with me because she actually eats the whole thing!  I went with manly burger she went with the truffle burger and we shared truffle fries. Everything was amazing and the fries were unlike anything I have had and I cannot describe the truffle cheese flavor it's completely different for the better!  My wife said her burger was possibly the best she's had and considering she ate the whole thing I believe it. The restaurant itself was pretty cool too with tv's at each booth and a couple very large screens overhead. Highly recommended and the casino itself was very clean!  Good job crew!!

This place is amazing! Out bartender, Melissa was cute, funny and extremely knowledgable. Not only were our burgers she recommended amazing, but she knew her beers too! The red IPA she suggested after I started with a Firestone IPA, was awesome. 

It was a busy Sunday, and she was making drinks non-stop for all the waiters AND helping half the bar. I was really impressed by how flawlessly she handled it all. I'm used to bartenders in Vegas just wanting to up sell you and take your money, but here the staff is so friendly, and just seem interested in making sure you have a great time. Will definitely be coming back here for football on Sundays with Melissa! 

Also, I've read some reviews about the burgers being too small? They are perfect sized, especially if you get a side of the amazing manly fries. They have so much flavor too! That's why most Americans are overweight, because they want to eat 3 serving sizes for 1 meal!

This place was fairly good. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again, but if I were at the SLS and didn't have better plans, it's worth eating.

It wasn't good enough for me to remember exactly what I got, since it was a couple months ago, but I do remember that it was fairly good. The food took a long time to come out though, especially considering how relatively empty the place was.

I tried to like this place, but didn't have a great experience. Went there for dinner, ordered an appetizer and a couple entrees. The entrees came out before the appetizer. One of the entrees was the wrong burger. They fixed it, and the server said she'd get us a dessert for the error, which was nice. Then the appetizer finally arrived and it was also the wrong item! At that point we just wanted to get the heck out of there. The food overall was ok but nothing spectacular. The kitchen needs to get it together and get their orders right.

I live in Los Angeles and whenever I come to vegas I always make sure I make a stop here. The last few times were lucky enough to get our favorite waiter Sunny. He is always so personable and funny and always makes our time enjoyable.

We came here for lunch and ordered a burger, onion rings, and wings. Of those, the burger was the winner and the main reason for my 4 stars since it was the main part of the meal for us. It was soooo tender, juicy and flavorful. We really enjoyed it. The onion rings were breaded nicely and fried, but not greasy. Unfortunately they were totally flavorless. We told our waitress, but it wasn't taken off the bill or anything despite us clearly eating less than half of them. 

The wings were ok. I felt the bleu cheese dipping sauce was really a detriment to the wings as it was nearly bitter and a runny consistency....rather odd in my opinion. I love dipping my wings in bleu cheese, so I was really let down on that one

I also ordered a Pepsi because my hypoglycemia had badly kicked in, so I was really surprised to see it come in a bottle. Definitely trendy, but honestly, I prefer it from the fountain, especially for the price and no refill. 

The presentation was really impressive, the atmosphere was really fun and laid back, especially for people like us who had literally only been in town for maybe an hour. I enjoyed finding my hometown pro team stickers on the wall, and cheering on a few teams on the huge tv's. I really like how they have so many games going so you get a nice variety. We really liked the SLS, so it would be a place we'd gladly try again
Our meals were great! Had the manly and ahi tuna burgers - both were flavorful and fresh. Our server Sonny, was very friendly and prompt, also had spot on recommendations.
I want to say this was a very nice restaurant Mandy was from Memphis service and I really enjoyed it and I'm coming back
tashja was the absolute best!! very pretty, extremely helpful, great service ..she made the overall experience fantastic [ everybody take notes ] honestly, truly lol

SLS? Seriously Lacks Satisfaction.

This is no more obvious than at Umami Burger, destination for our latest foodventure. But foodventures are not always successful, as Umami (Japanese for something) would prove. When Mama R wanted a burger for her birthday, Emijandro and I found it as our opportunity to try the much talked-about burger spot at SLS and off we went.

My thoughts on SLS itself are... sub-par at best, but this review strictly focuses on Umami Burger, which we found along the wall fairly easily. Walking in, there was a very... recycled... feel to the place, which I thought was supposed to be an urban hipster sports bar vibe. But one glance at the CHECKERED FLAG CEILING ABOVE revealed they just gutted the NASCAR Cafe and didn't bother to redo the ceiling.

When we were seated, we were handed small, trifold menus. Mine was dirty.

Seriously, your F&B department could have printed a ton of those, but you're giving me a dirty one?

Maybe it was to hide the fact that the basic burger was $12. No fries. NO GAWDANG FRIES. **flips table**

I ordered the Manly Burger, without the beer-cheese (?) as I don't care for cheese on my burger. The (dirty) menu said it had "bacon lardons" on it. "Ryan," you may be asking, "what in the Sam Hill is a 'lardon?'" I didn't know either, but it's somehow related to bacon, so I took the risk ($$) along with an order of Tempura Onion Rings ($) and water (HAH TAKE THAT CORPORATE MURRKA!). Emijandro ordered the Jose Andres Burger ($$$) and Mama R ordered the basic burger. Well, basic according to Umami's standards.

The burger is an art form. I know. I'm a burger connoisseur. A burger gourmand, if you will. Its art is found in its simplicity. A patty made out of some meat, toppings-a-go-go, and a bun. Delightful. But at some point Umami just made it all too fancy-schmancy. First off, lardons are apparently cubed bits of slab bacon. I suppose that's fine, but some thick strips of bacon are just as tasty and probably less expensive for the restaurant so they can lower their prices. Secondly, would have liked some barbecue sauce on this type of burger (also had onion strings), not their Umami Ketchup (Japanese for something ketchup), which really was just ketchup, nothing really different.

The burger was too pink for my taste -- apparently my waiter heard "medium rare" instead of "medium please." Or he was just dumb or hated his job -- the service was unsatisfactory, he spoke too quietly for a sports bar atmosphere during the third quarter of Monday Night Football, and dropped items repeatedly  (fortunately not our food). When we could hear him, he was being pushy about us ordering dessert.

Listen, dude, I know you're supposed to upsell, but when my bill is already about $19, don't give me a look when we say no to dessert.

Which I could have gone for, by the way, because for that type of money, the burger was small. To be fair, I didn't leave hungry, but I didn't leave with that OMG NO MORE FOOD IT WAS TOO GOOD kind of feeling. It just left me with a general MEH. I shouldn't leave with MEH for $19.

A few positive notes: The onion rings were tasty, though I could have used a dipping sauce beyond the four tiny little ladles of sauce they provide, one being the Umami Ketchup (something ketchup), and one being HOLY CRAP MY BUTT WILL REGRET THAT TONIGHT kind of spicy.

Umami should be Japanese for "overhyped." If you want the best burger on the Strip, it's still at Holsteins at The Cosmopolitan. Or stay off-strip and you can find a lot of high-quality burgers at a much lower price point. Either way, maybe SLS stands for Satisfaction Low, Sorry.

Great restaurant. Great food but what stand up the most was my server Tashja. She went beyond my expectations. She make me feel like I was home. Great personality and great customer service. I gave her 5 stars because their was no more to give her. But I think she deserves 10. 
Thanks Tashja for making an espectacular fist time at  Umami burger at the Las Vegas SLS Hotel.

Others may like Umami - I just don't.  I like a tasty basic burger - and I think sometimes - the more stuff they are piling on top - it's to disguise the fact that the basic burger itself is not very good.

I ordered the Manly Burger, and I just didn't really like it.  I removed the bacon lardons cause they are just too thick for me to find appetizing.  The cheese is more of a cheese sauce, kind of runny and hardly any flavor.  And part of their thing is there is no lettuce or tomato or onion or pickles.  I'd rather eat at Smashburger or even 5 Guys for a tastier burger.  I did try the Sweet Potato fries, based on other reviews - and they were pretty good. Also, nice that you can get a beer - quite a large selection, and I think mixed drinks too. 

Our server was friendly and the food didn't take that long to arrive.  But the atmosphere here is also lacking, in my opinion.  It's like eating in the middle of a noisy sports bar - with TVs everywhere you look.  And if that's what you want - then that is great.  And then, also, with the Strip location - you are gonna pay way more than at any normal spot.  2 burgers, 2 sides, 1 beer, 1 pepsi, + tip: $50.00.
Second time eating here this trip. One of my top 2 burger spots in the world. Menu sounds simple but tastes extraordinary. Give it a shot.

I got the turkey burger and it was good but not great my husband got the umami burger and he liked the hamburger patty but not the rest. The truffle fries are ok also. The server was good but the waiting for our food took a long time.

Superb burger.  One of the best I've had.  I had the Manly burger, cooked perfectly with lardons and exceptional bun.  A bit heavy handed on the salt, but more than worth the price.  I had the lime-hinted pilsner to drink.  The cynic in me expected it'd be too sweet, but was not at all.  The lime hint was as an aftertaste...perfect.  The hostess was surly and seemed as if her face would crack if she smiled.  Oh well.  We're all broken in some way.  I'll be back.

Tashja was absolutely amazing! The service was efficient, and fast! She made sure we were well taken care of. I may even come here for Christmas and leave my family behind. I will recommend this place every time!
Amanda is an awesome bartender so accompanying and great beer very knowledgeable she is also changing games so u can keep and eye on all the scores!

The first time I came to this place a few years back, I absolutely hated it. Fast forward years later for a work trip and I happened to get placed at the SLS. The first night I was there I absolutely avoided it because I was scarred from the first visit. All I could remember was being disappointed because someone told me that they had the best burgers in Vegas. Still not true if you ask me but they are certainly good.

Anyway, my coworkers convinced me to give it another shot, so I did just that and to my surprise it was way better from what I remembered. I actually enjoyed the burger, fries, and beer that I ordered and I certainly felt that the pricing was pretty great. 

In fact, i went there for a second night and enjoyed another burger. My only gripe was that the wings that we ordered left me unimpressed but I definitely recommend it for a cheap good meal at the SLS. If I stay at this hotel again I am certain that I'd go back for another burger.

Ok so previously I rated Umami 3/5 stars because I just wasn't all that impressed by the food. (I had the ahi burger) Well this time I had the manly burger & added an egg to it.....phenomenal! One of the best burgers I've had. The beef was cooked beautifully, the egg was done to perfection, and the bacon lardons just made it. Now I can't wait to try their other burgers!
Amazing burgers, amazing salad, and amazing waitress, Mandy was awesome! Super helpful with making decisions, would definitely come back!
Little disappointed with size of burger.  Med  was rare- and who doesn't know what cave man style is ?  I wanted a BURGER and I got a burger.
Best  burger  ever. I can't  eat  other  burgers  now  cause  nothing  tastes as good  as  a fresh  ground  burger. Had  the  truffle  fries too which  were  good.
I give it a 4 star because their signature "ketchup" was not that great I think I prefer regular ketchup. The Cali Burger was SO GOOD tho!! Burgers are cooked medium rare

This was a great experience. I loved the atmosphere and our waiter Megan was awesome. She was really sweet and had great customer service. The food was different but good. It was my sis birthday and they gave her a free kamikaze shot. I would definitely stop by here if I'm in the SLS.

Arrived and was seated swiftly. The wait person was quite nice and very attentive. The kitchen was very slow.

Now, for the food. My medium hamburger was served raw in the centre and had to be sent back. After waiting an extremely long time to be served they obviously rushed the order and undercooked it. But that makes it all the more disappointing, because then I had to wait around again to get a properly cooked burger. (And let's be realistic, unless the meat is cut on the property, hamburger meat needs to be carefully cooked.) The fried pickles were excellent. The onion rings were obviously dropped into a fryer that was too cold since the batter was exceedingly oily and had little flavour and we only ordered them because so many people rave about them, only to find them almost a total disappointment that we didn't even want to eat.

So basically, good server, bad (slow) service caused by the kitchen. Disappointing onion rings and undercooked burger. What a disappointment... recommended by Thrillist, but maybe they haven't been here lately?
Burgers and service were amazing. Coming here 2x a week! I loved all of their beer suggestions and how fast the food cane out. Over all 10 out of 10!

My four stars are mainly based on the food. I've been here several times and everything is consistently delicious & cooked to perfection. Never a disappointment. Service on the other hand just keeps getting worse! My husband & I aways sit at the bar and there are a couple really good attentive bartenders there....if you're lucky enough to get them. Otherwise it's a challenge to be taken care of. They need to work on customer service skills.

Got to try Umami Burger since I stayed at SLS Las Vegas. I always hear about this place upon their delicious burgers! My boyfriend and I decided to eat here before we headed back home. We both sat down and look through the menu. The menu threw us off with the very limited selections. "That's it? Hm... ok!" Lol. I definitely thought it was more to it. We shared our order of chicken tender, umami burger, and sweet potato fries. The chicken tender was just perfect and crispy! Umami burger was juicy with great flavors. The crispy cheese! Yum. It's different, but good. Sweet potato... meh. It was way too sweet. It taste kind of like candy or maybe too much cinnamon on it? *shrugs*

-1 Star: Service was a little slow since I think there was only 1 or 2 waitress on the floor.

Overall experience, it was gooood. Must try, if you get a chance. Chill spot to hang out and watch the game too. I dig the set up with the couch and tables! Great atmosphere.

Overpriced teeny tiny "Burglettes" served,, and don't even attempt going for lunch during "March Madness" without taking out a 2nd on your home... Sheeshhh! 
More seats "reserved" (empty) than available for paying customers.

First bite. WOW!  Shitake mushroom, sun-dried tomato, and baked crispy Parmesan wafer.  My wife ordered this well done and I'm a medium burger guy.  This is a solid burger that doesn't fall apart. We agree this was possibly the all time best burger ever eaten. This is a lively (loud) sports bar.  Great place to hang to watch a game.  Take the Deuce or SDX bus from the strip to near the stratosphere.  SLS hotel is a Very nice Starwood property and casino. Very up to date!

My friend Kamala had read all about Umami  in a magazine article. I love non-meat burgers so, I really wanted to try it as well. 
We were a party of 4 when we came here for a late lunch. 

 We were seated right away. In a nice large booth.  The restaurant was nice and cool inside ,which is another plus. 
 Our server did come quickly to get us all something to drink while we looked at the menu.  However, after we got our food. We really never saw our server again until we got the check.  We never got refills on our drinks and we had to ask another girl passing by for a to go box. 

 Other than the service issue, we had a good experience. Enclosed is a photo of the menu. There's many different types of burgers to choose from. Yes, they are very expensive.
 However, you are in Las Vegas, in a hotel restaurant. So that is the Norm. 
 Kamala and I both ordered the Umami  burger.  It's a vegetarian burger. It has a lot of bread with it, I found it to be really good and had cheese and lettuce on it. I thought it was great. I will order it anytime .  Our other two friends both ordered regular burgers. They both loved them. The fries and salad are extra, à la carte.  We ordered regular fries and sweet potato fries. There was more than we could finish, so that is a good value as well .  The food is good, worth a try.  It's located inside the SLS Hotel.

SERVICE: Something is clearly amiss here. After ordering our drinks and food at the same time, we waited for 15 minutes as we wondered which would arrive first. After deciding that we would give them two more minutes for SOMETHING to arrive before walking out, our drinks arrived. Our server seemed frazzled but was very apologetic. The manager caught wind of our situation (or maybe he just saw the stopwatch running on my phone) because he came over to apologize as well. He offered us some "complimentary sauces" to go along with our fries, but, not surprisingly, those never arrived. (And I was looking forward to those "apology sauces.") Oh, and our check showed up before being asked if we were interested in dessert (which we were)! I guess they weren't offering any that night. Oh well.

ATMOSPHERE: It's difficult to tell where the sports book ends and the Umami Burger begins, but maybe that's the point. Either way, I can't say I enjoy eating while ESPN commentators scream in my ear about college football, but that's just me.

FOOD: Not much to say here. The fries were okay and there wasn't anything all that offensive about the burgers, but nothing stood out. So, as Las Vegas locals with lots of other restaurants to try, we won't be visiting Umami Burger again.
The caesar salad was okay. The vodka lemonade was okay. The service was excellent. I plan on going back for a burger and hope it's better!!

This was a very nice restaurant and the burger was truly savory as the name would have it.  I had the manly burger and it was so yummy and messy.  Very flavorful and the juices just oozed with every bite.  They put thick slabs of bacon chunks on top of the burger so when you bite into one, you just get a big chunk of chewy, moist bacon flavor.

Each bun was branded with the "U" logo which was pretty cool.  Not too pricey, but everything is Ala carte so fries are separate. :(

Looks like a great place for parties.  Very trendy, but when I was there, it was not too busy so although it was a nice atmosphere with large screens everywhere, the room lacked the buzz.

Nice drink menu.  Even offered frozen Kirin beer, which sounded yummy, but too cold for this Hawaii girl in Vegas!

Overall it was a great dining experience and would definitely go back for my manly burger....Yum!

Hubby and I had a great dinner at Umami Burger.  There was a short 10 minute wait to get a table for 2 but we got it just in time, right before the 5 & 10k Rock-n-Roll run got out!

Sunny helped us out and he was the most perfect server, a F&B operations manager can ask for:  attentive but not overbearing, quick but not clumsy, made cocktail suggestions for my cold (yes, I was drinking with a sinus/respiratory infection. #yolo)and THE BEST thing ANY server can do, which Sunny did with finesse, is to fix mistakes rapidly without making into a huge deal to draw attention.

I let my hubby order food choices for the both of us because I always end up eating his dish.  He ordered the Umami & Manly burgers, a side of sweet potato fries and the Beef Barbacoa Quesadilla.  Sorry yelpers, no pictures.  The food was so damn good we inhaled it as soon as we layed eyes on it.

This place is absolutely one of the best on the strip. THE best burger I've ever had! Came in here with a friend for dinner and right from the start the service was top-notch. We sat at the indoor bar and our bartender was Charisma. She was very knowledgeable in the menu, gave us some great suggestions on drinks (Try the Packard Clipper, it's delicious!). She checked up on us to make sure everything was good. When our food arrived, she made sure everything was looking the way it should. You don't see that kind of dedication to the meal presentation like that anywhere. Overall, this was an amazing experience and I will be returning here on the regular! Thank you Charisma!
Mandy was AMAZING. She was informative, and explained every item that we asked on the menu. Great experience due to her. Thank you Mandy!!

Extremely annoying! I called to see what time they where open till that day and they said midnight. (Even thow yelp said 2am but I called to make sure). My friend and I took a cab there exited to go because we've never been but have heard about it. We arrived at 11:20pm and they said they where closed....are you fucking kidding me? After I SPECIFICALLY called to make sure this wouldn't happen. They didn't seem to care that I was lied to and my trip over was a total waste of my time and money. Boooooo! To bad I didn't get the chance to try the food to rate otherwise :(

Bad service not our first time but most likely our last!!! Always bad no excuse not like it's in the middle
Of the
Strip even on a rainy day WOW!!!
The food was good and the service was even better! Ask for Mandy, she'll give you great service and talk football with you.

Waiter was nice, good was great, scenery was stunning.

Good food, and fast! Very well done.
Over rated food and way over priced.  The burger was so salty and just all over the place with the flavors.  I much prefer an IN-n-out burger over this place.

The service from our waitress Tashja was great. The place has a sports bar feel but makes you feel at home if you choose to sit on the couches and enjoy the sports games they have going on. I ordered the nachos which were delicious. I also had the greenbird (turkey burger, green cheese; ricotta and spinach, sprouts). Food was good and drink menu is very nice gives you time to taste things you might not have had interest in before

No this place is not good the waitress was rude and very hostel for no reason she charges me twice on my card and when I called to express my concern the management made it seem as if I deserves to get charged twice and hung up. Push come to shove I had to cancel my card and wait for another one this is nothing like the one I went to in the bay area do not get your hopes up high !!!!

I've heard about Umami Burger in LA but since I was hungover in Vegas, it was an opportune time to try this hyped up burger joint at the gorgeous SLS Hotel. I'll keep this short: 1) awesome and knowledgeable service by our sweetheart server Mandy 2) my friend had the Manly Burger & I had the truffle burger w/egg and both were delicious. At first glance, they looked small but the flavors were rich enough that it filled us up (coupled w/3) 3) SWEET POTATO FRIES. ORDER THEM. I will come back to try a different burger & save room for a Kool Haus ice cream next time

Came here for the first time, great beer list and Mandy was knowledgeable and friendly. All her recommendations were on point and she was very friendly and patient with our undecided party. Pretty cool spot to grab a beer and watch the game.

Extremely slow service and it's really. It busy. Menu is very small too. If you want something other than a burger, go somewhere else. This is not the place to be. With so many options in Vegas, I'd skip this one.

So they have a very limited menu. A few apps and 7 burgers. That's it. 
They're beer menu is varied but not deep. This is not for the beer snob - more for the novice beer snob. 
I had their Caesars salad. It was not fishy. Which is one of my criteria - few anchovies. However, it was bland to an extreme. There was nice lettuce, a few croutons, and those expensive hatch cheese crisps. And some white dressing that was undetectable. It was like 10 bucks. For lettuce. 
My server was great. Very nice and helpful.
