The outside patio was almost fun to be at. The concept was there - the execution was not.  Cheap regular wood patio tables. Next to the noisy strip/Sahara intersection. 
I'm very happy with the movement to strip side bars, but what's to see here?  The enormous intersection?  Three bus stops?  Not my thing.
Checked this place out for a quick bite to eat. Great burgers, and yummy truffle fries! Our server Liz was excellent! Highly recommend!
No complaints. The burgers are ridiculous. I had the Hatch Burger and truffle fries. AMAZE AMAZE. Our server Ben was cool as sh*t too.

Was there Saturday night, sat outside. Took a little bit to get our drinks but after that they were quick. BEST SWEET POTATO FRIES IVE EVER HAD! Ugh, oh my god, mouth watering. And I got the salad with the tuna, delish! And the snicker doodle ice cream sandwich, so good! Just an excellent meal all around. I want to go back and have the exact same meal. Good job umami

I don't understand why this place got horrible reviews! Since we stepped in, the service was over the top. Our waitress was very friendly and takes her time to explain the menu. 

I ordered truffle fries and cali burger. I fell inlove!!! I love the unique taste. Makes me want more and more! Our glasses of water never got empty. 

For dessert we had salted caramel and peanut butter ice cream sandwich. Both were very good! 

I will definitely come back!!!!
Service was poor. Pricing was deceptive.  Burgers were meh. Avoid this place and go to in and out burger. You'll be glad you saved the funds

Ordered the Manly burger and recieved free truffle fries for checking in. Omg they asked me if I wanted it medium rare. This is my kind of burger place! Not those pussy places that are afraid of their hamburger being tainted. Got the food burger was spot on nice and red in the middle, very moist great flavor! Awesome burger. I'll warn you on the truffle fries once  you start you cannot stop until you are scraping the cheese on the bottom of the basket. Service was very good. I would of gave this 5 stars except for the cost $30 for 1 drink and a burger seems very high. They get it and the place was full. The worst part of the entire experience was watching the MN Vikings let another game slip away.

The customer service was excellent. This is definitely a sports bar/restaurant. I was overwhelmed by how many televisions were in this place. Every booth has it's own tv. Yikes. So the food comes out. The french fries were good. I thought the taste of my turkey burger was just ok. My boyfriend hated his turkey burger. Later on in the evening we both ended up with bad stomach aches. Never eating at Umami again.
Great place to hang watch some sports/tv and veg on a comfy couch!! Absolutely love this place :) Tashja waited on us and she was Awe-Mazing!!!

So slow. We have been sitting here forever waiting for a basic hamburger. None of the tables have food. I would have expected better service at a nice resort. My husband ordered no onions, no mustard. He got both. I asked for ranch dressing. They didn't bring it. The menu says you get 2 beef patties, but you get one. Avoid this place.

Stopped in after an industry event and before catching my flight.

Open space with a lot of tv's for watching sports.
Excellent options for beers.
Ordered a Cali burger and regular fries.
This was one of the better burgers I've ever had in 44 years.
Healthy size patty with great toppings and awesome sauce.
Fries were thin cut and very good portion.

Excellent place for a beer, burger and watching a game.

Will be back in 2018...

Was okay. I ordered the poke with chips and lettuce wraps and the fish was kind of warm. It was super mushy too. The service was good. The music is soooooo loud here though I had to ask someone to turn it down so I could hear myself think. It was 11am when I had lunch.

It is amazing that I live in Los Angeles and the first time I try Umami Burger is in Vegas. To tell you the truth, I was a little disappointed. Perhaps, it may have been my fault that I got a Turkey burger over a Cow burger.....but nonetheless I still got a burger. 

Turkey burger: 2.5/5- The buns were fluffy and soft. I do have to admit that I thoroughly enjoy a great burger when the buns are fresh. I hate stale buns, what's the point of that. Secondly, I was mildly obsessed with the fact that my burger had sprouts on it. Double points. Thirdly, this is where I couldn't do it anymore. This green salty sauce was horrible. It overpowered the burger and it was extremely salty for my palate. UGH!

Truffle Fries: 3/5- I could go on about these. I love cheese on my fries and even better truffle oil. I must say that the truffle oil was a little bit on the lighter side, but the cheese made up for it. 

Sweet Potato Fries: 2/5- Why is their sugar on these? You may want to let patrons know that it is covered in sugar. I was thoroughly saddened by the sugar on these fries.....

Poke: 2/5- My fault for ordering poke at a burger place. It just sounded good at the time. Too much sauce that covered the poke. Not the best poke ever.....

After reading the reviews and accolades about the burgers here we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant itself is pretty impressive with plenty of open space and an abundance of screens to watch sporting events.

We were seated quickly but then waited about 10 minutes for a server to arrive. We ordered our food and appetizers and unfortunately both arrived at the same time. The food was average. It wasn't great and it wasn't bad. You could tell our waitress was handling more than her share of tables, so I don't blame her. I had the ahi tuna burger and it was good, just not great.

Dined here with my boyfriend one night and I had the truffle burger. It was not the greatest thing ever. I had been hearing about this place by friends and when I actually went to eat here I was quite disappointed. Maybe I just chose the wrong burger, but I didn't like it. It didn't live up to the hype everyone was making over this place.

We started with the pretzel, which is impressively large.  The beer cheese dip was so good I got a side with my chicken fingers.  My husband got the manly burger (also because of the cheese).   I had a Sahara Cooler which was ok...refreshing, but the flavor was a bit off for me.  Husband had the Original Sin apricot cider, which was ok, but I like their straight cider better.

The chicken fingers were indeed extra crispy and well done.  The jalapeño ranch dip was strongly jalapeño and the first bite was a little much for me.   When I added less dip to chicken it was tasty.   Husband liked the burger...saying the bacon lardons (like French fry sized bacon pieces) was weird but good. 

We also got a flight of the beers...mostly from the local Tenaya Creek, which were pretty good (keep in mind we are not big beer drinkers).  

Overall, a good experience, though the service when we first got here was a little lacking.

Great food great service! Hatch burger was awesome! Ice cream sandwich was last meal worthy! Tashja, our server was fantastic. Every time we had a thought of needing something she was there with it! We will be back!

Foodwise, this was the best burger I've had in Vegas. We were staying across the street at the Hilton and after finding Unami on Bon Appetit's top 50 burgers list, I knew we had to roll over.

We came with a group of 8 and were easily seated outside at one of the picnic tables. Only disappointment with that is that we were seated on the far left side where there was no light. And it was bout 7pm and so it was dark. Would have been nice to be seated closer to the lit bar, or inside.

Drink specials during football season are amazing and so our beer drinkers were very pleased. I had a tequila/ginger beer cocktail that was delicious and well worth its $13 price tag.

Food wise, I had the cali burger and smothered fries. Everything was beyond delicious. The burger was thick and super juicy. I like the homemade american cheese and the caramelized onions were perfect. The smothered fries were heaven as the short rib was very tender and the gravy was super good. I had some of my cousin's beet salad and that was very good as well. 

Service was my main reason for deducting a start as our server wasn't around very much. There would be long stints that she was gone, even though the restaurant was quite empty. She also quickly asked to process our check as she had tickets to a concert that night and wanted to leave as soon as she could. Made us feel really important.

Overall, I would definitely return for the food and atmosphere. This time I'll know better to request not to sit at the far end of the patio and will cross my fingers that there are no concerts going that night.

Sooo good. I don't meat and I've gotten this in 2 different occasions while staying at te sls. The truffle burger with the portebello mushroom patty as a substitute with the truffle fries, and another one that comes with a white sauce that was just delicious.

I've eaten at Umami Burger twice, and my server both times was Brooke N. She was super friendly and went out of her way to make sure we had a good experience. The food and service were both on point. I'll be back again for sure.

Unimpressed with their original burger and short rib style fries. The burger ju didn't tats that great. It was cooked nicely but the flavor just wasn't there. As for the fries, major letdown - soggy city. If it's gonna be soggy because of the gravy then the gravy should be decent

I love the food! It's getting better comparing to when they started. I had a vegetarian sloopy joe and it was fantastic. The ahi tuna salad was very delicious too. Beers are very good. The only downside is price, it is expensive for what you get. Drinks are expensive. Other than that, food is delicious and service is great!

I've heard good things about this place so I tried it with my girlfriend. Service was great but I personally did not enjoy the burger. I had a Umami burger I believe and truffle fries. I don't recommend those specific items.
The food was great but our waitress sucked....it was if she assumed that we wouldn't tip cuz she never gave us her full attention....always cut us off before we were done....wasn't happy at all

We were there last week it was fantastic service and even though we were in our sleep for three hours the waiter was more than kind enough to keep refilling our drinks and asking us what we needed.  Even though we are locals we have never been here before and we would recommend it to anyone whether you're a local or just visiting town.  I had the Ahi burger and it was absolutely fantastic !!
Great specials. Truffle fries and a burger. $2 Bud light specials during football game on the TV. Plenty of others on tap. Very bright space with couches and room at the bar. Friendly bartender.

I have to say the service was great because we changed our seating 3 times, and each time the servers and hostesses were very accommodating. When I asked the spiciness of a burger the server told me about the Diablo Burger, which isn't on the menu. It comes as a turkey or beef burger, with beer cheddar cheese, onion straws, diced hot peppers and Diablo sauce. I got the beef - it was very spicy but not some much that you couldn't taste the flavors, and it was delicious. I also got sweet potato fries which weren't very good, I got them with salt instead of the cinnamon sugar, that might have made a difference. My husband got the Parmesan fries which were just ok, the Manly Burger which he said was a really good bacon cheeseburger. The fries were a good portion and enough to share, I expected the burgers would be bigger but they were still filling. We used a Groupon for 2 burgers and 2 sides so this was a great bargain, as well as a good experience.

Service was great. Had a great waitress, very attentive. Food was lackluster. For Vegas fare I was really expecting a wow burger. The boyfriend ordered the Umami Burger. It lacked seasoning. I ordered the Manly Burger and it was decent. Again not the wow factor I was expecting for a spot that claims they won best burger in vegas. Big pet peeve they charged $1 for lettuce and ano$1

Pretty darn good place, in the north area of Las Vegas strip where there is not a lot of choices. We went with a big group, the wait staff was very friendly and helpful, we all ordered burgers. I had the hatch burger, and that was prepared perfectly, we also got an order of sweet potato fries and they were also fantastic. The burgers were not as big as I was hoping and I left a little hungry, but would definitely go back.

Either I was really hungry or this was one good burger!  I had the Manly burger which is a bacon cheeseburger with onion strings...seems basic but it was real tasty and juicy!  Also had a side of the Korean sweet potato fries that was covered with kimchi, goat cheese, scallions and korean ketchup...mmmmm!  A definite must try if you have the chance.

My first trip to Umami was pretty stellar. The burger was perfect and so were my truffle fries... I'm honestly not sure what happened in the 3 months that it took me to come back, maybe my palate changed? That and perhaps the service... no, the service definitely changed.

I'll start from the beginning. On my second visit to Umami, we had originally wanted a booth but were told that three guests were waiting ahead of us (still unsure how that one booth remained empty during our time at Umami)... we were also told that a private event was being held in the Beer Garden so we couldn't enjoy the nice weather either. We ended up taking the table that they offered us instead. The table was in the middle of everything, it seemed. Not only that, but in one of the more crappy locations to view the TVs. TVs were important during this particular visit considering that football was on. This table was also the table of a server who was either swamped or due for a break. 

A host dropped some water off for us but it took about 15 minutes for someone to actually greet us and take our drink order. We had ordered chips and queso to start, pretty simple. The chips and queso actually arrived before our beers. Chips were pretty bland, not sure what exactly I was expecting out of chips, but they were that bland that I feel the need to address it here, ha! The queso was also lacking some flavor. I was pretty hungry though so I gobbled it down mindlessly. 

The burgers were the main thing that we came here for. We had found a Groupon that offered dinner (a burger and a side) for two ($40 value) for $25... yeah, not really worth getting at all. The burgers were tasty, per usual. This time around we ordered the garlic and parm fries... they were simply okay. It would have been nice to have the parm cheese melted... but it was not. Simply sprinkled on top; the fries weren't even warm enough to melt it. 

My biggest gripe this time around was the Groupon situation... the deal said that it was a $40 value but they split the bill and only applied $25 to our bill! We basically just went through Groupon to pay $25 of our bill. What in the world? The server was nice about explaining that the deal was specifically for 2 burgers and 2 sides, and I understand that it was out of his control. Seriously though, Umami? Why list that you're getting a $40 value for $25 when you're really just getting $25 for $25? LOL! 

Overall, the service ended up being ok, after we finally got a chance to put our order in. The food was ok, nothing stellar like our first experience. This place has potential to be awesome (again)... just gotta go back to whatever it was they were doing 3 months ago. :)

Talk about amazing service! Megan was so attentive and knowledgeable. She made the lunch experience even better, thank you for that. Also the manager Joe is really funny and nice, so kudos to those two!

Our second burger in Vegas. I'm getting disillusioned.
The atmosphere was better here than at Fat Choy and our waitress was politer and more polished.
The burger wasn't as good - a little dry and crumbly (overcooked for medium). Toppings were really good, though.
 The fries here weren't homemade either. What is with Vegas and frozen fries? But I have to admit that they were good with the truffle sauce.
Beer selection was much better. though no local beers.
I probably enjoyed Umami better, but not enough to make me return.
Hoping that the next burger place is better.
Went to watch a game and both food and drinks were great. Staff was friendly and attentive to us for the entire game. Would definitely go back.

Hmmmm 
12 bucks for 6 wings 
They were dry and over cooked 
It a sports bar. 
Seriously?
You're making money from my drinking habit.
I'm ok with that. 
At least give me a descent wing. 
Holiday Inn has better heat and  serve wings 
"let's face it guys. 
That's what they usually are  at a hotel"

This is vegas 

Jeezus 
I'll give you money in slots
I'll give you money in beer
I'll  give you money in black  jack 

Common
Give me a reach around. 

Ask your purveyor for better wings and increase the portion.

My boyfriend and I were visiting Vegas for the first time and we stayed at the SLS. We had a long night and let's just say I had a little too much to drink . I don't drink often but we're in Vegas so why not ! Well I woke up feeling like my life was ending . After walking around we decided to just eat at Umani Burger. Our server TASHJA was beyond amazing !!!! Her service was above and beyond ! She went out of her way to make sure that all was well with me . She suggested food that she knew would make me better and listen to this ... she went to the opposite side of the hotel just to get me soup !!! If that's not amazing service i don't know what is . If you're reading this and you're visiting Vegas or if you live here please go see TASHJA at Umani Burger . She's the sweetest person I've ever met . They are blessed to have her on staff !  I want to say thank you so much and I can't wait to visit her again . She rocks !

hi, we went here dec. 18th , a party of 8, i agree with the other yelpers their burgers are WAY below avarage..... for the price $12.00 to $16.00 they are very small with a very very small patty, who caRES IF THE BUN HAS A "u" ON IT???   THE BUN WAS RIGHT OUT OF A BAG :(  the fries are $8.00 extra, theyre soggy, the onion rings are $10.00, the batter was thick, cold and soggy, very gross when you bite into one. one person ordered their chicken wings, very soggy with icky sauce... Why is everything so soggy ???? the patties had no flavor, the green chile buger was awful,  they also charge $3.50 per pepsi NO FREE REFILLS, ice teas? $3.50 NO FREE REFILLS.... you dont find out until you get the bill...... bad restaurant policy :(  everyone in our group said they were the worse burgers they ever had !! save your money......... yes......... we did order their apple dessert..YUCK...............right out of the micro wave.. the crust was tough and chewy... what a disappointment....weve never been to another location and sure wont...for VEgas??? terrible save your money:(

fyi: for a third of the price Smashburger has a great, tasty buger!!

There is no other way to describe this place other than  DELICIOUS. 

Everything was juicy flavorful and delish.

I was staying at the SLS with a couple of friends and we decided to find out what all the hype was about at Umami Burger.

There are some screens to watch a few sports games and eat. There is also a betting station nearby and video poker/blackjack. 

The food here is decent, and a bit pricier than your average burger joint, but the service was nice during my experience and the food was delivered quickly.

Service was fabulous! Sarah was a superb server and was prompt and attentive. I already knew the craft burgers were top notch - but Chef Mo held nothing back tonight. We had the Ahi Poke as an app, Manly burgers with truffle fries and a snicker doodle ice cream sandwich for dessert. I also enjoyed a Velvet Mule as a cocktail. Great meal!
Very good. Perfect. I got the greenbird and it hit the spot! The best part was gambling while you eat and the blackberry mojito got me the perfect buzz.

Part of the Sports Book at SLS, Umami Burger has a sporty yet comfortable feel. A short menu of appetizers and burgers (duh) but much more extensive choices of beers, wines, shots and bombs. Try the Clover Bomb, subtle and easy.  The chicken fingers were sizable and fairly tasty and so were the burgers themselves.  I had the Ahi Tuna burger with a side of sweet potato fries. Other than a flavoring in the avocado,  I enjoyed it. They do offer a cookie and ice cream desert but I skipped it. For a December Friday night,  it was fairly tame in the restaurant & casino which was a plus.

The burger was good but not as good as the California locations I've tried. Also we ordered our patties cooked differently but they looked identical. 
Good but not Umami Burger awesome.

I had the beet salad which was a nice portion, light and very good.  My husband said his Throwback burger was also very good...not huge and over-bearing.  But the sweet potato fries was amazing!  It came with 3 dipping sauces and their special ketchup.  This was a perfect lunch!!

Our waitress, Mandi, was helpful in answering our questions and gave very constructive suggestions.  Glad I did not read Yelp before eating here.

As I mentioned I would in a previous yelp review, I visited this location yet again. I ordered the nachos but prior to ordering I mentioned I hadn't eaten all day. They made sure to bring out my food promptly and continued to ask if they could serve me anything in addition! It's a must go for every time I'm there!!
Great burger really kind staff need a few other items on menu maybe and a better desert but over all awesome burger. Perfect burger really
Service was slow and it was pretty early in the day. We split our check but the waitress wasn't good at math and over charged us. They were nice but nothing to go back for

Lunch with my coworker on our laptops was so easy here! Loved being able to sit outside and our waitress Mandy recommended a really delicious drink (Lolita) - we ordered it with vodka instead of tequila and it was so gooooood. Muddled cucumber and watermelon - the perfect combo! Of course the truffle burger was amazing as well!

Went in for their recent #socialsundays for Vegas locals deal. I do have to say that while I didn't not care for my burger there were a couple others on the menu that I would still like to try. I opted for the Cali Burger. It had caramelized onions on it which I love but these were disgusting. I don't know if they made a huge batch of them early in the day & then just popped some on the burger each time it was ordered but they  tasted gross. They also made the top of the burger slide off in every which direction. Loved the truffle fries & the sweet potato fries. Tried the onion rings & while they were as big as a softball there was absolutely no flavor what-so-ever in the batter. Not even a little salt.Glad I hadn't ordered them. They were very accommodating to our party of 12 that included a child which technically they couldn't seat where they original sat us but did accommodate us by moving the sports book lines since there wasn't any one actually sitting in that area. Server was frazzled but she still did a great job.

Burger perfection! I was able to customize my burger and it was perfectly prepared. We had the tuna poke and truffle fries for apps. The truffle fries were a bit strong for our taste, but still good. The husband had the hatch chili burger and described it as awesome. 

Service was great. The 14oz beer was described as a pint, but the husband just went for the big mug anyway. I expect this will be one of the best burgers we will have on the trip.

Carlos was the da bomb! Super friendly and attentive server.  The food was amazing! Truffle and umami burger was delicious, cooked to perfection, along with the truffle fries.  Come here and your belly will thank you.

I like Umami Burger but not this location.

The quality standard at this location was poor and what the heck, why it has to be inside a sports book? We decided to take a seat outside but even there TVs hanged on the walls and people were watching them without paying attention to the food.

Great place to grab a burger.  A friend recommended me and it was not a disappointment.  My waitress, Mandy, was awesome.  She recommended the Manly Burger with an egg on top and it was perfect.   I've included a picture here. I also ordered the sweet potatoe fries which were nice and crispy and perfectly seasoned.  Great place to watch sports and place your bets too!
We come here all the time, we live across the street at allure! Great beers and amazing food! Sofa is a great bartender and mike is awesome as well!!

Fell in love with this restaurant! The service was speedy and so friendly! Everybody seemed so caring and really took care of us. I loved the green bird! Turkey patty too, so I didn't feel too guilty with myself after! Also their cheesy tots are to die for!!!  Will definitely come back next time!
The Manly burger was delishh! Mandy was a great server, super nice & very attentive! Definitely will come back

SLS had some deal with my room that gave us an app and 2 drinks for free with the room rate at any of the restaurants in the hotel, so we scoped them out and ended up at Umami Burger.

We chose the nachos - it just seemed like a simple choice. Definitely worth it. I would say that they are a smaller portion than what you would normally get - but delicious none the less. 

Umami burger - yes. Just as described. Split one of these, the parmesan, onions, burger - combination melts in your mouth and I will be getting this again.

Beer selection - yes! they have a great beer selection and plenty of TVs to watch your games.  Definitely a great sports bar option on the strip.

I'm familiar with this place from Los Angeles.  I had great service when I came.  They were a little out of sorts/ unorganized but it was opening weekend so I expected some hiccups. 
I like the burgers. The manly fries are killer. Ice cream sandwich with mint chip was good as well.  
I'm sure you could probably customize some burgers to your liking if the menu items don't tickle your fancy.
I will definitely come back.

Meh this location doesn't have the full selection as the other umami burger chains do. Considering the diverse selection of food that Vegas has there are definitely better options for burgers/food (mesa grill as an example!). The burger was fine, but honestly I would have been just as happy eating a meal from five guys for a little less of the cost. I think 3/5 stars is pretty accurate. They do have an awesome outside area though if the weather permits!
Coming from San Diego, I am a beer snob and they have a great selection. My waitress Lauren was quite attentive. The burgers are amazing and I recommend the sweet potato.

I'm walking distance to Umami and I've really wanted to make it my go-to sports bar. Unfortunately, I've completely struck out here on three attempts. 

The first was a week night at the indoor bar where my order was taken but never came. I left hungry and chalked it up to the busy crowd.

Grounder to shortstop, out on first.

On the second time around, I witnessed a lone waiter in the main dining area performing customer service heroics by juggling a dozen tables and very nearly saving everyone's Saturday night.  

Rare triple to left field, but it's caught anyway.

And this last time and surely my last trip here, my order was completely botched during an off-peak Tuesday afternoon. 

Pop fly to center field and that's the ball game!

1.5 Stars

Meh food. Bad service. We were seated with our toddler and the server took our drink order. We get some weird mix of juice mixers from the bar for our son because there aren't any drinks for kids (and that's OK really - we know it's Vegas). My son spills half the juice right away on himself and the booth and I use the napkins on the table to wipe it up. We never got new napkins, even after we asked. Server didn't seem to notice us frantically sopping up the spill on our kid. My wife was skeptical of the cheese sauce on the Hatch burger and asked for it on the side so she could try it out. This apparently annoyed the server. I got the Umami burger. We got sweet potato fries for our son. Food comes and my wife's burger is wrong - sauce and aioli on it which she wanted on the side. My burger is completely wrong - some other item entirely. We have no napkins and never received silver ware when we were seated. Had to ask for it. Our server proceeded to avoid our table for the rest of the night and help other tables around us. Various other servers and bus boys handled our requests for the right order, silverware, napkins, ketchup, etc. Food was pretty underwhelming. Hatch chilis had no heat or flavor. The burgers were nicely cooked and meat tasted good but otherwise it's just a heavy, fall-apart meal. Server finally comes back and we ask for the bill. Twenty minutes pass and we have asked a bus boy who bussed our table to get our server to bring the bill as well as another server who walked by. We ended up walking to the bar to pay. This might be the worst service I've ever had. Restaurant was pretty empty too, so it looks like everyone else knows to avoid this place as well.

First I have to tell you I am not a burger person.. I would NEVER choose a burger place if there is another option.. ANY other option. Just not my thing. But my man wanted to try so alright.. Let's do it!
We got the onion rings and nachos to start.. He said the onion rings were the best he's ever had and I'd probably agree!
Nachos weren't piled w/a ton of topping but it worked! I got to taste each ingredient including the super fresh chips!
Then came our burgers.. A manly and sunny side.. We couldn't decide so we split both. Sunny side was good.. Manly was AMAZING! Best burger I've ever had! Going back for lunch! 
Lauren was our server.. Great service!
Came for my sister's birthday and tashja was very attentive and patient with everyone!
Food = great. Service  = subpar. If it wasn't for the food being really good I would have rated it a 2 star.

Decent place. But quite expensive for what is on offer...$9 for a pint of beer? Come on! And the ultra hard metal bar stools! Make your customers a bit more comfortable! The burgers we had were decent. But you can do better...for example go to the absolutely awesome Izakaya Go in Chinatown. A much better application for your time and money!

Meh. Umami failed to impress. My friends and I came for a late lunch and we all agreed that it wasn't worth it. When we first arrived there was no one at the hostess stand. We could see the guy who was supposed to be seating customers was busy chatting with another co-worker. He then yelled over that he would be over in a minute. We should have just left at this point. 

We started off with the truffle fries (which are free if you check in on Yelp). These were very tasty! And the three sauces they were served with were amazing as well. My favorite was the spicy orange one. These fries were the only reason I gave a 2 star rating as opposed to a 1. 

Our waitress explained that since their meats are very fresh that the color of the meat may be more red than we are used to. Okay, no problem. I asked that my burger to be cooked medium and there wasn't any redness in the meat at all! It looked more like it was well done....Why give us that warning if all of our burgers came out dry and overcooked?

This is my first time to Las Vegas and we were looking for a a more casual dining experience and this spot was amazing.  The burger was outstanding and our waiter Sonny was great.  Super attentive and a great personality!

We stayed at the SLS last week and decided to try Umami our last day there.  I got the Cali burger which was really good, until it became soggy and I had to eat it with a fork.  Something about the tomato just threw me "off".  The sauce that they put on it was very tasty.  Not entirely certain what it was, but it was yummy.  We also ordered the Umami burger, which was very good (so I hear, as I don't do mushrooms).  To top it off we ordered the sweet potato fries to share.  They were good but the brown sugar threw me off again.  All in all, we would visit again if ever at the SLS, however I wouldn't make a special trip for it. 

Service was good, not horrible but not great either.  The place was not super busy and they were still just opening, so I understand some confusion.  All we ordered was water due to it being 116 outside and having a plane to catch.

I love everything about this, a comfy outdoor sports book with great beer & food options. The staff was really sweetly accommodating and found a way to sneak my baseball championships up around the more popular football and in the area outside I really wanted to be in. Huge hat tip to Shane and his team.

Although I did have to wait at the exterior walk-up entrance for about 5 minutes before anyone noticed me and asked me to be seated (albeit signs do tell you to wait there, but staff said you need to go to interior entrance to be seated by host) the rest of the service provided by Liz who is an exceptional barkeep and the burger was one of the best I've had. It really was that delicious and it reminded how great a burger could be when done right. I had the Manly burger, fries, and $2 Bud Light draft pints!

This place is super cool! Food is amazing and our server Megan was just better than sliced bread on a Sunday! She is just the sweetest, most bubbly thing and made our day even better than it already was. Go to Umami and ask for her! And tip her well!! You can even bet on sports while you eat because it's a sport book too! Amazing. Thank you :)
Burgers were good.  Like the large TV, would be a great place for a quick game and food.

Great spot for a bite and a beer.  Inside the SLS and also has a strip street dining for cooler days.  There's more than just burgers here,  and They have any amazing beer list.  I would recommended this place for a group,  or for mixed company because there's a little bit of something for everybody.  Service was great and food is on point!

We didn't eat at Umami proper, there was an hour and 45 minute wait because the World Series was on, but was able to order some of their food at a casino floor bar. We had their Manly burger, which had house beer cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked salt onion strings, ketchup and mustard. Burger was mediocre. First, it came out lukewarm. Second, the burger tasted like it was previously frozen with no flavor. Thirdly, for $13 it was small and unimpressive. We also had their fries, which I thought were pretty good. Almost McDonald's like but still decent. But, again, $5 for them was fairly steep.

The food was pretty good. I definitely recommend the Maple Bacon Fries. The prices were a little steep for the larger beers. You can get a full-sized Rogue beer at Whole Foods for $9 but here they charge you $30. They also don't have more than 100 beers on tap. The selection was slim and very overpriced.
Amazing burger and you must get the sweet potato fries! Super fast service and very friendly wait staff that went out of their way to make my kid feel welcomed.
Best burger joint hands down! Great service, great food, and a  great sports bar! Server Mandy was excellent!  Will definitely have to come back!

Off the CHAIN! TOP NOTCH service, food, beverage and atmosphere!  It's my GF 1st time to Vegas and I'm a seasoned traveler and we will DEFINITELY be back to Umami Burger at the newly revitalized SLS!!! Special SHOUT OUT to Sunny who was Da BOMB server and made our second trip to Umami a memorable one :-)

Nope. Came once and got horrible service and unremarkable food. Came back, and was again completely ignored by staff in this area. The SLS is involved in the Rock N Roll 5K event, and had several participants staying at their hotel. I came here prior to the run, and my BF stayed here while it was going on. 

Arrived to a fairly empty restaurant area, despite the busy casino floor and many race participants around- BF approached the bar to order a beer,  placed a bet at the counter, and watched a game. After being gone nearly an hour, I returned. BF stated he hadn't been able to order anything, because no one had come by. At all. In almost an hour.

We stuck around a little longer to see how a game ended, then went to another property to dine. This is now the second time we have tried to come here and apparently the staff do not have any interest in providing service. It's not due to lack of staff: there are plenty chatting away to one another. I have no idea how this place stays open.

We had tickets for a concert at the SLS and wanted to grab a bite before the show. Three of the four of us in the party wanted to try you Umami Burger ( I really don't like eating hamburgers but I was outvoted). I substituted a portobello mushroom for my hamburger patty and went with the Manly Burger. Wow was that good. Bacon cheese and shiitake mushrooms on a delicious bun. Fabulous!! We shared a side of sweet potato fries. They put some sort of topping on it that made it incredibly sweet and Incredibly delicious. My buddy got just a plain hamburger ( bun burger bun with nothing on it). He also said his Burger was delicious. Our wives also raved about the Umami burgerrs that they ordered. The setting is like a sports bar with the Sportsbook at the far end of the restaurant. Tons of TV so you can catch any game that you're interested in watching. I will definitely come back when I am in the area.

We were so excited to try a restaurant at SLS. What a letdown. Terrible service. The waitress never came by the table after the food was brought out so we couldn't inform her that our burgers were cold and our orders were wrong. Our drinks hadn't been refilled at all. You'd think at $8 a beer they'd at least offer to get you another one. I know they're new, but at $15 a burger, they should have great service to compensate.

My boyfriend and I ordered the manly burger and the umami burger. They were both very delicious. The manly burger is your typical bacon cheeseburger and the umami burger had a fried Parmesan cheese on it. In addition I ordered the velvet mule which was equally delicious. My boyfriend ordered the ballast point dead ringer Oktoberfest which he thought was very delicious. 
We also ordered the wings which I thought was pretty decent. It had more of a ketchup flavor as oppose to a bbq flavor.

We had the Truffle burger and Turkey burger. The truffle burger was very tasty even without the usual condiments! The Onion rings were awesome with their tempura batter. Our server Mandy was great &  very knowledgeable about the food.

This is a great change to the Umami concept in LA now with more sports. They have all of your favorites if you have been to other locations. 

Only thing that I can say that I didn't like was the buns. Which I have taken 2 stars off for since they are not the same as those in LA and they really do matter when it comes to a great burger. 

If you have never been you will still love it though.

I only came here because I love a good burger and that's what I thought I was getting here. So I was really excited to try the burger here because I had heard so much about Umami. I'm definitely a burger snob so much so I did a search for the best burger in San Diego and Southwest Riverside County.

Okay so I Yelp some burger spots in Vegas and this is one of the places that came up along with Chef Ramsey. I was in this area anyway and decide to check it out so in order to get here I had to walk through the casino which wasn't a big deal. I found it and was seated pretty quick because I came early evening. My waitress was cool so no problems there and she was easy on the eyes. I ordered the burger and when it came out it looked like it was going to be very good.

The burger was very simple but the ingredients made the burger seem like it was going to be fantastic. I was a little disappointed with the burger because the flavor just wasn't there for me and it wasn't that juicy either. Would I come here again? Yes because I give places second chances!

I am so sad writing this review, because I truly loved Umami Burger in Japan. The overall quality of these burgers were ok compared to the one in Japan. The burger itself was a little dry and the flavor wasn't as rich and indulgent, especially for the price we were paying. 

On a brighter note, the drink list is pretty extensive and there is a sports book with a bunch of tv's. 

Umami is tucked in a corner on the casino floor of the SLS Resort on the very north end of the Las Vegas Strip 

We came here on a Friday and there was absolutely no line and very few guests dining. (Should have been an indicator) 

All in all the burger experience was mediocre and would have gladly gone to in and out instead.

This was my first time coming to Umami Burger and it will probably be my last. The food was okay, not that I would rave about. Prices are fine. But the service is absolutely horrendous!! It took at least 15 minutes for the bartender to acknowledge us. After he finally did, taking our drink order seemed like an inconvenience for him. Sitting here at the bar for an hour and haven't seen him smile once. He ran out of fireball while pouring a shot and filled it with some generic whiskey to top it off. When he finally came around to take our food order, we felt rushed and once again like we were inconveniencing him. When I food arrived, my burger was rare and I thought that it was strange that they didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked. When the bill came, I saw that he had taken the liberty to put in how I wanted my burger cooked without asking me. 
This sounds like a lot of complaining on my part but I work in the industry. I'm not hard to please but the service here was terrible and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

We have been to the bar here a few times for drinks and I think the kindest way to describe most of the bartenders would be uninterested. Sunday we decided to give the restaurant a try. Our server, Tashja was great. Fast accurate and fun without trying to be our best friend. I had the original, cooked perfect and the mushrooms were great. My wife had the throwback which was also very good. We split an order of thin fries that come with three dipping sauces. A couple of less surly bartenders and this place would be a 5+. Oh, the booths each have a monitor which they will change to your favorite sporting event and with the sports book on site it's great.

I would like to rate this place as one of the best burger joints I've dined. Gourmet burgers for reasonable prices.  UB is a hidden gem...tucked to the side within the hotel.  I felt compelled to give this place a high rating because of the menu variety and excellent customer service.  I enjoyed all the TV's in every booth and inviting fresh, fun atmosphere. UB focuses on quality and intention.  The buns are soft. The burger patty is flavorful, juicy, and the portion is generously perfect.  I was really stumped on what to eat  because I wanted all the burgers.  But, our server, Lauren (with the pretty dark hair), made it easy to choose.  She was very knowledgeable and friendly.  The Manly Burger and Truffle Fries were delish!!  I enjoyed my trip to Vegas earlier this month and next time I visit, I will be sure to return for another delicious meal at UB!!

Stayed at the Westgate, but ate ag SLS because, well, Westgate.  Serving staff gets points for honesty, we asked about the joint's namesake burger, but she directed us to the truffle burger (+ carmelized onions and fried egg).  Food is exactly as advertised, quick and completely covered in delicious cheese.  No pretense here, just cheeseburgers.

Had the umami burger; it was average. The truffled cheese fried with the cheese sauce was pretty tasty though.

Service was good, but the burger was just average. Wouldn't come back but didn't regret it.
Five stars for the Umami burger! It's delicious! Snickerdoodle, vanilla and chocolate chip ice cream sandwiches were delicious as well.

My girlfriend and I went to SLS Umami Burger on the north end of the Las Vegas trip. First impressions of the casino itself is that it's very nice. It seems that they have a really good filtration system as we couldn't smell much smoke compared to other casinos. It could be that there was just not a lot of people smoking there.
Now, down to business. I ordered the impossible burger. The cost was really high. It was about $18 just for the burger. The side of fries was another $8 or so. I did get truffle fries which were delicious. The burger was really tasty and it came with two patties. I also ordered a lemonade which was $4. My girlfriend got a salad and a beer. The salad was around $12 and a beer was $13. I would come back here but not often since it costs so much. But on a special occasions or to treat myself. Parking is complementary which is nice and I did like the ambience. Your options were sit in a booth, a table with chairs or you could sit on couches which is what we did. Our waitress was really attentive and anticipated our needs. Excellent customer service! I did enjoy my plant-based burger which tasted very good , the only issue I may have with the burger and the fries is that it is a bit more on the sa side then I'd like it to be. But it was still tasty.

Located in the remodeled SLS, we walked past the hostess to check out the tiny sports book first.  We then went into the restaurant to find a seat.  I guess when you ignore the hostess, the waitresses forget to serve you, so we had to flag them down ourselves.  

Our meal was pretty decent, although we didn't order too much because we weren't hungry.  Not entirely your average sports bar food.  Some more adventuresome dishes.  Plenty of big screens, but surprised the crowd was pretty lame for a playoff game.  Maybe a bigger sport book with more gamblers would have juiced up the crowd.

I have heard about this pace so many times but just had the opportunity to come in, and I have to say this place is amazing not only is the service unique and great,but the food is finger licking delicious !!! Officially one of my favorites in Vegas!

Uhmm I had previously been here with my BF, and we had a very good meal, chicken wings and tots included. Come in here today with my family today and the wings are off the menu and the tots as well. This is a sports bar-how are you going to take the wings off the menu?!!!!!

Thanks for the free beer but way overrated...truffle fries were clued up chicken wings were mass produced and way over breaded and the blue cheese was literally water with some crumbs.  Burger was ok. Nice shape with a weird U brand on the bun.   The bartender was a little standoffish and as expected snobby....

Very disappointed considering the other reviews....

I wanted to like this place, because it's a very nice place to watch a game, with plenty of TVs and good view lines.

But... the food!  Just not good enough.  The burgers are missing a key ingredient - taste!  Really overpriced, and the chef needs to figure out where to locate the seasoning.

Lastly, I don't think the waiter every made eye contact with the group.  Flying around, all sweaty and gnarls.  I have been rushed out of nicer burger places (read: In N Out).

Go for the game and a beer, leave before the burger arrives.

Went on a thursday evening at 10pm and was sat indoors. There were 6 other tables/booths with people eating. I waited 10 minutes before my waitress came to the table to take my drink order. I ordered the pretzle, as that is why I came in the first place but was told they had run out earlier that day. Not quite sure how a restaurant runs out, but would have thought they would have made more instead of a certain quota since that is one item this place is known for.
Ordered fried pickles and was disappointed that I only received 11 for $6 and don't expect your burger to come with any sides. My burger was $13 and it came with half a pickle spear. Only 6 oz burgers, but maybe that's before they're cooked as that burger didn't look like 6 oz to me.
Awesome place to eat a good burger! Our waitress Tashja was so pleasant and attentive with a smile. Awesome service! Cookie dessert is to DIE for!!!

Have not been to Vegas in awhile. Umami Burger was across the street from our hotel.   The burgers were AMAZING! But what was even better was the service. Sunny, our server, was very attentive and a terrific personality.

Great spot to grab a quick meal.  This was my first time to Umami.  I got the Ahi Tuna burger and truffle fries.  The fries were so good!  Also, this is your spot for a cheaper meal on the strip.

if you're a sports fan, they had a ton of TVs to watch whatever games were on at that time.  Service was good and the food came out fast.

I had the cali burger, it had a roasted tomato, Swiss cheese grilled onions special sauce butter lettuce and ground beef patty,  cooked medium. It was amazing! The service was excellent, we had to make a reservation for a club on NYE and only had 30 minutes to eat, we were served quickly and they brought our bill quickly, we were very pleased.

We stopped in a few minutes ago, and ordered our burgers without onions. There was a mix up and my burger had onions on it. The waitress not only offered to replace it, but took it of my bill. She also gave us dessert on the house. The burgers were excellent, and the staff was very courteous and friendly. My waitress was Mandy, and she was great! I downloaded this app just to leave this review, so I was pretty impressed!

I am usually not a burger girl but they have a really good turkey burger. It's probably the best turkey burger I have had!! Mixed in some sweet potato fries and of can't go wrong. 

They have an outdoor section with games like air hockey but they apparently can't find the puck which really sucks.

It took me over a year to give this place another shot and I am glad I did!  I was craving the Truffle Fries and I could not wait until I went to California again.  

The service overall is mediocre at best.  It took a good minutes to get my cider and my boyfriend's beer, and the server did not stop by very often....but at least we were not forgotten about again.  

The food is delicious!  This is the place I do not mind paying a bit more for a burger.  The truffle burger is by far my favorite.  It is very juicy and flavorful.  The bun they use is perfect and it does not get soggy with all of the cheese!  

While the service still needs improvement I will definitely be back for the yummy food.

My first Umami burger:
*perfect size
*the truffle cheese is fantastic
*loved the bun
*great truffled aioli

The Royale was decadent.  I'm not a burger person and I'm sold.  I need a salad now.  

Lived up to all the hype.  The wait was pretty excruciating.  25 minutes?  Ugh.

Came here as an out of town guest on a referral from a colleague.  Best Burger! Highly recommend the "Manly" burger, and don't forget the Cheesy tots; they are not on the menu until YOU ask for them....oh my the secret menu.....love this place!

So when I saw the prices on the menu I said what the heck $15.00 for a burger but we ordered anyway and let me say it's worth the $15.00 it was the best burger I've ever had too bad we didn't have time to visit again. My hubby says next time he'll order two just for himself

Mandy is the type of waitress that you wish that every time you go to a restaurant you can  get her to be yours. 
She is very engaging and knowledgeable about the menu and the options available. 

My wife had the Cali burger and I quote "it melts in your mouth " I had the truffle burger and it was amazing. The flavors were perfectly balanced. 
Sweet potato fries. I got mine without the sugar/cinnamon.  Mmmmm mmmmm good. 

When I come back I will try Mandy's suggestion of adding an egg to my burger. Along with the Spaten Octoberfest. 
Thank you Mandy for a wonderful experience.

The sporting environment and TVs are nice and the outside seating area. That is all! Drinks are overpriced unless you like beer. I came to watch a football game and they don't have happy hour for the games. Beer only. Burgers are overpriced and average.

Umami Burger was very good. Went there for the local Sunday deal and had a great lunch. 
I had the Truffle Especial burger and the wife had the Hatch burger because she is from New Mexico. We also order the Umami dog for our daughter, along with everything we order the Onion Rings and Truffle fries.  
The burgers were very good the dog was nothing special but good. The Truffle fries were amazing the Onion Rings were good just had some uncooked batter on them still very little but still there. 
Pepsi was served in the glass bottles which was cool. The whole place looks great very cool and comfy food was great service was amazing and the local deal was awesome. I will return with like everybody I know.

Over priced
Over hyped burger 
$18 Fries not include , really?
Expect snotty waitresses
The staff seems to believe the hype about this place 
Lol
Save ur money, really !

Walked into the restaurant at 8:20 pm on a Sunday and the Beer Garden was closed. So, that was annoying but the hostess told us we could sit at one of their couches and that actually was really cool and comfortable. However, we walked out of the restaurant at 8:52 pm. 

The restaurant was not busy, maybe six tables all together. 10 minutes passed and two tables were sat after us and acknowledged by a server. So, we waited another 5 minutes and still no acknowledgement. I advised the bartender and hostess, they said they would send someone over and apologized. So, now it's 8:35 and it has been 15 minutes... not even a glass of water or a hello. 

Finally, we waited and we saw a waitress come out, she walked right passed us, and went to another table that just sat down. At that point I was done... we sat there in an empty restaurant for over 30 minutes and we were not acknowledged once by any server. 

We got up and walked out, and we will never be back. I have been to the restaurant dozens of times, and their beer garden was one of our favorite local spots. Well, not anymore.
Juiciest burgers I've ever had. I highly recommend this place. Went twice while staying at the hotel. 5 stars all the way!

who doesn't love a burger? The menu is amazing, the service even better. Our server Brooke made the meal even more fun, she is funny and fantastic. her suggestions for our lunch were terrific. Brooke rocks. and the Burgers are great too

I went to umami burger for the first time today. I personally am not much of a burger eater but, man this place is good! I didn't know what to order and I had a server named Angel, she was so patient and sweet and recommended the truffle fries with my burger. Best decision because the umami burger and truffle fries is so so so tasty. For sure going back sooner then later.
Nom! The Umami Burger is definitely one of my favorites, the Parmesan Cheese Crisp and Umami Ketchup make the burger extra scrumptious. I also really love the jumbo size Tater Tots.

It was on Dec. 18th, 2014 dinner time. First time trying the brand, we ordered the Truffle and Umami Burger, with all due of respect, it nothing close to what we expected, really, absolutely not impressed by it at all, not sure it was the cook whom was on shift that particular day or.....perhaps other challenging issues, so overall the food is really so so. Cocktail was really not there, the bar folks is in need of more training, never return a drink in my life and this night was my very first time. We will try other locations when the opportunity comes, hope it better where else.

First time here for an event and we had a set menu family style.

Sweet potato fries were ON POINT. French fries were ON POINT. Onion rings were ON POINT. But......I'm not too sure if I like their burgers. we had the Truffle Burger, Cali Burger and the Hatch Burger. The beef seemed pretty A LITTLE better quality than other burgers but the bun tasted so weird to me. I'm not sure if it was the specific type of bread or the bun was super bread-y and thick. The different types sauces in the burger were also different so I give them kudos for that. The three burgers didn't seem different to me. I'll probably try this place again back home in SoCal.

Stopped in on a business trip and boy am I glad I did so.
Service was great, Burger was awesome. There is not a whole lot more you can ask for. Will definitely be coming back next time i am in town.

The ketchup tastes like it is very fresh and made by scratch, their jalapeño ranch dressing is tasty, not too spicy. The beet salad was excellent. My boyfriend got the original burger and I got the manly burger.

I ended up sending mine back because I don't like the fondue type of cheese that came on it... Nor did I like the bacon lardons- they are too thick and not as tasty as real bacon. I was frustrated... I just wanted a bacon cheese burger with real solid cheddar cheese or solid pepper jack cheese on it. Unfortunately I learned that Umami does not have any solid cheeses. I decided the next best thing to get would be a Parmesan cheese crisp minus bacon lardons. The bun was cute with the U on it. At first I thought the burger quality was good but it just fell apart in my hands and started breaking... My boyfriend said it was because it was too juicy... Not sure but it made it very difficult to eat. I felt bad that I needed to send so many things back... 

Even the diet Pepsi because it tasted flat. So I got iced tea but there was no sugar on the table and it didn't come with a lemon. Our server was sweet but way too busy to check on us enough, perhaps due to poor staffing. There was indoor and outdoor seating. I loved the open layout with couches, our booth was comfortable, there were televisions everywhere for the sports fanatics. 

The sweet potatoe fries were a little too sweet, like they had excess sugar on them. I am a sweet potato fri expert:)

Conclusion is that Umami in my opinion is better than a fast food burger but nothing compared to Hook (located in Woodland Hills). I thought Umami would be very similar in quality compared to Hook. If Umami used a pretzel bun my burger never would have fallen apart. If they used solid cheese and plane jane bacon I think they could accommodate more customer requests. I don't think I have extraordinary tastes when it comes to burgers.

Great burgers! Burgers aren't massive,  but still filling! Super filling! And add an egg to it too! Amazing chicken burger too if you aren't diggin beef. Great pretzel appetizer too! 

Great service! Tashj is an awesome server! She took care of us and looked on point with her other tables while tending with my drunk group! Great restaurant!

Although we absolutely love this restaurant we were so disappointed when we arrived yesterday for lunch.  The restaurant was CLOSED.  We were informed they would only be open Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday.  WHY?  Being local we love to go to the SLS at least twice a week, do a little gaming and have lunch at Umami.  The restaurant always looked busy, including the patio.  Apparently the hotel has new owners and no decisions will be made about anything regarding the hotel/restaurants until the deal is done. If you want to have lunch at the SLS there are now only two options, the pizza place and the cafe, neither of which appeals to me, my wife or our friends.  Guess we will have to find a new favorite hamburger place until such time as the future of Umami is decided.  Just an FYI, we do not go to the Strip on the weekends.  That time is for tourists. Hopefully the new owners will realize that locals can and do patronize the restaurants on the Strip.

We stayed at the SLS and decided to try Umami after arriving from the airport and checking in. We were extremely tired from a day of traveling (I was practically closing my eyes at the table), and we were super hungry...so a burger sounded great. The restaurant was pretty much quiet and dead, but it was a Sunday night. I think we were one of five tables there. 

We had a coupon from the hotel desk for a free appetizer, and I asked if there were any exclusions, and the waitress was a little snippy. My boyfriend ordered the Truffle Burger (she asked how he wanted it cooked, and he said medium) and I ordered the Greenbird, which is a turkey burger instead of beef. 

My boyfriend took a couple bites into his burger and I could see on his face that something was wrong. This thing was super rare...way more undercooked than he anticipated. We're never ones to really complain about things, but he pointed it out when the waitress came back to check on us. She was kind of rude and seemed oddly confused about it. She just stared at him and said "well OUR medium HERE is red like that." He always orders medium, so clearly this place must do things differently, or the burger wasn't cooked long enough in the kitchen. He asked for a replacement burger cooked medium-well so that he'd at least be able to enjoy his $14 burger. When she brought it out, her attitude was a little better and she apologized a few times. Her words were "sorry guys, that was my fault" which caught our attention, because we didn't exactly get what THAT meant after all that trouble...

She also noticed my boyfriend's empty water and said "oh...I'll get you more water" but never came back for the duration of our meal, except for dropping off the check. (Like I said, it was not busy at all in there). 

My turkey burger was also a little pink, which I didn't expect for poultry...but I honestly scarfed it down in like 2 seconds and was too tired to care. It probably shouldn't have been that pink. The greenbird is definitely a tasty burger though.

The bar tender that served my friend and I did a good job and, if you are playing video poker you can get some free drinks (the specifics for what qualifies is on the bar).  The nachos that we ordered were okay but the problem was that, even though they were not very busy, it took a fairly long time to receive them (enough so that our bartender went back to check on the order).  That's what killed the review as otherwise I had no beef with this place.

We liked this place while staying at the SLS.  GREAT turkey burger, fries.  Like the sports bar theme - did not do beer garden in back.  Prices weren't bad.  Two burgers, two fries, one beer - $40.00  Perfect portion too.  Awesome server.  Too bad it's in the SLS and at that end of the strip.  Just not a good location at all.  5 stars for burger and server :)

I was so excited when I found out Umami Burger was coming to Vegas and better yet right ACROSS the street from me! Being that I no longer eat meat... I always get the ahi burger that is always a win with my taste buds & for dessert I get the caramel ice cream which is bomb! 1 of two good things inside of the SLS casino! Definitely worth a try

I think the sportsbar environment kinda makes this place a little underwhelming. However, there were some really unique concepts on the menu. I really enjoyed the truffle fries. Of course, the prices were high for a burger place but it is Vegas and here we're some pretty unique ingredients used in the burgers we ordered. But it wasn't a place where I felt like I had to revisit.

Still the best burger Ive ever had. And Ive been to two locations.

Mmmmmm. Buuurrrgggeeerrrr. Aaaahhhhhhh (in my Homer Simpson voice)

Got garlic fries, umami burger, and a chicken lettuce wrap. Honestly it was really bad esp the chicken wrap the chicken was cold and the sauce they drenched my chicken in tasted weird. The fries were the best part of the whole meal. Not trying umami burger again.

Nothing gourmet about the burgers.  Online menu varies from this location.  Sports bar but all the TVs were not connected to the satellite.  Matchstick fries were overly fried and hard.  Truffle sauce was tasteless and burger was over cooked despite my request for medium.

It's taken me to travel to Vegas to finally try an Umami burger and holy crap I should have done this sooner! The burgers are ammmmaaaaazzzziiing. Ok now that you know how good the burgers are let's talk about the service. Tashja took care of two weary travelers and made us feel at home. Her recommendations were spot on and damnit man I want more!!! Thank you Tashja!!

5 star for the service and 2 star for the food. I ordered the truffle burger substitute turkey patty and it was TERRIBLE. The patty tasted like it was microwaved and 0 flavor. The truffle fries and Tots were okay. 

We are regulars at SLS however would not be a returning customer to this place.

Having chicken loaded nachos tortilla chips chicken breast black olives house beer cheddar avocado salsa and cream. No to jalapeños. $13.95 alittle too much for its size, should be alittle under $10, had cut pieces of chicken...maybe less than half cup of chicken breast. And had a sunny side $14.95 Parmesan frivolity fried egg truffle thyme butter truffled arugula and truffled aioli burger. We will see how scrumptious these are. Enjoyed the burger more than the nachos. The fries were thin, alittle hot, alittle salty but the sweet waitress gave me ketchup, ranch, scirrachi and aioli sauce, making them very tasty...but it's leaving my tongue with an inflammation.

We took the monorail all the way to the last stop and ended up at SLS. Since we wanted a snack and a drink we ended up at Umami Burger. 

Ordered the Hatch which come with Roasted hatch chilies and a roasted garlic aioli. I split it with my husband but wished I could have eaten the whole thing. It was yummy with a capital Y. 

We also had the truffle fries. Truffly cheesey goodness! 

I also had the velvet mule. It was a great take on a Moscow Mule with blackberries. 

All in all a great afternoon treat!

I know they say what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas but this place deserves a shout out!

The hatch burger was in a word "disgusting" 
The Caesar salad was sub par. Total disappointment. The only thing I truly enjoyed was the bottled ginger beer by fentimams.

The Truffle Burger was good.  A decent sized burger that was juicy and tasty. The truffle aoli sauce was oozing out.  The Bun had a big U logo toasted on top.  Nice touch.  Had it with the Panko Onion Rings which were light and crispy.  Awesome home made ketchup for dipping.

Local las vegas resident. Went to check out SLS and the menu looked really interesting and unique. The place was about 10-15% full and it was a mid day on sunday, not busy at all. Front waitress said it would be a little bit of a wait, didn't know how long, and they would text us when they had an opening.
poor first experience and we went somewhere else and won't try here again.
2 stars for having what looks to be a unique menu.

One of my fav burger places in LA finally made it to Vegas! Unlike many of the LA restaurants, this Umami burger is also a sports bar and beer garden.  There is usually plenty of seating unless there is a big game on. We've been here twice already and the burgers/fries are so consistently well executed. I'm not a huge fan of truffle fries, so I usually get the regular thin fries and Umami burger. The size of the burger is on the smaller side, but it is very filling especially with fries and a beer on the side.

This Umami burger is located in the SLS hotel, and they offer both valet and self parking. I would definitely recommend the burgers here for anyone looking for a casual dining restaurant!

First time at an Umami Burger and may I just say that everything about this visit was amazing. Got the Throwback burger, Hatch burger, and the truffle fries. All the food was amazing. Like AMAZING. Our server, Ben, was awesome too. Exactly what you want in a server: customer focused, down to earth, and funny. Very good first impression.

Great place great food had the truffle burger was so good it melts in your mouth I also had the beet salad as appetizer was so tasty will definitely be coming back here again. The staff was friendly and gave us good info on what to order

We tried Umami on our way to the Stratosphere. The waitress was friendly, but the food was just okay - nothing I would have to come back to when I'm in Vegas. The truffle burger was a little sweet but okay - it needed something else to complement the burger. The manly burger was delicious, though. It had a great flavor and taste to it! The truffle fries were too ooey and gooey for me. Again, it was an okay restaurant with friendly service. If we do end up going back, I won't get anything with "truffle" on the menu.
Good service and great set up. Food unfortunately fell short. I got the umami burger and it wasn't very tasty:( the truffle fries were delish though.

$9 Goose Island for this location, for a local and during an NFL game? Nope, we have too many other options! Hey SLS, you do know where you are located? Not exactly center strip eh?

It wasn't a good sign when the guy at the bar next to ya say "good luck" after noticing the way were thirstily eyeing the bartender. So he gets an order of onion rings (not bad looking rigng BTW) and asks the runner for some catchup and the runner says "sure, just ask the bartender and she'll get you some". Now maybe I'm becoming a stickler for service but he asked YOU for catchup not the slow ass BT. Bad form in a hospitality city like this.

That was our third time at SLS... $18 in two beers, thats three strikes and we are OUT.

The signature Umami burger definitely fits the claim of rich and savory flavors. It takes control over everything else in a meal and delivers exactly what is promised. The bar is not quite as well stocked as I would hope and the service was nice enough if a bit slow at times. If you find yourself at or near the SLS, it's definitely worth trying.

Started with the pumpking ale which was good, did the beer with some truffle fries and watched the blue jays get slammed by kc  .. Then my awesome waitress liz recommended the manly burger and the new ice cream sandwiches they have, is like an ice cream burger.. Everything was great.. This is my go to place on my cheat days

This place is rated four stars. I'll give it another shot next time I'm in town but I didn't get a four star experience. It wasn't a super busy night. I ordered the manly burger. It had onion straws, bacon and cheddar. I asked for it medium. It came out very well done and had American cheese on it. I realllly don't like American cheese but I couldn't tell it wasn't cheddar till about two or three bites in I was wondering why it tasted like plastic. So I didn't send it back. Also, make no mistake, this is a sports bar. It is not quiet. It is not pub-like. It's loud and there's tv's and sports fans everywhere. Also totally fine if you know what you're getting. But I thought it was a gourmet burger place. My mistake.

Came into SLS to place some sports bets but decided to grab some food while I was there since the sportsbook is inside umami. Had the manly burger and truffle fries. Manly burger was cooked to a perfect medium temperature and was so juicy. Truffle fries had a lot of flavor too. Lauren, our server, was amazing with her recommendations. Will come back soon.

Ordered a burger and fried pickles and decided to go down and pick it up instead of having it delivered to the room. 1) it was ready almost 30 minutes after I was told it would be ready. 2) they did not include the ranch dip with the pickles. When I called they said they would bring the sauce right up, but they never showed.  (surprise)  

The burger was ok, but a little dry. Not worth the hype. I would review the pickles but they got too cold to eat while I was waiting for the dip.
umami burger was fantastic.  liz was extremely friendly and helpful.  the food was amazing and we will be back again.

Best sports book in vegas, i had the best service at the bar, enjoying some football . I am a local and i love beer, very good food too, impressed about their beer selection, the manager suggested the manly with a fried egg on top, its a life changing experience, the onions the meat, the bread and their diabla sauce are great!!! Coming back for sure .

The burgers were very good. Every thing else not so much. The frys are thin and bland and for $5 very disappointing. The worst though is the chicken fingers. The look and taste exactly like the frozen ones sold through Sysco. Most disappointing chicken fingers I have had.

This place was the best thing at the SLS hotel . Not sure why it doesn't have higher ratings . We went there 2 times I was obsessed with it. Both times I got the sunny side burger which was amazing. The truffle fries are an absolute must have. They also have great hot sauce and aioli sauce. Would definitely go back for this

Just had dinner here tonight and everything was perfect. The burgers were cooked perfectly and all the starters looked picture perfect and tasted perfect as well. Our server checked up on us consistently throughout the night and made sure we had everything we needed. It was a pleasant experience.

Enjoyed the sports atmosphere while watching the NBA finals.  Food was delicious and the Cali Burger the best.  Shout out to Mandy who was very personable and provided great service along with history of the building.

I  had the green chili "hatch" burger with the bacon sweet potato fries - and the lolita cocktail. 

This place is YUMMY. Love it - my husband and I will be back - its a little loud, and in the SLS and we went during EDC, so it was a little extra crazy... 

Great service, great good, good prices, just a little loud - but again, this is a casino. So, you're forewarned.
Best burger place ever!! Definitely recommend to anyone! Friendly staff, good food... Basically the whole package!!

They are an expensive burger place where you'll have a good, but somewhat over-priced hamburger served somewhat absent-mindedly, but with good intentions. We checked them out because they carry the vegetarian Impossible Burger.

The venue is lively and comfortable. It basically also serves as the sports book area. The service is adequate, but misses the target frequently. They may or may not know you've been seated and they may or may not bring you things you've requested. But they are friendly.

We tried their Throwback and Impossible burgers. The portions are good, but feel a little over-priced for what you get. Strip prices basically. The Throwback was fine. The Impossible was a very impressive vegetarian burger that tasted and felt like real meat.

All in all, you'll have a good meal and a good experience here, but we probably won't be back any time soon due to the high prices.

Big fan of burger joints, so of course I had to try this. The atmosphere is was amazing (not sure if the age group that can be seated in the restaurant, first thing we were asked was if everything in our party is 21 and over). Food was great was as well. My burger has amazing taste and the onion  rings (which I highly recommend) are mind blowing. 

My only thing with this place (that gave this place 4 stars instead of 5) was the amount of food for the price you were paying for. We were group of 5 that ran up a $80 bill, but not full/satisfied afterwards.

It was my first time here and it was amazing! Our server Courtney was very helpful and friendly and gave us really great recommendations. We had the truffle fries and the truffle burger. It was to die for! I definitely will come back again in the near future.

There are two things I take into account when eating somewhere, the price of the food and the quality. I've heard a lot of good things about umami. However Vegas has a great rep for taking restaurants, franchising out to the strip and poorly executing it. I ate here and paid 14 for a burger and 6 for some fries. Price to me isn't a huge deal however to me the meal was not that great. The burger had no flavor, the fries were alright. However there are way better places you can go for a good burger on the strip.

 I will say that I usually have a bad experience with female servers and my server a bubbly blonde if I remember correctly, did however make the meal quite pleasurable. She was a great server and I will note that.

Amazing burgers! Left us wanting more. Meat was extremely fresh and the burger buns were soft with a toasted outside. We also had the ice cream sandwiches which were fantastic. All and all, great experience.
Got the truffle burger & trifle fries, kind of small portions but it was delicious. Great customer service. Enjoyed the experience.

Mandy was our sever and let me say she was AMAZING. Phenomenal server.

Aside from that, the buffalo wings were the best we ever had. We also tried some of their draft beers and had 5 dollar shots. Great place, good ambiance, definitely would give it 5 stars.

Well talk about shocked only gets three stars...Or should say not sure why Umami not getting much yelp love except everyone has right too ones opinion. I feel that Umami Burger offer unique experience comes to watching games at a sports book. Trust me use to be one of those sports parley betting addict every weekend. Before realize the house always win. Lol. I can only think of handful of sports book that first off offers food more less quality food not just your normal fried everything bar food. Plus the ones that do offer food usually adjacent or may need to walk some ways get food then bring it back. Not like the sports books are made for food. The chairs made for parley sheet, drink, and sheet write down bets. If in front of small television booth in reality same thing. The thing about Umami literally you just walk up place bet (live betting; that new one for me) and go back too eat, drinking, or talking stories with friends. I came here watch MNF with friends visiting from the 808. I read reviews that need order certain amount on Sunday or on football days in general. Between the three of us ordered everything and the kitchen sink so we were good. We started with truffle fries, nachos, wings, and I had "The Royale Burger".

The truffle fries was Amazing! By far the best truffle fries had in long time. I had the ones at more fancy place like Olives that totally suck compare too Umami. The thing that makes them shine above the rest. The homemade truffle cheese that put over the fries, then add truffle oil on top, and nice hot right out of the fryer. Just the smell is divine. If not fungus person this not the dish for you. But if love cheese fries in general these truffle fries take tradition fries too another level. Rich. The Nachos with the short rib meat on top, fresh guacamole (one of the better ones had in town), jalapeño, fresh cilantro sprigs, and the chips. The CHIPS tell fresh chips nice thick corn ones. I could have just eaten chips and salsa whole game be content in life. Me my pet peeves with Nachos like mound of stuff on top but think excess not always better. I love the fact that really had the right amount that none of the chips got completely drowned by the topping that the chips on the bottom bottom still has the crispy crunch. The chicken wings we had six an six. Those were ok nothing really memorable about them. 

The "Royale" Burger talk about gourmet burger! This one rivals any of the top gourmet burger joints in Vegas.
