I can honestly say hit the full list from Gordan, Bobby, Burger Bar, Holstein, Fuku, Bachi, and the only one missing is Guy. The thing I love is the combination of all the flavors. It heavy burger with lots of meat! The burger, short ribs on top, then got truffle cheese, and believe might put hint of truffle oil top it off. Messy burger. Those are the best one that all the good stuff comes out with every bite and gets all over your hands. The "U" on top of all the burger that nice touch that definitely  Umami style. The burger buns are on point. Few more reading description that need get me some next visit. 

The service was five star for me!!!! Our server was on it. This was on FOOTBALL day or say MNF. Our server was friendly and during the game on it making sure never empty on our beers. Since first timers all around answered all our questions. 

If one thing that had issue. Maybe only had one hostess working that night. Not sure if we sit ourselves down or go hostess stand get seated no sign. From the outside looks more like lounge then restaurant restaurant. I never checked out the Beer Garden. 

Umami Burger is awesome. I look forward too trying more of the burgers next time.

Good food. Good service. Gambling. The trifecta of Las Vegas. Came here for a quick bite and to watch some sports and this place provides on both fronts. There is food,beer,and many TVs playing sports to watch so you can enjoy the game or gamble because the betting station is right there. I had the 'manly burger' and 'manly fries' and they both were prepared well and was good.

Visited on 8/25/2014

Food: Had the Sloppy Mami. Very delicious vegan burger, although I could have done with a bit less of the onion strings on the burger. Still great. Also received numerous sauces that were all delicious. The waitress did not mind explaining to us what each sauce was again after we forgot the first time.

Service: Our waitress was excellent. She was very friendly, knowledgeable and was very eager to answer any questions we had about the menu.

Decor: Restaurant was very open, with tons of TVs to watch any channel we wanted. We even had our own TV for our booth, which is really nice. The place was also very clean.

Food: very good (Ahi tuna burger)
Drink: average (local brewery flight)
Serv: above average speed
Music: average
Price: average
Other: located in the sports book

Food was alright. Service was ass. Didn't fill up my water, and forgot part of my order. We came as a large party and the waitress refused to split checks through the party. If you want good food and service then go to Batchi Burger.

Great food, and service! Liz, our bartender was funny and friendly! Food came out really quick for how busy things were. Burger was tasty and unique, $2 domestic drafts were a bonus. Will be coming back any chance I get.

First time here and it's so loud you have to yell across the table if you want to talk also you can't hear the waitress and they can't hear you very poor atmosphere, probably will not come back I don't like that I have to yell just to talk at dinner. Very disappointed for my first time here.

So on top of horrible horrible horrible service I was then grated 20%!! I've got no problem with gratuity as I am a server myself but when I am adding a service fee I make sure my service it excellent!! Drinks took a long time and waiting for the check was the worst, 40 minutes!! They also forced our waiter to a 30 minute break during our visit. I always take things into consideration when I go out because I understand being short staffed or overly busy, definitely NOT the case this time. I'll give 2 stars because of the food.

Great selection of food at very reasonable prices.  I'm not a burger person so I got the Ahi Tuna lettuce wraps, loved them.  Everyone who got a burger enjoyed them and they were cooked to requested temp perfectly.  The only downer was the side sweet potato fries, was noted on the menu that they are cinnamon sugar fries, too sweet to eat with the burger and tuna.

They do have a nice selection of beer and craft cocktails.

Booked a booth and table here for Superbowl Sunday. 130 a person included a $20 food credit PP, open bar and the kicker... a nice comfy booth. I forget the hosts name, but big thanks to her as she dialed in our booth and table right next to each other. Also sat us right in front of the video wall which was great for the game.

Positives:
- Lots of TVs
- Solid Food
- Good service (Wish I remember her name, but we did take care of her on top of the auto gratuity)
- Sportsbook in the restaurant, which was great for mid game betting

Cons:
- Location of the SLS in general. It's a bit off the beaten path
- Umami Burger was fine, but walking into the Casino reminded me of some weird mashup of trendy LA and Fremont street.
- Some interesting characters walking around the casino (and by interesting I mean sketchy as fuck). Security needs to be improved.
- The DDR-esque lightup entrance to the casino was severely tacky and slightly depressing 

Side Notes:
- Had 800 Degrees Pizza after the game and it was delicious
- Needs improvement overall on the casino front, but SBE knows whats up when it comes to restaurants

I came here 3 times during my stay at SLS. My girlfriend and I sat at the bar twice and in the restaurant once. 
When we sat in the restaurant, our server went on break in the middle of our meal and informed me someone else would be over to take care of us. A blonde girl walked by once and asked if we were ok and quickly walked away before we could even answer. We had finished our meal and were waiting for the server to come back over and deliver our bill/check in. In the mean time we went to the bar to gamble and grab a drink and our server still hadn't of come back. Finally I had to walk to the hostess stand and tell her I just wanted to pay since I had finished my meal over 15 minutes previously and wanted to leave. Maybe it's just me, but I feel like I shouldn't have to practically beg someone to come take my money. A server should be eager to get customers out, get a tip, and have that table sat again. From an operational standpoint, a restaurant shouldn't be sending servers on break when they have tables they are responsible for still, and throwing the table onto another unwilling server. The manger Jessica was very apologetic though and comped our food when she realized what had happened. 
The food it's self was pretty good. I recommend the barbacoa nachos and pretzel. The Ice cream sandwich wasn't something I would recommend though. It was Ice cream in between a bun and not something I personally found appealing.

Went for Superbowl.  We sat in the outside patio area.  Although we felt a little packed in, and the tv's were to small, we had a great time.  We could not hear much of the game, so we gave up.  The Barbacoa nachos were really good as were the tater tots.  I ordered a Hatch burger and truffle fries which were good.  What made the experience fantastic was our awesome waiter Josh.  He was so attentive, remembered everything without writing it down and brought us everything we needed pretty fast for as crowded as the place was. He was amazing!

Located in the SLS hotel and casino. When you enter, to the immediate left there's what seems like a fully stocked bar with usual gambling games. To the right of that a comfortable area with tables and couches to dine or watch whatever sports game playing. The high ceilings has a black and white checkered pattern. And to the right of that their sports book with a few tables and tvs. But wait there's more. Exit the doors and you'll enter their "beer garden" outdoor patio area with lots of seating, ping pong table, and an even bigger bar than inside.

The staff are very friendly and welcoming. They were patient enough to explain the items and what the concept of Umami Burger was each time.  They are supposingly a known business which I've never heard of and they prefer that you don't mess with the chef's creations and have them as is . It seems a like a place to hang out at and have some beers but I wasn't impressed with what I ate. 

Korean Style Brat http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/umami-burger-beer-garden-and-sports-book-las-vegas-2?select=EXZKbmaYdCoXrn7spPRf-g#EXZKbmaYdCoXrn7spPRf-g It looks great but I probably won't order it again. It was a pork belly brat topped with caramelized kimchi, their korean ketchup, sesame aioli, and green onion for $11. The pork belly brat was sliced like a hotdog bun it was thin and tiny in proportion to the other components.  It was like eating a bun filled with just caramelized kimchi. The caramelized kimchi was kind of nasty tasting for me, maybe too caramelized not sure but I needed lots of water just to finish it. 

Manly Burger http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/umami-burger-beer-garden-and-sports-book-las-vegas-2?select=61-9mqfYzG0SuuOpy7DuNw#e-XzbnWpPTFtb9y9GM93FQ Their burger topped with beer cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, their house ketchup, and mustard all for $12. I don't know if I liked too much. The manly aspect wasn't there unless manly meant tiny. It was like an over sized slider.  I would've preferred the onion strings to be crispy. The U on the bun was nice.

Also had the Truffle Fries. Thin fries with truffle cheese and truffle salt. Didn't like it maybe try the manly fries or something else next time. The fries were cold and were all stuck to each other. 

I've had way better comparable food for the price in Vegas. I was expecting something on the line of Bachi Burger or at least better than 1/2 of the numerous burger places here but got something far far from that. Other than that I like everything else about it the huge misters, decorations, the bar, the many TVs, customer service, the outdoor patio with view of the Strip and people walking or driving along the Strip which is why I didn't give them a 1 star.

I might be back.

Was surprised about this place. Though the name says sports bar and it is the food is far from standard bar food.   

I decided to do a truffle night.  Truffled beet salad  truffled fries. Truffled burger.  I would put it in my top burgers ever.  Salad was huge and could be shared with 4. Fries we're awesome.   My friend had burger with lardons it was fantastic and Garlic fries  she liked my fries better 

Are server was a stud.  Again a shocker that this place has this high end stuff.

Customer service was rude, food took over 60 minutes, still didn't come out 
SO WE WALKED OUT 

Warning:: MENU IS DIFFERENT THAN UMAMI BURGER IN LA!

Had FOX news on blaring over what was supposed to be GAMEDAY. 
Fox News guys really?!

Asked multiple times before they put the football audio on

 Didn't even bother to bring the appetizers before the food or refill water until the check came? What sense does that make? 



HORRIBLE HORRIBLE
Worst burger I have ever had. Bread was stale and no condiments given on a to go order

Not my first time at Umami, but yet another great experience! Out server Tashja was great. She gave off a great vibe and great service too! I got the hatch burger and truffle fries this time. Amazing as always. Be sure to check in on yelp. Might get a free beer or fries. DEFINITELY check this place out!

Awful service. Placed an order over the phone and was told it would take 5 min. Went down there and no one knew of any orders that were placed. I had to reorder my ONE order of truffle fries and specifically requested that the sauce be placed on the side so that they would not get soggy. I waited and waited and waited and thirty minutes later after speaking to two workers to follow up on the status of my fries, they come back w my fries. I walk all the way back to my room, starving, and notice my soggy fries swimming in sauce. Exactly how I did NOT want them. Extremely annoyed, disappointed, disgusted and really hating this place right now.

While staying in the SLS we desperately needed food. Decided to stop for a burger and a beer. 

It was so easy to walk from our room to still have a great meal. I tried to signature burger and it did not disappoint. We also grabbed some truffle fries and they were one of the best I have had before. 

Pricing is average. It wasn't the cheapest burger I have had, but also wasn't the most expensive. For Vegas, I felt it wasn't horrible.

Half of their beer selections were not available, which made for wanting a couple of tasting virtually impossible. So, I had to settle on the only one I thought I would want. That was a major bummer.

Love this joint. I stay at sls when I come to vegas. Carlos, is an amazing server. He hung out, chatted and listened. Didn't even feel like we were waiting on food. Good guy. And the food is always spot on.

I purchased a Groupon for Umami since my friend and I were staying at SLS Las Vegas for a few days. The deal included a choice of two burgers or greens, and a choice of two sides. For $25, that seemed like a steal! My friend and I both ordered the truffle burger, complete with truffle fries (clearly we were indulging). The burger was cooked to a perfect medium, per my request. The burger was delicious! Thankfully, the truffle flavoring wasn't overpowering (some restaurants tend to go truffle-crazy). Presentation of the burger and fries was very clean and minimalistic. 

It's been a couple of months since my visit, and I can't remember what we ordered to drink (may have been due to drinking beforehand). However, I do remember that they were off of the specialty cocktail list--and they were amazing!

I will say service was pretty slow, but our waitress was very apologetic and nice. There was a larger party being tended to at the restaurant, causing a bit of a lull in the arrival of our food and drinks. Considering I was on vacation and not in a hurry to go anywhere, this certainly didn't detract from the overall experience.

Service was great! We just left lunch and were served by Mandy!!! She was the sweetest server ever! 

Food is always awesomeeee!!! And if you haven't tried the Estrella Spanish beer- GET IT! (Gluten free and amazing)

Horrible service. Couldn't be worse.  That blonde worker, too bad she was the only one I saw in that bar area.  Perhaps she needs more help with taking orders and serving customers.  I checked the time I placed my order on my receipt, and it took me over 40 minutes to receive my burger. Turns out the burger has been ready for some time now.  Of course this place puts lots of sauce in their burgers, so mine was soggy and gross.  I definitely will not order if its that blonde lady taking orders.  If this is a common problem, they need to pay more attention or rethink their system.

I dont yelp a lot as you can see....but i have to on this one! From what this place 1st was to what it is now is a complete rip off for what you get and the quality just is lousy..And yes its in a hotel but serve better quality food.  In n out burgers are better, and cheaper.  Chicken fingers from US Foods doesnt cut it either when your paying 12 bucks for frozen chicken fingers.  Truffle "fondue" didnt even taste like truffle but more like swiss cheese, and came out cold.  But you can charge more when you put the word truffle on a menu...we came here cause a friend was stayin ast the stratosphere so it was convenient..but never again.  Sorry guys if you call yourself umami it should be better.

We just visited Las Vegas and tried Umami for the first time.  Our server, Josh, was really great, explained the "umami" concept to us and gave us plenty of time to choose the right beer and Umami burgers, which were DELICIOUS, We went back again, this time trying barbecue wings and a Seared Ahi salad. Again, way better than expected in a beer garden.  We asked for Josh this time, and again got excellent service. We'll definitely recommend this place and be back again.

Thought we would eat before the Bill Bellamy comedy show at the Foundry. My party of 4, we were seated, waitress took drink order..the End.   In comes a party of over 25..Next thing I know, she takes the big party drink order. Asked waitress about our drink order, she tells us, " I have to take THEIR ORDER..not nice!  We got up and left.  I went back to talk to someone.  Did I mention that the party of 25 "ALREADY" had heir drinks!!!
Tony the Manager wanted to know if we wanted  to come back ....AFTER THE SHOW at the Foundry.  UMMMMMM, NO!  
I'm not coming back.

I came here with a few of my girls before hitting the Foxtail Dayclub. There was no wait and we were seated promptly at a booth table. Walking in, I instantly noticed how different the decor was from the location in Palo Alto. While the one in PA had a much more college library type of feel, this location has more of a sports bar type of feel. 

Our server was Tashja. She was super sweet and attentive to our needs. I ordered the throwback burger which had two beef patties, ketchup, pickles, mustard, cheddar cheese, and minced onions along with the FREE truffle fries (make sure you check in on Yelp for this!). To be completely honest, I think the burger I ordered had too much meat portion. But that shouldn't be anything to complain about lol so to make it better maybe some produce like lettuce or tomatoes would make the burger taste even better. Also the burger seemed to have too much bread as  well, so it did seem like a heavy burger. You would think that since the order of truffle fries is free that they would be smaller in portion. But no, my order was heaping with fries! 

I don't think I would go out of my way from the strip to SLS to come here, but if I am in the area; I would come back!

Just ok.

Understaffed. Came in post lunch, few people in the restaurant, four of us at the bar. Bartender running around frantically trying to keep up.

Ordered the Classic, short rib smothered fries, and a beer. Charging a lot for pretty pedestrian draft selection. The burger's bun and toppings were good, but burger itself was small and lacking any real flavor, maybe overwhelmed by the toppings. At least was cooked properly. Fries were good, but not wow.

Looks like Burger Bar, Bachi are still my go-to luxe burgers in town.

Came to have a burger and it was great. The meat tasted very fresh which is what I like in a burger and none of that frozen for days stuff.
The man who had the Mohawk  was very helpful and friendly I wish I knew his name. 
I will definitely come back for that fresh burger.
I was looking forward to eating a great burger. Wow was I disappointed. From the start the waitress had a real dry unfriendly personality. Never really made eye contact and looked l

New favorite dipping sauce... Jalapeno Ranch. Omg Delicious. 

Umami Burger is a nice place I have to say.  I really enjoyed the interior layout. There are a lot of TV's, nice open bar area, and everything is new and clean looking. 

The staff is very very pleasent.  Everyone has a smile on their face.  One thing that perplexed me was when we arrived (Like 9 at night) they told us there was a 30 Minute wait for a table... as I looked into the dining room it looked empty? I am assuming they didnt have enough servers on for the late hour? (Thus the 4 Stars)

However we were told that we could go out to the beer garden area thats open aired to the strip for immediate seating if anything was available. 

The outside bar area is fantastic! Very modern looking, plenty of seating.  Very artsy with the lighting. 

Shout out to Chris the bartender.  He was extremely nice, and took care of our needs.  Our drinks did not go empty. 

They have this Frozen Beer there.. ask about it. It's simply genius.
Literally.. Best hamburger ever!! Ordering medium -rare was a mistake! Could not eat fast enough!! Do not skip this place!!

One of my favorite burger places in town. I know they are more on the expensive side, but sometimes you get what you pay for. The truffle burger is a delight. Delicious in all the right ways a burger should be. I really should try some of their other burgers, but when you do it this good... It's hard to order anything else.
We were here with my friends last time. Service is really good and the hamburger is amazing!!  Get the fried pickles and the Manly Burger with a pint of Stella Artois :)

This place is awesome! Amazing atmosphere inside and out and the waitstaff rock! Their food is so delicious! Now this is NOT your average burger joint.... It's better. Very unique flavors that pair well with a good beer! Definitely a must to check out!

The food and drinks were good but the 5 stars are for Sunny, the best waiter ever! Our dining experience today was awesome, especially  because of Sunny. SLS should stand for Sunny Leads Service! We will be back as soon as we can.

Fast and friendly service, clean restaurant and lively atmosphere.. it was my first time here my waitress Rhitzee was sweet,attentive and helpful she helped me figure out this new check in thing on yelp with the pictures. Ordered the Umami burger with chicken breast, Truffle burger and Truffle fries.

The chicken in the Umami burger was nice and juicy and all the ingredients blended together very well. The Truffle burger was tender,savory and juicy as well all the ingredients seem to compliment each other. The Truffle fries were great too food came out after about 15 minutes and was hot.

Only deducting one star because the portion sizes are kinda small and I thought it would've been similar to say like slaters where you could create your own burger but it wasn't really like that. nonetheless was good and would definitely recommend !

Ok. As an LA native I have generally high expectations because of its local reputation, but I think it's highly overrated. I had the turkey burger (named "green" something) and it tasted super greasy/fatty and fairly low quality. Of course the cheesy tots and tempura onion rings were great, but I definitely won't be craving Umami anytime soon.
I'd give it a solid 4 stars. I had the Hatch Burger and sweet potato fries and wasn't disappointed. I recommend asking for the Diablo dipping sauce if you like spicy.  I will definitely come back.

Gross! Diva chefs won't accommodate minor requests .. All I wanted was different onions!!! Bland, tasteless and plain boring!
Worst feeling.. Leaving a restaurant hungry

Riktigt god burgare! Lokalen är precis innanför casinots dörrar. Det går till och med att sitta och spela i baren. Lokalen i sig är en sport bar med flera tv apparater.

Burgaren hade riktigt bra bröd med lagom stuns i sig. Köttet var saftigt och med mycket god smak. Baconen påminde mer om bitar av rökt sidfläsk men det var också väldigt gott. Ovan på cheddar-osten var en liten hög med krispig rök saltade lök strängar. Det här var en riktigt höjdare. Snygg touch med ett sotat U på brödet.

Rekommenderas starkt om du far ut mot den gamla delen av strippen.

I was really excited to try this place out. Burgers are one of my favorite food groups and I am always interested in trying something new. This place was just so-so however. 

Pros: the meat in the burgers is really well cooked and super juicy. The beer cheese on the manly fries is superb. I also really liked the sweetness of the Umami ketchup. 

Cons: too much bun in top and not enough on the bottom. The buns get really really soggy. The fries also get pretty soggy from all the sauce they put on them. 

Flavored were very good, but in all aspects I have had better. It's a solid restaurant though. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and food came out quickly. I'm just not crazy about any if that food.
You know what you're getting here. The burgers are good but not great and the service tends to be on the slow side.

I dine here for lunch about once a week because of the convenience of its location. Food and service is consistently good, but could be better. I am a huge fan of their ahi tuna salad, and truffle fries.

Great burgers, great atmosphere, but over priced. Sit outside  and people watch at one of the busiest intersections is Las Vegas,  Sahara & Las Vegas  BLVD.  Located in the SLS this spot has a lot of options.

I always have a great time at this fancy burger joint! The last time I was there a server name Sunny took amazing care of us... I was extremely impressed by his menu knowledge and attention to detail. He made the whole experience that much better because the food is already amazing on its own.

Mandy was awesome, helpful and she knows her stuff.  Burgers were awesome!   The truffle fries were amazing.  Check in on yelp and get free beer or fries.  Also look online for the menu as there's more on the menu online.  They have a surprise menu that includes cheesy tater tots!  They took things off the menu and if you ask for them, they might still have them. If I cone back to Vegas, I will come back.

Went on a Saturday night and had a great time! Our group was made up of exclusively of locals, and after checking our ID's the waitress brought us free apps on the house! Not too many places give out nice little extras for locals, let alone point it out to them. Very much appreciated the quality service from hostess booth to the table.

I got the choose-for-me combo with beer. For $22.50, you get an entree, fries, and a beer. After being assured I was not going to receive a Stella or Bud Light, I went ahead and gave it a shot. Was glad I did!

I received even more sweet potato fries (one of the apps we initially got, along with truffle fries and onion rings), which were seasoned just right with brown sugar and salt. The entree was the Hatch Chili Burger, and living around Carlito's Burrito's I love them and this burger! Was well cooked, chilis were well roasted, and the bun on the burger was just firm enough to hold things together, add some texture, but not get in the way. Finally, the complimenting beer was Old Chub Scotch Ale, a pretty good micro-brew. All in all, loved the pairing, and look forward to ordering the dining world's equivalent of the "I'm feeling lucky" button again soon.

We went to umami burger for the first time and ordered their hatch and umami burgers and a side of truffle fries that were free with checkin thru yelp very cool.  The beef was high quality and was cooked to order I thought the tomato sauce on the umami burger was different but tasty.  The cheese and chilies on the hatch were good but didn't pack a flavor punch

I'm not much of a reviewer.  This is my first Yelp review, even though I use Yelp often. I travel every week and eat at the best places in many of the best cites in the US. Umami is a great spot to relax and get good burgers and watch sports. Prices are fair for Vegas and the staff was very attentive. Mandy, our server, made several sharp recommendations on our orders and they were all spot on. The food arrived warm and fresh and tasted very good. The big screens were very sharp/ had great resolution. I wish I was here on Sunday for the NFL. 

Only other high burger in Vegas I've had Gordon Ramsay's BurgR and I'm a huge Gordon fan, but Umami makes better food at better prices and has a way better vibe and service.

This place is located in the sls hotel and I had moderate expectations before coming here. I have to admit my Cali burger was prepared nicely and it tasted great! Our server, Carlos, was nice, courteous, and friendly. He gets an A+ for customer service.
Wow that's what a burger is suppose to taste like.  Fantastic.  Don't miss this place you will not be disappointed.

Dang it..... my boyfriend and I came back to Umami Burger again because we had been here about a year ago and umami was so bomb the last time we were here so we were really excited to come back. Sadly this time the burger was not the same it was juicy but was lacking flavor and it's hard to describe it but the meat tasted extra chewy and to make a long story short I only ate a quarter of my burger because it just wasn't right. Im not one to ever complain or send things back unless I'm acknowledged by my server that something is wrong which my waitress did not. My boyfriend only ate half of his because he felt the same way about the burger. Which if you don't know you ONLY get the burger it doesn't come with fries and it's $11! This is usually fine because the burgers should be bomb dot com like they usually are, but when the burger is crappy with no sides I feel your waitress should see there's a problem. We paid our bill and left and within an hour my boyfriend and I were super super sick and had a terrible case of food poisoning for a complete 24 hrs from their burger!

They changed their menu very recently. They had such good food and selection last time we went. We just left the place after realizing  what they have done to the menu. Reminds me of a place like Gordon Biersch. .. The change is menu killed that place and they never recovered after that.

Not going to Umami again with their new menu choices. Why do companies do it ...?

Stopped by Umami today. Everything was great as soon as I walked in the hostess was polite and sat me. My server, Casey, was great! Recommended the manly burger and I loved it ! I even got the cookie for dessert. I will be back!!! 


Review update!! 06/21/17 Came back again and this time we had Lauren as our server. (Easy for me to remember. Lol) She was just as great as Casey, all the staff here is wonderful! Food still delicious! Add an egg to the manly burger, you won't regret it!!!!

After reading friends reviews I came in with low expectations.  Like others I have had Umami Burger in LA and enjoyed it.  I ordered the Truffle Burger, hubby ordered the Manly Burger and we shared Garlic Parmesan Fries.  He had some kind of cider and I had a soda.  Soda is only available in bottles.  Can't get a fountain drink even though they have fountain at the bar they get the rest of the drinks from.  Burgers were cooked perfect.  Flavors were on point.  Service was excellent.  We came in for lunch during the week and there were only a handful of tables occupied.  Loved the sports bar atmosphere.  TV's everywhere including in our booth.  Fun place to place a bet and watch a game.

What can I say other then I love this place. Not just because of the great hand made food made to order but because when you're located in Vegas, you get sectional couches to relax on and tons of TV screens located throughout this fine location. Oh did I also mention that you can place bets on any sports games there while you eat. 

Umami burger is conveniently located with the beautiful SLS casino at the end of the strip. So because it's a new casino what better way to pull people in then to build one of the best burger joints to eat at. The layout of this place is awesome! The have a bar and bench area that overlooks the strip but puts you right in front of this wall size TV screen. That's almost every mans dream right there, to have huge burgers covered with truffle cheese sauce and a cold beer. 

I will say they also have extra dishes on there menu compared to the California locations. So that was a pleasant surprise. So the first time I was there I ordered there standard truffle burger, (I love truffles) so this burger was packed with flavor and a side of oozing and rich truffle fries. On day two I ordered the 12oz. double patty, caramelized onion infused B.U.B burger. If you're on a diet or squeamish, I suggest you not order this burger. It will keep you set for the rest of the day.

So when in Vegas or staying at the SLS, stop by umami burger. It's never let me down and hopefully it won't for you.

I have to stay at this hotel because of my company. Went to Umami Burger in SLS. Most other restaurants too expensive. Loved the fact I could substitute chicken breast turkey patty or portobello mushroom for no extra charge. Also found a Yelp check in for free fries or beer. Got the fab truffle fries. Amazing. Great service. Good food. Only complaint was I have wanted Ahi Tuna on my burger  but the server did not understand when I asked her if it was sushi grade she had  no idea what I was saying.  I overheard hear ask a server who said ""always say yes". I ordered the chicken. English was not her first Language.  Very loud but then again  I'm old.
Food was good! Sweet potato fries were delicious! Service was awesome, Tashja was great and she's a cutie

There's an Umami Burger at the SLS Hotel! This isn't fast food and definitely a great spot if you're looking for a gourmet burger. They have various specialty burgers and always have the logo on the buns. They're fries are amazing!

The have shock top on tap!

The restaurant is pretty big and can accommodate large groups! We fit a group of 15 people when I first came here on a work trip. 

Definitely worth checking out!

Umami burger trifecta was great!  Got there before 9am on Sunday and people were already claiming seats and making wagers.  Leather couches are reserved so get there early if you want a decent seat.  $50 minimum food/drink each person if you want to sit in the booths all day, otherwise will be automatic 20% gratuity if at the tables in the middle.  Friendly staff with manager who totally tried to make everyone happy by running around to set all the different TV's up for all the different fans.  Outdoor patio is awesome and wasn't crowded.  I will be back.
The service was great.  Mandy took good care of me.  She checked on me to make sure that I was satisfied.

Great food. Manly burger is on point.
Watch out for coming around dinner time on a week day, under staffed, and those on staff are stretched too thin to take care of table effectively, constantly had to ask for a refills, ketchup, salt, ect.
I went to dinner with 3 guys, our checks were separate. Upon checking in on Yelp, I was offered a Free Truffle fry with the only stipulation of 1 per guest. One of my friends notified the waiter upon ordering his fries, I presented mine after, when the check arrived. Because they are stretched so thin when I presented my coupon, the waiter said it was one per table and he didn't have time to re-do the check.

What the hell?! They changed and shortened their menu and not for the better either. 

My Royale (braised short ribs burger) and the Jose Andres burger are no longer on the menu. 

They have a bigger alcoholic menu than their food menu!!! Argh..not pleased about that. There's seriously way better burger joints to go to than THIS place. Move on. Nothing to see here.
Excellent atmosphere and burgers! Was with a group of 4 people and we all got different burgers and they were all awesome!! Would for sure recommend to anyone looking for a great burger!

Hatch Burger is out of this world!!! Umami Burger is so good.  Love the Korean Fries and Truffle fries!!! And nothing better to start it  all off than the Truffle Beet Salad!!!! One of my new Fav places to come to in Vegas!!!!

I had the pleasure of getting an invite to a private party here at Umami Burger, SLS where I was treated to comp burgers, fries, drinks, and dessert and it was OUTSTANDING.  Thanks so much to TouchTunes for throwing an awesome party and inviting me to come!

I have eaten at an Umami burger before and liked it and this time, I happened to get a truffle burger as the tray was passing by and it was so delicious.  Sometimes things covered in truffle oil can just be overwhelming and more hype than yum, but this burger was mouth-wateringly fantastic.  I paired it with some of their sweet potato fries which are sweet AND salty and thus, deliciously flavorful - hm.  Umami?  Luckily for us, they also brought out some of their signature ice cream sandwiches and we got to try each.  I liked them, but my first one was the best, chocolate cookie with peanut butter ice cream.  By the end, the cookie parts were getting a little soggy for my taste.  Overall an AMAZING experience and the people working the party and wandering around with trays of tasty treats were so polite and friendly, we really felt like we were at a friend's party.

A few days later, we found ourselves BACK at Umami Burger.  We were looking for somewhere to watch the Nascar race and I remembered that Umami Burger is also connected to the sports book at SLS and is filled with televisions everywhere.  Because it was the March Madness semi finals, I was worried about where to go, but no worries, we were able to get into a booth at Umami and have our private television in the booth tuned to the Nascar race.  Of course, no sound, but at least we were right up close and personal and could see all of the racing action.

Since we'd done burgers and fries, we decided to try some of the other fair offered and the husband ordered buffalo wings and I had the nachos (sans beans).  The nachos come with braised pot roast on them and it's really good.  I enjoyed the nachos very much... only thing that would have made them better would be MORE CHEESE.  Why are people always stingy with the cheese anyway?

We also ordered the pickle plate which is not pickles at all... well, there are a couple of bites of pickles, but it is a plate of a bunch of different pickled veggies, more of a giardiniera with beets, spicy carrots, peppers, etc.  It was tasty! I also actually ordered one of the ice cream sandwiches (the same one I'd like before), but it was surprisingly soggy like the ones I'd had late in the evening at the party, so I thought that was weird, and disappointing.  I wouldn't recommend the ice cream sandwiches due to that.

We milked a good 3 hours at that table and our server was very gracious, but we kept ordering and I dropped a 25% tip to make up for hogging the table.  

Between these two experiences, I definitely recommend Umami burger.  The food is quite tasty and my service experiences were very good.  I'll be back.

Fantastic! I think our table tried about half of the menu!! Ahi salad was delicious. Can't even begin to put the burgers into words just have to try it yourself! Nachos were a great starter! 100% satisfied. Stop in and ask for Mandy everything she recommended we exactly how she described.

If you're a burger fanatic, you must try Umami! Though it is somewhat pricey for the small portions, the quality of each burger is fantastic. My favorite would be the hatch burger since there is a little spice to it. The homemade ketchup makes a difference for the burgers and the fries as well.

SLS hotel's grand opening was today and while there were many restaurants to eventually try, a gourmet burger was what my mind and stomach were set on. 

The wait for a table was a good 30 min. but this gave us some time to explore the casino.  The friendly staff took our info and we received a text message when our table was ready.  When we arrived, we had the option of indoor and outdoor seating.  We stayed cool inside. 

The atmosphere is loud.  Half the room caters to the sports book where you can order food while catching multiple games on large plasma tvs or sit at the bar and have one of their specialty cocktails.  The music rolls in from the casino so you won't be making much conversation though without raising your voice. 

Our server was very nice and accommodating, explaining the menu and the sauces, and making suggestions for us.  We opted to start with some fries as an appetizer which you can customize.  We had gravy and braised short rib on top.  Delicious.  

We ordered the original umami burger and the truffle especiale. Descriptions on my photos, my wife and I decided the truffle burger was the better of the two.   Other non-beef options like ahi tuna and the green turkey burger will have me coming a second time at least to try those. 

The one hiccup was that my wife had her burger (the original) ordered well, while I like some pink and ordered mine medium. The order came out switched so I had to give up a majority of my yummy truffle burger to her!  We were just too hungry to send it back! :)

Anyways, solid burgers and fries. 4 stars!  Will be back.

Service was slow and our order was wrong. The burger was actually really good just wish it was bigger. I was still hungry after we left. Being a server in the past it would be nice to interact a little more and instead of saying no we don't have this or that make a recommendation.
It was okay... Nothing to get excited about. I love a good burger but this was just lacking in flavor for the price. The tempura onion rings were spot on though!

Ok sorry I  know that as a Vegan I should not have any expectations of being able to eat something in a burger joint.  Serious I know this.  But when you travel with people that eat meat there is a certain amount of compromise that must be done.  So there I was at the Umani Burger - went all the way to vegas to eat at a chain, so disappointing.  

Anyway,  I was pleasantly surprised to see that there was a portabella burger on the menu,  so I order this to share with Buttercup and then we find out that the bun has butter, so our waiter enthusiastically informs us that he can make it a wrap and will take care of us so we order the portabella and sweet potato fries.  

Ok what comes out is the just wrong on so many levels.  it is a grilled mushroom and a couple leaves of lettuce.  no tomato, no onions pickles like nothing.... I ask for tomato or something he leaves and comes back to tell me the tomatoes are not vegan.  Whaaaatttt?  ok so we eat our mushroom and lettuce and them try to fries.  They are covered in sugar and cinnamon. super gross who decided this is a good idea.  So at this point our waiter is avoiding us,  I catch him because he can't avoid the customers around us and request regular fries.  He brings he takes away the desert fries and brings us regular ones.  They could use a little salt, but the table has none,  what every we eat this and wait for our bill.  The bill finally arrives and yes they charged us 12.95 for a portabella mushroom and a couple pieces of lettuce.  Really if the kitchen or our waiter had put any effort at all into making this decent then that would have been one thing but not so much.

The draft beer selection was decent. My friends enjoyed their burger so if you want a burger then it beats McDonalds and they have beer so sure go for it.

I wish I was back in Vegas right now just to grab the amazing Ahi Tuna burger at UMami!  Absolutely hands down the best thing I had eaten in a long time!  The restaurant had been plenty of room and seating inside and outside.  Wide range of beer selection and very nice staff.  The only thing I was a little unhappy about was how long the service took. I will definitely be back for the Ahi Tuna burger for sure!

I got the short rib burger and it was incredible. Very well prepared. The bread was buttery and toasted and the meat tender. It had a great sort of roasted flame flavor that really kicked it up a notch. 

I had the truffle cheese fries. Those were really good but not amazing. A little too much cheese for my states. I ordered the salted caramel ice cream sandwich to finish and that was incredibly good. Simple but packed with flavor. Highly recommend.

It is a unique layout with one very large room with couches and leather chairs underneath massive big tv screens for sports fans. On the perimeter of the big room are booths with individual TVs.

I definitely think it's a good chocked for football and food. I don't know if I would make a special trip just for the food as the menu is a bit small. But either way the burgers are excellent.

I heard a lot of buzz around Umami this last year. Friends, yelp, and a whole slue of other people have told me how much their love their burgers. While I enjoy a good gormet burger, normally I find myself always going back to The Counter and calling it good because I have yet to find something to top that experience. 

While Umami is indeed really good, I still do not think it takes the title of being top dog. 

We were eating at the SLS and everyone wanted to try a new burger. We sat down in the heavy sports bar feel of umami because there are TV's absolutely everywhere just like a sports book. It took us a forever and a half to get served because of a mix up, but when we actually ordered everything was smooth sailing. 

I shared a truffle burger and some sweet potato fries. I loved the truffle on the burger, the cheese, the patty being cooked just right, and the bun. It was just a little bit small for what I was paying I feel. I got the sweet potato fries because my girlfriend really wanted them. Normally I hate sweet potato fries, but these were not like other's I have had before because they had cinnamon sugar sprinkled on them. This must have been magic pixie dust because it made them go from something I do not enjoy to a plate of fried potatoes that I wish I was no longer splitting with someone else.

Was better the first time we were here... right after they opened.  They've since changed some things on the menu and now I'd say its good, but nothing special.  Beer selection is unique, some varieties you won't find elsewhere.
My burger was iight. I think I would order something different next time. The truffle fries were bomb though and it was great to sit in their outdoor seating.

This place never seizes to disappoint me! I was here months back and loved it so much I shared my experience with everyone. The vibes are just amazing here and they do such a great job of making you feel at home. Luckily I got the same server again Sunny! He has excellent memory because he remembered me and how he helped me get the early bird the first time... He is so attentive and you don't need to repeat anything to him  like most other restaurants which i love... Ended up getting the same thing with truffle fries since im not a fan of trying new things but every bite was better than the last once again!!

This is a must go restaurant and request Sunny as your server because he makes the experience that much better :)!

I don't follow a vegan meal plan but if I did, I'd eat here DAILY. I first had the impossible burger in LA and mentioned to our group we had to try it out in Vegas. 10/10 hands down. We had a friendly server Liz who went above and beyond. She let us sample a few beers based on our preferences and she  kept our drinks full and had us laughing the night away.  

Back to my favorite part, Liz put in the order for the impossible burgers and added truffle style. Again, I was incredibly surprised that it wasn't beef! Literally, the best burger on the planet. 

Lastly, I'm so glad we came to this location. We had great service, delicious food, and will recommend it to everyone we know visiting Vegas.

What does Umami mean? Since I have never been there I googled it and this was the best answer.

Umami is a basic taste like sweet, sour or bitter. Umami comes from glutamic acid, which is an amino acid - a form of protein. It gives food a "hearty" or "meaty" taste to it. There are specific taste buds on the tongue to pick up on it. 

So after reading this, it only made me want to go there even more. As luck would have it, the Umami Burger that is located inside of SLS was the designated restaurant for Social Sundays that day. It is an event every sunday where a particular restaurant takes 50 percent off its menu prices. 

So me and two other buddies meet up there around 8:30. I was kind of surprised the place was not that busy given the fact that it was social sunday. Im thinking great service should ge a given.

Since it was my first time, I went with their namesake, the Umami Burger also known as the "Original" ($12.00) and an order of Tempura Onion Rings ($5.00). My buddies both got the Sunny Side also known as the "Truffle Especiale" ($14). They also opted for Korean Fries ($6.00) and Truffle Fries ($5.50). Note: These prices are what is in the menu so what we paid was half of what you see.

The Umami Burger has parmesan frico, shittake mushroom, roasted tomato, carmelized onions and Umami house ketchup. After the first bite I knew that I had picked the right burger. Definitely lots of flavor. The beef patty was very juicy and from the looks and taste of it, it was cooked medium. This burger might just end up being my usual.

The Tempura Battered Onion Rings had the nice crispiness to it just like how tempura is supposed to be. You can tell that it was cooked fresh and not frozen simply because the onion itself was still semi crispy. They cooked it just right.

The Korean Fries were sweet potato fries topped off with kimchi, scallions, goat cheese, and Korean ketchup. The sweet potato fries by themselves were already good but when you eat one that has the above mentioned toppings on it look out! It had a bit of a kick to it but very tolerable.

The Truffle Fries were shoe string fries smothered with melted truffle cheese. Nice flavor combination of crunch and seasoning of the truffle cheese.

Im glad we shared all three sides because we would of never gotten to taste the variety of each plate. Im assuming that their Maple Bacon Fries were really popular because that was the first thing we wanted to order but our said they ran out of maple syrup.

As for the service, eh, it had great potential when we first got there seeing that the place was not that busy. Our server took our orders and got them to us in a timely manner. Now thats where the service pretty much stopped. We didnt see our server for quite sometime and ended up flagging down another server just so we could get refills on our waters and sodas. One of my friends had already used up most of his napkin to so he asked for another one but never got it.

So overall, the fact that it it was 50 percent off and everything we ordered was delicious, that deserves 5 stars. But the lack of service after receiving our food kind of ruined my experience. So 1 star for bad service and 5 stars for great food which was half off. So there's your ok rating of 3 stars. Im hoping that the bad service was just a fluke and that my next visit will be better. If it is then I will update this accordingly.

Yelp 2015 Review #26
524 overall

Casey is absolutely fabulous!!! I live in Vegas and we do not always get a good experience dining out on the strip. I was here with a high profile client that wanted to watch the hockey game so we came here since it is close to the convention center. Since we sat down Casey was extremely friendly out up with sense of humor and we had a great time. The only reason I will come to the strip for dinner without having a client in town is because of her. Thanks Casey !!!

The absolute best burger and service ! The manager: Tony Penniman recommended the Cali Burger and I'm so happy I did . He made my first experience here at Umami one to remember I will 
Definitely be back... I highly recommend ! Thanks Tony !!
The food was subpar and the service was lackluster as well. French fries were served stale. Burger was nothing to rave about either.

Nice place, no line no wait we were seated immediately. Has a sports bar look and feel, decently priced for a place on the strip. T.V's everywhere, staff is very friendly our server Ben is great explains everything in detail told us about there off menu items and was very accommodating with my girlfriends food allergies.  Drinks as far as soda are pricey but they are imported from Mexico meaning no garbage chemicals they use in fountain drinks. Food is amazing came hot and fresh on a sweet Portuguese bun absolutely delicious. Good food great service worth the price of eating on the strip and will definitely compete with Gordon Ramsay's BurGR.

Came to Umami Burger after a trade show at the convention center. I was staying at the W and ate at Cleo the night before, this night I was wanting more of a place to go to the bar and grab a beer, eat, watch sports, and head back. When I got here the bar was already full (good sign people were here) so I got a small table for myself. I kept catching myself looking in all directions at all the different screens there were, there is also a sports book with people betting so that was neat (if only they had a blackjack table in here). 
I ordered the Umami burger because 1) the place is named after it 2) it had a crisp Parmesan cheese 3) shiitake mushrooms. The burger was great. Only disappointment was I think they shorted me on the mushrooms since I only noticed one shiitake mushroom, nonetheless it was a solid burger with soft buns and cool logo burnt on it for a nice appearance. 
I also ordered the Truffle Fries. These were great as there was not an overwhelming taste of truffle and the cheese was good. What really caught my taste buds out of everything was the sauces! ASK FOR THEIR SAUCES. I believe this is one hidden gem of this place. I got their jalepeño ranch, buffalo sauce, diablo sauce, and BBQ. I'm a sauce guy so I was excited when my waitress brought all these out after only asking for ranch and buffalo. The ranch is more of a homemade ranch that they make in house, the buffalo is fantastic if you're a buffalo fan, the diablo is exactly how you imagine it tasting, and the BBQ was a smoky tang flavor. LOVE the sauces.

Lastly I had the cookie with ice cream and it's a perfect dessert in the desert...(good luck to the people who can't read the difference between those) 
A warm cookie oozing the chocolate chips as you fork through it to the perfect scooped vanilla ice cream on the bottom. Not too rich!


Other than the food the service was prompt and respectful. The beer came cold, the burger came much quicker than expected, and the waitress was very nice.

We arrived a bit late so the beer garden was closed, however we did have time to grab a few beers off the menu and guzzle them down before closing time.

The service was friendly and attentive, that was good.  The menus were crisp and well-laid out.  The selection of beers, however, contained a lot of superfluous, turgid descriptions of trash beers like Miller or Bud Light alongside a raft of garden-variety beers you see in just about every bar in America.  There was a small selection of higher-grade rarities, but the premium charged for these was laughable.  Also, the souvenir beer bong thing you get for $24 is a plastic lip-murdering beast that is best left behind.
Amanda was great!  We had a large group and she rocked it!  The burgers were amazing and the fries did not disappoint!
Truffle fries were tasty...easy to eat.  Manly burger was filling and the 4 beer custom sample topped the meal off.
We went back to Umami after our first bad experience. This time, the food was spot on. All the burgers were cooked perfectly. Fries were crisp and hot. Loved the parmesan garlic fries.

Words can't explain how inexorably horrible this pale imitation of an L.A. original the Vegas Umami is. From the rude, slow help to the inconsiderate management, this place is worthless. And the food is nothing like it's L.A.counterparts. Don't waste your time. SLS should me ashamed of themselves. Don't be surprised if it's closed within the year. I KNOW I'm not the only one who feels this way.

Overcooked burger for $15 no fries ? Are u serious, shack shack much better even in n out for $3,99 is better than this burgers. Also very slow service, 50 min to get burger. The cooks go outside and famble for sports instead of cooking properly the meat. Also there is no manager here at 1:36pm. Sad to visit a place like that and spend your money.

This place is amazing.  Our waitress Casey was a blast.  The beer garden is fun. You can play ping pong and foosball while waiting.  Truffle burger is to die for.  They do need to fix the air hockey table though.  There are lots of burger places in Vegas.  The truffle burger here and the bacon burger at I love burgers are my two faves.

I understand why this particular Umami has horrible reviews, but the umami burger I ordered was delicious ( albeit small ) 

We came here for lunch time around 11:30 am, and waited about 30 minutes to be seated which I thought was ridiculous since the restaurant was not crowded at all. My group had 7 people so we were told beforehand that we would be charged addtl. gratuity which usually I don't mind but when we received the bill I saw that we were charged 20% which is ALOT! especially when the server freaking forgot our umami fries even though I checked with her twice that I had put in 2 orders of umami fries. 

I ordered the umami especiale truffle burger, and we also shared the umami fries, fried pickles, and sweet potato fries.  I especially love the ketchup that they have here, it is the only ketchup that I will eat.  The sweet  potato fries and fried pickles weren't particularly worth it, since they only give you 6 spears of pickles for $6 so $1 per pickle wtf. 

Service just took way too long, and it was pretty obvious the staff did not know what they were doing. I wouldn't mind the price for this restaurant if only the burgers were a little bigger.  I usually cannot finish an entire burger but at Umami I always can. 

P.S. ONLY umami with a full bar.

Everything was excellent ! My server, Carlos, was so nice he recommended the manly burger with truffle fries they were super good. Also from the secret menu the cheesy tots were delicious. I enjoyed the whole experience from service to food and drinks ! Definitely recommending and going back !

I simply love this place. The truffle burger w thin fries were delicious. The treatment & experience were phenomenal. I highly recommend icoming here & will definitely come back. Thanks to our waiter, Kevin, who was awesome & the lady manager who took care of us!

I wanted this place to be better, but as my 3-star review suggests, it's A-OK at least. It's a restaurant/sports book, and I wouldn't say one step's on the other one's toes too much. There's something about the food though, it doesn't taste the same as other locations. Granted, I haven't been here since they opened, so maybe I need to see how it is now. I expected this place to be a regular spot I'd frequent, but the first visit just didn't wow me enough to come back. Our server was great, but he actually wasn't a permanent employee here, they were still sorting out staffing at the SLS and one the hotel's departments had workers that were placed here. You could kind of see confusion though with the other servers at other tables. Our burgers, fries and dessert just weren't as good as I remember the SF location being (I even took the day off of work to make the venture into deep SF to indulge)... and it just didn't.. umami. I think anyone who hasn't gone to previous locations though will like this place well enough. The SLS itself is all kinds of blah, so that probably has something to do with my overall aversion to coming back. Vegas has a ton of burger options and this place needs to step it up if it's going to survive (which I really hope it does, Vegas economy doesn't need another hotel closing).
The manly burger with chicken was delicious! However, the rating reflects the level of service we received from our server. She was rude and inattentive.

Amazing burgers here, I got the manly burger. Even their fries were amazing! It was a bit loud in there though, I sometimes had to shout to the person right across from me. Otherwise, still a great place to eat, staff was really nice

Flavor mouth party!   The burgers are to die for!  The side sauces are incredible.  Great place to watch some sports and grab a super yummy bite to eat.  The noise level is ear piercing, and the service is decent but they were slammed.  Can't wait to try their San Francisco location, hoping for a better atmosphere there, but the food flavor?! UMAMI!

Love this place! I've been to Umami Burger in NYC and it's excellent; honestly, no different at this location. The service is great. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. I had the Greenbird Burger - delicious! The fries were a bit over salted but still really good. Drinks are good; I had the Black Raz Mojito which wasn't overly strong but still pretty good. Prices are high.. that's the only drawback to this place (seems more like NYC than Las Vegas). But if you're just visiting Vegas and need some good food and beer (they have quite a selection), then it's worth it!

The burger was tasty but it was small and pricey. I watched an NFL football game there. It was a nice atmosphere. The best thing is that there is a Sports Book inside the restaurant.  You can collect your winnings when the game is over.  I did.

I had heard a lot about Umami Burger from friends and relatives from California. So I was, naturally, excited to hear that there would be a location inside the new SLS Casino. 

We had a party of 5 of us this past Sunday evening. We had the option of having a table or booth, so we opted for the booth. I was diggin' the layout of the space. It is attached to a William Hill sports book, so there were plenty of TV's around playing football(including in our booth!). You can NEVER go wrong with me by having football on the TV!

The service was outstanding! Our server, Mandy, was both personable and engaging and helped us with recommendations(including my tasty Stella Amber!). Our party ended up trying a little bit of everything. First we ordered appetizers of fried pickles and "manly" fries. I didn't partake of the fries pickles, but those fries were delicious! I had the classic burger, while my friends had the B.U.B. and the Truffle burgers. They all ranged in price from $12 to $14 each. The burgers were juicy and tasty. My only complaint would be that they were a bit on the small side.

It wasn't until after we were finished that we walked out to the patio facing the strip and took in the Beer Garden. Looks like a very cool set up and I do look forward to coming back and trying out some more menu items!

This was a pleasant experience and we will certainly be back once things calm down a bit at the SLS...

so I have to give it..

4 stars!

Great place to go on the strip! My boyfriend and I ordered several different items for us to split and it was well worth it. We were able to try so many good things from the menu. Service was very nice and even got to chat with the manager. LOVE LOVE LOVE

Amazing!!! Try the Ahi Tuna Burger! A party of flavors in your mouth!
The drinks were phenomenal!!

Our waitress was fantastic! And love the outdoor sitting.

Walked here from SLS.  Nice sports bar and burger joint.  Busy for World Series game 7. Got Buffalo wings to start. Half dozen in order.  Great.  Ordered a Cali burger med rare.  Good quality meat and nice temp cook.  Truffle fries are great.  All burgers are a la carte so fries are extra.  Overpriced for what you get but it's Vegas.

We had a great experience at Umami Burger thanks to Liz Veloz, who was our bartendar!!  She was exceptionally nice and made our stay at the SLS a awesome experience!  She is what we expect of the quality of bartenders when visiting Las Vegas!  Thank you Liz for everything and we hope to see you again in the near future!   Our best, Don and Ernesto from  Melbourne Florida.
Had the Manly burger, fries, and the pickled plate. Everything was excellent! Even the ketchup was awesome. TVs everywhere catching all the games. Definitely recommend this place

This place hit the spot after a karate tournament! I had two hungry teens and a hungry boy and we had an awesome lunch! What made it the best was our server Sunny. This guy is friendly, prompt, funny, and all around a perfect waiter. They should make him a manager or at least give him a raise because he made the whole dining experience fun and enjoyable. The maple fries are also A1! Thanks again Sunny for a great dining experience.

Terrible service, okay food, good drinks

Umami Burger is basically a poor man's Bachi Burger, or a dressed up overpriced burger where you over pay because it is on the strip.  Combine this with a total lack of competent service, and you're in for a disappointing night.  As to the service, SLS apparently stands for "Style, Luxury, Service," but Umami Burger contorts that to "Severely Lacking Service."  If you're local, eat at Bachi Burger before going to the SLS and you'll get a superior burger at better prices.  

While I can appreciate that the restaurant just opened and it may be working out the kinks, the service was incredibly disappointing.  To top it off, a marketer for the restaurant went to the adjacent table to see if they were locals to give them information about local specials.  When we looked at her to catch her eye, she just looked at us, then ignored us, and walked away.  This was pretty much on par with the terrible service we also had from our server who had nothing but attitude and rarely came back to check on the table.  That said, the server was cognizant enough to smile and tell us that she hoped we had a great dining experience when she was dropping off the check.  

Umami Burger, you just lost 8 customers who will never eat at  your establishment again.  From looking at the other reviews, it looks like you will be alienating your future customers.  At least you're consistent.

SLS hotel in Vegas has the umami burger lounge and bar. It was a really nice decor. We were a party of 4 and had the Travelzoo deal for 4 burgers and drinks for $55. We walked in past the hostess because she was busy chatting with her colleagues. We didn't where to head out so we ended up coming back to the front and letting her know we need to be seated. The service was good but slow bec the server took our drinks, while it took sometime to bring those drinks. The food took sometime to get out of the kitchen. When it did, it was really good. In addition to the deal, we ordered their fries selection and they were awesome. Their umami. Tigers are really flavorful with a good quality and size. Their bun is pretty tasty too. I would get that again for sure and their truffle fries.

I have never been to any Umami burger joints in LA, since we stayed at SLS hotel, there weren't many choices for lunch, I wanted some ice cold beer, so Umami burger it is.

Glad to see there are veggie appetizers, ahi tuna burger and vegan burger. That's all I can have on the menu. The Belgian draft beer I tried was pretty good, very tasty and strong. Had a glass Stella for second one, couldn't finish it, poured it in a plastic cup and took it back to our suite. 

Appetizers: House pickled veggies, Thin fries. 

The assorted pickled veggies were delicious, sour and salty, great hangover snack. They provided three dipping sauces for fries, the yellow jalapeño sauce was extremely spicy, loved it. 

Burgers: Umami burger in medium rare and Vegan burger. 

Hubby liked his burger alright, he said it was tasty but nothing spectacular for being their so-called signature burger. My sloppy mami was really"sloppy", it was open faced and impossible to hold, also hard to take a bite, the stuffings made the buns so mushy, tasted nasty, but the stuffings were very delicious, liked the onion strings so much. 

Food was good but not great, portions were huge, our waitress was friendly and fairly attentive. 

This place is great for watching sports on the leather couches in the mid section, a few enormous flat screen TVs hanging up high right in front of those seatings, those are for reservations only. A great way to kill some time in the afternoon hanging around here. 

Unless we want to have drinks and watch sports, I wouldn't come again, just not my type of food.

Seriously, this place sucks.  Get over the hype that this chain is from LA.  Get over the fact that Las Vegans want to be Los Angelenos, and eat whatever they eat.  This establishment still rates high on the suck-o-meter.  2000mg glutamate-ridden burgers.  Fries that even Ronald does better. And what is this? No milkshakes?!?!  What kind of burger place doesn't offer a milkshake? Ah they have pre-packaged ice cream sandwiches from CoolHaus though, come on!

Here is why Umami gets one star instead of none...because I can use their outside entrance to gain access to the SLS quicker.  Milkshake, figure it out...it's ice cream, milk...and a god damn blender.

If I could give zero star, I would. Very unprofessional & unapologetic. Customer service was very unsatisfactory. 

Came here for lunch with my daughter while waiting for hubby to finish playing on the table..thinking I'd give this place a try after having read some reviews about the bad service. I requested to be seated at a booth considering my daughter always, and by always, I mean literally always manage to fall off chairs. We were explain that since I had my daughter with me, it's automatic that they'll seat us by the back booth because of the sports book. We were shown the way & guess what! 2mins upon having sat, I was told we had to finish ordering, waiting & eating by 12:30pm. Mind you, it was literally 11:54am!  Just coz a party was coming at 12:30pm to occupy the space where we were seated -- WHY HAVE US SIT HERE WHEN YOU WERE GONNA USE THIS SPOT IN 36mins! I don't work in the restaurant business but I think courtesy is a universal thing wherever & whatever field of work you do. I asked for specifics but no answer provided. NO APOLOGY EXTENDED. 

I had to LEAVE. I wished it would have been a better experience. Very disappointing. Sometimes it's not just the food that matters, QUALITY SERVICE means a lot to paying customers like me as well. You get more exposure by word of mouth especially if patrons get good service. Very disappointed.
Located inside a sports book. Best rendition of an impossible burger. Tasted just like a traditional cheese burger. Only con was there wasn't any vegan cheese.

Great burgers.  Great service. Mandy was our server and she made our eating experience a pleasure. She went out of her way several times to do us a solid. One of the best eating experiences we had during a very busy NCAA weekend. Plus, the catsup is awesome. Please come to Texas.

Umami: 
noun
a category of taste in food (besides sweet, sour, salt, and bitter), corresponding to the flavor of glutamates, especially monosodium glutamate. ???

I wasn't sure what Umami meant, so my assumption was that this was going to be an Asian fusion burger. Nope, this is just a straight up burger with truffle oil randomly thrown in the mix. C'mon, you were thinking the same thing when you heard the name, "Umami Burger". 

I came here with some friends and we started this meal off with a cornucopia of deep fried, carb loaded appetizers, Mmm Mmm my favorite. First up, the "Smushed Potatoes" these were ok, but a tad flavorless. They look like a mini-baked potato and be careful when eating, I tried putting a whole one in my mouth and nearly lit my tongue on fire. These little pockets of heat are best cut in half and dipped in Umami house ketchup, which I liked a lot. It's ketchup, but with a mix of truffle oil and something spicy. We also ordered sweet potato fries and tempura fried onion rings. The sweet potato fries were cooked perfect, crispy and soft and the tempura coating on the onions was light, flaky and not too heavy. Overall, deep fried goodness. 

On to the star of the show. I ordered the Truffle Burger, the hat trick of truffle oil infused beefy eats. This burger has; truffle aioli, truffle cheese, and coated in a truffle glaze. This burger was super juicy and full of flavor and honestly didn't need any sauce assistance, but I still dipped it once or twice in a mixture called, "Diablo Sauce"? Plus the bun was super soft, like dissolving in your mouth soft. Cute side note, they adorn each bum with the letter, "U" which in the words of Ralph Wiggum stands for, "Umm-believable". After the burger entered the equation I completely forgot about the side dishes and went full carnivore. 

To finalize the meal, like any good eater, we ordered and shared a dessert. This was an Ice Cream Sandwich. A snicker-doodle cookie with caramel ice cream filing. Sooooo good, a must order! 

- Was this the best burger I ever had? Nope. 
- Was it tasty and satisfied me? Yes
- Would I come back? Maybe. Every once in a while. 

Umami is good, but the prices are a little high for a burger place, but If you haven't been here yet it's definitely worth a try if you're any kind of burger loving American. 

Cheers.

The food was good but the service we had was not the best. I was there for lunch and the female server we had  did not have proper customer service etiquette. We informed her that we did not receive one of the dishes that my friend ordered. Instead of apologizing her comment was "I asked you and that's what you told me" rather than saying "My apologies, I will get that order in for you right away". They need to work with their staff on proper ways of speaking to customers but the food was good that's why I gave three stars.

I didn't really know what to expect seeing the mixed reviews but once my boyfriend told me about this shortrib and truffle burger, I knew we had to make a visit. When we went on a Thursday around 10pm, there was no wait and only a few parties seated. Our server Charlie was awesome! Super friendly, had a great upbeat attitude and made sure we were well taken care of.
Onto the food! I've never tried Umami Burger so I was surprised when they brought out four complimentary sauces: umami ketchup, jalapeno ranch, spicy diablo, and garlic aioli. All of them had great flavor and consistency. 
We also ordered the smother 'em fries, shoestring fries with shortrib and gravy and they were delicious! I  couldn't stop eating them with all the sauces and I usually never finish fries.
To the main event! We both ordered The Royale medium rare, topped with short rib, truffle aioli, and truffle cheese. The truffle flavor was definitely there, but less than the Fungi Burger from Holsteins and I was surprised at the amount of short rib on it, it had a nice thick layer. At first glance though when they brought it, it looked kind of small but it was the perfect amount because of how thick and meaty it was! The only thing I didn't like was the bun. I'm a big fan of brioche buns and judging from the look I thought it was but when I took a bite it was kind of dry and tasted like basic white toast haha and also the bottom half got pretty soggy. Blehh it would've been perfect!
Dessert time! I forgot to take pictures of the ice cream sandwiches but I liked the regular vanilla and chocolate chip cookie combo the best. The mint and double chocolate combo was a little too fresh and minty for me, like eating mouthwash lol and the peanut butter was alright, maybe if I was more a fan of peanut butter desserts I'd like it. I'll save my ice cream cookie sandwich craving for Sweet Addictions next time.
Overall I really enjoyed my visit here, great customer service, and yummy food. Will definitely be back!
Tip- the couches and booths can be reserved for game days, just call ahead! :)

Ordered the Ahi burger and redeemed a free truffle fries to go (I hate casinos, cigarette and slot machines.) Upon arrival at my hotel, I found out that they gave me fries without the truffle oil.. 
Major disappointment as I love its location in Palo Alto :(

Wish they had one in Houston the truffle burger is out of this world the fries are OK but it's hard to beat free with a yelp check in 

Only negative the place says beer garden but not much on draft but oh well Tuesday was 2cent beer so another reason for bottoms up

Came here for the impossible burger but was really disappointed. First the restaurant was in a weird location which in the same spot as the sports book. Hard to find and the host was no where to be found. This wasn't that big of a deal but it was just weird. When we were seated the waitress we're wearing t shirts advertising the impossible burger but no one explained to us what it was and there wasn't any information about it anywhere. It also came with regular cheese not vegan cheese. This could all be overlooked but the $16 double impossible burger came out and my first thought was I thought it would be bigger. The burger was good but I was not even close to full and was really disappointed with everything but the taste.
Visited with my daughter and boyfriend and the service was excellent.  Burgers were great too!  Love how the sweet buns are stamped with a "U".  Love the truffle fries!!!

When you fail the fundamental basics of customer service, you're going to get a 1 star. Looking for a bite to eat before meeting friends, I decided to try Umami Burger, as I'd heard good things about it. I waited patiently, since the place had a handful of tables busy, and the bar was half full. 10 minutes went by. Not even so much as an acknowledgement that I was there, let alone any hope of getting seated. The final straw was this guy in a Manziel jersey (all the staff except the bartender had football jerseys on, due to it being an NFL Sunday) who walked lazily past me four times, looked at me directly twice, and ignored me. At that point, I'd had enough and walked out. Rule #1 of any service industry - acknowledge that the customer is there. Needless to say, I won't ever be eating here voluntarily. If you can't even get the first, most basic rule right, that speaks poorly of the business as a whole.

Wanted to try. Food was great! I would like to say we were told by the host the wait would be 45 mins. I looked around and saw 7 empty tables. I guess the manager Jessica overheard me talking to my husband and Jessica got us sat right away. We were served by Micaila, she was an absolute pleasure. Attentive to our needs and smiling every time we saw her. To top off the experience the manager Jessica bought us our wonderful dessert. Kudos Jessica and Micaila!!!

First time having Umami burger, & honestly, I think people just live for the "hype" of this place. 

First, customer service was terrible. For a very slow night out waitress's only came to our table once to refill our glasses (which were empty for 20 mins). The restaurant only had 5 tables occupied & a couple people at the bar. Not only was my boyfriend & I waiting for our glasses to be filled, but also the table across from us. Before we got our food, I noticed my knife pretty dirty. It seemed like there was still food residue on it. I asked our waitress if I can have another knife, & she came 10 mins after we got our food to give me the knife. Which was useless.

Second, the food came at a good time, we didn't wait too long. The burger I got was the sunny side burger, which had the egg in it. I enjoyed my burger very much. The meat was juicy & not too much crap in it; just the greens, cheese, patty, & the egg. My boyfriend got the regular burger & his was just plain bland. We even put a onion ring just to have some type of crunch or flavor, but nothing. On the sides we had onion rings which were pretty good with their homemade ketchup. The fries, we ordered from the secret menu & had the "manly" fries. It had truffle sauce, cheese, & bacon bits on it. The fries were cold and did not even taste like it came from the fryer. It wa soggy and had way too much sauce. The fries even tasted like stale potatoes. The bacon bits were real bacon, but it was so hard that I'm questioning if that bowl of French fries were sitting out for awhile before it was served to us.



Overall, place is alright & they're burger... Well the sunny side burger was good.

Umami in Japanese means 'delish'. We were staying at the SLS hotel, so we gave Umami Burger a try. The restaurant is like any sports bar, but it's more roomy & the seating is comfortable. However the 'Umami Burger' is a little disappointing. First off, the burger comes without any fries or salad. Fries & salad are extra. The patty was not very tasty; NOT 'umami' at all.
