There is not much of anything on the patty...maybe a sundried tomato & a little bit of onions. It is just not very appetizing. I expect a yummy burger, but this burger is really bland. You pay this for $12.95, without any fries or salad. I had better burgers  somewhere else.

Came here because groupon was having a really good deal, $25 for 2 burgers & 2 sides. 

You have to park in the SLS parking structure and then walk into the casino. Umami Burger is on the opposite side of the casino floor. No worries though, because SLS is very small so its not a long walk at all. 

When my friend and I first arrived, we were really confused. There were two lines, roped off but no host. So we went inside a bit, no one said anything to us, and walked back out to the host stand and was about to walk to the other entrance when the host finally came. I wouldn't have known she was the host because she didn't have a uniform, I just saw her ear piece and was like... maybe she'll help us. She didn't say anything to us, and I had to tell her seating for two people. Even when she led us to a booth, and set down our menus, she still didn't say anything. 

Our server wasn't too friendly, but he was attentive. I added lettuce, tomatoes (which he told me were grilled), and onions to my truffle burger. I wanted to order the truffle fries but was afraid it would be too much truffle so settled on the garlic parmesan fries. My fried ordered the ahi burger and sweet potato fries. 

Our food came out in a good amount of time. My friend said she could SMELL the truffle when it was brought out. Maybe my taste buds suck or something, the truffle burger had truffle cheese and a truffle aioli but i didn't really get that much of a truffle taste. The burger patty itself was very juicy, and cooked medium, just the way I like it! One of the RARE occasions where I actually get my meat cooked how I want it! I like my fries to be... not so skinny. So I didn't enjoy the fries very much, but they were crispy. The pieces of shredded parmesan was just sad. At least melt the cheese or use a different type of parmesan. A lot of the parmesan fell off as I was trying to grab the fries. 

Overall, my friend and I enjoyed our meal. It was interesting to watch all the different sports on the many many TV screens that they had. Apparently, you can bet at the bar and watch whatever sport they have on the big screen. Trust me, the screen spans the entire wall. They had baseball on as well as football and boxing. 

Don't expect to come here for a nice date night. Because of all the sports, it can and WILL get very loud! On the way out, we walked right past the host who just stared at us. I was watching the way that she seated other parties (without a smile), and wanted to see if she would thank us for coming in or at least say goodbye. Nope. 

SLS is a pretty confusing drive from Henderson, our GPS took us in a weird route. I may be back but not anytime soon.

Went here for a birthday lunch. Being vegan I was disappointed in the selection. They did not have a vegan or veggie patty, and to top it off, what they did have was a sloppy joe type or sandwich that was open. The menu stated "vegan mix" with lentils, tomatoes, and cheddar jalapeños and some other stuff. That's not vegan. Maybe the chef needs a refresher. Then I got my food it and it  had a creamy sauce on top, again, why does your "vegan choice" say vegan when there is dairy in it. I didn't want to complain because I was out on a birthday lunch, the environment was great. U can eat on the couch and watch sports, or sit at the bar. Service was ok. Fries don't come with your meal but burgers start at 12$!!! I found that crazy. Huge drink selection but nothing appealing. Maybe I'll consider going back once they update their "vegan" selection.

I want to give them 5 stars, but because they're so busy inside, the patio lacked prompt service. However.... the food is amazing!! I had the ahi tina burger, please get this. My friend had the Cali burger and she says it was totally worth it. Another friend for the nachos and she wasn't impressed, but she doesn't like beer and supposedly the cheese is beer infused. Last dish ordered was the chicken Cesar salad and she says it was good. Nothing as great as the ahi air the burger. Yum!! Also dairy free burgers. They melt in your mouth.
This is a great place. I ordered the manly burger. OMG. it was delicious. It had chunks of bacon and the cheese sauce was fantastic.  The ranch sauce was dressed up with garlic. Just pure fantastic.

Overhyped and under delivered. They will take forever to seat you even if it seems like there are open tables all throughout the restaurant. Ok, they are probably short staffed but still.

I ordered the truffle burger. Meh, I've had better. It tasted plain, not a lot of flavors going on, maybe because I like my burgers with lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. The truffle burger consisted of meat, cheese, sauce, and bun. The only item that I really liked was their ketchup, that ketchup was souped up with something. All I'm saying is for the price, I could go somewhere else and have a way better experience food and service wise. (?_-? )
We had our family in town, we enjoyed the different array of burgers. My dislike is no kids menu.

What kind of place makes anorexic nachos like these? 
What is the point?
I understand this is a burger joint, but why sell nachos if you're going to be so frugal with the toppings. Your burgers are only decent...so at least make these overpriced nachos (same price as burger) above par. It is ridiculously easy to make bomb a$$ nachos! Please give your nachos an upgrade (loads of melted cheese, sour cream, onions, more beans, etc.)!!!

A-OK is the name of the game over at Umami Burger. Everything I tasted was good, but not great and for the most part, wouldn't warrant a return visit unless I was staying in the hotel. The seating itself is a bit wacky, as it's combined with a sports book and outdoor area, so make sure you get there at the right time if it's Sunday or Monday night. People are staying at those tables for a loooong time. Items ordered..
Buffalo chicken loaded "potato nachos" - chips with cheese and chinks of buffalo chicken on it. Hard to get a piece of chicken onto the chip. Finger food time! 
Black bean burger (chipotle black bean patty, Cotija cheese, guacamole, street-cart
pickles, cilantro) - Very, very average. On the dry side and quick to crumble. 
Truffle fries - Good fries, with or without the truffle cheese. Came with three dipping sauces which were all unmemorable. 
Beers- not a huge selection but some nice stuff. Check their webpage for drink specials. 

Bonus: There's a good manager in the house and the truffle fries are comp'd with Yelp check-in

After checking out of our room and heading to the airport, we had lunch here. Not much of a selection, but the food was good. You receive a massive menu, of which, 1/8th is actually food and the rest, beers and drinks.

If you like different craft beer - may be a fun place to try. The food was good too. Burgers were cooked well and had good flavor. I don't care for ketchup or mustard on a burger and requested mayo, they have a garlic aioli instead, which was very good.

The truffle fries are good - but strong. Make sure you have some gum for after your meal. :) Our waitress was great and recommended the spicy sauce and house made ranch for the fries....both had a good flavor.

3 stars because while it was good, it wasn't memorable....not sure I would necessarily return if we found our way back to Vegas.

After my last review the GM from Umami Burger contacted me. The GM was very concerned about our negative experience and extended their sincere apologies and invited us back to give Umami Burger, Beer Garden & Sports Book another try.  I was really impressed with the customer service, so we'll try this again.  I do have to say that my experiences at the SLS as a whole, have all been very pleasant and positive.  The SLS is a new hotel, and there are growing pains - I hope they can grow from our feedback and make the upcoming experiences wonderful.  They get 5stars for doing the right thing and offering a make-good.

This is my favorite burger of all time but the service might be the absolute worst. Combined with high prices (it's a casino location). Try the truffled fries and truffle or hatch burger. Also, coke comes in a glass bottle! My wife's favorite part of the experience.

When I was walking around the SLS Las Vegas Hotel while waiting for my hotel room, I was ecstatic to try out the Umami Burger restaurant. I sat inside near the bar on my first visit. Their alcoholic beverage menu had more items than the food menu. The first burger I tried during my first visit was the Throwback burger with two beef patties, white cheddar cheese, miso mustard, Umami house ketchup, soy pickles, and minced onions. I also had sweet potato fries on the side. Let me tell you, I was amazed with the Throwback burger that I literally wanted to order another one, but I was too full. It was juicy, not too salty, and a tad bit tangy. The sweet potato fries tasted more like cinnamon, which I did not mind.

My second visit to Umami was on the second day of my stay at the SLS. This time around, I asked for outdoor seating since I was in a group with five other people. I ordered the Truffle burger with truffled aioli, house truffle cheese and truffle glaze and a side of truffle fries. Out. Of. This. World.

My last visit was on the fourth day, in which I ordered the Sunny Side with parmesan frico, fried egg, some butter, a hefty amount of arugula, and truffled aioli as well as a side of sweet potato fries. The Sunny Side burger wasn't the greatest for me. It tasted more like an arugula salad than a burger. The sweet potato fries were great anyway.

The service at Umami in the SLS Las Vegas was outstanding. I even used the complimentary ice cream sandwich coupon from the coupon book that held my room key and tried the Peanut Butter Double Chocolate ice cream sandwich. Sweet and salty amazingness.

I'm just so glad that there are two Umami Burger restaurants in San Francisco. I just checked their menu and there is a wider variety than the menu at the SLS. Score!

It was just an O-K experience for me. Personally the burgers and hot dog were decent in quality but still overpriced. $10 for a hot dog that really wasn't special... I am not a picky eater but I am also not a crap eater. Their signature sauces didnt exactly hit the spot either. The only sauce was decent enough to eat was the aioli. The house salad dressing was awful... They dont describe what's in it but I dont think I want to know anymore. Their signature ketchup has also hint of spice in it, it was ok. The only thing I did enjoy was the sweet potato fries and the buns... I will not recommend this place.

I recently moved to Vegas and have to admit was not very excited about another burger joint. . My friends had visited and highly recommended I give it a try.  We  asked for "Mandy" because we were assured she would take care of us. We were in luck because she just so happened to be working! She was also being requested by a party behind us... I guess she is somewhat of a celebrity in these parts ? She was very busy, yet very fast and gave us the personal attention as if we were here only table. I especially liked that she was not "over the top" and really was a expert on the menu. She described the cooking process, the choice of meats used and even what beverages would compliment each entrée. The recommendations were all spot on as well. We each had selected something different so we could sample everything ( all 6 of us).  I Had the truffle burger... I CAN NOT PUT INTO WORDS HOW AMAZING THIS WAS !  I myself, am opening a sports pub/ lounge and tried to get our server Mandy to come and join my team... (she definitely would have a following) , she of course declined stating she herself would miss umami burgers  to much. I have since visited twice, as it is the spot I take family and friends when they come into town... Definitely exceeds its reputation !

I had the pleasure of eating several items here. The umami burger and truffle fries were excellent, bursting with lots of flavor. The onion rings were okay - they were almost as huge as bagels! The fried pickles are amazing!
Great food, service.  Go see Ritzy.  She is the bomb.com!  Fun atmosphere!   I'll be back!

Don't believe the hype. I don't know maybe the one in California is way different and much better. 
The layout was cool open concept, gets pretty loud since you can watch the game and  the sls sports book is inside umami. The service was ok, we had to flag the server down for some refills. Didn't check up on us frequently how he did his other two tables. 
Food was not the best! The burgers were plain no lettuce just meat, cheese, and a sauce. I got the the classic and it had a roasted tomato I felt like I was eating a meatball sub. The truffle burger was better but still plain. Fries got soggy real
Quick, onion rings were over battered and soggy. The only thing I liked was my jasmine green tea. I did not feel like I got my money's worth. I spent $50 for nothing. All a hype. I won't return.

Before heading to the airport, totally spent from a few days of "conventioneering" and a little late-night indulgence with friends, I needed some some lunch...hello Umami Burger!

Turned out, it was a great spot to relax, watch some sports, have a beer from their excellent selection of brews and eat good food with friendly, efficient service.

My wife ordered a pretzel to get started - YES!  A giant, yummy pretzel showed up with two dipping sauces (a cup of dark mustard and a cup of melted cheese.)  Loved it.

I ordered a turkey burger with sweet potato fries for lunch. Oh my, it was delicious - all of it!

The burger was not giant, but sized appropriately for a normal human being.  It was beautifully presented and tasted delicious.  The sweet potato fries showed up in a sizable bowl sprinkled with sugar & cinnamon (they were delightfully good and complimented the tart green sauce on the turkey burger.)

In all, a rewarding lunch experience.  I'd like to return sometime and have a few brews in the beer garden.

4 stars

Food was ok, beer was ok, server was ok, prices were high for the service offered, and the medium cooked burger was way over cooked. The fries were soggy...

Overall a very ok place, nothing more, nothing less

The best burger joint in town. I hate to even try and classify it as a burger joint because each masterfully crafted burger is a work of art. This is the pinocle of deliciousness in the burger world. Each burger is a work of culinary genius with an explosion of excellently blended ingredients leaving your taste buds begging for more.

Oh my God. I only eat the Truffle Burger med rare. Ive eaten it in all of Los Angeles Umami Burger Restaurants when I lived there 6 months back. 2nd time at this location. This Burger is by far the best one. We had Truffle fries that were to die for. Service was not the greatest. Wasn't asked if we wanted another drink. Tip will justify how we were treated today. Sat in a booth watching the Kentucky Derby. What a perfect time with my Love.

This place is awesome.  They have Mexican Pepsis, these out of this world food.  Ben our server is one great listener.  Oh, by the way.  You can go meatless or bunless! They have portobello mushrooms for the meatless option.  I didn't try them but oh that sounded so good. I got the lettuce wrap. 

We had tater tots for our starter (Ben suggested them).  They had these sauces you could try.  I fell for the Jalapeño Ranch. It wasn't spicy at all.  They're not on the menu, shocker. They should be. 

 I had the Hatch Burger $11, no bun but I cracked and had the bun on the side. It's a portuguese roll. I'm portuguese so I couldn't turn it down for a few little itchy hives. Besides it reminded me of home (Rhode Island). The bun wasn't overly sweet. It was just right. 

Very filling. Locals should come here.  It's a nice sports book to grab a bite at the same time. 

The bill came to $24.86, they took the tater tots & Pepsi off the bill. So we left a 32.5% because we felt the service was excellent.

I loved my burger. It wasn't too big, not too small, perfect size for me. I had The Royale and it was just so succulent and yummy.

I was not impressed with the fries (which we umami'd) or the BBQ wings. Service was kind lacking too. We couldn't get dude's attention for refills and for the check.

I've had the original Umami location in LA bookmarked for the longest time, and for whatever reason, we've just never had time to make it there when we're in town. So, when we booked our room for SLS, we knew Umami was definitely going to be one of our meals!

This location inside the SLS is quite large. Not only is it a full service restaurant, but it's also houses the casinos sports book and a beer garden. There's quite a bit of seating throughout the location, but the way it's set up is weird and there seems to be no real uniformity. Alongside seating at the indoor bar, there's small tables, high-tops, and couches for the sports book. Then when you walk outside, you've got more picnic table style seating, and another fairly large bar that's got to be a good 50+ feet long. There's just a lot going on and depending on where you sit, you may not be able to order food or just sit down to enjoy a drink while watching the games. If you are coming strictly for the food though, they do offer text notifications so you can go gamble or do whatever while waiting for a table.

Looking online, it seems like the menu is pretty much the same as at other locations, and there's a good amount of options too. If you're not feeling a burger, they have salads, "Un-Beef" sandwiches and even sausages. The sides are pretty typical for a burger joint and the fries can be customized in a handful of ways. There's 8 burgers to choose from and this Umami is no different from the others as their infamous no substitution rule is in full-effect. Although, they will let you request a different cooking temperature for the meat. Standard cooking temp is medium rare, just so ya know.

We decided on an order of fried pickles to share, and I opted for the Truffle Especiale burger. Oddly enough, after receiving the order, our waitress told us that she wasn't a huge fan of the fried pickles. I couldn't disagree with her more as they were definitely some of the better I've had. The batter was thick, crunchy, flavorful and stuck to the pickle completely. It never fell apart and I liked that the pickle inside wasn't so hot that you couldn't eat it. Adding to the flavor was a nice side of jalapeno ranch that was creamy with just a touch of heat.

Although a bit on the small side, my burger was equally impressive. If you're a fan of truffle, Umami does not disappoint! Topped with both truffle butter and truffle arugula, the flavor is immediately present without being overpowering. The arugula still had a nice crisp texture to it, and it coupled perfectly with the fried egg. Now, these guys are proud of their beef too...and rightfully so! The meat isn't smashed down like meatloaf and on it's own has hints of both sweet and salty flavors. It was juicy and cooked to a perfect medium rare. 

With all the commotion going around on their first day, I admittedly expected less than stellar service. That was far from the case and I thought the service was excellent. Apart from her expressing her hatred for the fried pickles, after we ordered them, our waitress was extremely friendly and even a little funny too. I appreciate that she knew the menu well and didn't hesitate to answer a single question. And not only was she on her game, but other servers were checking on us and every other table to make sure drinks were full, etc. The team work and overall ambience was just great!

For a burger joint, the overall prices aren't horrible, but they aren't great either. My burger was $14 and even though I think this was more of a casino thing, I was pretty irritated about paying $5 for a soda. For 2 burgers, 2 drinks and a side, our bill was $55 with tip. I'm also not a huge fan of having all that stuff packed into one location. But the food and service were both very good and I definitely see myself coming back!

Great atmosphere, and a good place to come and watch the game. The food is pretty much on par with every other Umami restaurant - which is a good thing. Our server (Mandy) went above and beyond to accommodate our group. Overall, we'll definitely be back next time we're in town.
Really bad. The Unami burger had some cheese that has been solidified and tasted bland. The mushroom was the size of a dime and the burger was dry.  2 stars for the good fries tho.

Yum yum!  Ok, so I'm from California and I heard about this place and never went. When I made my trek to vegas at the sls hotel I was extremely famished. In a hurry, I looked up something nearby. This place was awesome!  I had the original burger medium well with the free order of truffle fries. The 3 sauces were great with the burger. My friend had the cali with the Korean sweet potato fries. The burger was juicy and mouthwatering even though it was medium well. I'll definitely be having it medium next time I visit. The truffle fries are to die for but the Korean sweet potato fries were lacking compared to everything else.  If you are a local nevadian you get 50% off Sunday. I recommend this place for a filling meal that won't break your wallet.

What a meal! I had the Manly Burger, House Made Tater Tots and the best Buffalo Wings I have ever eaten. I got the Hop Knot IPA which is made by Four Peaks Brewing. They do "Tap Take Overs" which is a great way to try out different beers. Amanda, the bartender was super friendly and quick with great service. Umami is the Royal Flush of dining on the Strip!

We so wanted to eat there?  The menu looked awesome.  Was with my wife and we were seated at our first booth.  Filthy.  Food on seats and floors.  Not crumbs!  We asked to be seated at another booth. Not any better.  I wanted a pretzel so we tried a third?  3 strikes your out!  Dirty seats and white dress on wife means we were out the door.   If the seats are dirty what does the kitchen look like. The dumb hostess had no idea.
So Disappointed.  Slow service,  very small portions and very bland. A bit pricy for a burger but that is what you get on the strip.

Umami Burger has always been  on my top 3 fave burgers. They only opened yesterday but it felt like they were already opened for quite a while! Our server Ben is super friendly and has answered every single question  that we have! If you have kids with you, you will need to stay on the left side because the sports book and bar is on the right. 

As for the burgers...they did not disappoint. Perfect as always! 

No need to drive to California for an umami burger fix! Will definitely go back to try the exclusive items they have on the menu!

Phenomenal !!!! Im impressed, great food And extraordinary service, you can tell those guys love their job, everyone is super friendly, we were greeted by the manager at the door, super friendly, he walked us to our table and offered some of their craft beer. Also suggested an appetizer. Yes i will be back!

OK I have to admit the Umami Burger was a great burger. You can tell the high quality of the meat they used for their burgers. It was perfectly cooked medium and it was juicy and flavorful. No fillers here! It was topped with a fried Parmesan cheese crust that they call a frico. It was also topped with shiitake mushrooms, roasted tomato, carmelized onions, and house ketchup. The top bun is seared with a letter 'U' for Umami! It was accompanied with sweet potato fries, which were also good. I'll be Bak!

Their variety of fries are excellent appetizers and pair well with their unique cocktails. I didn't have a burger here, but many of the people I was with did and they looked amazing! HUGE portions!

Great ambience and a perfect spot to watch the games!

(3.75) Good Overall.  Note: It's in the SLS Hotel

MENU:
** Grapefruit Cider = (4) very refreshing
** Water(tap) = (4) very good...must be filtered
** Simple French Fries = (4) very good
* Umami Caesar Salad = (3.75) Good
* Umami Burger = (3.5) good, but it was a little too sweet for me, and needed more salt.
* Chocolate Chunk Cookie = (3.25) pretty good, but I prefer softer cookies, versus hard & crunchy.

Umamimamimami! Excellent experience!

Staying in SLS/W and upon checking in around 11pm , definitely needed lunch! 

Umami is a sportsbook as well, so it was pretty lively on Sunday at 12pm with plenty of people in gear rooting for their team.

1. Ambiance is lively. There are hightops, tables, booths with personal TVs, bar with games, AND comfy coaches in front of HUGE screens. 5/5

2. Drinks are good. Upon checking in we redeemed free 16 red rock beers. The other option is free fries. I purchased two additional ones at $7 each with an additional whisky shot $5 each. They have many size options available to accommodate all sizes of thirsty. 5/5

3. Food was AMAZING! My date had the manly burger. He is quite a big guy himself but was full for hours after.  I did not taste it, but he raved about richness and amazing taste.  I had the ahi tuna seared burger. WOW! This was so delicious,  a must try! I had lettuce and tomato added.  I really like that it was a full leaf, not shredded.  We added some tasty wings and truffle fries , so delicious! 5/5

4. Service is solid here. We were welcomed immediately and sat without wait. After our server took orders, another waitress brought waters and place settings.  Despite it being a packed house , service never lagged! We were never left empty handed and they took all empty plates and cups during our meal. Perfect!
5/5

I had heard good things about Umami Burger and decided to have lunch there while staying at the SLS hotel. 
The staff were friendly and the food was great. I had half of the tuna burger and half of the umami burger, both were great, but the tuna was my favourite! 
If you like onion rings, theirs is A MUST! Perfectly battered and crunchy, I fell in love.
We ordered the buffalo wings as a starter, they were nothing to write home about. Just your generic wings, really, which was a bit disappointing. 
I also loved that they have a "taster" option for their draught beers. Great for if you're not sure what beer you want, or if you just like a bit of variety!

Decided to try this place for a quick lunch. Wasn't very impressed, I'd say sub-par at best. If it weren't for our server, Casey, I would give it 2 stars.
The atmosphere is more of a sports bar with couches, very laid back. Perfect for MNF! 
I was really shocked to see that the menu was so tiny. What threw me off guard was the fact that it's a beer garden and they had Bud Light and Stella on tap...it needs a much wider selection!
We had the Pulled Pork nachos:
the flavor of the meat was great, the presentation wasn't there and besides the massive layer of meat on top it was just cheese sauce and cold chips.
Turkey Burger: I ate half and pushed it to the side. The green sauce they put on the burger wasn't good at all. Burger itself was flavorless and the bun was so soggy that I had to eat the bits I did have with a fork and knife.
Manly Burger: this was probably the best thing at our table. Full flavor and was gone in under 5 minutes haha
Truffle Fries: the cheese sauce had alittle hardening look to it. It was definitely sitting in the window waiting on the rest of the ticket. It had the consistency of almost hard wax. The sauce was only on the top part and they sprinkled some green onions on top and called it a dish.
The truffle salt was good but besides that we couldn't eat them.


This place has a lot of potential but it just seems to be executed in a lazy way

Meh. This place was okay. It didn't exactly blow my mind but I didn't hate it either. The server was very friendly and knowledgable of the menu. My burger was slightly over cooked. The sweet potato fries were my favorite part. Those we delicious.

Pretty disappointing!  I came here expecting to be blown away by the word of mouth I have heard regarding Umami Burger.  I ordered the original Umami Burger with a side of the thin fries and a $8 draft beer.  I think the $8 beer was the best part of this experience!  The burger was quite bland and covered in a sauce which tasted like a bottle of Ragu pasta sauce.  Fries were mediocre at best.  Service was pretty slow especially considering I was there on a Monday afternoon and the place was not even half full. Maybe if I am in the LA area I will try one of the locations there but I do not plan on coming back to this location.

Once again Umami and the staff delivered amazing food and service. The truffle burgers came out hot and delicious. Due to a new diet we had to try the lettuce wrap version and it didn't degrade the burger's flavor. The pickle plate for an appetizer was a great surprise. Normally 1 pickle is enough but the this assortment is amazing. Amanda our server is an All-Star also!!

Meh.  When it comes to fancy burgers I'm looking to be wowed. I don't feel like Umami burger lives up to the hype. If I'm in LA I prefer Fathers Office and if in Vegas Bacchanal is hands down the winner. 

I prefer the beer garden outside of Umami it's great for people watching, playing foozeball and drinking.

Went to Umami for dinner. There were 3 of us, no alcohol, and the tab was $74 without tip just to give you an idea of the prices. Burgers are about $12, but do not come with any sides. I think that's the new trend following the lead of the pricey steakhouses. Everything is a la carte, so what you think is a $12 burger actually becomes a $15 - $20 burger once you add some fries or another side. 
I had the Manly burger with American cheese and bacon. The bacon chunks were tasty, crispy on the outside and chewy inside - just right. I was hesitant on trying this place because of the negative reviews. My burger was very tasty, meat cooked right, and overall and above average burger. My wife had the Original and she loved the Parmesan frigo on it. Her cousin had the Truffle Especiale.  He loves the fried runny egg on the burger. I should have added a fried egg on my Manly burger. That would have been awesome. I have an issue with them charging $5 for a soda. I don't even know if the soda is bottomless because they only serve bottles. A Pepsi is $5, really?  Desert is an average size cookie sandwich for $7. It was OK. We tried the salted caramel ice cream with snicker doodle cookie. 
Ambience - a sports bar with booths around the perimeter, and tables in the middle. Each booth had a small TV, but you can't control what is on your booth TV. That really doesn't make sense with all of the channels they have available. We wanted to watch a different game. The waiter made up some story that the "guy" with the remote was walking around and would change the channel to whatever channel we wanted. We never saw the "guy" with the remote. The people ranged in age and style from club goers having a bite to eat before hitting the club to an elderly group grabbing some burgers. There were some couples there as well. The middle of the floor has a living room type setup with large screen TVs and leather couches around some coffee tables. You can sit there and have a beer and burger, and bend down to eat over the coffee table like you do in your own living room. My wife didn't get it why there were a bunch of guys using the couches to eat. Gives you the opportunity to stand up and walk around if the game is stressing you out. 
Service - sub par. I think it was just our waiter. Everything was soooo slow with him. He spent 90% of his time standing in the kitchen. I could see his bald head through the window of the kitchen door while waiting for water, to order something, desert, the check, etc. I actually gave the lowest tip I have in a long time (15%). I usually give 20% without question, but wanted to make a point. Hopefully, he gets it. He was a very nice guy, just very frustrating to have to wait for him every time we needed something. Waiter, try walking around to your tables more and ask people how they are doing. Make yourself available. The restaurant is charging premium prices for burgers. The service should match. This isn't McDonalds. Charge me McDonalds prices and I will happily get my own napkins and ketchup. 

Summary - get the burger of your liking and one order of thin fries to share between 2-3 people. Burgers are good if you get them medium. Drink water or a beer (somewhat overpriced at $8 for domestic). All sodas aren't worth the price.  Skip the apps. The fried pickles ($6) taste like Vlasic yellow pickles with some breading that falls right off on the first bite. They were overly sour, and not like good deli pickles.  Skip desert as well. If you must have, split one cookie between two people.
Wasn't as great as expected the burgers were very different . However I did love there chicken Caesar salad !!

We were looking for a quick, delicious dinner before heading out to a club.  Umami Burger was a place we had heard good things about, so we gave it a shot.

The service was above average, and the burgers was delicious!  We had the sunny side burger and umami burger with truffle fries.  Also loved the dipping sauces that came with the meal; can't go wrong with that jalapeño ranch on anything!

I was excited when I heard Umami was finally coming to Vegas but my excitement quickly turned to disappointment when I actually tried this spot out.

A lot my review is based off a comparison of this location to the ones in Laguna Beach and The Grove in Southern California. If you've never been to a Umami before, its definitely worth checking out even here at the SLS. 

Umami serves up some pretty good gourmet burgers and fries. The burgers are juicy and flavorful, and you can taste the quality in the toppings. The stamped buns are almost begging you take a picture and Instagram it. Plenty of sides and entree options means there is something for everyone. While the food is fine I take issue with the dining experience itself.
 
Each time I have dined here the restaurant has been virtually empty, but somehow there is always a 10-15 minute wait to be seated in a barren dinning room. The outdoor patio huge and overlooks the north end of the strip. The free ping-pong, air hockey and foosball tables are a nice touch and a good distraction while waiting on your food. Unfortunately, the massive size of the patio makes for just an awkward dining space. Rarely is anyone at the bar or eating out there and the backless wooden benches make for an uncomfortable dining tables.They merged the main dining room with the "sports book" and its a mess. Random people walking in and out making bets and standing around creates a weird dining atmosphere. Service has always been slow and disappointing. Its sad that this locations gives so many first timer Unami eaters a bad first impression of the franchise.

This is the third restaurant I have tried at SLS. I am a huge foodie and have searched high and low around town for the best burger. What is Umami up against? Fukuburger, Badger cafe, Burger Bar at Mandalay. These are all great burgers and all cost less. We ordered the "Manly Burger" and an order of fried pickles. S O asked for regular ranch instead of jalapeño ranch for the fried pickles. Waitress said "we don't have regular ranch". Ok, kinda odd at a multi million dollar new casino trying to impress but we carried on. The burger arrived and it was tiny! This is a freaking slider folks. The nerve of calling it "The Manly Burger"! Before I took my first bite I thought to myself for $14 this better be awesome for this price. It wasn't :( It was average at best. The fried pickles barely had any batter on them and tasted like warm soggy pickles. I got 5 pickle spears for $6! Come on guys, really? I have no problem paying high strip prices for a premium product (I.E. anything at the Wynn) but you gotta deliver a premium product. The waitress noticed we didn't eat the pickles and did take them off the bill. 

Atmosphere was ok and the service was good. I just can't figure out why people would pay these prices for micro servings that aren't amazing. 

General lesson for SLS and any other new business. You can't charge ultra premium prices and not deliver 5 star food and service. I have now eaten at Cleo, Umami and The Griddle and I wouldn't recommend them to anybody for now. As a long time local I want The SLS to succeed. We need jobs and great showcase properties. Come on gang, pay attention!

Came to Las Vegas for a business trip and decided to come here for dinner. Best burger I've ever had. You could tell the ground beef was high quality. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and friendly. I ordered sweet potato fries as a side and a stella on draft. Both delicious with the Hatch burger. Wish there was one closer to where I live!

Umm how does this place only have 3 and a half stars?! I get it, it's not the original umami but STILL. I have never left disappointed from here. Hands down my favorite restaurant of all time. Ordered the seared ahi salad, maple bacon fries and a truffle burger cooked medium. 5 stars for everything. Food is rich and delicious. Service is a little slow but hey, it's a busy place. You pay for what you get for. :)

Not a bad place to hang out, watch sports, eat burgers, and drink beer. I had the Throwback burger for $10.  The food is good, but it isn't spectacularly great; or at least there's nothing about the burgers that really sets it apart from any other burger place. It is very reasonably priced, however which is why it maintained four stars.

Overall, great place to take a break from gambling, or continue playing the machines and/or chat with friends. I'll definately be returning, but I might try a different menu item next time around.
Had the manly burger with a fried egg.  Absolutely Amazing!!!  Sarah was an excellent server as well.  I would eat here regularly if I could.
Good burgers and good beer. What more can you ask for. Def a cool place to sit and have a meal. Hip atmosphere. The music/game was a little loud for my group but we were ok after we got used to it.
Small menu with no flexibility. The burger was tasty but nothing memorable. I regret not being more adventurous.

Great food. The service is good, but good be better in some aspects. Everyone is mostly friendly. 

We ordered several items and pretty much shared everything. I really liked some of the spicy sauces that were brought out on the Chinese white spoons. The waitress explained them but I would have liked if she informed you what to pair them. I wasn't sure if went with something specific or if it was just for the table or etc.  

My burger was delicious. I added one of the spicy sauces and that made it that much better. The pretzel was the biggest one I have ever seen. It was really good. Soft, fluffy and Perfect. I also really liked the fried oysters - it had a really great flavor. Truffle fries were delicious as expected. Umami, we will definitely be back especially since I work basically next door. Yum!

My girlfriend and I were visiting from Miami when a friend suggested the Umami Buger located at the SLS hotel. As soon as we entered we were greeted by a friendly and welcoming staff. Our waitress was very kind and attentive! The food was exceptional, I myself am a huge burger man and the Manly Burger was delicious! A manager came by our table to make sure that everything was going well and up to par which it was. I had mentioned that we were looking for a place close by to grab a couple cocktails and they referred me to the center bar also located inside the SLS which was great! Overall a great experience, definitely recommending this place to my friends and definitely will be returning here during my next visit to Las Vegas!
Love the Grilled mushroom burger since I don't eat meat. Would love if they actually would have a veggie patty. That is something to consider. Love the truffle sauce.

Stayed at this hotel and decided to have a casual meal.  The highlight of my meal was the loaded Manly fries.   Complet decadence.  Ordered the standard burger and it was pretty good.  Undercooked, but interesting flavors with the Parmesan crisp and roasted tomato.  Didn't get much out of the Umami ketchup besides it being ketchup. 

The big disappointment was it's part of a Beer Garden.  
The menu was 1/5 food and 4/5 beers , wines and cocktails.
Of the three ciders they had listed NONE were available.    Waitress's poor  excuse was "its the end of the month ".   Uh, you're a beer garden AND it was only the 24th of the month.   Not exactly END of month    
She got frustrated and just blurted out that she wasn't responsible for the ordering.   Bad answer.

Best lunch i had in a long time, great atmosphere, chill, well designed. Great service. very well prIced. AMAZING onion rings! Great tuna tartar, great salads, good burger. Amazing service from a very lovely Asian? girl, who was very prompt and patient with me.

This was my first time at an Umami Burger and everything was superb. The cleanliness, the food, the service and selection were awesome. Everything was great from the burgers to the appetizers to the selection of brews. All of the employees were super friendly and courteous. You can tell this is a well run establishment. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas.

OK, so the burger is a little small and the price tag is kind of big.  It's one of the best burgers I've ever eaten though!  Love the umami burger-- its bursting with flavor and so craveable.

The beverage list is a big disappointment...  The beer selection is a joke for a place that's supposed to be a beer garden.  Too many mass market beers here, the few interesting geeky ones are marked up obscenely.

My usual go to is wine...  They have edmeades zin by the glass.

Service is usually friendly.  Comfortable environment.  Definitely worth a trip here when craving a burger.

Disappointed with the burgers. Overpriced and small with no distinct flavor from the burger. I know it is on the strip and this price is not really pricey, but the food quality is beyond me. Maybe if I ordered medium rare burger would taste better, but who eat undercooked burger, only people who wants to get sick that's who. The truffle fries and sweet potato were pretty good, but I've had better and cheaper. The waitress were nice, which was a good thing.

I saw via a post from both Alton Brown and Umami Burger about a special collab burger and I wanted to try it so I go on down and then the server informs me they don't have specials after I mention the Alton burger. The reason I came is not there, disappointed I don't wanna feel like I wasted my time so I order their truffle burger and simple fries. Didn't take as long as I thought it would.

The patty was thick though undercooked (I like my steaks rare-med. rare but when it comes to burger I prefer medium+ normally.) I didn't mind that too much. Sadly the burger was overall disappointing. The meat was way too under seasoned and they amount of truffle  aioli they put on the burger was sad. I didn't even taste it. There was some on the plate and I tasted it and it was good. Shame they didn't put enough on the burger itself to lend any flavor what so ever. Patty, a slice of melted cheese and a thin squiggle of truffle aioli is all I got. No other toppings that could have helped impart the burger with some flavor. 

The fries came out cold. They are super thin and while crispy seemed overlooked and hollow.

Overall my experience was very "meh." Definitely over priced for what you get. I didn't taste quality, poorly seasoned beef led me to tasting not much of anything to be honest. Just the burger and regular fries after tax was $19 and change and I left not satisfied. I suppose I should be thankful they didn't serve the Alton Brown burger as I am a fan of his and if I had such an experience trying the Alton Brown I would be even more disappointed.

Burgers were really good. We had a truffle burger and a manly burger that were quite tasty. Our server Mandy was very attentive and friendly. Good drinks, good food, good service, definitely coming back.

Our bartender at the front bar, Liz was awesome! Totally great service and attentive. The other female bartender that was on was creep. We were playing and she was obviously a gaming bartender and was creepy hustling us.  The nachos and fries were awesome! My biggest complaint with this restaurant is that 3 times I've been turned away to try to go out to eat and drink at the outside bar around 9:00 pm when there are plenty of people out there. They told us they were just waiting for people to clear out but we ate and left before the space even cleared out. It was nice out and we wanted to enjoy it.

Great atmosphere for any casual occasion, service was well and fairly quick.
As for the food; the truffle fries were delicious! Nachos weren't the best I've ever had but they were good.
The burgers:
I had the sunny side with bacon and as far as burgers with egg it was pretty good and stayed together surprisingly well without getting too soggy.
My friends had the Cali and the manly burger
The Cali burger was very similar to an In-N-Out burger, it was good, but can't really compare
And the manly burger was very flavorful and one of the more favored of the 3.
$$for the price you can find much better$$
Amazing spot! Great burgers, and our server Tasha made our experience so great. We came from Chicago to visit - it has a really cool sports feel and cozy seating.  Check it out --
Best burger on the Las Vegas Strip award goes to Umami Burger!!!
Been to several Umamis and this experience was great, Mandy our host was an absolute doll, she was very informative great experience overall ..!!!
Best burgers in Las Vegas. The food never disappoints and a fun place to watch games.

Amazing! Great food and perfect service. Ordered a pizza and it took longer than expected, so our server Tashja gave us a free appetizer! Pizza was amazing, as was the appetizer and she recommended a great beer!

I stopped by for the NFL kick-off, which seems like just yesterday, to see the Pats-Steelers game. The place was obviously packed but we still managed to snag a booth. They had several servers walking around handing out free samples. Great for customers, but awful for the servers as many people probably didn't order food or tip well since there were plenty of freebies all night. I tried the skinny fries and sweet potato fries, both were tasty and crispy. I also tried slider version of their truffle burger and hatch burger -- the patties on both juicy and cooked to about medium. The former only had subtle amounts of truffle in the aioli, cheese, and glaze, while the latter had just enough heat to enhance the flavor. 

As for the food we ordered, the Korean fries had a mild kimchi flavor paired with sweet potato fries while the chicken wings had to be sent back because they only gave us five instead of the advertised six. They corrected the mistake and  sent out a correct order. Each coated with a crispy exterior coated in a spicy BBQ sauce. The lone full size burger sampled was the Manly burger ($12). A bit small but filling with a densely packed patty topped with house beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked salt onion strings, ketchup and mustard. The branded bun was a nice touch.

The quality and variety of burgers and appetizers lags behind the top burger joints in town, but it was a cool spot to watch the game thanks to the in house sporting book, large TVs scattered around the room and the smaller TV right at our booth.

Came in to watch some football  and it was pretty cool they have tvs everywhere.  I ended up ordering a burger and when I got it it looked amazing.  The burger was a little small but looked so good. When I took the first bite I must say it was scrumptious. I would definitely go back again.
As a local, it is not easy to park and just go into. The food is fair, the service was a little slow for my liking. The prices were higher than Id like, but it's the Strip.

I haven't been here in about a year, but I've been craving this burger since the last time I was here. I had the Ahi tuna burger, I have it every time I've been to Umami burger and it never disappoints. I also ordered a side of their sweet potato fries which taste amazing with the sauces they offer. They actually taste good with or without sauce. For dessert I had the Frank Berry strawberry, which is an ice cream sandwich made with snickerdoodles and strawberry ice cream. It was just the right size for myself. I didn't feel too full or like I didn't get enough. I'll be back soon, I won't wait a whole year this time.
Omg absolutely delicious!!!! The wings were so good and crispy and the truffle fries & burgers  hit the spot! Will be coming back!

We were sat yesterday around 2:20.  The server came to ask for beverages.  We all ordered water with lemon as we really don't drink.  The disappointment on the servers face was evident because we didn't order alcohol.  My sister ordered coffee with cream and sugar.  No biggie we thought.  Drinks were delivered and food order was taken but no cream or sugar for the coffee or lemon for the water as requested.  I went to go ask an employee to send over a manager as we still didn't have cream or sugar after 10 minutes for the coffee.  Our server never came to the table to tell us there was an issue with the cream or sugar.  Apparently the manager had to go across the whole casino to retrieve cream and sugar (WTF???).  My sister didn't receive her cream or sugar until 2:35 with no explanation or apology from the server or management.  I had to get up from the table again to ask another employee for lemons as our server forgot!  
Food was delivered in a very tacky way.  The food runner came to the table and auctioned off the Food.  Apparently Umami doesn't have position points so the runners don't know which guest gets which item.  So the runner stays in one position at the table and delivers the food expecting us to grab the plates instead of moving to the other side of the table and put the plate down.  Very tacky to stand in one area and attempt to deliver to 5 different people.  Most decent restaurants have the runners walk around the table and deliver to each customer.  I asked the runner for more napkins as we only had 1 each. The manager finally came around and wasn't really empathetic at all and didn't really seem to care that we received horrible service.  I told her that I am a local and work in the hospitality business.  I had to ask another employee again for napkins as they we're forgotten. The food was extremely average for vegas standards.  We were done eating and it took at least another 10 minutes for someone to come around, I asked for the bill.  The employees didn't start pre-budding the table until the bill was brought.  Normally pre-bussing is a given when everyone is obviously done and stacks empty plates on the table.  I guess Umami does it differently than every single restaurant I have worked in for 15 years on the strip.  By the way the manager never came back to ask about the food or say anything to us.  I felt bad about leaving a very crappy tip but we did receive the worst service I have ever had in Las Vegas.  I like the SLS but Umami sucks.  We were all extremely disappointed.

It was seat yourself today, so my wife and I did. After 10 minutes of no one acknowledging our presence, I went to the bar and asked for service at our table. I had The Umami burger medium well. It was dry and luke warm. I never had any of these issues at any of the Los Angeles locations and I've been to all of them many times. This location at the SLS Hotel is a real let down. It's not what I associate with the Umami brand. The service in Los Angeles is top notch as well as delicious, juicy and hot burgers.

Everything we ordered was delicious especially the Carmel & chocolate-hazelnut ice cream sandwich! 
Service was great and food came out in a timely matter. Excellent!

The food was pretty good, but the service was mediocre. The truffle burger I had was good, and my father enjoyed the Umami burgdr. The fries came out cold, but the food runner replaces them with fresh ones. The pickle platter was a nice addition to the meanl as well. Cozy little spot with lounge areas to watch sports and a great selection of beers.

Went here for lunch yesterday and our server was all in our face the minute we sat down, very pushy and motivated to take our order 3 seconds after sitting down. We ordered a beer to start and before they came she even stopped back to ask if we knew what we wanted to eat. Geez ... slow down. Then we do order, food comes, our beers are finished .... 20 minutes later - still empty beer we flag down another server to get our check and that takes another 5 minutes. My biggest irritation is that she lost revenue for the restaurant and thats not the person you want on your team. 
Food was OK, I wouldn't go back.

We went to Umami realitically - we were walking for water/gatorade and saw a huge billboard with a delish looking burger so we figured - lets check it out tnight. I went on line/ they didnt take reservations which was fine- there was room when our party of 4 arrived. The menu has alot for everyone but we came for a burger. Our group each picked a diff one based on our likes.  I had the Mindy Kaling burger-spicy deliciousness: my hub had the Manly with the bacon lardons. He didn't speak for 20 minutes telling me he enjoyed it. Our friends ordered the Umami burger which came with an awesome parm/cheddar crisp and home made ketchup. We all enjoyed it. Including the tempura onion rings and deep fried butter pickles. Our server was also delightful. Very helpful and fun as well. Great spot.

checked this place out last night and it was alright. The place is nice with an outdoor Beer garden, huge TVs and comfortable sofas on one area. I had the Truffle burger which was ok and I have had better elsewhere maybe I prefer a unique taste. I will have to come back and try out more stuff on the menu. 

The service was good.

Service was ok.  I can't even remember which burger I got, it was either the Truffle or the Manly.  And the truffle fries.  It didn't take long for my order to be done.   So the fries looked yummie, but wayyyy too salty.  So the burger was dry, so I had to ask for more sauce.  As I was eating it, it seemed to also be way to salty.  Com'on Umami, ease up off the salt!  Let people add there own salt to it.  I couldn't even finish my burger or fries.  I only ate 1/2.  And if anyone knows me, I try and eat everything on my plate, and I couldn't do it.  Even 1/2 was a bit much.  Heck I guess we broke even, because I used the local speciall they were running.  Locals eat for 1/2 price and that's all I ate was 1/2.  I would have been pissed if I would have paid full price for this burger, it wasn't worth it!

If you want speed along with your order being taken care of right the first time this is the wrong place.  Service took entirely too long and the 1st meal in Vegas was not the best especially on my cheat meal day

Stopped by for a quick bite before catching my flight. Ordered the Hatch Burger and a Brooklyn Lagger. The food was great, and Sunny, my server made sure everything came out quickly so I wouldn't miss my flight. Excellent food! Excellent service. 

A+++++

I don't know why everyone is giving such bad reviews...I went earlier today with my friend and all I can say is...THE BURGER WAS BOMB! Until now I'm looking at pictures of it..lol It was simple but the patty was juicy and perfect. My friends from Cali always talked about it so I was happy when we finally got one here. We made reservations a few days before so I recommend doing that especially if there's a game. Service was also good. She was very attentive and explained to us the menu and sauces. Overall had an awesome experience and will definitely go back..maybe next week..haha!

My coworkers and I had an amazing lunch today...

We tried the Truffle Burger, Truffle Especial, BBQ Burger, the sweet potato fries, the truffle fries and the onion rings! The food was absolutely delicious, the decor is great and the service was pretty good. I would have gave them 4-stars since the service was semi-lack luster, but the food was easily 6-stars, so it averaged out! Lol 

Our fat asses also got two ice cream sandwiches and they were both great! (Snicker doodle and mint)

This place is a must try...

Ate here at the recommendation of a friend who said it was the best burger they ever ate. Ordered the chicken fingers appetizer--absolutely nothing special about it. My husband ordered a Guinness that was all foam and the waitress told him to just "give it time."  It ended up half foam still so we sent it back. I ordered the hatch burger and my husband ordered the manly burger. We also got a side of sweet potato fries. The burgers were good, but definitely not the best burgers we've ever had. If I'm making a trip to the strip for burgers, i would rather eat at Gordon Ramsey Burgr or Burger Bar. Atmosphere is cool--would be fun with a group of people to watch a game. Prices were decent for the strip.
We stopped in for a snack. The thin fries were great. Only 4 stars though because their ranch was terrible and they don't have regular Heinz ketchup.

First time visiting this place. They have plenty of TVs and plenty of sports playing with two huge HDTVs in the middle of the room. The beer selection is great, the food looked phenomenal. 

I tried the fingers crispy or buffalo chicken tenders. They were off the chart!! crispy, very tasty, fresh and large, not bad for $10.95. I also tried a draft beer called 312...very refreshing, fresh and super cold. The bartender was friendly, engaging and provided superb customer service. Great job Jonny!! I'll be back...

Updating my review... I came back to vegas and stayed at the SLS again and couldnt wait to come back here. To my disappointment they discontinued their onion rings. The onion rings were the best part about this place. Also their kale salad has changed, nothing like i remember it. Probably wont ever come back here. The giant pretzal was good though.

Liz was a great server/bartender at the beer garden at the back patio of the beer garden.  She was very conversational and engaging in a busy environment.  If you're in Vegas and you come to the SLS, ask for her because she will definitely hook you up.

Started the day off right with a good meal and great service. Since the place is called Umami Burger, I figured the burgers would be the star. And they were good, but really it's the little things that made the meal stand out. Homemade ketchup. Yes. Ketchup. It was really flavorful and tasty. As was the diablo sauce that spiced up the fries nicely. Also, do yourself a favor and ask for the roasted tomatoes. Alone or on top of a burger.  You'll thank me. Finally, the whole meal was tied together by the buoyant and responsive Tashja. Ideal personality to enhance the meal and take the experience NL. We will definitely be back before we leave town. And we will definitely ask for Tashja!

Come on, Yelpers!?!   3.5 stars?!?  Really!?!
They have 5 star service (Thanks Sunny for hooking us up!) & 4 stars for their delicious food!  Really, the service along with the food makes this a 5 star rating.  

Husband ordered the Throwback and it was a very good burger.  The server recommended adding the Diablo sauce to the burger and it gave it a nice zing.
I ordered the Truffle fries and they were soooo yummy!!!  Thin cut fries cooked perfectly with melty cheese and truffle oil.  Yummy!  I did try all the sauces jalapeno ranch, Diablo, garlic aioli & ketchup with truffle oil.  They all tasted good but I ate half the fries without any sauce ... They were that good!  And I'm a sauce person!!!  Finally, the dessert was the perfect ending.  Ice cream cookie!  Cut up so we could share but most importantly, the ice cream was firm!  ... Not runny!  I'm definitely coming back ... Funny because of the Vegas location, I will try out the ones in LA.  LOL!!!

45 minutes to finally greet me and take my order. Another 30 to make a burger. And it wasn't even a very busy time.

Burgers disappointed me compared to the hype as well.

Everything is fantastic! My husband and I both got burgers. I got the Manly and hubby got the Sunnyside, both were amazing! We got a side of sweet potato fries. Tasted great alone but even better with the sauces they provide. The drinks were good, the only thing is they were out of the cider along with the pool bar at SLS. I got a strawberry daiquiri instead. Very good! We got a free ice cream sandwich with our stay at SLS. Also amazing! The cookie is soft and salted caramel ice cream is devine! I would definitely come back!

The SLS Hotel/Casino is amazing, and this a fantastic place to have beer, food, and watch NFL.  

I am not much of a carnivore, so I had a caesar salad which was delightfully fresh and had delicious anchovies.  I also sampled fried pickles which were very lightly tempura fried.  

They have an impressive beer list and the overall scene is very fun.  NFL football is shown in the beer garden allowing the opportunity to watch patio style.  Always appreciated.  

Fun times and nicely convenient when on strip.

Staying at the SLS, called in a burger and an order of truffle fries to go, they said 10-15 mins, got there about 12 minutes later and they said, oh we just put the order in it will be 10-15 minutes. Really annoyed but ok fine, said ok.  Go back 15 mins later, get my order from the bartender who had an attitude and didn't say a word to me but puts my food on the counter and said, sign this, no thank you, have a nice day, nothing, get to my room, regular fries, not truffle fries and the burger was just ok. Very dissatisfied, this place is way overrated.

Visited today for lunch... there were 7 of us.  The food was just okay.  I had a truffle burger and we all shared side items including French Fries (shoestring fries that are HORRIBLE and cold), a house pickle plate that includes a variety of pickled items (carrots, mushrooms, beets, etc., also YUCK), and were supposed to share a plate of fried pickles which were forgotten and never brought to the table.  Aside from the crappy food, soda is served by the bottle (so be prepared to shell out $3 for each 12 oz bottle you drink).... and the real clincher: on top of the 20% gratuity they automatically added to the bill, they added AN EXTRA 20% SERVICE CHARGE simply for being a party of 6 or more.  Nope, sorry... never again!  Good luck surviving in SLS where the hotel smell alone made me want to vomit!

Got the manly burger and OMG!!!!
FREAKING AMAZING!!!!

Our server Tashja was awesome! Made us feel very welcomed! Sweet as can be!!! Great vibes I got from here

I am DEFINITELY coming back on my next trip to Vegas!
A unique place to be around friends. They have a neat beer bong. It is big. Nice atmosphere! I can't wait to try the burger. The Umami burger.

Came for dinner here because it was convenient for me before a night out at the club. Already familiar with several of the Umami locations in the LA area so the menu isn't really a surprise to me. 
We were greeted and sat right away by the hostess. Our server came a few moments later and got us started with drinks and allowed us wayyy too much time to look over the menu. She pretty much disappeared on us throughout our dining experience. We asked other servers for help but they said they would call our server for us..not sure if they really did because it took her so long to return to us.

Food wise, their burgers are good.

The staff is phenomenal! I suggest if you own a restaurant in Las Vegas to steal the waitresses from this place. I have been there multiple time and always have great service and friendly people. 

Only one drawback, Umami Burger's menu is limited and not in a good way, but the staff makes up for it and I give it a 4 star.

We went late about 9 pm. We probably shouldn't have ordered medium well with the umami burger and manly burger. They were little dry! The food wasn't very hot and the buns were so-so! I do like the truffle fries, very tasty. Also the fries seem to cool a little in the kitchen before they bought to us.

Awesome dining experience!  The food was great and the service was excellent. Megan L. was my server, and she was very friendly and attentive. She did a great job, and made the experience even better.

I kept seeing advertisements for Umami around town and decided to give it a try tonight. I have to say how much I enjoyed the burgers tonight. I had the Umami and the Manly burgers and split it with my friend. I could taste the charcoal on the meat and it was juicy inside (medium). Courtney handled my food allergy perfectly and stopped by our table just enough. The truffle fries were thin and crispy and the cocktails did their job. Ask to sit outside in the evening.

Food was amazing and the service was awesome as well!! :) We ordered the truffle burger with turkey and Manly burger. Both were amazing! We also got the truffle fries which was awesome. This place is a must try.

Not worth the money.
This was the first place I found to eat when my husband and I got to Vegas and I was starving!  Issue one was it was $12 for just a burger, and fries or any other side that would normally come with the burger at any other place was a seperate cost. It took forever for the food to get to the table and when it did my burger was missing the Portobello mushroom.  It took me several mins to find anyone who noticed me to tell them about the mistake and by that time my husband had finished his burger. When i showed them about the mistake they pointed out two tiny black chunks and said that was the Portobello and it just comes with one mushroom... this was highly insulting so I explained i wasn't going to pay $12 for a burger that didn't come as ordered so she went in the back and brought out 2 Portobello mushrooms. The burgers them selves are nothing to write home about, honestly I could get a better burger at red robins or fuddruckers and pay less. Due to the issue the waitress comped our drinks which was really nice.

First time trying the so called famous burger place , a little disappointed I was , thought it would wow me. Definatly tasted like a normal burger you get from any local burger place just a lot smaller and more pricey. The truffle fries ain't all that either. Hands down the best burger place in Vegas is Gordan Ramsey BurgR and order euro  . Ps I'm a guy that loves my burgers lol. 
BurgR 
Shake shack 
Ketchup 
FukU 
The best places on the strip .

Love Umami burger, and our server Jordan was incredible. Super cool, always came to ask if things were ok, how food was, and if we needed anything. Even though it was outside on the deck, he made sure to check glasses for beverages, ensure we have enough utensils and napkins and took care of the generally small details that making a dining experience memorable.

Not to mention he recommended a damn good burger.

Food is pretty good but the service moves at a snail's pace.

I ordered the Umami Burger and it was incredible. Perfectly cooked. The only problem was how long it takes for the food to come and the drink I ordered had sat so long it was watered down.

now, the ambiance and the tv's in the booth are incredible arbitrary elements.

Burger was very underwhelming and they weren't very clear about which beers qualified for the Yelp offer.  Perhaps my expectations were too high (given the hype/reputation of the brand), but I wouldn't recommend the lackluster food and average service.

I heard such amazing things about this place and then was underwhelmed...sad face.  Maybe I put too much anticipation into the restaurant.

The menu is small, and all of the burgers sound delicious.  I got the Classic, but when it arrived, I was surprised at the size of the burger (read: small).  Having been to Bachi Burger and Burger Bar and even Yard House, for the $12 price tag of the Umami Burger, I was expecting a nice, huge, messy burger.  But it was about the size of a McDonald's double cheeseburger.  Worse, my burger was dry and flavorless.  My husband got a burger with beer cheese, bacon, and all sorts of stuff on it, and that one in contrast did have a lot of flavor.

And then came the fries.  When you order "smothered fries" you expect them to be SMOTHERED.  What we got was a little bit of gravy in the middle of the bowl and dry short rib on top of that.  I mean...put the gravy on top of the short rib to keep it moist.  It was hardly smothered in anything.

Things I did love: the patio has great misters and a great environment, our waitress was wonderful and perky and attentive, and the jalapeno ranch.  Oh damn that jalapeno ranch is good.

One last note.  I ended up getting a tequila based cocktail for $13 (yes, that's right, the cocktail was more expensive than the burger).  When we went next door to The Sayers Club, the EXACT SAME cocktail was $18.  As a whole, I think the SLS hotel has the most expensive drinks on The Strip, and I was shocked at the mark up from one restaurant to the lounge just next door.

Our waitress forgot about us halfway through our meal, but when we brought it to the general manager's attention she comped us and genuinely expressed how sorry she was. I would definitely come back based upon my interaction with the GM, Rachel. I frequent the Umami in Los Feliz, and the burger here was just as good. It's always nice when a chain can stay consistent.
As always, Umami was great!  Mandy was very informative, and fun!  I always recommend The Manly Burger!! Mmmm-Mmmm!!

So we were in Circus Circus and we we wondering what was nearby to eat at. It said this was .6 miles away. Liessssss. I think the GPS inside CC is kinda off... but anyways, we trekked our way to SLS to eat some burgers. If you enter through the Las Vegas Blvd entrance, just walk to your left and you'll see Umami quickly.

Got our seats and table quickly and our server came over and asked us if we wanted anything to drink. Water please! And he left us to go get us water while we looked at the menu. 

I ended up getting the manly burger:
manly $12.95 
House beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, Umami house ketchup, mustard spread.

and they also have a Yelp Check in offer, of free fries or a draft beer if I recall correctly, as we opted for the fries.

The server came by regularly to refill our water, but all our attentions were to the many TVs that lined the Umami "walls" (they're not really walls, as you can still see and feel casino of SLS outside). They even have a personal TV for each table. However, I do not know if you can change the channel of the TV next to you.

Manly burger- Onion strings. After taking a few pictures and enjoying the mix of bacon on medium meat, along with the addition of ketchup and the mustard, you feel manlier. Just kidding. It's mostly because of the bacon and onion strings, along with the flavor you get with everything else that makes it come at ya ;) Tasty but I don't know.. $12.95? :/ 

Their truffle fries were heavy but amazing. It did not make me sick like the ones in the Irvine Spectrum did. It's a good amount for two people to share (so make sure you don't get too many if you have the Yelp check in offer).

Service is attentive. Even with the college football game of the week going on, the server came to us and asked if we had everything, if we needed anything else, etc.

Maybe I'll try Umami again in Socal, because of the LV location~

Pretty good burger and a great atmosphere to watch any sporting event! 
I had mushroom burger which only had about three mushrooms on it because they are some kind of special mushrooms?! 
My husband had you mommy burger enjoyed it. 
Server was excellent!

We Stayed at sls and saw the umami sign so wanted to try it out. We were greeted and given the menu to check out. This is located inside the sports book. They are lots of huge television showing baseball for entertainment. I browsed to the menu and decided umami burger and truffle fries. Carlos our server said the umami was good and he recommended truffle fries. He also gave us free cheesy tater tots. Burger came out excellent and truffle fries was on point. There is a slight tanginess and sweetness to the umami burger that I liked, definitely one the tastiest burgers I had. Carlos is awesome and this place is great, would recommend umami burger.

I was lucky enough to have Umami Burger via Room Service, so I can't really speak to the service. As for the delivery guy, he was super friendly, and the food came quickly.

I ordered the Truffle Burger Royal (the one with the egg on top), the sweet potato fries, and the pickle platter.  Everything was just the right size, not too small, and not too large where you feel like death afterwords.  The fries were a little cold, but delicious. Really delicious.  Plus the temperature was totally forgivable, given the fact that I was able to enjoy them in the privacy of my hotel room.

I found the burger to be something truly special, and would order it over, and over again if I could.  The meat was perfectly cooked, the egg was perfectly runny, and the compilation of ingredients was quite spectacular.

The only reason I can't give Umami Burger 5 stars, is because much like other people, I found the ketchup to be pretty gross.  I don't understand the reason for that exact recipe, or consistency, but I felt like it actually took away from the meal, rather than added to it. I'm a pretty big stickler for ketchup, so I really hope they decide to go another route.

1.  server was nice but the service was bad.  food took a while to arrive and was broken up (ff showed up after i was finished the burger).
2.  the burger was average.  I had the umami standard burger. overall the burger was not juicy, rather dry.   could not find the mushroom that was supposed to be on the burger.  the sauce was really ketchup,  the sweet potatoes were undercooked.  had the dessert of warm cookie with ice cream.  if by warm it meant room tempature, well it met expectations.  the ice cream tasted like ice cream you get when you buy 5 gallons for a dollar.  too wast of money
3.  speaking of money, this place is way overpriced.  take an uber and go somewhere else, it may end up costing the same but the quality would likely be better.  
4.  if you are a nonsmoker, you get the enjoy inhaling smoke.
5.  lots of tvs but you only get to watch the games they want on the tv.  i asked to have a specific game on the tv that is situated inside my booth. "we will see what we can do"  nothing was done.

First time at the umami in Las Vegas. As always the food is great. Ordered the Royale, onion rings, and peanut butter ice cream sandwich. The burger was mouthwatering good. If you haven't tried any variation of umami's truffle burgers you are seriously missing out. 

I gave this umami 5 stars bc there is more variation of drinks/beers but also AJ was super sweet, attentive, and checked on our table all the time. Customer service is what makes this Umami burger stand out from the other umami's in LA that I've been to.

Amazing place. Mandy made it more memorable. She has an amazing personality and charisma; she would be a great bartender!!!! Thank you very much for your service Mandy. It was such a delight to be waited by you. We will definitely come back just because of you. If anyone comes and tried this place, ask for Mandy!!!

Liz was the best! Outgoing, professional, and so knowledgable. She made me excited for the food haha!

Great atmosphere, love the hotel, and love the food!

I wanted to know what the addition of Unami  ingredients would enhance or compete with the beef.  After a couple of minutes the wet ingredients overcame the dry bun so I ended up eating it with a fork and knife.  Each ingredient was highly tasteful; portobello mushroom tomatoes carbonized onions and the parmesan"Frico" were knockouts. 

What I missed was my idea of a burger:. Something I can hold in my hands and get a great burger taste, maybe with cheese.  What I got at Unami was almost a burger and a bunch of ingredients that didn't help the meat even t though they were good.  The burger itself was not hand made and I think that it did not have enough air in the ground meat which led to a tougher bite.   Overall it's good if you want to go for an alternative to the traditional burger.  At $14 I don't think I'd come back

In order to be fair, I'm going to say that I probably ordered the wrong thing. I ordered the truffle fries, with chives, cheese, and truffle oil. I've never had truffle anything before, so I figured I would give it a go. The fries left an extremely odd taste in my mouth, which i didnt really care for. I'm not sure if this is because its an acquired taste or if it was just no good, but I'm leaving this at three stars just in case. I ordered the Manly Burger and it was absolutely fantastic. I would come back here again, i would just be wary of the truffle fries.
Came in for Monday night football and had great service from our bartender Liz. Great drinks and food. Had the manly burger. Soon good!
Delicious food, great venue, and terrific service by Mandy. Their ketchup is to die for :)

It was my fellow Yelpers who convinced me to come here, and there's a lot I like about this place.

First, I like the design overall because it combines a little of everything. It is right off the casino floor, there's a two-sided bar with gaming machines, a neat dining room, a place to make sports wagers and a huge outdoor bar and patio. 

Honestly, this is not your "traditional sports book" and is basically a window to make bets adjacent to the restaurant. They have a handful of high top tables reserved exclusively for sports book patrons, but I much preferred sitting elsewhere where you receive bar or table service.

A new manager named Drea took a ton of time to answer my questions one night, so I planned a return for the Sunday Night Football game and a bartender named Natalia also provided exceptional service and conversation. 

There were a couple beers on good specials for the game and they went well with my Manly Burger, which was cooked perfect and served quickly. This burger featured a really high quality meat and I enjoyed how all the toppings complimented the meat, but did not dominate the overall flavor of each bite. 

Others here on Yelp seem to question the size of the burgers for the price, but I do not. Sure, I can find a bigger burger at a better price somewhere else, but couldn't that be said about virtually any food/restaurant if you really think about it?

This would also be a fun place with a small group if you can get one of the couches surrounding a coffee table that is set up like a living room in front of the televisions. The outdoor patio is another good option with how they set up the tables and the bar outside is very long with plenty of additonal seating. 

Oh, and it is significantly louder inside than outside. So pick your noise level accordingly.
