On a lighthearted note, way too many servers and bartenders were wearing Seahawks jerseys. I'm just guessing most of these were purchased within the last year unless Umami Burger imported 25% of their employees from the state of Washington. If it looks like a bandwagon, it usually is one.

I ordered a chicken Cobb salad. Probably the worst salad I've had in a long time. Hard chunks of bacon fat found only two small chunks of chicken in the whole salad. The wings were drenched in sauce and had too much breading on them. They looked like they came straight from the freezer to the fryer. Nothing screamed fresh about them at all. Being at such a nice hotel I expected more from here. I was surprised to find they do not carry a regular ranch dressing. Who doesn't carry such a basic condiment? The other two ranch flavors were not up to par for me. If the salad wasn't already a fail it was after I learned I couldn't get my dressing of choice. Drinks were ok and a nice place to watch sports, place bets, and relax. I will not cancel this place out because everyone else's food looked so good maybe I just made bad choices but u expect everything on the menu to be good. Hopefully when I visit again I can try something else and update this review.

We enjoyed our Umami original burgers along with truffle fries that came with two types of sauces and our peanut butter ice cream sandwiches.  Service was friendly and helpful, plus Umami was one of the few restaurants open on SLS on a Tuesday evening.  If you are a sports fan, they have plenty of TV screens of every ball game going on at the moment.  They have a beer garden in the back and a full bar at the front.  Look for Umami coupons in the hotel booklets.
Wow, the most amazing vegetarian burger I have ever had. Really. Sit at the bar and hopefully Liz will be your bartender/waitress. Great experience. Super friendly service and reasonably priced.

While on vaca at the SLS we ate here looking to see the NBA playoff game.  The hostess was a little overwhelmed I guess I'd call it and it showed.  The inside was crowded due to the game being shown, so we opted to sit outside at the bar, which was okay, I say that becasuse the bar seats weren't that comfortable.  We asked the barmaid if sitting at one the tables was an option and it was, however we had to go back in and have the hostess seat us.  So we did as instructed, but the overwhelmed hostess expressed to us that there weren't many servers for the evening so sitting at a table would mean a long wait.  So we just went back outside and sat back at the bar.  We ordered drinks and our food.  Drinks were good enough and the burger and fries that we ordered were okay.  I truly have had better burgers and fries.  I had the Cali with Truffle fries and my husband had the Manly with skinny fries.  My burger was cooked good the fries were a tad over salted and the ketchup that they make and serve is not that good.  My husband enjoyed his food, but mine was just "Meh".  When the check came I felt that I was charged entirely to much for a Vodka lemonade made with Grey Goose and an extra shot $28.00! So I pointed it out to the barmaid and she was thoroughly pissed and bought in the manager to explain why it cost so much. The manager was gracious enough to take $10.00 off of the drink.  Not one of my favorite places.

I visited this establishment and want to say this place is  the best burger joint I have ever been to and the service I received from Mandy had alot to do with the experience she was amazing very happy and outgoing made my visit that much more memorable if you live in Vegas or are visiting make sure you come here and make sure you ask for Mandy you time  will be that much better

Umami's Beer Garden was great! Outside but in the shade, great atmosphere and our server Mandy was fantastic! She gave great suggestions on food and her drink recommendation (the Lolita) was spot on - Watermelon + Cucumber deliciousness. We'll definitely be back!

Place is awesome. Tvs everywhere. Insane beer list. Amazing food. Server was super knowledgeable over the beer list and helped me match a beer with my food. Blonde manager came up to the table to check on us and told us more about the brand and some history about sls. Really recommend this place if you're looking for a burger in the area. Staff is super friendly and very welcoming.

We went there on Saturday 11/11 after the Rock and Roll 5k. I had been dealing with a headache that was tolerable at the concert, in the crowds, and in the casino. It was so loud in the restaurant that my headache became a full blown migraine and I had to leave before our drinks even arrived. My mom asked for our food to go since I had to leave. The other half of our party got their food (that we had ordered at the same time) and were over half finished before our boxes were brought out.  The food was cold when we got it and despite my mom telling the waitress the checks would be separate ahead of time she only brought one check. In the end the burger was mediocre at best and the fries were inedible, so not worth the price.
Delicious burger and cool ambience, check it out.

Took an uber across the strip specifically to come to Umami Burger only to find the kitchen closed. Very disappointed. Have heard really good things but probably won't bother coming back to try it. 

If the hours change, it should be the restaurants responsibility to change the hours on yelp to reflect the true hours.
The food and service was really good. Try their truffle burger or truffle fries. Nice outdoor patuo. A little loud but a nice environment otherwise.

Loved Umami Burger in LA, and so happy to have Umami Burger here in Las Vegas! You must try the truffle burger - and the hatch burger, and the Cali burger.... Sitting outside is nice and the outdoor section is nicely done. We had a small issue with the seating, but the general manager reached out and addressed it. Megan was our waitress and was great. We will be back!

For starters I will say our service was great. Our server was very attentive ( even though she had too many tables to juggle). 

The food and restaurant in the other hand was not a good experience. The food was decent but very small portions. A burger fries and drink plus desert still left me hungry. Not to mention way over priced ! $5 for a soda. The burger was decent but nothin to rave about. There are too many burger places in Vegas that are much better and most cheaper. I wouldn't waste your time with umami burger.


I will say the ice cream sandwich was delicious though ! Even for $7

A great sports bar. Lots of beer choices. The truffle cheese fries are great. We had the manly burger and that was delicious. Great selections of shots and bombs. I thought it was a bit pricey, but reasonable for Vegas. My husband loved it. He thought it should get 5 stars. The screens are amazing all around.

My friends and I ate here around the time they were opening. Servers were super nice but I thought the food was average. Maybe I was expecting it to be amazing as what I've heard. 

Maybe I'm boring but I think I'll stick to in N out.

This place is terrible!! The hamburgers look and taste like they were frozen at some point, yet they're $11-14. I had the Cali which I couldn't even finish. The buns are so soft before I even took a bite it was so soggy. The tempura onion rings are lacking in flavor, actually so is the burger. And they call themselves a beer garden - the beer they offer is bottom shelf. I'll definitely not be coming back. 

The service is good though.
Got the truffle burger and cheesy tots (not on the menu) per Tashja's request. The burger was insane and the toys put it over the edge. Great burger and great service! Thanks Tashja!!

I've been here twice and had TERRIBLE service both times. The hosts sit you down and hand you a menu quickly, but it takes the waiters/waitresses 30+ minutes to even acknowledge you. What puzzles me is this place has tons of staff walking around, but no one to help you. Both times I've been here I've had to get the attention of a manager and complain about waiting and not being helped. Food is ok, but I recommend just driving a few more miles to get better food and service at Bachi Burger.

Yesterday was Social Sunday at the SLS and Umami Burger was the place where locals got 50% discount on their orders.  This was one place I had yet to try at the SLS so off I went to have a burger and fries before going to a play.

I had looked at the menu online and I knew what I'd order before I got there.  It sounds like I had truffle mania but actually there was little truffle taste in anything that had the name truffle attached to it.

I ordered the Sunny Side burger which is also known as the truffle especiale.  The menu describes it having parmesan frico, fried egg, truffle butter,and truffled arugula.  Along with this, I ordered the truffle fries described as thin cut fries with truffle cheese.

I ordered my burger rare and that's just the way it was served.  That was great!  The burger was large.  I didn't eat the top bun with its U brand for the company.  The burger was good.  I ate it with knife and fork rather than the pick up and slop over myself.  The fries were OK.  They were limp which I gather is the way Umami always serves them.  They were like an 80 year old who hadn't taken his Viagra.  I also had a black iced tea--known as gun powder tea--that was refilled without needing to ask.

My server was Courtney and she was TERRIFIC!  She was pleasant, knowledgable, and good at her job!

I'm glad this place was the Social Sunday place.  It was not a $25 meal but for the $12.70 price, it was OK.

We are here later in the evening because we were staying at the SLS. There were nit many places open and we were kind of tired after a long drive. The food was mediocre! Nothing was terrible but nothing blew me away. The cocktail was very fake tasting and tasted like a diet juice. I probably wouldn't go back!

We're locals, but we're attending a convention where we are given limited time for dinner breaks. We waited in line forever at 800° Pizza for them to tell us when we finally got to the counter that they were out of gluten-free crust, so this is where we ended up. (As SLS has a pretty shitty selection of restaurants and by then we barely had time to eat) Anyway, enough about us..

This place is a small burger joint that is directly in the tiny sportsbook, so you get to listen to the blaring sports games over the loudsystem while you to try and converse. The menu sucks. Maybe 10 items on the menu, and very limited toppings for burgers. Also, the burgers don't come with fries, everything is a la carte. I ordered a "burger" with truffle cheese, truffle oil, and substituted the patty for a Portobello, as I don't eat meat and had it wrapped in lettuce since I don't eat bread.  They don't offer a small salad or anything for those of us that don't want fries. No other sides, whatsoever. 
He ordered a turkey burger, and one side of truffle fries. Soda water and iced tea for our drinks. 
Server wasn't rude, but certainly not friendly. Acted like we were a burden. Food runner dropped the food and ran. Had to keep asking for ketchup, mustard, and extra napkins, as nothing is kept on the table. For one "veggie" burger, one turkey burger, one side of fries, a tea and soda water.. $43.00. He said his was just ok, however mine was delicious. The final straw, though, was that we were charged $3.15 for soda water!! I've never seen a place (yes, even on the strip) that charges for soda water. Won't be back.

Super Bowl Sunday, not an open seat anywhere in town and if you missed out on this place, you had better put it on your list next year. Paid seating, no crazy crowds or people 4 deep at the bar. Bar seats, beer garden or lounge areas all spacious and perfect to watch the game, eat and drink! We had bar seats, 2 of only 10 and nothing but the game, bartenders and food in front and behind us. Bartenders and servers were great, food was better then pub food and geared more towards those with better tastes! Do miss this spot for any big game you want to watch.....

Cool atmosphere, lots of TV's. Service was friendly but terribly slow and lacking. We had to ask for extra place settings, napkins, plates.. Our waitress would disappear and nobody got their water or drinks refilled. I wonder if she felt like she didn't need to earn her tip since it was automatic with our party of 6. I don't feel like she deserved 20% for showing her face twice. I spent more time watching the server interact with the booth next to us than actually seeing our server.

Food was good, the only thing keeping a third star. Although 3 of us ordered the same burger but cooked differently, and when they were brought out they passed them out as if they were all the same. It was never indicated which was which. Not sure why they asked if it didn't matter? They also brought a bunch of different sauces with our onion rings but never said what was what.. 

Everything is a la carte. 

Sodas come in old fashioned bottles except diet.

Have been a fan of umami burger for awhile now since I've been to the California locations so I was ecstatic when they opened one here in Vegas. We were given the option on sitting inside or outside and our hostess recommended that we sit outside since they had multiple televisions. We were seated very quickly. It took about maybe 10 minutes for them to ask what we would even like to drink, it wasn't even crowded either. Unacceptable. Took about another 10 minutes to actually get the waters and order our food. So all in all it took 20 minutes to place our order, crazy.

We both ordered the royale burger and my friend got the sweet potato fries while I got the truffle fries. The food was brought out in a timely manner, surprisingly! They bring out 3 different selection of sauces that were phenomenal. The royale burger was pretty tasty but I do like the truffle burger a little better. The truffle fries never disappoint and the sweet potato fries were good, but nothing mind blowing.

When we got the check we instantly paid and left. The meal was very pleasant just like California locations, just kinda wish the customer service was up to par like the other ones. I will be back in the future with the hope that the service will be better.

Talk about amazing customer service! 

We showed up interested in experience the much-hyped about Umami inside the new SLS. To be honest, I didn't set high expectations, I honestly thought it was just yet another burger joint on the Strip. I was wrong.

Immediately we were greeted by the staff, our server, Mandy made fantastic recommendations since it was the first time for us here. I had the truffle burger, it was really really good! She surprised us with an item from Umami's secret menu. I don't remember what it was, but it was some sort of cheesy goodness! The outside seething was a great idea, it was bright, sunny with a cool wind. The ambience is relaxed, the food and drinks were good. I definitely recommend Umami burger as a place for eats for anyone visiting Vegas!

As I was walking through the SLS admiring the beauty that this hotel/casino offers decided to stop in here for a drink. This is my first chance enjoying this bar and restaurant. The smells that are coming from the kitchen are amazing! They are also making me hungry. Originally I was only staying for a short while but the servers keep passing the bar with all these lovely treats. 

I enjoyed my drink at the bar and I ordered a rum and coke. The bartender was even sweet enough to add a cherry to it too! The staff here are very friendly and pleasant. They provide such great service and have positive attitudes too. There is a lot of team work between the server and the bartender. A team that gets along provides a better atmosphere for all. 

After another look at the menu I fell in love with the maple bacon fries. Who does not love bacon and now with fries. These fries were amazing and it is best to smother them in ranch dressing too! The serving of fries is so large that I could not even eat them all. The menu here for little treats is fantastic and a must try!
This place had very poor burgers!! Very disappointed and is would highly suggest you don't waste your time.

Could this be the worst possible bartender service in Las Vegas?.... I would have to say yes. Having been here multiple times since opening and nothing has changed. I entertained the fact of coming out here based on an invitation of free play and gifts. I frequent the strip weekly. I love this city and love all that it has to offer. And I'm so disappointed to say this particular place has failed me each and every time! 
When there are three people sitting at the bar and one is gaming (me) and I have to ask for service of a drink or a menu...Completely inexcusable. I'd much prefer a loss in gaming, and fabulous service over this.
Sorry SLS. Train/educate your staff to be a little bit more customer oriented. You already have real estate against you. Step it up with service. So sorry I had to write
 this ' after 'several visits, as I said I love the city and everything has to offer. But there is no way I could give a recommendation to come as a local or as a visitor to this property, when there are sooo many fabulous places they need to compete with....smh...
Amazing burgers for less than the average price!  Be sure to truffle your fries---it's ridiculously good!

Checked this place out for the first time last night. And I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised! We were able to sit outside in the beer garden, and the weather finally allowed for that! It wasn't packed, there were cool picnic tables, and an awesome bar! 
Our server was super cute and sweet! We had the grapefruit beer! Delicious! Then the food... We went all out!! 
Bavarian Pretzel 5/5 salty warm and perfectly cooked! 
Tatie Tots (not on the menu) 3/5 I wanted them to be cheesier, if you can believe it. 
Truffle fries 5/5 delicious skinny fries covered in truffle cheese! 
Manly Burger 4/5 I have to admit I hate the name but i ordered it anyway! Bacon, cheese, onions! So good and juicy! The bun fell apart that is why it lost a point. 
Truffle burger 4/5 truffle on truffle on truffle!! 
I gave Umami a 4/5 because I was up sold on a shot a vodka which ended up costing $13 alone! So that was excessive but other than that I loved it! Great place inside the SLS.

This is not my first time at Umami, but this was my first time at this location. My first Umami experience was at The Camp in the OC.  I wasn't impressed with the service, the wait, and my burger at the OC location. At the time, I thought Umami was just over-hyped.  After my experience at this location, I'm convinced...I know Umami is over-hyped.  

Let's start with service. We arrived around 1:40 PM on a busy football Sunday.  We were fortunate to get seated right away.  Our orders were taken fairly quick and our waitress was attentive. The service and the wait at this location is 10 times better than the location in Orange County.  I just think we got lucky and had a good waitress.  The guests seating directly behind us weren't so fortunate. I noticed that no one was attending to them. After about 10 minutes, they left.  

This Umami was packed with enough TV screens that there's no chance of missing any football action.  There's even a sports book right inside Umami.  If you're a fan of William Hill's Sports Betting, then you'll love the ambiance here.  I didn't place any bets because most of the afternoon football action was already closed.  Good for me. That also means I didn't lose a cent.  

I thought that the food was less than average. We started out with their Smothered Fries, which is their thin fries covered with braised short ribs.  This wasn't bad, the burger on the other hand, was. If you've been to Umami, then you know that their burgers look better than they taste.  First of all, Umami uses a thick or high bun.  The bun alone is about 4 inches high. I think this is done intentionally to compensate for a weak burger patty.  I got the B.U.B, which is supposed to be 12 oz.  For a 12 oz burger, it was small, exceedingly greasy, and lacked taste.  The burger is so greasy and the bun so soggy from the grease that you're almost forced to eat your burger quick.  Otherwise, your burger will turn into an open face burger.  Yes, it gets all over the place. I wasn't impressed with Umami. I wasn't impressed at all.  Overall, I was disappointed with the food at Umami's.  The only reason this Umami gets 3 stars from me is because of their sports book and game day TV screens.

Love this place.  They have real live time betting on NFL games, which I've never seen anywhere else.  Plus the truffle burger and truffle fries are amazing.  I highly recommend coming to this place during SNF, MNF or TNF.
I must say they have pretty tasty burgers. Service was ok could've been better but other than that I would recommend this place to others.
Mandy was absolutely amazing. She put up with me and my horribly awkward husband all night. She was a great!! The food was also amazing !!

Sooooooo.... I had the ahi poki burger and I think I wanna pay them to take it back and if you order  to go I suggest not putting the fries in the brown box container. They ended up tasting like mash potatoes but I'm having fun!!!

I had pretty much every burger in almost every restaurant  this one of the one of the best Sunnyside burger and truffle fries I ever had and the service felt like a five star restaurantand .. I applaud the management for training  their staff  very very well hats off to a server Carlos great experience thank you

This place is the bomb!! Carlos and Joel were our servers and they gave us nothing but the best service! Super friendly, helpful, and definitely made our lunch time better. About the burgers: my boyfriend got the hatch burger and I ordered the cali burger... All I can say: Amazing! We are definitely coming back on our next visit to Vegas!
Mandy was a great server! Got order right on, and really showed she cared to serve us well. Thanks Mandy!

We are staying at the SLS and decided to make a reservation and give this place a go! I ordered the sunny side up burger and it was perfectly cooked and really juicy. All of the flavors worked well. Our waitress told me I could check in and get the truffle fries for free, which I thought was super sweet of her to suggest. We had a salad and my hubby had the original burger. We each had a 2 cent beer from a special they had going. Everything was awesome and the atmosphere was great!

Ok, I don't usually give bad reviews, however I had my father-in-law with me from out of town and told him of a good sports bar.  However upon arrival, the waitress named "Natalia" gave us attitude from the get go and said that unless we inserted $20 in the bar machines,no drinks could be Comped.  Mind you I had already spent $40 and my father in law $60.  This made no since, until a party of 8 women sat next to us, then she was elated to serve them, even though they had not played any of the bar machines.  I guess "Natalia" only serves those who order directly from the bar.  Not good for locals trying to show relatives a good time.  Thank you "Natalia"

My Unami burger was grilled to perfection! Slightly chard and not dry! All of their sauces are made in house. I suggest trying all of them. The tempura onion rings at Tasty!!! Try the ice cream cookie sandwich!! Not hard or frozen! I'll be back!!

Eh. It wasn't terrible - quite edible and serves a purpose as an eatery in the sports book of the SLS Casino. Nothing special as far as menu items go .. To a point where I just went with the namesake burger, to get just anything to eat.. Fairly uninspired as a stand alone restaurant concept - just great as a sports book cafe. 

We had a giant pretzel and chicken fingers to share and sweet potato fries and an Umami Burger. Heading to a show at The Foundry, we wanted quick and tasty. As I mentioned before, the food was fine. I just. don't see a lot of reason to ever go back just to eat .. We sat in the beer garden that is along Las Vegas Blvd and even still it was just whatevs. 

The the pretzel was a large pretzel smeared with mustard. The chicken fingers didn't look worthy of Costco (who have very good chicken fingers available, btw:) the Umami burger was my favorite and it was still pretty basic. The Parmesan tuile was a nice touch - but the single shitake mushroom and single roasted tomato - makes for a "pretty" burger (see photo) but a semi boring burger.

I'm still mad about the chicken fingers tho. If they were made in house, which I highly doubt, they were made terribly. I honestly hope they weren't made in house ... So that drops it to 2.5 from a solid 3 stars. Not trying to be mean, they were just not good. Everyone was hungry and one was left uneaten. I couldn't do it so I left mine there. Cuz it sucked. Lol. Anyway.. Happy Eating!

Came in on a Wednesday night and sat inside, part eatery and Sports bar. I liked how each booth had a flat screen but there were flat screens and sofas if you just wanted to relax as if you're at home!

I opted for a booth but had great views of the entire place for decent people watching. I started off with a cold green tea which was flavorless. My waitress who was there physically but mentally absent took my order for BBQ wings , onion rings and the  B.U.B burger. I specifically requested the wings first and others to follow later but within minutes after the wings arrived the other two items appeared. When the waitress returned and I advised her what happened and her reply was the kitchen was caught up!  The food was decent but I was pleased mostly with the wings. The onion rings were too large, under cooked and a few had too much batter. The burger which contained two large slices of beef, bacon bits and contained another slice of bread which I removed. The burger was overcooked and on the dry side. I was ready to order peanut butter ice cream but the absent minded waitress didn't even bother asking if I wanted dessert and just left me my tab. It's ashame an establishment put this much time and money into this business and yet they have such a sad and unmotivated employee interacting directly with clients. I made sure I tipped accordingly which I thought was still generous.

Compared to my first experience outside at the Umami Beer Garden, this was a horrible experience. Such a disappointing dining experience. If I ever returned here, I will make sure and request not to be seated in the area of this waitress!
This place is awful, we were there for like 20 minutes,and nobody even offer us drinks or anything and, we were like we just want leave and never go back to this places again. Like horrible.

I love Umami so I was excited to see this in the SLS.  It is visually different than any other Umami I have visited before.  I get it, it's a sports bar but I think Umami could have been as successful if they kept their modern design vs. the "Man Cave" vibe.  
The pickle platter was bomb!   I love funky flavors and each item brought a flavorful kick to my palette.  The pickles were very craveable.
My husband and I shared a burger, hot dog, and onion rings.  Onion rings are good but eat quickly or else you will see a pool of grease.  The other thing different at this location is the lack of homemade ketchup.  We received regular ketchup in a squeeze bottle and not the brownish red homemade stuff that we are used to.
I would definitely go back and recommend it!
Got the manly burger and my girlfriend got the sunny side with a fried egg. We split the truffle fries, everything was delicious and the outdoor seating was perfect on a warm Vegas day.
Casey, our server, was awesome! Very attentive and super nice! Couldn't ask for a better server. Oh...the food was awesome too! Truffle burger was amazing!
Awesome burgers, cooked to perfection. Truffles make all the difference. The restaurant is located inside the casino and has plenty of tables.

Food was tasty enough. Small portions for what you pay for, and the $13 burgers don't even come with fries! Some claim "double patties" but it's really just the single patty cut in half. With a group of 6 people, the waitress tacked on a 20% gratuity tip without informing us, and the receipt still had a place to fill in an additional tip. I would say 20% or more is what we usually tip for decent service, but our service was pretty subpar. The waitress came by to take or order, and drop off the check. Busboy brought food and drinks. When the waitress was asked almost anything, she was very attitudinal with us for no reason. Not worth 20%. They don't have a basic burger for, say, a ten year old. Instead of informing us the cheapest option is to take a couple things off a fancier burger to make something simple, they wanted to charge us per topping. Good thing I asked before she put our order in - got the same burger for dollars cheaper! Probably will not go back.
Ahi tuna burger was interesting; flavourful but so moist that it falls apart quickly.  Truffle fries are good.  Pretzel is large enough to share.

Went today because locals pay 1/2 price.  I had a reservation.  Got there at 1:15 and there was a wait for tables, but we were seated right away.  Table was horrible.  Inches away from the next diner and to get up, you basically had to walk a block.  So I saw an empty booth and asked to be moved and they did relocate us.  Ordered the Manly's and garlic fries.  My first comment was that the food was not hot.  Burgers seemed that they were probably par cooked and then finished to medium, but it was truly just luke warm.  The fries were not hot at all.  For half price it was just OK.  If I paid full price I would be unhappy.  On the plus side, being that it was super crowded, the service was very good.  Our food order taken quickly, drinks came right out, and food came out very quickly.  But, I don't think I will return.  Fat Choy, just 3 blocks away is leaps and bounds better.

CUBS WIN!!! I had the best time at Umami SLS last night. Yeah they are Dodger fans but I reminded the Host that Umami Chicago is  rich with CUBS fans.. He laughed. The service at this location is some of the best in Vegas ( super sincere). I relaxed after a long day of meetings. Enjoyed great cocktails and of course the Umami Burger with Truffle fries . I definitely binged on Truffle flavors by starting with the Beet salad... Killer good!( got to love arugula) . An associate met my about half way through the game and he was raving about his Umami experience to others at our meetings today.

I first tried umami burger in LA and it never really left me a good impression. And it's the same impression after today. 

Our waitress was very friendly, helpful and accommodating to our large group. She explained the beer menu and took her time in taking all of our orders. She gave us our free yelp fries with a check in. She also gave us a free birthday ice cream sandwich.  Pretty much just because our waitress was awesome, I'm giving it another star.

The food was average.  I felt the same way as I did before when I first tried the food back in LA. The fries were semi crunchy. The grilled chicken nachos were sad and barely could be considered "nachos." 

I ordered the grill chicken sandwich and it was alright. The parmesan cheese was a nice texture added to the meal, but it was nothing special.

Overall, I'm not a fan of umami burger at all. It's expensive, and you could get a better burger for much cheaper.

Meh. Not worth the hype or prices. The burger bun was soggy and the chicken wings felt greasy and over battered. It also would have been nice to experience the patio and beer garden but it was closed during our entire stay.

Had a Cesar salad, umami burger and truffle fries. Truffle fries were to die for and I give the burger and the salad a solid B+. Service was meh at best and ambiance left something to be desired. Wwere told there was going to be a fifteen minute wait when half the place was empty and continued to be empty and when the bill came out we were overcharged. We told waitress bill was wrong and she kind of shrugged her shoulders. Also on the negative side was two flat beersI'll be back though... the chicken fingers looked ahmayzing!
The burgers were good, but the portion was small. This would be 4 stars if it came with a side or if the service was better. One Umami burger would not fill up a hungry man or woman

I'd give this place between 3-4 stars. I think you just have to experience this place for yourself after reading everyone else's reviews...

Our waiter was super awesome and came to our table several times. Hostesses sat us right away. Not too busy for a Monday night. 

They are known for their "Manly" & "Truffle" burger which we enjoyed :) 

This is a great place to sit down and watch a game on TV. They have many TV screens playing diff games.

Vegas local here, but my first time to Umami. First off, our server, Mandy, was phenomenal. Very friendly and attentive. Her recommendations were spot on and she even surprised us with an item from the secret menu! Both the truffle burger and the B.U.B were amazing. Oh, and the B.U.B is HUGE!! The Salted Caramel ice cream sandwich for dessert was just the right size. Forget the haters, come try this place. I know I'll be back.
Awesome food and great service from Amanda. The price is very well priced and we will be back!
Ew I don't know how this place has four stars. Yuck. Limited selection and seriously crap service. Never again.

I was a little skeptical in eating here seeing all the reviews. However, I got the Truffle Royale Burger and the Truffle Fries and both blew my mind. That braised beef was such a great addition to the burger. 

The only downfall of this place is the service and the prices. $5 for a sprite is beyond me. We also had to tell our waitress twice that we were waiting for someone else in our party to come but she proceeded to keep asking if we were ready to order so we ended up giving in to get her to stop. Then when it came to refills, she was never to be found.
Terrible service for overpriced mediorce food. I would not recommend this place. The manager could care less if his restaurant makes revenue.  The food is not that great.
Tashja was our server for a big group and she was fantastic! So friendly and fun. She did great and the food was great alsothank you!:)
Our last day in Vegas we went to eat at Umami....very good, fast service and awesome customer service. Our server was Mandy.....thank u for the great service!

My girlfriend and I love this place. The quality of the burgers are great and the price is even better. We've tried most burger places on the strip and this place is by far one of the best. I always get the manly burger and truffle fries. The maple bacon fries are really tasty too. 

Only thing we dislike is the booth with the pokey hair.

Been to this place several times. I think they should have a sign that say, "we don't want to make money" out front. Random people sitting around watching sports at tables, maybe 30 people in the place, 10 might be ordering food. Random servers walking around talking to each other and sometimes some people sitting around get a menu. I came in to bet and maybe get some food. 
So this happened both times. Sat around watching a game for about 30 minutes. Asked for a menu from one of the servers that seemed to be just randomly walking around. Got one after a while. Then waited for someone to take my order, oh for about 45 minutes? This last time I just left. 
Food is pretty good actually. Burgers are juicy, chicken wings are tasty and prices are just fine. Just whoever manages the place obviously has no clue what they are doing. Just managers and servers walking around, looking around with no organization or idea of what's going on. 2 stars still because of the food, sportsbook and nice TVs, but they are gonna close up..I mean, that's easy to see after about 10 minutes in the place.

Good burgers, great customer service, was seated pretty fast. Highly recommend if you're staying at SLS Las Vegas as one of the restaurants to try since most of the strip hotels are overpriced and average food quality.

One of the most important parts of a dining experience is SERVICE SERVICE SERVICE! 
I cannot speak for the other days, but I went here with a group of 4 girls on Sunday night to take advantage of the 50% off the bill for locals. The restaurant is HUGE, and it wasn't packed. I believe they are understaffed, because the waiter took about 20 minutes to come to our table to ask for our drinks. That is by far the longest I've waited for water. AND, it was ONLY 20 minutes because I had flagged the waiter down while he was serving customers two tables away. 

During those 20 minutes, my friend had even left her order with us to go use the restroom, maybe took a number 2 or the bathroom was far away, returned, and was shocked that we hadn't gotten our waters yet. Actually, we hadn't spoken to a waiter yet when she had sat back down. 

Despite the slow start, the food came out within 15 minutes of ordering. I'm not sure if it had anything to do with us letting the waiter know that we were in a rush to catch a show. 

I don't blame the waiter, as he was trying his best to serve the customers. Perhaps they were understaffed or didn't have the system figured out completely yet. 

As for the burger--I"ve had Umami in L.A., and this was similar. The burger was good, but not out of this world. 

Truffle fries- I don't like it when my fries get soggy. I did not like the gravy looking sauce that was all over my fries, and the flavor of the sauce was meh. 

Onion rings-  VERY GOOD. I'll come back on another day for that, and try out a few other items. When I'm not in a rush, and have a good 2 hours to kill.

Great burgers! Had a sample plate of 3 different types and all were good. The servers were very quick and I had a nice salad too. If you are in the SLS I would check it out for lunch. You can place a bet in the sports book as well.

This place is always delicious. Not my first time but my first time trying the truffle burger which I would definitely recommend. Also my waitress Mandy was fantastic! She gives great recommendations and is so attentive! A great and easy choice when in Vegas.

Umami fans in SoCal should know the drill here for the most part - for everyone else, Umami is a decent burger place that has some unique little spins although the menu doesn't seem to have really innovated all that much from many years past with a taste that is just okay.  
 
The restaurant is primarily a beer/burger place with some side options like salads and such.  If you're staying at the SLS, make sure to bring down the coupon book in case they do have some interesting options for food (like free ice cream sandwiches).  

Burger-wise, I tried the Ahi Tuna burger.  Presentation was fine.  The taste was simply okay.  The burger oddly didn't have much flavor although it had a ton of ingredients on it.  My friend said he enjoyed his onion rings and truffle fries along with their unique slightly spiced ketchup.  The ice cream sandwiches weren't bad but nothing too special.  Also had the beet salad side which was surprisingly big.  Didn't like the flavor very much this go-around for some reason though.  Prices will vary about $8-$15 per item.  

They have a regular beer/bar menu with a sorta-extensive beer list.  Surprised that the beer flight was limited to just a few of the core beers that included such not-so-great examples like Coor's and Bud.  They do have specialty beers at the very least which is worth checking out if you like it.  They also have a bar area with video poker.  

Decor-wise, you're looking at a very sports/bar setting.  They seem to have a beer garden in the back although when I was there, no one was around that outer area so we stayed indoors which had plenty of seating and tons of TV's.  

I'm personally surprised it closes at 11PM - being a beer garden/sports bar in a Vegas location.  Perhaps it's with the lack of a crowd at night but feel that it's a restaurant/bar that should be open much later - especially for the late munchies crowd.  

In the end, I'd give the restaurant about a 3 1/2 stars.  It's not bad by any means and hasn't lost much in the transition to the Las Vegas.  It just doesn't seem to have evolved much in its taste and even lacks a little bit in the wow/taste factor.
When this place first opened the food was amazing. Now it's honestly nasty and a waste of money. Burgers are dry and not what they used to be. Also got rid of some of the best food items on the menu.

Spectacular burgers and beer! Have the truffle burger...off the HOOK. And the banana beer and dark chocolaty coffee beer are YUMMY! Big TVs and comfortable atmosphere top it off. Plus, they have a bar on the outside for playing video poker n such with drinks. Good times.
Drove 17 miles is to eat here and it's closed on a Wednesday night at 6. What a fucking joke.

Great experience here. We wanted a quick bite because just got in and needed to catch a concert. They brought out food so fast. Excellent work by Sarah. She is an awesome waitress.  Timing was so good that we even got dessert.

I don't like to throw 5 stars out there unless the entire experience is exceptional. Here's why I'd give it 4....  the service wasn't quite up to par. Although the place wasn't packed for lunch, our waiter was a bit scarce at critical moments:
Like after we were seated. 
And after the great food was delivered and it became apparent extra napkins would be needed. 
And when drinks were running low...

The burger I had was excellent- both flavorful and juicy. Price points are a bit higher due to being a hotel/casino restaurant, but by no means outrageous. Will hit this place again next time staying here.

Pros: $ 2 Bud light during games and a free order of truffle fries with a Yelp Check-in. 

Cons: ...the rest of our dining experience. It took 9 minutes after we were seated before a waitress came to our table. She didn't know about the Happy Hour specials from 5-8pm that are clearly advertised all over the property.  The burger was meh.. 

Check out other burger places on the strip. Won't be missing much here.

We were tired, hungry and getting a bit jaded with flashy Vegas restaurants. We went to Umami because everything else in SLS was either closed or unappealing.

We were seated in a booth that was comfortable and immediately greeted by a refreshing friendly voice and face. Our waitress AJ was a breath of fresh air. She gave us plenty of menu advice and time. She was genuinely concerned with our enjoyment of our experience. 

We didn't want to watch basketball on our booth TV. As soon as we let someone know we'd prefer hockey, the game was switched. 

The food:  ahi burger - amazing!  Big, well seasoned and perfectly cooked. Throwback burger - solid traditional burger, substantial amount of beef and a very tasty bun. Truffle burger - just excellent, a wonderful grown-up mix of flavors. 

A choice of three sauces plus house made ketchup is offered up to the table - these were a great compliment to everything we ordered including the tempura battered onion rings, cinnamon seasoned sweet potato fries and truffle fries. 

Then there are the cocktail and beer selection. Amazing!  Try the Le Freak brewed by Green Flash!

I'll sum up the experience like this: this is the only restaurant in Vegas we went to twice during our trip. Loved the drinks, the food and especially the staff. Go there!

Just had a late lunch here after returning from the NASCAR races and wow were we impressed! Best burgers, fries, beer and service! Sunny was our waiter and gave us excellent recommendations! We had the Manly burger ,the Greenbird burger and truffle cheese fries! All were stellar!!! We were so sad it was over when we finished. And have already decided to go back later in the evening to have it again. Lol! Sunny also recommended an AMAZING beer that wasn't on the menu. It was Samuel Smith's organic chocolate stout beer! Let me just say it's the best I have ever had! Highly recommend this place!!!

Boy. Do I hate this place. But before a concert where else is there in this hell hole to get a drink?  

The outside bar was closed because "it was too hot". Hmmm. I thought SLS was supposed to cater to the locals. 

So I have to sit at the gaming bar. 
I put my $20 in the machine and then the bartender informs me that the large beers r not compted when u play. 
Isn't that nice?  After I ordered. 

After I said something she did fix the issue with a smaller beer. However I was already done once again with this place. 

I guess the only way to c a concert at SLS and get there early to enjoy a pop or
two is to bring your own. 

That's what I will b doing from here on out.
Great service and burgers. Would definitely come back again. Lots of televisions as well for sporting events

I've been looking forward to trying a Umami Burger ever since I saw a TV special on them a few years back. I spike my own burgers with everything from fish sauce to marmite, so this is a burger I knew I could appreciate.

It was an exciting moment when I finally wrapped my hands around a $12.95 Umami Burger consisting of a 6-ounce beef patty reportedly made from American Wagyu beef and seasoned with soy sauce, ground-up dried porcini mushrooms, and dried fish head dust. Toppings included roasted tomatoes (tomatoes slow-baked in soy sauce), shiitake mushrooms, caramelized onions, and a round parmesan cheese crisp (referred to as a "frico.") The burger was served on a Portuguese-style roll.

Imagine my horror as the flavor of the burger tasted muddled going down, almost like the burger was not made of meat, but instead of mushrooms or vegan ingredients. To be fair, the after-taste of the burger lingering in my mouth after I swallowed was good, quite "beefy" -- but there was something "off" by a mile with this.

After another bite, I identified that the burger was waaaay under-seasoned, despite whatever umami infusions happened in the meat. The lack of salt in this burger was tragic -- think of drinking a can of Coca-Cola without sweetener (sugar or otherwise) and how weird and jarring that would be. Salt is nature's best and most powerful flavor-enhancer. It is bizarre that a restaurant so focused on achieving a big umami flavor would eschew salt, likely relying on the soy sauce for salt rather than seasoning the meat manually.

Another crucial element was lacking: one of the best ways to generate umami flavor is to invoke a Maillard Reaction (e.g. browning reaction) and generating a flavorful crust on the meat. Yet, my Umami Burger looked baked rather than grilled and did not go through this process, arguably the most important flavor-producing reaction within all of cooking.

Some of the toppings were more effective than others. The roasted tomato confit was good (yay! flavor!), but the caramelized onions were just barely discernable. The burger needed cheese, and the problem with the parmesan cheese crisp is that it doesn't hug the burger the way a melted slice of cheese would, and it seems very separate from everything else when I was chewing it all.

On the other hand, the thin Truffle Fries I ordered were very tasty -- salty and crisp, smothered in melted cheese and a well-restrained amount of truffle flavor. Best of all, they're free with a Yelp check-in. If I found myself at the SLS late-night and hungry, I may hit up Umami Burger for the fries, but I probably would not get another burger.

I'm interested in knowing what I'm missing here. Somehow this restaurant remains in business and is known for its burgers -- what am I not getting?

Food/Décor/Service: 2.6/2.5/3.5

Decided to try this place out since we'd been to Bachi Burger last Vegas trip and wanted to try something similar but new.  Well we should have gone to Bachi Burger because this place was nowhere near as good.  The food was decent but nothing special.  The maple bacon fries were probably better than the burger so that should tell you something.

I wouldn't come back here again.

So excited there was an umami burger here in Vegas!! Truffle everything, that's the way to go.  Service was awesome, Tashja is an amazing server!  She was quick and made sure to check on us multiple times. Took care of things we asked for right away and didn't have to wait long at all!

Sat at the outside bar and service was stellar. The bartender was attentive and suggested different items on the menu. Great beer selection. I ordered a baby daddy ipa. Hoppy and bitter like how I like my IpA

We ordered a truffle burger and it was consistent to other Unami in terms of taste. However it was overlooked, asked for medium, came out pretty well, no pink in the center, but we didn't send it back. Was just hungry from the pool. 

The thing I did not like at all was the maple bacon frites. It was too gooey (too much syrup). You can't even taste the sweet potato fries and it was greasy. They give you about 3 pieces of bacon bites, you have to search for it. Just stick with regular fries, onion rings or sweet potato with nothing on them.

It's very rare for me to ever eat at Umami, so I definitely had to stop by in Vegas before I leave back to SD! I had always had the truffle or the umami burger, but I tried the sunny side this time! The egg adds a great taste to it! 

I can't believe just a small burger can be so filling! They're definitely different than most burgers. Truffle fries is a plus! And when you check in, it's free! Also, their sweet potato fries are good!

I love how clean and different the place is than others. They also serve there condiments on spoons, super cute!

Megan G was such a wonderful server. We were being somewhat complicated, but she was still amazing and didn't mind helping us out! She always had a smile on her face. We need more servers like her! Thank you so much Megan!

Worst service ever. These waiters gave us:  serious attitude, terrible service, wrong orders, sub-par yet overpriced hipster burgers, and botched split checks. I'd rather die of famine than ever eat here again.
I loved the service by staff and I received my meal quick. Plus it's in the sports book.

Nothing Special , actually kinda dissapointed because i was expecting more decent food. Burger is so small and patties are cooked dry. I wouldnt pay $12 or more for a burger  just go to Gordon Ramsay Burger

Umami Burger is one of my favorite burger joints in the heart of Las Vegas. You can taste the quality and flavor in their burgers, not that big or with a lot of fixin's (maybe you have to request?) but just right to fill you up.  Fries are normal but the apps are good including the nachos.

We were staying at SLS and chose Umami Burger for dinner.  We were seated immediately.  There are TV's everywhere, even at your booth.  It would be a great place to watch a game and grab some food.  Our server was super friendly and we got our food very quickly.  

I ordered the Sloppy Mami, a vegetarian sloppy joe.  It was served open face and was piled high with lentil sloppy joe mix and topped with fresh slices of jalapeno.  It was absolutely DELICIOUS!!  The texture was great, the bread was soft and the flavor was rich and perfectly spiced.   We ordered a side of onion rings.  OMG the onion rings were scrumptious!  They were huge rings with a nice, flavorful, crispy coating.  They brought out a variety of dipping sauces which I thought was a great touch.  I would seriously go back for the Sloppy Mami again.

While visiting Las Vegas my friend and I stopped through at Umami Burger, mainly because of the huge beer selection. The ambiance was great and the service was fantastic. I had the truffle burger and truffle fries and they were both pretty good. Also, the side portions are large so you can definitely share. I would recommend this spot to a friend looking for a nice casual dining experience.

So Wednesday, I was sat outside with some of my friends. I had the delicious hatch burger and truffle fries; wow, those fries! It was better than BURGR's parm fries. 

I wanted to say the service was amazing. Usually in Vegas you get those shit servers who don't really care... But That wasn't the case. My severs name was Sunny; he was so attentive, sweet and helped me pick my food, thank god cause I couldn't decide! I'm definitely gonna come back every Wednesday in hopes he's my waiter again. 

Thanks Umami!

I was skeptical trying Unami Burger at first because of some of the low reviews. I had  a 50% off coupon because it was my birthday month so I figured , "why not"? I called ahead of time to the hotel's players club to see how to redeem the coupon and they told me to redeem it at Unami Burger. When I got to Unami Burger they told me to go to the players club to redeem it ....see the run around. Finally the players club had to work with Unami on how to redeem it. When I got back the fries were cold and the burger was warm but at least the problem was solved. 

I had the Manly Burger which consisted of beer cheddar, bacon lardons (bacon chunks), smoked salt onion strings, house ketchup, and mustard. The burger was juicy and had a distinctive taste it didn't taste like a burger from Jack and the Box or anything like that. The burger was overall very tasty. The Make em Manly fries was a different story. In short they tasted pretty bad the fries being cold didn't help either. It had the same toppings as the burger but the taste differed in the fries . It was too salty for me to eat and the fries were not crispy enough to withstand the toppings. The fries ended up a soggy mess. I ended with Mintimalism for dessert. It's a double chocolate chip cookies with dirty mint chip ice cream. I wouldn't suggest this unless you really like mint like I do. It felt like Christmas in my mouth which was great because I wanted to get rid of the salty taste of the fries out of my mouth. 

The service was very accommodating despite the birthday coupon snafu. They kept checking on us to see if we needed anything else. If you don't want to try Unami for full price the SLS offers 50% off one of their restaurants every Sunday. You would need to call ahead to the players club to see which one is being discounted on that Sunday.

Every casino has a burger restaurant and this one definitely doesnt disappoint. 

Umami is a popular burger joint and they are known for their Truffled creations. To me, truffle anything is a winner for me. Anywho, let me take you my adventure at Umami Burger at the SLS hotel.

The Umami Burger is combined with the Beer Garden and Sports Book. A dream combo for any beer fan and sports fan. With wide screens all over the place, this is definitely one of the casual hang out spots at the SLS hotel. Our server arrived promptly and explained the whole menu to us. This was my first time eating here, and if any server explains the menu to me, they are off to a good start. Two burgers that caught my attention was the Truffled Burger and the Jose Andres Special Burger. For those that are unfamiliar with Jose Andres, he is the culinary superstar chef behind the world-known Bazaar. A hint to all is that if its a Jose Andres creation, it certainly worthy to try out. Along with the burgers, we also ordered fries...truffled fries of course. The neat thing about this 3 hit combo establishment are the beers. Most places will have the typical everyday beers you can find from the supermarket. This place surpasses all of those expectations. This place has craft bottle beers and even beers that Ive never even heard of.

Beers are out, fries are out, burgers are out. Everything tasted great, service was prompt, and the dining experience was great!

If your low on a budget and want to eat something casual a the SLS hotel, lets this be your number one go to spot.

UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

I've eaten at the Umami Burger in Santa Monica, CA and the one in Pasadena, CA so my Husband and I were crazy excited to see that one was coming to Las Vegas right next door to us!! The truffle burger is AMAZING! So juicy and bursting with flavor. If you like tater tots, order the cheesy tater tots. They're not on the menu though, they're a secret... Shhhh. My hubby and I agree the jalepeno ranch sauce is best with the tots. The other sauces are just ok.
I took a star away, because online it said they weren't taking reservations until September 1st. But when we walked into the dining area, after about a 40 minute wait, all of the booths were reserved. The waitress  was nice though!

I was really disappointed!
I had the Cali Burger. The meat patty was good, nice taste and quality. The rest of the burger was terrible. The roasted tomato is so wet it made the bun soggy and mushy. They do not have fresh tomato, fresh onion, or pickles...... this is a burger place, right?
oh yeah, no regular ketchup or yellow mustard either.... you better like the unami sauces.... those are your only options here.

I highly recommend the seared tuna burger.  It was sushi-grade tuna and it was amazing!  So tender, so good!  We also ordered the "pickles" plate, which was a selection of different vegetables (mushrooms, carrots, beets, peppers, pickles, etc.) with different pickled flavors--different but good.  We got in late after all the buffets were closed, so we went here.  We were impressed.

Husband and I came in for a quick lunch - and was very impressed by their delicious burgers! Their truffle fries were on point too. Our server, Tashja was very friendly and hospitable. We definitely will be back the next time we're in Vegas!
The truffle burgers are amazing!! We tried two different ones and they were to die for. Truffle fries are so thin and delicious also. Yum yum.

Had the burger here with an added egg. It was bomb. The thin crispy fries are a perfect complement. I've also had the nachos and ahi tuna salad here for appetizers. Those were just so-so. 

Service is hit or miss, depending on when you come. One guy was on point with his service game. The other time I came, the waitress was swamped, covering way too many tables to provide quick service.

Can't get enough of this place. Great quality burgers and fries, awesome atmosphere and a chill place to relax and have a drink (or 2 if you're like me) and of course friendly staff.  Conveniently located inside the SLS Hotel, after a little fun in the casino its a nice spot to watch games with friends.  I'll definitely be there during football season!

Ordered to go and they had you wait standing by the reception desk,
didn't even offer you to sit down..waited for 1/2 hour standing.
My daughter was disappointed for the small burger she ordered.

Some of my sorority sisters and I stopped here for a late lunch between our meetings on Saturday and I was quite surprised. After reading some fellow Yelpers reviews I wasn't expecting much but the food ended up tasting pretty darn good.

I opted for the Hatch with a portobello mushrooms rather then the burger just to mix things up a bit. The flavor was great! It was a bit messy to eat since the chillies kept sliding out and the bun was a little bit bland, but overall very good. 

I also went with the side of truffle fries, yum. They had a cheesy topping on them as well as plenty truffle flavor. I personally love skinny fries so these were right up my alley.

I must say it was a bit pricey for a burger joint, but it is technically the strip after all so you kind of have to expect that. My bill came to around $30 for a "burger," fries and pear cider.
The beet salad was fantastic and twice the size I was expecting, the burger was perfect (I got the Manly) and the service was great. I definitely will be coming back.

The most delicious burger I have ever tasted , cooked to perfection , juicy as a real medium well should be , fresh  baked buns and perfect portion. We can not stop talking about this place . It can be a little pricy . I would recommend a visit to add to your list while in Vegas

Umami~~"the beautiful taste" and so it was! Went for lunch and was taken care of by "Charlie" our server who made for the best lunch ever by his friendly personality and outstanding service he gave us. He really went out of his way to make sure are glasses were always full and if we needed anything he would be more than glad to get it for us! 

We decided to order one Green Bird "Turkey Burger" and one Original "Umami Burger" along with Sweet Potato Fries and onion rings.  The Umami was oooozing with flavor & well the Turkey Burger was okay I should know better.......dammit next time Im not playing anymore I only order BIG JUICY STEAK BURGER "UMAMI.    

Charlie our server also brought out a complimentary birthday sweet treat for my bestie which was really sweet, I definitely will return for a  mouthwatering yummy, deliciousness "Umami Burger Binge" when in Vegas!

To start off, SLS is amazing. Friendly people, great vibes and overall just a beautiful hotel. Among all the restaurants this place has, Umami has to be my favorite! Amazing well cooked burgers that make your mouth water and the fries are so crispy and tender it's just too dam good. Highly recommend this place!

My friend told me this was the best burger she ever had. As a burger lover, I consider that a personal challenge to eat that burger. We stopped at the Las Vegas location after 6 hours of driving on our way back from the Grand Canyon to Southern California. I was ravenous. I ordered the truffle burger (added roasted tomatoes) and we split truffle fries (blahhhhhh give me my own fries people! Friends who ask to split fries are bad food friends). NOM NOM NOM! I was a happy camper. I do not know if it is the best burger I have ever eaten but it definitely ranks up there in the top. Truffle. Brioche. Meat. Fries. More Truffle...need I say more?

We stayed at the SLS and saw that they had an Umami Burger so we dropped by for a quick late night bite. We came by around 9:50pm, right before closing and we're graciously sat by the friendly upbeat manager. Service was quick, efficient and friendly. The Manly Burger and Truffle fries were great. The Truffle cheese on the fries were just right and the burger was cooked to a medium rare perfection. I definitely recommend Umami Burger!!
Pretty good burger but the size is very small. Service is good. We ordered French fries and the waitress brought up different kinds of sauces along.

I love this place. It's chill and it's got one of my fav burgers in LA, flat screens at all angles to watch any game you want and lots of beer options. On Mondays, KU noodle is closed, and so are most the other "light bite" places at lunch, so Umami was the ultimate choice. We got the most lively waiter ever, being 1pm in the afternoon and hung over, he happily brought us everything we needed to remedy our ailments.  

The burgers are on-par with the LA counterparts, but I still wish they would ditch the ketchup in a spoon concept. I need more ketchup than that. The garlic fries are bomb, but the sweet potato fries were a bit dry. The best part of the meal was the mint chocolate icecream sandwiches. Real mint leaves infused in icecream wedged between two chocolate cookies. B.O.M.B. Must try for anyone who hasn't had it.
Mandy was awesome!!!  Great service!!! Great food!!!  Our group of 20+ people had an amazing time!!!!

I was pretty satisfied with my experience at umami. The atmosphere of this bar was awesome. I was there during the NCAA tournament which made it even more fun. The crowd was really into the games, they were very upbeat and excited to be able to watch the games on multiple tvs while placing bets without having to be at the sports book. 
Also the food was pretty good. I ordered the green bird which was a turkey patty with avocado and it was great! Very tasty, perfectly cooked. I added some truffle fries to my meal and I was pretty happy with them.  They offer several options for their skinny fries: the garlic fries, the truffle fries (probably the better option) and the sweet potatoes fries. They also carry a good selection of bar food in case you do not feel like eating a burger. Overall, a good place to watch sports, place some bets and enjoy good food!

This was my first time in Las Vegas and I stopped by this restaurant for lunch. The atmosphere was amazing I got a pizza or "pie" from the 800 degrees menu and some sweet potato fries. They where delicious. The manger Rachel was so pleasant and had a great personality, amazing time laughter with her and our server Tashja was a sweet heart, she not only was on point with my table but she gave some good tips on things to do while we where visiting. If you are ever in Las Vegas and staying at the SLS Las Vegas hotel you have to visit them.

I love Umami burgers, I love sports betting, and I love beer gardens. This place does a bad job with all three. I don't know if it's a lack of process controls from corporate, but the burgers just don't compare with the LA locations. They're either overly greasy and raw..or burnt to a crisp. The sports book is small, the odds board is just a couple of flat screens, and as far as I know they don't give out drink tickets for placed bets. The beer menu is pretty limited for being a "beer garden." The LA locations usually only have 5 draft beers, but at least they are interesting craft selections. And don't get me started on the required minimums to sit down at a table. My group was told that we would have to commit to spending $100 a person in order to be seated. That's a lot of burgers and booze! We refused and they seated us anyway...go figure!

On a separate note, review your bill and credit card bill carefully if you choose to eat here. I don't know if its willful fraud or just lots of billing mistakes in their favor, but I have had overbilling problems at multiple Umami burgers. In previous experience, the Hermosa Beach location billed my card twice on two separate days for the same meal. It took multiple calls and a Visa chargeback to fix the situation. During my visit to Umami Las Vegas, we tried to split a $170 bill (tip included) on 3 credit cards. Each card was charged $90. When we complained to the manager, he claimed that it was a typo and that the waitress had meant to type $60 per person. We signed and left....but just to be clear $60 x 3 does not equal $170.

I like the concept of a restaurant branded sportsbook. I just don't like this one. I'm gonna spend my time at traditional sportsbooks, where I get to watch games with free drinks rather than get overcharged for already overpriced ones.

Best burger iv had in a long while i had the Umami burger but when i opened it it had ONE single mushroom in it i mean cmon its a 14 dollar burger and they can only spare one! I read another comment that said they got 3 so i guess they are getting cheaper. The thin fries were also kinda awkward to eat and the ketchup tasted weird.
I'd eaten at one location in San Francisco.  This location was much nicer!  Plus Tashja took really great care of us.  What a great final lunch for our trip to Vegas!
Yup...I'm back!! Found out today, if there is a group of you and you are not super hungry....order a few burgers to share and taste, some fries and nachos and it is PERFECt

We decided to have dinner at Umami while checking out the SLS. We were promptly greeted, and our server came to take drink orders within moments.

The service was really great. Friendly, attentive, but not smothering. Mandy had great suggestions for food and beer, and really made our experience fun and engaging, definitely ask for her. 

As far as the food, generally excellent. The burgers are unctious and full of the namesake flavor sensation, which I'm not sure some reviewers get. Meat is ground in-house (which yields a much better texture than typical compacted rubbery ground beef). The fries are underhwelming. They'd do better to switch to a hearty steak fry, especially since "manly" is a recurring theme on the menu. Contrary to the fries, the onion rings are thick cut, not encased in heavy batter, and are among the best I've had.

Make sure you also have the Brooklyn Later, it's as winning as Nancy's service.

DO NOT EAT HERE. I ate here last weekend and after eating a Cali Burger, I was throwing up all night into the next day with diarrhea and spent my weekend in Vegas in bed which is NOT where I wanted to be. It completely ruined my birthday weekend with my friends. The hotel does not want to take accountability for this awful experience. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Never coming back here again. Thanks for ruining my weekend!

I can't explain how much I love Umami Burger. I first discovered it in California, and was so surprised to see it was in my hotel!

It's set in a sports bar, which is cool to have tvs to watch while dining. I of course got the fries and truffle burger; all excellent!

When I checked into the SLS I had no idea that there was an Umami Burger onsite.

I love Umami!

Mandy was my server and she was fantastic, I was in a bit of a hurry because I had to get over to the convention center for work and she got my order processed and food out super fast!

Very convenient to where we live but unfortunately the positive stops there. Service was very slow but that's okay as long as the food is awesome. Having had experienced and loving Umami Burger in several different Southern California locations, we were so excited to find one in Vegas and so close to where we live. This is absolutely not the same, unfortunately. It's more like casino bar food. Nothing was great about the experience. I guess being in a high tourist area, repeat business may not be high priority.

Not a bier garden, per our server .  A restaurant that serves beer.  Burgers are very good, service not so much.  If you are looking for a quick bite  and not in a hurry, this might be the place to go.
The ahi tuna burger with a lettuce wrap was bomb! Good service, even prices, great place to grab lunch and a few drinks!
One cool thing about this place is that they brand a U on your burger. But other than that its mediocore
Great burgers. Great service - thanks Tashja! My favorite are the sweet potato fries as they have a cinnamon sweet flavor!

Imagine yourself sitting in the middle of a of the redock sports book and then have your booky cooking your food, that what this place is. The Manly burger was a horrible burger and was more of a burnt slider that a cheese burger our smothered fries were cold and the bacon cheddar hot dog was absolutely disgusting. Way over priced we just told the waiter and left

Worst experience ever. I fell in love with umami when I was living in cali but the umami restaurant in sls hotel sucks. Service was bad and especially the burger was dry. So sad!!! Won't be coming back.

We came here for #SocialSundays when locals get 50% off the menu at a selected restaurant and obviously, on a Sunday. What a fabulous deal! I made a reservation through OpenTable and requested a table in their Beer Garden. The hostess couldn't find my reservation, but luckily, I resolved that through OpenTable. Fortunately, it wasn't busy yet and we were seated in our preferred area immediately. 

Side note: They're open an hour earlier (10AM) on Saturdays and Sundays during football season. If you sit inside, there's a $50 F&B minimum PER PERSON during the 10AM games. This does not apply to the Beer Garden though!

The Beer Garden is their outdoor patio facing Las Vegas Blvd. There are several televisions along the walls showing multiple games. The seating is picnic tables and very casual. There's also an entrance/exit to street, but you can't just seat yourself. It was a great atmosphere, especially with the beautiful weather that day. They don't allow smoking on the patio, but some patrons thought that hanging their arm off the patio railing meant that they were abiding. Yeah, no. The smoke was bothersome and off-putting.

Our server was really nice and with supporting staff, everyone was relatively attentive to our needs. The manager was constantly walking around the restaurant and he was approachable. There was an issue where we were watching a particular game and it was switched abruptly (however, the audio remained on that game) and we spoke to our server and the manager to have it resolved. First, we were told by our server that they do not change the channels for anyone or any reason (Really?). Second, we were told by the manager that the games switch automatically during Half Time, however, the television did not revert back after the game had resumed the second quarter. It took approximately 15 minutes for the game to FINALLY appear! No explanation as to what occurred. I can't imagine anyone being happy if this happens often during big games.

Truffled Beet Salad ($7): truffled ricotta, smoked almonds, wild baby arugula, and truffle dressing. The arugula was fresh. The truffle wasn't too overpowering. Overall, a decent salad, but nothing special. It's missing something - I didn't get that "umami" factor.

Fried Pickles ($6): artisan-crafted pickles, jalapeño, ranch, and shaved Parmesan. The pickles were okay; still had a bit of crunch. The batter was light.  Nothing remotely worthy of a repeat.

Smushed Potatoes ($4) with roasted garlic aioli. These were good. The potatoes were nice and soft inside while having some exterior texture. Their roasted garlic aioli is great.

Thin Fries ($3): Nothing special, but not terrible.

Umamify Your Fries - Truffle 'Em ($3): truffle cheese fondue and truffle salt. This definitely made their boring fries much more exciting. Nothing I'd come back for though.

Hatch Burger ($11): Roasted green chiles, house American cheese, and roasted garlic. This was just okay. It wasn't cooked medium rare like we requested. There was nothing exciting or even good. I can barely recall its taste now.

The Original ($12): Parmesan frico, shiitake mushroom, roasted tomato, caramelized onions, and Umami house ketchup. This burger was terrible. The burger had no flavor and I didn't have anything remotely close to an "umami" experience with it. Oh, and you know how it says you get "shiitake mushroom" with your burger? Yeah, you really get only ONE mushroom and it had the circumference of half dollar coin! WTF?! How does that make any sense? Why wouldn't you slice the ridiculously small mushroom and attempt to distribute it on the entire burger? You get the experience of a shiitake mushroom, but only in one bite. You're SOL with the rest of the burger.

Spanish Royalty Combo ($35): Jose Andres Burger and Estrella Damm Inedit. The Jose Andres Burger ($15 individually) has a pork and cured ham patty, piquillo pepper confit, caramelized onions, Manchego cheese, and roasted garlic aioli. The Estrella Damn Inedit (750mL; $25 individually) is a malt and wheat beer created by Ferran Adria and his El Bulli team in 2009. So, you save $5 with the combo. Thank goodness this burger was good! It earned the additional star. The patty was juicy and the whole burger was extremely flavorful (or maybe just in comparison to the other tasteless burgers). I was happy with this burger. Ruben enjoyed the beer very much.

The food was extremely disappointing. We've been to Umami Burger in California and really enjoyed it, so this experience was surprising. The burgers are much smaller than the ones we had there. Even the Smushed Potatoes are smaller! Everything was hit with a shrink ray when it came to Las Vegas. The sides were decent, but the burgers (the Jose Andres Burger being the exception) were offensive! Also, I'm not sure when you receive the soup spoons with dipping sauces, but we weren't offered!

Horrible. Horrible service. 
We're staying at SLS and decided to come here for lunch.. Wish we hadn't wasted our time. We come in, and it's not busy at all. We ask for a booth for 4 people, they seat us in a booth made for probably about 10. Huge table. Really? We asked for a smaller one but the hostess or whoever told us, "Well they're all dirty so.." there were at least 5 dirty empty booths at the time so I asked if they could clean one maybe? Hostess seemed irritated that I god forbid even asked of such a thing.. and told us that if we wanted to wait that we could. .. ok.. 

So we waited for them to clean the table. And waited. And waited. They finally do and we go to sit at the smaller booth, and one of the servers tell us "uh, somebody is going to be sitting here..." we replied "yeah, us." Totally rude. Eh, whatever. 

We get our drinks after waiting for at least 7 minutes for anybody to even realize we exist. From the busser. The server comes later to finally ask what we want. We order, and I'm watching the tables around us being sat.. at least 3 tables we all watched being ignored. Waiting at least 10 minutes to even get acknowledged. Are you kidding me?

One table ordered champagne, and the server didn't even know how to open the bottle. Had to take it into the back. The customers seemed confused. The people at those tables were still waiting to order food, looking around for anybody to help.. seriously there's so much to type but I can't even deal with writing the rest right now. Just irritating that customer service has gone down the CRAPPER.

I'm sad to say that I am so disappointed in Umami. I was looking forward to eating here ever since I booked my stat at the SLS. I LOVE a good gourmet burger, but sadly this place did not live up to my expectations. I ordered the truffle burger and truffle fries. When I got my meal to my room, I tried the fries first, but they were...mehh. I've had excellent truffle fries at other burger joints (they're kinda hard to not do right), but these were just not great. On to the burger... it was simply ok at best. The flavor was just not what I was expecting, and I know a good truffle burger :/ I cant quiet put into words what exactly it was missing, but it just did not do it for me. Oh well, at least I gave it a shot.

Great place right inside the SLS, the burgers are good but this review is for the service. The server, Mandy, handled our group of rowdy guys really well having fun and being attentive. Enjoyed a nice bite while watching our Cubs leading the Indians in the World Series!

I went to Umami for their NFL kickoff party! It was very busy but the hostess quickly accommodated my husband and I and seated us in the beer garden outside. There were 12 TV's outside that I saw, a lengthy bar area, and some table games as well. I would definitely recommend eating outside; however, they raised the window shades halfway through our meal which in turn raised the temperature about 10 degrees. Keep the shades down guys! The view isn't worth it unless you like looking at trashy souvenir shops. 

I only tried the sliders and sweet potato fries (because they were free for the party!) but both were delicious. However, the Pepsi I ordered was very watered down and the menu was very basic with little variety at all. 

I was impressed with the good service! Our waitress Rachel was juggling several rowdy tables but made sure to bring over drink refills and ask if we needed anything else. She had a huge smile as well. Take note, management! She deserves her tips tonight. 

Overall, I enjoyed the kickoff party, food specials, and the football atmosphere but wouldn't return on a regular night.
