Liz was really the star of the show. The beer selection is one of best on the strip. Cool vibe and a great burger menu. Check this place out. Video poker at the bar. TV's pack this place and all the games are on. SLS is one of the newest hotels on the strip check it out.

Meh. We decided on here because I've heard people rave about their veggie burger. Guess what - they don't have a veggie patty option here, LOL. The portabello mushroom was nothing special. We also split the regular fries and the arugula beet salad, the latter of which was extremely tasty. For Vegas, not so bad. In a fairly nice, modern, sleek hotel type (best looking type of people in Vegas I tell you), but much like many of the food options in Vegas, so whatevs.

I finally got a chance to check out SLS. 

Pros-Came here on Thursday night football, and WOW! They have like a 150 4K foot screen and it was beautiful! Surround sound was incredible. Restaurant is built different then what u expect but it was cool.  
Ordered the manly burger because quite frankly I'm a man. Lol it was very tasty. Wasn't blown away by it but it def did the job. The sweet potatoes fries are INCREDIBLE! They add like brown sugar to them. It's heaven In your mouth! (Pause) lol
Server was really sweet and pleasant. My burger didn't come out to the specific temp I wanted and they took it off my bill. I didn't even complain! That was a huge plus I just upped her gratuity . 


Cons- good beer list but some of their beer was over priced. 12$ for a Octoberfest? 14$ for a Duval? That's ridiculous lol. Maybe more menu items in the future it was pretty limited. If you don't like sports don't come here during game time (I do love sports by the way) but it gets  pretty loud.

Overall I'm glad I waited to come here. I will def be back!

I think there is a umani burger in NYC but never been and actually did not eat a burger while here though did try out there beers, and salad.  My friends stated burger were good.    I did like the outdoor seating in their beer garden area as nice to get out of the casino and relax especially during the cooler months of the year.  I was a little annoyed they would not plug in my phone as needed to charge it up at a plug by game table which was in a section one could not sit in.    Does not open at 10am when games start which is surprising since sports book is within its confines.

Wanted to try this new burger place at the SLS,  We walked in from the outside entrance. The hostess opened the gate for us never greeted us and told us we needed to go inside to the hostess stand to get a seat outside.  We walked through to find a hostess to seat us outside, we then waited for another waiter to take our drink orders.  I received my drink 10 mins. after I ordered it and then the other drink came 10 mins. after that.  They were out of the first choice, had no ginger soda on hand. Ordered the signature burger,  you can't specify how you want your burger cooked. Our waiter just said it's a thin burger and it comes the way it's cooked.  We were never given any napkins or utensils and had to grab them from another table...we were told not to do that.  lol.  They had all these workers walking around doing nothing!
 We had to move from our picnic table because of a smoker.  they didn't want us to use our free fry coupon because we ordered truffle fries, scolded us again for that... upon leaving the hostess opened the gate and we were herded out with no goodbye or thank you again!  I was warned by a friend that spent the weekend at the SLS,about the place;  thought I'd try it anyway.  I guess they don't want any locals, this is not a feel good place u-mami?

The food was good but the service was terrible.  The host took our order, the waitress introduced herself and then we only saw her again when she brought us our change - we had to get the host to bring us our tickets.  I think we were seated away from her other tables since no one else was around us.
Food was awesome and so was the service! Our waitress Mandy was super attentive and her recommendations were on point!

This place was perfect.  Great burger, great beer, loys of tvs, and wonderful service.  My server, Lauren, was on-spot with recommendations and everything was delicious.  Recommend the 'Manly' burger, truffle fries (request the sauce!) And the cookie ice cream dessert.  Really enjoyed my meal.  The ice cream cookie was perfect, ice cold ice cream and hot, melty cookie...

Tony and Jessica hooked it up for my industry group of 6 during one if the NBA finals games. Comfy couches and armchairs if you reserve them. We got a great deal - a special package incl. unlimited draught beers and wings. Only reason I deduct a star - the wings were average, but I'm fancy so don't let that put you off!
Tv's everywhere, good atmosphere, friendly staff, and free easy self parking. Great hospitality for local industry people. Thanks for the patron hangover Tony!

I wasn't a fan of Umami Burger when I lived in Los Angeles but this location is more of a bar rather than a fancy burger spot filled with hipsters dressed in overly priced grungy clothes. 

On Thursdays wings are 50cents and beer is a dollar!

This is great place to watch football and place sports bets!

*check in and get a free order of truffle fries*

Sitting outside along the strip was quite enjoyable! The burgers were delicious. We ordered a beer tower and when we poured the beer we noticed absolutely NO head on any of the beers. We tasted the beer and everyone thought it was flat. We told the server. She came back with a manager and the manager asked "what's the problem with your beer?" We told her that we all thought it was flat. She immediately responded "oh yah! We have been having problems with our CO2"... if you know there is a problem, then why would you ask us "what's the problem with your beer?" Anyway, she quickly offered to get us something else and offered to upgrade to a more expensive beer. 
I definate would go back!

Would have given Umami burger a 4 if it was just me - My burger (with Hatch chilis) was awesome and the truffle fries were fabulous. That said, hubby thought his burger (a double of some type) was dry and uninspired. Overall I would go back.

Too bad Umami is so far from Houston!! 

Booked my hotel at SLS and a friend heard this place has really good burgers.  Turns out, it was fantastic!  If I ever run into another Umami Burger I am down to go in a jiffy!
The place looked really nice, I think it's one of those places that take down bets and has those super huge screen to watch sports.  Waiters were fairly quick and attentive to us.
We had:
--Truffle burger (5/5) (added bacon) :D
--Truffle fries (3/5)(didn't taste the truffle much, but it was still good)
--Ahi Poke (2/5) (it was alright, wasn't that much of a fan)
Great burgers & excellent service. Had Mandy as our waitress & she's fantastic. She recommended the Truffle Burger & she didn't steal me wrong. Great choice.

This is really all you want in a sports bar.

Awesome beer selection, delicious burgers, and giant TVs everywhere!

And you can bet on games in the restaurant... Whaaaaaat?

The manly, hatch, umami, and Cali burgers are all fantastic (actually all of their burgers are amazing).

Service was impeccable as well - get Charlie! He has a cool Mohawk.

I was staying at the SLS for business about a week ago and this was the perfect place to grab a quick bite in the hotel before an event.  When we told the staff we were in a rush and only had 30 minutes they were very accommodating and made sure we were in and out.  A coworker and I split the manly burger & truffle burger , and also got a side of the truffle fries.  Enjoyed everything. I wish I had more time to finish my stout and truffle fries!

Out of the way, but a short Uber ride and so worth it!   The food is very filling, so we split a "Manly burger  " that was so fresh and cooked perfectly.  The Blvd. North cocktail  was light, fresh and not made with simple syrup.  Yelp hooked us up on a free order of truffle fries - yum and thanks Yelp!  My tip is to order the secret tator tots that aren't in the menu - made with fresh Parmesan and cheddar / WOW!  Great friendly service and reasonable !!

Pretty tasty burgers. I ordered the truffle burgers and truffle fries and they were truly something special. The ahi tuna burger was a little weird for me and didn't mix well in my stomach. The ice cream sandwich was also a little strange since it used buns instead of cookies, but I'm giving them four stars for outstanding truffle recipes.

Service was good sitting at the bar. I ordered the manly burger. Came out undercooked and smelling rotten. The bacon pieces were pure fat chunks. I sent it back after trying to eat it and she took it off my bill. Food is gross service is well.

We were pleasantly surprised. Came Sunday for lunch on Memorial day weekend.  Service was attentive and spot on. We got the Manly burger, maple sweet potato fries and a couple of beers. I agree that they need to update /expand the beer selection, but the vibe is great and we had a really nice lunch. The three additional dipping sauces were a tasty unique touch.  I'd come back.
Awesome time at Umami Burger at the SLS.  Safa was so polite and helpful. Great food. Great service. Cold beer.

$11.50 for 5 wings. Hmmm I've never paid over $2 per chicken wing in my life unless it was for room service. The wings were cold by the time they got to me which is lame considering I asked for them to be well done. The bar was nearly empty when I placed the order. 
Burgers are small comparably here I saw.
I also don't like the signs at the bar that say basically- "don't sit here and expect to get a complementary drink unless you are entering $20 per drink into the machine & betting max bet" 
It's lame. If you sit and legit-ably gamble, your drink should be comped. Very stingey SLS. 
That is the problem that I believe is that  Umami burger and SLS are separate entities and can't agree on a policy that suits guests of the hotel vs. walk ins?

I tried the burger when I went to LA awhile back. I liked it. Hell, I loved it. The service there was bomb and the food was pretty good. So, guess how excited I was when this spot opened awhile back?

Well, lemme tell you about this location. I finally tried the place after how long, but NOPE. I get comped rooms at the SLS and stay there when I can. We did try to go to the restaurant first, but the host didn't even pay attention to us, so we left. They do room service and all so we thought, why not? Let's eat and hang in the room. For some freakin reason, NO ONE answered! No one!! Hell, the operator was even lost to why they weren't answering. Took maybe 6x to finally get through to them but that's because the operator tried another extension. HORRIBLE. 

When we finally got our order, which was disgusting and super oily, it was a mess. I feel like the person who delivered the food decided to swing the bag around hardcore and hit some random gambler on the way to my room with it. 


We ordered: 
Umami truffle - Decent at best. Simple expensive thing. $13
Manly burger - Regular...mediocre...a mess. $12
Truffle Especiale - The egg makes everything better. Like I said, everything looks like it got into an accident or shaken to death. $14
Smothered fries - This looked like puke and it was cold. I couldn't do it. $5?
Truffle fries - I liked it. This was my fave thing. $5?
Ice cream - Prepackaged, overpriced, CoolHaus ice cream. $7 per a small sandwich.

There was more, but these are the ones I tried. 
BTW, they forgot our ice cream. Dude had to make a 2nd trip and he had attitude. Wow...  
We ordered a lot, I get it... It also cost a lot. Cost over $100. Ugh... We should've just went to In'n'out or at least Bachi Burger. 


This really upset me. I liked the place....but this location killed it. BAD. 
Never again. Go to In'n'out or at least Bachi Burger for gourmet burgers instead.

Service - F- (Retrain the staff.)
Price - D+ 
Food - D - 
Ambiance - C 

Overall: NO. Never again! 0 stars if I could. It's hard to wear my patience thin and this place definitely did.

Meh
Had the chicken lettuce wraps and my husband ordered the Cobb.  Yelp checkin gets you free truffle fries.

The space is nice and large and our waitress was awesome - absolutely lovely, fast, and accurate.

The menu is rather limited and healthy options do not abound. The chicken lettuce wraps were rather lackluster - pieces of chicken and mushroom slobbered in ranch dressing and covered in a mountain of fried onions.  No intrinsic flavour to speak of.

According to my husband, the Cobb was decent and the fries were good, but were served in a porcelain bowl that assured they got cold within a minute of being on the table.

We will probably not come back.

Good burgers, but very poor service! It took over 15min to get our drinks and another 10min to get a hold of server to order food.

Had to ask for ranch and ketchup 3 times to get it. I was expecting better service from a sbe resturant.
Managers were trying to help but they need to reconsider new staff.
Transaction#9030022(9/12/14)

The original Umami burger is the best burger I've ever eaten.  Get a side of nachos, any beer of your choosing, or the truffle beet salad and you're set for a grubulous meal!  The best meal I had on my recent weekender in Vegas.

The food was amazing but service did not exist! I think this is the saddest looking group of people I have ever seen working in a restaurant. We asked twice for a waiter after we were seated. Had to ask for silver, then napkins after the food was served and of course had to wait on them. Asked for the drink menu to order second round and the waiter never came back to take the order. We finally just asked for the bill. If you don't mind casual, I don't care if you're served attitude then try the truffle burger and Manly fries.  We wanted to sit outside but they said there was a private party so check before you go if you are wanting to eat on the patio.

After a long day driving to Vegas, I wanted to get some food close to the hotel we were staying at. Unfortunately, I didn't want the buffet since I had heard some bad things about it so decided to go to a better place (being Umami).

I know there are other Umami burgers (one in SF), but I definitely wanted to try it. 

As a family we ordered the smother 'em fries and a some nachos. We had them to share. The nachos were good - like regular nachos with beef. However the smother 'em fries are delicious. Gravy and shredded short ribs are a delicious topping to fries. It's really like poutine without the cheese curds. Wished that we could just get the fries poutine style! 

I ended up ordering the Royale burger - with short ribs, truffled aioli, and truffle cheese. All this truffle is delicious in a burger. My dad ordered the original which he enjoyed. Brother ordered the B.U.B. which was a big burger. 2 patties is quite a bit to eat, but he seemed to have enjoyed it a lot. Mom ordered the ahi tuna burger. Delicious! 

Overall, decent service, kind of slow, but there quite a few people eating at 9, but then again it is Vegas. Burgers came before the nachos and fries which we wanted as an appetizer which was kind of weird.
Nice beer garden with typical umami burger quality.  Nice scene, good for catching the game and a beer.  Courtney was a fine server too.
Pleasantly surprised. Was expecting it to be more hype than anything, but enjoyed the food and atmosphere during lunchtime.

Sadly I revisited this restaurant because I loved it the first time. This time It was horrible and I'll never waste my time and money again. I only frequent Vegas for work purposes so I usually order Togo and take it back to my room. This last time it was nearly impossible to get anyone to help me. When I finally was able to get the attention of the bartenders I didn't even ask for a menu ,just gave my order and I was ready to pay. She put in the order and I waited 35 minutes before she even remembered I was there. Someone finally saw that my Togo bag had been placed on the counter and the ticket showed it had been ready for the last twenty minutes. She mentioned nothing of it, processed my payment and gave me the bag. I get to my room and the burger was ice cold. Had it not been for the fact that I had to be at the airport at 4am I would've brought it back. I simply tossed the cold turkey burger in the trash and considered my money wasted. Word to the wise, unless you're coming to sit and truly enjoy a hot burger at a table... Togo is not where they strive.

Had an amazing experience here today!  Sunny, our server, was totally attentive and very helpful in picking out a solid set of beers. I had the Umami burger, and, though I was slightly disappointed to have only 1 mushroom, the burger was so perfect in medium rare that I didn't care once I started eating. I'll be back here for sure.

I took advantage of a discount coupon (spend $50, get $20 off) to check out Umami Burger a few nights before Christmas.   It was my first visit there, & first time dining at a restaurant inside the SLS.    Things can be somewhat deceiving -- the gaming floor inside SLS at about 7PM on a Thursday night was absolutely dead.  I felt sorry for some of the dealers, etc. as they just stood there.  Some were just looking at the floor, one was actually filing her nails(!!) and when others made eye contact with you, it reminded me of volunteering at the local animal shelter, where the dogs all gaze up at you & beg you with their eyes to take them out for a walk...

  Anyway, my friend & I were seated promptly (no reservation), and a waiter quickly stopped by to take our drink orders.   My iced tea was about $4, so when it showed up not filled-up to anywhere close to the top of the glass, I was rather annoyed, but thankfully, they had free refills so it was a non-issue.

My friend ordered a burger, as a vegetarian, I the one burger I could have -- the "Sloppy Mami" burger.   We decided to share an order of Battered Onion Rings, Smushed Potatoes &  Thin Fries with the Truffle treatment.


  The best way to describe the atmosphere & ambience of the SLS Umami Burger -- at least at the time we were there -- is SPORTS BAR!   There were dozens of TVs all over the place, *plus* the SLS 'Sports Book' is just there on the other side of a rail -- its basically part of Umami Burger, whether they describe it that way or not.  Seems like if you're wagering at the sport book, you're basically going to sit at one of the tables used by Umami Burger.

 The place was loud -- so loud that my friend & I really couldn't carry on much of a conversation.  I have no idea if it's always like that, or perhaps there were just some particularly 'important' games going on that evening (I'm not a sports fan...).

  My "Sloppy Mami" burger was, despite the name & list of ingredients, actually pretty tasty so I was pleasantly surprised.  A lot of 'upscale' burger places just glop a bunch of vegetables together into a patty to make one token burger for us vegetarians & that's what I was expecting, but the Umami people actually seemed to put a lot of thought & effort into designing theirs, and it was very good.

 My friend said his burger was good.

  The onion rings were just OK -- not a lot of flavor to them unless you dipped them into the ketchup, and them they tasted like ketchup.  Come to think about it, onion rings at most places are pretty bland.  Umami was no exception.    Thankfully, the thin fries & Smushed Potatoes were great -- mostly thanks to the truffle flavoring.

  All in all, food & service were very good.  If I was big into football, I suppose I may have appreciated the atmosphere, but there's a difference between showing some sports on TV & being a sports bar, and at least during prime-time hours, Umami Burger is absolutely a noisy sports bar.

  In retrospect, they do have outdoor seating -- a semi climate controlled patio looking out onto Las Vegas Blvd.  I'm not sure if it's only open seasonally, and I know it does have TV sets in that section too, but it may have provided us with a quieter environment.    It can be a lot of fun to people-watch along the Las Vegas Strip but the Umami Burger patio area is back a couple dozen yards from the Strip/sidewalk, plus the SLS is on what at least these days is considered the far Northern extreme of the LV Strip, so there's not a lot of action to watch.


  Would I go back?   Maybe in a couple months, if I had another coupon, yes.   But without a coupon, I can get food I like better elsewhere, cheaper.    If I was into sports & staying at the SLS, I'd go there to grab a beer & watch the game.
Incredible food , amazing cocktails ,service was prompt and all over us. Different type of sports bar! Left stuffed and happy will go back for sure once in Vegas!!!!

Umami burger has been hyped up for me, so this was disappointing. It's in the SLS, which I thought smelled odd. It's connected with a sports bar, which threw me off. It made me wonder if I was having a true umami experience.

Our server was wonderful. She was the only server on Christmas eve, and you could tell she was working hard. Kudos to her.

I had one of the truffle burgers and tempura onion rings. The burger comes out looking visually stunning. I enjoyed eating it until about halfway through. After that, the truffle oil felt overwhelming and I didn't want to finish it. The tempura onion rings were huge and so light tasting. They were delicious with the house ketchup.

I'd give umami burger another chance, but maybe not this particular one.

I was really looking forward to this place. Heard great things about their Los Angeles location. It did
Not live up to the hype. Ordered my burger medium and it was deliver cold. In addition we waited 25 minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant and couldn't get a booth even though they were all empty and everyone that got seated after us got a booth. Weird level of service. They better get their act together because we have many options for burgers that are actually good.
Burgers were awesome. The pickled plate is so original. Don't skip the truffle fries. YUM! Our server Mandy was terrific!
We ordered the Umami & Sunny Side Burgers w/ a side of Sweet Potato Fries. ALL DELICIOUS!!  The house ketchup & the 3 sauces they serve on spoons are so good too!!

Burgers were delicious!! They look a little small but they filled us up. I got the Greenbird (I substituted portabella mushroom instead of turkey patty) and my bf got the Cali; we shared an order of sweet potato fries. Quick, very friendly service! Casual, relaxed environment with lots of screens to watch sports. There are even multiple couches to sit at and eat!

I sat at the bar and ordered a delish Black Razz Mojito, the bartender made it excellent!!! My meal was the hatch green chili burger & truffle fries. They were both very good, and flavorful. The bartender cane back many times to check on my and to see if I needed anything else. I would definitely visit again. I will for sure get the mojito and probably try different burger options.

Came here as the last day in town and wanted to go someplace by the hotel. Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try.  Glad I did! We were promptly seated with our party of 6. Carlos was our server and gave great explanations and recommendations. We started with the truffle fries and the buffalo wings. The wings were crunchy and not soggy or dropping in sauces, the truffle fries were amazing with the truffle cheese. For lunch I got the Truffle burger medium and my partner got the green bird with a beef patty. Both burgers exceeded expectations. My picky teenager got the manly and devoured it. We also had the sweet potato fries from checking in here and those were also simple and amazing. I love the food and the atmosphere (think sports bar) and definitely recommend it for anyone wanting to catch the game, get a good drink, and really good food.

The Burgers here are amazing! The truffle burger came highly recommended and that was what I went with. Let me tell you, it did not disappoint! Sooo good! We also tried the truffle fries which were also amazing. They have a "secret" menu as well and we got some of their cheesy tots, also good!! The burger was done medium rare and I recommend it to be prepared that way for maximum deliciousness. Oh yeah, I can't forget about the ice cream sandwiches we had for dessert. Very very tasty!! 

The service was good as well. It took a little time to get a table for our bigger party, but our server Casey was on point. She was awesome! She definitely knew what she was talking about and seemed like she loved working there. She was super friendly and made sure we had everything we needed at all times. I'm glad we had her serving us!! 

I've only been to a handful of burger joints in Vegas, but this place ranks up right at the top! Highly recommended to anyone looking for a great burger spot and a fun place to grab a drink and hang with friends. 

Cheers!!

Umami is new, and it seems that it's just not my taste. Gourmet burgers, maybe, but not my style. 

Ambiance: 3 - Located in the Sports Book, Umami definitely has an active feel. It's loud and exciting, but not too busy..The place was organized, but the tables in the middle are TOO close together. We might as well have just pushed our tables together with strangers because it was basically like we were talking to each other. Someone please space the tables away from each other!!!! 

Service: 3 - Our server was sweet, but the service was great and fast in the beginning...but very, very slow at the end. Not too fun to be waiting 20-25 minutes just for the check! And there wasn't even that many people around. 

Food: 3 - Food was just okay. I got the Truffle Burger, Truffle Fries, and Onion Rings. It's a little sad and disappointing for me to announce that the best thing I ate was the onion rings..and maybe the sauces on the side they gave to us. 

I did not like how the truffle burger was just --drenched-- in truffle sauce. It made my entire meal soggy, and that's just not what a burger is about for me. I think if they go easier on the truffle sauce around here, people might like it better because it WAS actually a juicy and well-cooked burger. 

The truffle fries were way too salty. We had to constantly wipe salt off of ours. The truffle sauce and cheese that's on it is already pretty salty! Hopefully they will be subtle next time with that seasoning! 

When I had wine tasting classes, they taught us that umami was a balance of the tastes on your tongue. Yet, everything was either too salty or too soggy. Find a balance, and you'll get better reviews!

We did go eat here before we went to freemont street. A very nice experience. They have a great outside place and inside area. 

Nice diffrent burgers to try. I had the sunny side and this one was a blast. With truffle butter..delicious!

Also the service was friendly and nice. Gave some reccomodations for the menu and also asked for refill our bucket of beer.

Recently tried Umami Burger for the first time this weekend while visiting Las Vegas... Overall the experience was awesome! We ordered the Ahi Tuna salad and the Ahi Tuna burger with a side of truffle cheese fries. All of the food came out fast and had great flavor. Our meal was exemplified by our server, Abbi! She could not have been more genuine and attentive to our table on a Saturday afternoon that appeared to be fairly busy in the restaurant. I'd recommend checking out this Umami Burger to any of my friends looking for a casual place to watch a sporting event.

Came to Umami Burger for the first time since they opened here in Vegas to eat and have some drinks. 

Ahi Tuna Caesar Salad - Good, perfectly seasoned. 

Fried Pickles - Nice and crispy

Sloppy fries - Good flavor

Sweet Potatoe Fries - Crispy outside, soft inside, sweet

Original Burger - Was just OK. Nothing great about it. Lacked flavor

Hatch burger - nicely seasoned

Cali Burger - OK

Mint cookie ice cream sandwich - refreshing, chocolate cookie was warm and soft. Mint ice cream was nice n minty

Peanut Butter Ice cream sandwich - Too peanut buttery for my taste

Service was great. Very attentive with good recommendations. Food was just ok to me. Nothing too special for me to go out of my way to come back. I along with many other people prefer Bachi Burger lol

Sports Bar where the waitress couldn't find ESPN 2, didn't know which channel ESPN 2 was on, didn't want to ask anyone and got annoyed at me for wanting the TV at table. Hanged to something I specifically came in to watch.

And the same place where the waitress ignored me after my food was delivered until twenty minutes after my food was finished.

I had a Cali burger which was super good, and my friend tells me his Sunny Side burger was great as well. With great service (with an outstanding beer recommendation from Courtney) and a solid drink selection. A bit pricey, but not exorbitant and totally worth it.
Safa is rocking behind the Patio Bar! Great food, awesome service with a smile, and the best place to watch football in Las Vegas!

Food was the bomb!! 
Had the Cali burger and wow!!! 

Our server name Tashja made it such a fun experience...best server we've encountered in Vegas that obviously enjoyed her job and enjoyed us tourist folks 
Thank you guys for a awesome experience

More of a review of the Beer Garden located within Umami Burger.

Good spot to watch a game, place some bets at the attached sports book, and enjoy a cold beer.

For a beer garden the tap selection is underwhelming though but an overall decent selection of brews.

They have some outdoor seating if you feel like melting to death in the 100 degree temps. I preferred sitting inside with the cold air conditioning and multiple screens to view all the sports. Plus, the booths have their own tv's too. Video poker at the bar area.

Just had a beer here so I can't comment on the food, but my brew was chill, the service was good, and the Stanley Cup playoff game was on. Life is good.

Living in Los Angeles, Umami Burger at The Grove was my favorite burger joint. 

The truffle burgers are amazing! Also the truffle fries.

I got the B.U.B. this time, although it was really good, I still absolutely love the truffle burger. 

Service here was fast and friendly. Our server Matthew was always there to take care of us, and our food came out fast. 

As good as this place is, it's not as great as the location in The Grove. I feel like I'm at a sports bar but I guess this place is a sports bar too. In Los Angeles the Umami Burger feels more upscale. 

I'm still giving this place five stars because as I've said, service is fast, friendly, and the burgers are so yummy!

The service was good, the cocktails were primarily spicy like they over ordered pepper or had something to hide. This would have had a 4 star review, but the $9 nachos were disgusting.  Cheese like you get at the movies,  jalapenos from a can, fake tasting guacamole, overcooked bland beef, and canned beans that would have looked much more appealing had someone bothered to rinse them before putting them on the nachos.   I'd rather pay $20 for decent nachos than $9 for .....that.

The food here at the Umani chains are subpar IMO... You try different locations and the food quality is merely the same, however the service separates each location. A few months ago I visited this particular location and this particular night the waitress spilled, no showered us with a glass of water and even said "I knew this would happen..." and I'm thinking well damn if you knew it was going to happen why not stop and pause before bringing us the waters... No discounts on the food, no comped meals next time, nope... Just soiled pants is all they gave us.

Cool burger place! Mandy our server was awesome, real simple menu, clean cozy spot. How can you go wrong eating burgers and fries and being able to bet sports in the same establishment? You can't go wrong!

Tried their burgers because of the hype and totally not worth it. Such a disappointment. Burger was less than average and priced way too high for the cheap quality and lack of taste. I gave them 2 stars because their customer service was awesome but other than that it would be only a 1 star.

We had a great lunch! Bucket of beer, watch the games and thanks to Tashja and her awesome recommendation of the Truffle Burger and truffle fries, we are happily stuffed. Service was great and the booths are so comfy and every spot has a view to watch the games; we will definitely be back.

Long time umami fan here! Been to most of them in so cal so when I realized there was one right here in vegas I had to go! Same delicious taste as the rest of them! This ones cool because of all the tvs showing sports! (Boyfriend loved that...) Our server, Lauren, was great & stayed with a smile the whole time!
Liz is so sweet! Love her. So refreshing to see a smiling face with my glass of vino after this long damn day!

Great place to hang inside the SLS.  They offer a great selection on the menu and they have plenty of good gaming along with the great food.  The service is good too. We came here and had a few burgers along with the cold beers.  Had a great time. Highly recommend sitting at the bar and playing the video poker.  The machine were on fire.  Everyone around us was winning and having fun while enjoying the food and drinks.

This was my first time here and it won't be my last. First off the service by Tashja was amazing. She was very nice and very tentative. Now for the food. I had the manly burger and it was cooked perfectly. Also had the truffle fries that were amazing. I can't wait to come back and eat here again!!!

Our first experience here was awful! Great food- I'm obsessed with the Truffle burger!! But the service was so terrible! The manager convinced us to come back and I'm so glad we did! Mandy was great! Beautiful girl and definitely a seasoned server! Great place!

My wife and I checked in with about five other friends at this bar and we had the most outstanding service by a girl named Liz who was bartending! I would highly recommend this place and especially having a trip outside to see Liz as your bartender!

Burgers are always on point, sorry but here goes my little rant. While the server we had was amazing, when we originally arrived we wanted to sit outside, when we were rapidly approached by a "harsh" waitress that told us that if we wanted to sit outside we could, but we would have to go order our food and drinks inside ourselves and basically we weren't going to have service. Sooo we look around and there were at least another 4 tables outside with people eating and drinking. So we don't know what was that about, we went back inside and got a table there, so we get the menu, husband and son order beers from their menu and they were not available, so they pick a second choice and once again they were not available, were we not at a bar that specializes in beer and burgers? Anyhoo the server made it up by offering something similar to what was originally requested. Burgers were great but the french fries and the sweet potato fries were seasoned great, but they were cold. Overall it was just a weird experience. This was our second time here, first time we were impressed with the overall experience, that's why we went back. This time was a disappointment.
Servers was friendly, We try SunnySide Burger & Umami Burger and Truffle Fries plus Salad, Amazing taste except meat quality

Just like pizza... burgers are all burgers to me. Aside from bachi burger they all taste the same!! UNTIL UMAMI. My server was SUNNY. MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR HIM.. you'll thank me later. The sunny burger, truffle fries HOLY GOODNESS and I can't remember the name of the cocktail but mandarin something with a jalapeño undertone which was actually AMAZING. 

UMAMI IS DEFINITELY THE NEW BURGER PLACE IN TOWN

With a large group tonight. Staff was friendly, but service was slow. Decided to get my beer at the bar since I did not want to wait long. We had the pre-fix menu. The salad was fine, decided on the truffle burger. There was flavor but the burger was dry. The sweet potato fries and truffle fries were good. Half our group left by the time dessert arrived. Overall, it's okay but way overpriced.

Server was friendly however our food took forever to come even though there were plenty of empty tables (8pm on a Friday night).

Had the Manly burger and Umami burger. Burgers were good but nothing special. Buns were not toasted. Garlic fries were pretty good.

Food was great,most of us ordered the truffle burger recommended by our waitress and it was truly delicious! the cali burger ordered by my friend was delicious as well and omg the truffle fries you have to try them! i would skip out on the wings they were a bit cold and just okay

Being from LA, it was a pleasant surprise finding an Umami burger tucked inside the SLS during our first visit.
I felt my tummy growl as I was looking for the perfect spot to catch the Warriors game so I headed into Umami's beer garden and grabbed a seat. My server Sunny was awesome. I went with his cocktail recommendation, the Burning Mandarin. Citrusy with a little kick to it. The perfect Vegas drink. 
My truffle burger was the bomb as usual. May have even been better than in LA (don't tell them I said that).

Also, I'm a sucker for antler chandeliers - so 5 stars all around

My husband and I were fed up with the overpriced dining options available at the Las Vegas Convention Center during the Wizard World Comic Con, so we opted to dine at SLS instead and ended up choosing Unami Burger for our dinner spot. According to the online menu, there's a black bean burger available. The menu lies. There was, however, a vegetarian "burger" option that was pointed out to me by the hostess. Salvation!

SLOPPY MAMI ($12): I'd best describe this as a vegetarian sloppy joe. The burger was topped with tasty lentils (so tasty it made me wonder why I'm not including more lentils in my diet), a fried onion "haystack" (I hate onions but actually liked these), and slithers of jalapenos. Melted cheese held everything together. I was impressed with this Sloppy Mami. The downsides? Not enough jalapeno and it comes a la carte. 4/5 

THIN FRIES ($4): You simply cannot eat a burger without a side of fries. Thumbs up for these fries! 4/5

BEEF NACHOS ($10): I loved that the nachos came with a side dish of salsa. Who does that?? No one, that's who. My husband super duper liked this dish. 4/5

SERVICE: The food came out within 7 minutes of ordering, but service was intermittent. There's room for improvement. 3/5 

VIBE: The layout is kind of weird since the SLS Sports Book is inside Unami. Weird, I know. There's Unami diners, and then there's people lounging on sofas watching sports on TV. The restaurant was pretty rambunctious, noise wise.   

Worth a Return Visit?
I'm hoping to come back on Social Sundays to score a 50% discount!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #96

Place is a lot of hype but no flavor. I didn't think the burger was all that great compared to the chains in California. 

I will say that the service was top notch though. The staff were very attentive. The atmosphere and outdoor area were really nice. Good place to catch a drink at the bar and catch a few games

Im happy to be writing my first ever yelp! , honestly it was my first time going here with my husband thanksgiving day as we waited for my parents to come down from the hotel room. It was surprisingly not busy. The food was great! Did not take as long to come out , I had a tuna burger honestly when it came out I was scared to eat it , but taste way better then whats it looks like ha , the vibe in there was fun , are server was fantastic really friendly and sweet I wish I could remember her name to give her credit she deserves , the young man that brought are food was so helpful and topped off are experience by just having personality he was very big with tattoos , made sure we had are napkins and condiments. Etc before he left. Overall great experience. Thank you umami

We have heard good things about Umami but we won't be back. We walked in the door at 9:30 and was told it was the last call for food and drinks. Got our food. Fries were almost cold. At 10:00 all TVs were turned off as in: Customers go home!!  

This is absurd that restaurants close at 10:00 on Saturday night!!!

Sorry, won't be back. It's almost too dark in here.

I'm a local and I wanted to watch the Yankee game so I went to sls sports book beer hall at umami burger in the Casino, I was drinking cold drafts watching the Yankees lose to Houston, I ordered their signature umami burger that was topped with a parmigiana frico  chip and their special umami ketchup, the beef was juicy and  delicious, a fresh bun great toppings at a fair price. The menu had about 6 or seven type burgers for everyone's taste, truffle fries and a few other sides available all great choices. The staff were friendly and all kept busy and just made sure the room was happy so when I'm looking for a special burger with  flavor building umami toppings on it and some cold drafts. I'll be back especially since I live a mile away from the place.

Good food, and outstanding beer selection, and terrific service. What's not to like?

Sure, the prices are a tad higher than I'd like, but the Cali burger I ordered was terrific and the truffle fries are addictive.

My server, Sonny, was likewise super.  Great please.

Got the unami burger which was really good! They have Both sweet potatoes or regular fries! Love both and also a pretty good selection of beer. Out door seating and overall different atmosphere compared to the other locations.
Delicious and great atmosphere! I had the short rib burger and it was delicious! Mandy my server was awesome and really attentive! Will come back next time I'm in Vegas for sure!

Classic Umami Burger joint.  Sports bar inside as well.  

The burgers here were cooked well even as of opening day.  They had a hard time getting their logistics together but tried really hard.  Really great service here, especially by their manager Rachel, who went over the top for us here.  

Get the regular burger, which is what they are known for.  Do medium rare.  It's juicy, slightly salty and tart, with plenty of beefiness.  

Good service, good food - place some sports bets.  

And thanks Rachel.

Came here opening day last Saturday! Located on the left side of the casino if you're coming in from the main entrance of the SLS Casino. 

Party of 3 lunchtime wait was about 45 mins. Leave your name & # w the hostess, get your gambling on, & they'll txt you when the table's ready. 

Cocktails are $13. The mule that I ordered was alright. Seeing that it was opening day, I'm sure the kinks will be tweaked out. 


Ordered the Royale ($15). Consisted of braised short rib, truffle aioli & truffle cheese on a med-rare burg. Taste and consistency were pretty on point from my usual go-to locations here in LA. Never had the short rib before so that was a nice tasty addition. Sweet potato fries ($4) were good as well. They had all the sauces displayed out on a plate per usual w the small pho spoons. 

Service was good. Each booth has a tv that in the future, you'll be able to request a channel change for a certain game I'm sure. Layout of the place is nice. Very open w a lot of tv's & a small lounge area in the middle of the restaurant that reminded me that there's an actual sports book in the restaurant. 

**PSA*** NO tots for at least a week!! Was very sad to find that out when I was there. Reason given from the waiter was that the training of the cooking staff had to be perfected before "secret menu" items were brought out. That also means no burger special for a while too. 

Overall, it's your usual Umami burger restaurant w the sports book addition. Great burgers w a lot of other menu options as well. If you can't get to LA or NYC, this location will def get the job done for the Umami fix. ENJOY!!

This seemed like a great spot to grab some food and also watch sports. Beer selection is decent but not amazing. It's a little pricey but getting a liter at a time helps soften the blow. I had a manly burger and a side of thin fries. While I enjoyed the manly burger I would have to recommend the original umami. The manly is heavy and rich but doesn't have the distinct flavor profile of the umami burger. The things fries were well cooked and tasty. I asked for some ketchup which never came but as we were sitting outside all the way on the end service wasn't stellar. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive though. I had no issues placing a couple bets on the NBA playoff games though I was a little disappointed that the sports book closed in the middle of the late game. I was a little worried I wouldn't be able to cash out my ticket until it reopened but I had no problems getting my money at the cage after telling them the sports book had closed. It's definitely a great spot if you a casual sports fan like me who wants to have a couple beers and maybe throw down $20 on a game.

I'm not a fan of Umami when I tried it a few times in L.A. years ago. My sister has never been and I can't say no to a free meal with family. You have to reserve a table (what?) or open-seating at the bar. I'd much rather stay at home and do homework than be here but since my sister already went out of her way to reserve a table, I showed up anyway.

Random thoughts: their house ketchup tastes like Filipino spaghetti; you only get 3g or protein per 100g (1 cup) of mushrooms which does not meet my protein needs therefore, I must stick with beef patty; I have low expectations of Umami Vegas thanks to Umami L.A.; Umami beer garden???; Umami buns look huge but press to deflate; they'll give you 4 different sauces: 1 spicy, 1 ranch, 1 garlic aioli that doesn't taste like garlic at all and house ketchup.

The Original:
House ketchup, parmesan frico, shiitake mushroom, roasted tomato and caramelized onion. The frico adds crispness to an otherwise boring burger. 3/5

The Royale:
Braised short rib, truffled aioli and truffle cheese. Again, not truffle-y enough. The short rib was a nice touch. 3/5

Truffle Burger:
Truffle cheese, truffled aioli and truffle glaze. Sounds like a lot of truffle but it sure didn't taste like it. It had a hint of truffle and that's it. 3/5

Truffle Fries:
I've had way better truffle fries elsewhere. The fries were soggy and lacked truffle flavor.  Get the smushed potatoes instead. 1/5

Sweet Potato Fries:
Sprinkled with sweet salt. This goes well with the spicy dipping sauce and the house ketchup. 3.5/5

Mies Vanilla Rohe:
Tahitian vanilla bean ice cream in between chocolate chip cookies. The cookie itself wasn't that great. The ice cream was ordinary. Hello, cavities! 2.5/5

At least in L.A. I've gotten better service, food was a bit quicker and my drink glass was never empty. Umami is a casual dining place but calling it a sports bar/beer garden and having that atmosphere is just blah. Flat screens everywhere with different football games on and Criminal Minds = headache! There are other better burger places in Vegas.

Best burger in Vegas! Beef was perfectly cooked. House Made beer cheddar is amazing. Tashja our server was friendly, helpful and prompt. Highly recommend. Free pint of beer on Tuesdays! Sports betting also available while you dine.

This place is supposed to close at 10 pm. We were staying in SLS and we got here around 9:30. There was no waiter or greeter around. We waited for few minutes, had to go inside and look around. Finally a waiter came and said they are already closed. We asked him what the working hours are. He said it is till 10 but the last call is at 9:30. I checked my phone and it was 9:33. If they were around at 9:30 we could have placed our order. Anyways it was a very disappointing experience.

Burger and Fries on Point, Chicken Wings Tasted Great.  But the high point of dinner was the service.  Mandy our server was a totally sweetheart !  The whole team is always great but from her greeting, suggestions and follow up, Mandy was our ROCKSTAR !  Las Vegas has lots of great burgers but the SLS has great staff.   We will be back for more !

DO NOT GET THE TURKEY BURGER. It looked like rubbery pieces of white and dark meat held together with meat glue. It was so gross I had to send it back. A couple yrs ago I used to eat the turkey burger at Umami in Costa Mesa on the regular. It was so good I would order two! They used very good quality turkey, I think it was from Diestel farms iirc. Then they started changing it about a year ago so I quit going. This turkey patty they are serving now tasted like processed crap that I remember from the cafeteria in elementary school. I really wish they would go back to using high quality ingredients. I hate it when chains expand quickly and start focussing solely on increasing profits. Customers do notice the difference. The truffle fries were the only good thing we had here. My bro got the Manly Burger and he said it was just ok. The chicken wings tasted old.

Took advantage of #socialsundays all locals get 50% off on Sunday's! Best deal ever! My boyfriend wanted to watch the celtics/Cavs game and was looking for a spot to watch the game and enjoy some food. This was such a great choice! Definitely gonna be coming back. Love the atmosphere he loves beer and I love UMAMI burger. Perfect match!!!

Great little place at SLS in Vegas. We had a flight of beers and the Manly burger. Great flavor! I really liked the Peach beer. The service was great and Mandy was helpful with both keeping our glasses full and giving these tourists some local tips!

We ordered 2 burgers medium. Both burgers were literally brought out to us in 2 minutes. Not an exaggeration. This location obviously microwaves the burger. They are cookie cutter patties. It's sad that they put a $13 tag on such a crappy burger when you can walk across the street to McDonald's for the same quality.  This place is just a reflection of how bad the SLS Vegas hotel is.

There were four of us. Two of us are very picky eaters and the other two are foodies who just live for food. We are Las Vegas locals and we decided will check out this place . All of us were impressed. The food was great. I couldn't eat anything with onions my partner had a lactaid problem. They made perfect changes for both of us to have a great meal. Raves on the onion rings. I could go on and the burgers and the great salads and the drinks wow. We will be back. And Joshua was a great waiter.

The dining area is pretty large with lots of TV's to keep up on what ever sport that is in season. There's a Beer Garden patio off the dining room if you wish to sit outside. Lot's of beer to choose from. Staff was friendly.
I was lucky enough to try The Hatch burger, I wouldn't of picked this burger if the menu was presented to me. But after I've tried it, I'd get it again. The burger itself isn't huge but it was plenty flavorful and juicy. 
I'm looking forward to coming back to Umami Burger and trying more of their fare.

First time here and not the greatest first impression. From the beginning (hostess) to the end I expected better, especially being a local and knowing how service on the strip should be, even for a new hotel. My friend and I were not greeted by the hostess right away. Waited about 10mins until someone took our order. The runner and bussers came to us and took our order before we even saw our server. Servers need to be more attentive whether it is their table or not. Mandy was awesome and very helpful though! 
Food was okay, sweet potato fries felt like a bowl of cinnamon toast crunch,not my thing.  
Overall it would not be my first choice of dining if I were to come to SLS again.
Back at Umami watching my LIONS whoop up on the Jets! This is such a great place to watch the games and hang out outside w drinks and great food!! SO GOOD!!! Everything's coming up Lions today!!

With so many options in the SLS hotel and surrounding areas it was hard for my husband and I decide where to eat (although we knew we were going to eat a lot, and often) We stopped here as we both were craving burgers and were delightfully pleased!! Megan L. was our server and she was wonderfully sweet and a great server! I had the Sunny Side (which is pictured) and I am telling you right now, this is a burger you want to have! My hubby is more of the veggie/white meat lover and went with the greenbird. Both were so scrumptious and we swapped back and forth. Add a side of truffle fries and two cold beers, pure bliss!

More generous side order portions but such crappy service. Had to flag down workers for water, ask twice for sauces, forgetting drinks. Retrain your workers, maybe ask the people at the grove umami how to run a burger place. Good luck surviving.

I always wanted to try this place from the first time I stood at SLS but didn't want to try it alone. So after a night of debauchery and a late check out, the miss and I decided to finally eat and we chose umami burger. I am a big burger eater and I take pride in being a carnivorous fool so my expectations were high. All I can say is that I was not disappointed. The burgers here are compact and pack a big punch of flavor. I am extremely satisfied and am happy I finally ate here. I ate the manly and she ate the sunny side. Both were amazing. I took a bite of hers cause I can. LOL Staff is friendly and very attentive. I highly advise you try it for yourself. GQ magazine got it right on this one. I still have no clue what umami means but if I had to guess I'd say it means yummy goodness. Holla!

I really dig the place. Although SLS isn't doing as well as it should, Unami was a good spot with great vibe.

The burgers are top notch and the truffle fries are delicious.

Service is good but not great. I will go back. Worth as stop especially if you're Looking to watch a game.

OMG!!  This place is AWESOME!! We tried another upscale burger place while in town & Umami was SOOO much better! I had the Ahi Burger and my hubby had the Truffle Burger, they were both incredible. Great flavor and presentation. The drinks were good and service friendly (thanks Casey!). This is our new FAVORITE burger spot in Vegas FOR SURE!!
Very conveniently located in the hotel. Came in for brunch. Our waitress was Tashja, she awesome everything she recommended was delicious. Will never come to Vegas again without coming here.
Dont understand why its closed 3 days of the week. One of the only locations that has the impossible burger, been dying to try but the hours dont fit in my school/work schedule.

Funny enough this is actually the best place to eat in the SLS and it has totally delicious burgers I would recommend the main umami burger for anyone that comes by and don't forget to try some of their fries as well

It was my first time at Umami and I was surprised at the scene upon arrival - loud and totally packed with football fans.  I did not realize that not only is it a restaurant and beer garden but sports book as well - and we were there the first Sunday of the football season.  I'm not a sports bar type of girl - I enjoy watching sports but from the comfort of my own couch :p  And it was too loud for my liking.  We were reserved a table inside but were shown a table outside and allowed to choose whether to dine inside or out.  The only tables available on the patio were out in the hot sun, so back inside we went!  It was very loud in there, and it looked like my sister and I were the only ones there for the food and not the games, but I couldn't complain being in a room full of guys and the 49ers game playing on all the TV's :p

Service was good and the food even better.  I ordered the Manly Burger (fitting for the day we were there lol) which is basically a bacon cheeseburger with onion strings.  My sister got the Truffle Burger, and we split some Tempura Onion Rings and Truffle Fries (like we couldn't get enough of them in our burgers lol).  I liked all the food, especially the burger and the onion rings - soooo good!  I was afraid the burgers were going to be on the smaller side - they look like sliders in pictures - but it was plenty of food.  I couldn't finish it all.  We split an ice cream sandwich for dessert, the one with snickerdoodle cookies and salted caramel ice cream.  I like both snickerdoodle cookies and salted caramel ice cream but this ice cream sandwich was just "meh."  Sounds great on paper but really not all that spectacular. 

While the dessert was underwhelming, overall I was definitely not disappointed by this place at all, and while I wasn't too sure about the loud sports bar atmosphere it ended up being a fun time :)

This is my kind of place. Plenty of televisions, good food, good service, and a sports book that will give you money to pay your tab (if you happen to give them the right number). I've been here four times total, with visits for both lunch and dinner last Wednesday.

On Wednesday night, we came for game one Cavs/Hawks. There are plenty of televisions so you can catch your favorite baseball team also. For drinks, we had the bucket of 5 beers for $20. If you have your Code card, they offer drink specials for members. Ashley took good care of us for the duration of our stay. No complaints with our service this time or any time previously.

We had nachos and wings while we were there. Both were average. We didn't get any burgers that night, but I've had three on the menu. And while not the best ever, a few of them have some unique twists and I would rate them above average. I like the sunny side and hatch. We also received a free order of delicious ice cream sandwiches using a coupon which was in the discount booklet for guests staying at the hotel.

The biggest draw for me is the sports book along with the in game wagering if you're following the flow of the game. We were pumped that the Cavs took game one on the road. We were even more pumped that we took the +2. We took our $100 winnings after we cashed our ticket, gave it to Ashley, and walked out happy without giving away a dime out of our pockets. I'll be back for drink specials, to get some action on the game I'm watching, or just to hang out, possibly in the beer garden.

Amazing service. Really. I've never heard of this burger chain, but hadn't eaten in 12 hours and 12 states. I just wanted a burger. The menu was a befuddlement of strange ways to make a burger. I picked a Cali burger but without the house sauce (careful due to egg allergy). It tasted weird, really...weird. The tomato was a glop (fire roasted apparently) and the onions were more like egg noodles - wet cooked strings. 
I scraped it off and tried again but it still tasted weird. Megan, my attentive waitress, asked if everything was good. I expressed my opinion. Although I didn't like it I didn't blame the restaurant. Sometimes things just aren't to your taste. However my  surprise and delight the manager immediately swooped in, organized for me as close to a "regular" burger as they were able to construct - which was basically burger, bun, lettuce, raw onions. The manager also brought over a selection of sauces on the side. She asked if I like mustard. I said don't even go there I only like colemans. 3 minutes later she showed up with a side dish of English mustard! The new burger was much more to my liking.

So there you go - it's not my kind of restaurant - but that's no-ones fault. This place went above and beyond to make it as right as they possibly could. Epically amazing service.

Good selection of beer, too bad we didn't have more time to try some others but the Union Jack was an excellent recommendation from our waitress.

We had a Truffle Burger and an Original and both were really flavorful but I have had sliders that were bigger than these burgers.  Hate paying $13.00 for a slider.  

Not the best value for your buck even in Vegas, but was pretty good.

The burgers don't come with a side. Mine was good, but it seemed like I was eating a plain burger on a bun for $13. The garlic fries were good but the sweet potato fries have cinnamon and sugar and we didn't like them. There is a huge TV so everyone in the bar can watch the game.
Service great, food delicious,   and we'll entertained by all the television. ......  gourmet bar food I can't complain  !
Umami burger was delicious!!!Mandy l, our server, was awesome. Talked us through the menu and gave great suggestions

What a nice surprise! Great, clean spot to watch your favorite games! Delicious food, definitely get the truffle fries. Service was fast and friendly! 

I've definitely found my new place to watch football!

Came here with my friend Robert who had been here before we got greeted by Mandy our server and was nice enough to point out how the menu was set up and recommended the Truffle Burger which was delicious and my friend had The Manly Burger! Great service highly recommend it will definitely be back again!

It's pretty crazy how an experience can vary from one day to another.

We came in to just grab some dessert. We got a couple of ice cream cookies and shared it among friends. Amazing! The salted caramel is probably my favorite. More importantly the gentleman that served us was AWESOME. Even though we were JUST getting dessert, he treated us super nice, was super personable and even checked in on us to see how the desserts were.

So, we came back the next night. This time to eat....sure cookies were the plan, but also to grab a late meal. This time, shiz went south. Real fast.

Placed our orders...and even though it was pricey I ordered a frozen beer. I think they are only available in a few places so I said what the heck. Got SUPER excited...then....our waitress forgot my beer. Like never wrote it down, never came with it. Burgers came out. They were good....

I mentioned to the waitress my beer (after flagging her down ... since she disappeared for a while). And told her we'd like to take a look at the dessert menu.

5 minutes pass.
10 minutes pass.

She finally comes back! Alright, so do you guys want dessert? UMMMM...you forgot to bring dessert menu??? Oh, yea...here let me get you one. No, that's fine. We will skip dessert. At this point I was frustrated. She didn't bring my beer. She wasn't around the entire time. She forgot the dessert menu. 

I asked for the manager and she came over. She gave me what I considered to be a pre-rehearsed speech. "We are going to take care of your meal." No, thank you...I'd like to pay. I just wanted you to know that your waitress really ruined the experience...and the guy the night before is AWESOME. "I understand sir, that you didn't ask to speak to me to get a comped meal, but we will be taking care of it since you were not 100% satisfied." It was robotic they way she said it. I reduced again. We went back and fourth a few times...then she finally brought my bill.

Listen, I'm sure they deal with drunk, angry customers all the time. But I was obviously sober (she forgot my beer, remember?). I genuinely wanted the manager to know, hey...this person is f'n up while also give props to the other dude. She seemed uninterested, and just offered a comp meal as a solution. I didn't want a comp meal.

So while the food is good - the service can really ruin the experience.

Perfect patio weather!  Went to see a friend and watch college football!   Paid after tip $16.00 for a Shock Top with peach schnapps float!   Way over priced and not sure WHY it's called BEER GARDEN...they hardly have any taps :(

Tired Umami Burger when I was in LA so when u heard it opened up here in Vegas I had to try it.

Food was same taste as the one in LA so consistency was good. 

The only thing that bothered me was the drinks were pretty expensive. I don't mind paying 6-8 on an alcoholic drink but it was $12. 

I would come back however, I would just drink water or soda cuz the alcoholic drinks are too expensive. 

It prolly was busy but the waiter was neither nice or rude. She was basically doing her job. Nothing really stood out on the customer service.

Very yummy! I'm staying at the SLS this week and we decided to check this place out before we checked in. Sexy, swanky decor. We were greeted and seated immediately. Our waitress, can't remember her name, was really nice as she explained the burger concept to us. I was curious to know about the bacon londrons that came on the Manly burger and she did an excellent job explaining it to me. We got the nachos and we both got the Manly burger. When I tell you those nachos were DELICIOUS! And the BURGER! The actual burger was seasoned so well and it was so juicy. The cheese spread that was on it was so flavorful and those bacon londrons set it off real proper like! Everything is a la carte. Slightly pricey, but it's VEGAS!

Well this is an OK place. Nothing special in my opinion. The Burger are mediocre. The staff is nice and friendly. The Tv's are way too loud. We had to yell to each other. I was disappointed because they were not able to bring the correct beer. The first round was correct but after that they always brought the wrong beer. I mentioned it twice but they were not able to fix it. They made me pay for all beers. Not a good example of fixing a problem. Again this is convenient if you wanna get a quick bite while staying here. Holsteins has way better Burgers for sure.

fam wanted to see what the umami hype was about...eh...i'm not a burger person, so it was aiight to me...not worth 14 bones...fam thought it was better than avg, but dunno about GQ's "Burger of the Year"...

THE VIBE  |  inside hipster SLS hotel...semi-loud, kool music...outdoor seating avail...sports bar w/ tv @ea booth...

THE FOOD  |  pix to follow...

- sunny side (aka truffle especiale): parmesan frico, fried egg, truffle thyme compound butter, truffled arugula  |  14.

- manly: house beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, unami house ketchup, mustard spread  |  12.
- side of maple bacon fries: sweet potato fries, maple-braised bacon lardons, rosemary aleppo salt topped w/ chives  |  6. ..actually really good!

- umami (aka the original): parmesan frico, shiitake, roasted tomato, caramelized onions, umami house ketchup  |  12.
- side: sweet potato fries, signature sweet salt  |  4.

- greenbird: turkey patty, crushed avo, green cheese, butter lettuce, sprouts, green goddess  |  12.
- side:  thin fries  |  4.

Draught Beers Flight  (choose 4)  |  14.
- goose island 312 wheat ale
- firestone walker union jack
- brooklyn lager
- new belgium fat tire

Dessert...
- salted caramel ice cream in between snickerdoodle cookies  |  7.

THE SERVICE  |  a super friendly guy sat us ...later found out his name is dave...prob a food runner... our waitress was aiight...didn't come around enuf...we had to stop dave sometimes to help when she was MIA...it wasn't hella slow during a friday lunch...

lil bussing too...& that's alwaz annoying to me...

IN CONCLUSION  |  overhyped...skip the $12-14 burgers...

TOTAL  |  out the door for 4 during a late lunch: $120

Horrendous food. It's a burger restaurant and their burgers are disgusting. They are frozen meat patty's with no flavor. Don't sit outside. The heaters on the ceiling drop black ash on your food the whole time.

Nice, well lit decor with couches, tables and counter to sit. Patio opens to the Strip. TV monitors are plenty. Not many people on a Saturday afternoon. But food is not their strong point. The signature Umami burger was small and just ok in taste. The sweet potato fries were also just ok. The beet salad was so bitter I could not eat. Service at the counter was lacking, the waiter never refilled water and just stop briefly once to check on me. Expensive for the quality of the food- burger was $12. There are much better burgers on the Strip.

3 visits, 2 great meals and 1 so so, but 5 star service all the way! Can I just say the staff here is fabulous?! I ate on the patio on my first visit - the Beer Garden (which is basically a let down of a name btw). I ate inside on my other visits. On all 3 occasions the staff were patient, attentive, offered great advice and even remembered us from prior visits.

My first visit I sat on the patio. It is referred to as the Beer Garden, but I can't figure out why. It seemed nothing like a beer garden to me. Seating consists of big huge picnic tables, which is great for large groups - a little strange for small groups. There are tons of big huge misting fans hanging, which help keep it nice and cool. My date and I shared the Sunny Side Burger, the Manly Burger and the Truffle Fries. The Sunny Side was by far my favorite, I can't generally pass up a fried egg on my burger. It was big, flavorful and worth the $14 price tag. The Manly burger was good too, lots of onion straws - but I don't think I'd order it again. The Truffle fries were TO DIE FOR! Shoestring thin, covered in truffle cheese but not soggy - perfection! If you like truffle you must try them!

My second visit I sat inside. There is a variety of seating, from big plush booths to leather arm chairs and sofas. It's what some might call a sports bar, but really it's a sports book! You can watch the games and bet on the sports, all while eating or enjoying a beer or cocktail. I had a Caesar salad with Grilled chicken. It has anchovies, which are optional - but I usally like that. The meat portions however were very small (my date had the same salad with Salmon) and the salad was just ok, maybe because it is kale, not sure why, but I didn't love it. I didn't finsh my salad and I definitely won't order it again.

My third visit I had the nachos with beef. The beef was shredded and marinated, it was amazing! There was plenty of guacamole which I appreciated. Strangely though the salsa came on the side and the cheese was a sauce, not real melted cheese so that was a big let down.

I will totally eat here again, but I don't think I'll branch out beyond the burgers, fries and beer next time however. Stick to what they are known for!

Terrible service, terrible food, i was disappointed. 

It was during a time were it wasn't even busy and there were tables open and it took 20 minutes to sit down. The hosts were talking and taking their time and ignoring people. When my family sat down, it took forever for the server to come. When he finally came my order was messed up and when I finally got the right order, the food was terrible. 

Never again will i ever go this location.

Came here on a Monday with some friends to watch the hockey game, our server was pretty good in the beginning but the service kept getting worse and worse. We ordered drinks which took oddly longer than it should have. We had to flag her down to let her know we needed more water and new plates. 

We barely even saw her for the last hour of our stay here. Casey could have provided better service by being more attentive. We even ordered a second beer with nachos and had to flag her down after 25 minutes for the nachos and the beer never even came. The entire place isn't even packed, doubtful il be back.

Abby was an exceptional server. She helped us make our minds up with what we wanted to eat and everything was amazing. I want to add also that the hostess was very sweet and informative. I will definitely recommend to Umami to everyone. Even the food runner was nice enough to get us more napkins and more sauce is that we love so much. This is amazing! & I love all the TVs!

I was skeptical about this restaurant when I read the fine print at the bottom of the menu stating "their need is served medium rare" I asked for my patty to be cooked well done. I ordered the Umami burger. I'm not a fan of mushrooms either but this burger was delicious. The thin fries were good too. Would definitely come back.

I love a good burger and always looking for a simple yet quality burger and the Umami is all of that and more. But, regardless of how good the burger is...customer service is key and their staff is awesome and very inviting and our server was great. Will def be back

Delicious food. We got to meet the manager, Rachel, she is a real sweetheart and great at what she does. The food is delicious here, my favorite is the Truffle burger and definitely get the onion rings they are some of the best I've had! I had to stay in Las Vegas at the SLS for 2 weeks for work and ate here 4 times.

My daughter and I went to this restaurant last night. We were greeted promptly and seated. We sat at a table near a big party who was checking out of the place. No one came by. The busser came by twice looking at us each time. There were 2 waitresses who were around but never came by . We sat there for a good 7 minutes with no one even stopping by. The place overall was not even busy. As a local who has lived here for over 10 years, I was very disappointed.  On our way out, I spoke to a manager who apologized and offered to take care of us but we decided not to take him up on it. We ended up eating at another establishment at the SLS and had a wonderful experience and meal.

I am not a burger fan, but I loved this place. I had the Ahi TUna Burger and it was delicious! The Korean Fries were excellent and I LOVED the sauces that they served on the side, as well as their own ketchup!!! Yumm

My favorite burger in the world!!! I always order the truffle burger medium rare! It's the perfect blend of sweet, savory, saltiness, juiciness, umami, and texture. This is the second day in a row coming and I'm ordering the exact same thing again!! It's just tooooo good. I've had billionaire burgers at Holsteins, shake shack, bachi burger, and a few other gourmet burgers, but the truffle burger at umami burger is by far my favorite!! 
Little tip: don't ruin the burger with adding additional sauces like ketchup or mayo. Just have it the way it comes from the kitchen. Guaranteed to amaze!!! Also thanks Carlos for being such a dope server!

We came here for post-race grub. I had just finished the LV RnR 5k which went around the SLS hotel and we decided to eat at SLS since we wanted to explore the hotel/casino.

Because we weren't dressed to impress and I was in my race gear, the quickest place we found with no wait was Umami. Good choice since they served beer and had the college football games on. TONS of TVs! YESSSSS

We were led to a nice table in the restaurant. The tables are kinda close together and you can literally talk to your neighbors. We were serviced by a really nice lady who was friendly and accommodating to our needs. 

Because of our race, we had 2 for 1 draft beers. NICE! We started off with a couple of drafts and then ordered truffle fries ($6.5) to share. I ordered the Truffle Especiale protein burger (parmesan cheese, fried egg, truffle butter and truffled arugula ($14). The fiancee order the Cali Burger (butter lettuce, roasted tomato, house spread and house American cheese ($12).

Damn these burgers were pretty expensive and lacked flavor. IMO, needed salt (which are not available on the tables). Without the buns, the portion is small. I did enjoy the fries however. Thin and crispy.

We ordered the Mintimalism Coolhaus dessert ($7). Basically it's an ice cream sandwich. It was a nice treat to have minty ice cream with chocolate chip cookies. MMM

Great place for beer and fries and to watch sporting events in a kick back atmosphere.

There a quite a few interesting items on the menu, from truffle burgers and fries, to gourmet sausages.

I went for the Manly Burger and Smothered Fries (short rib and gravy on top of them).

The burger arrived looking anything but Manly.  However, there were large pieces of bacon as advertised.  The fries had a large pile of short rib and a thin coat of gravy.  The burger was cooked perfectly and had a good flavor to it.  The bun was sturdy and overall, except for the size was a very good burger.  The fries were ok but by themselves were nothing to write home about.

I really want to give this  place 4 stars but I just can't. When we arrived and said we wanted to watch football, eat and drink, we were told if we sat inside it was a minimum of $50 per person. Wait, what? Outside there was no minimum. Being a gorgeous  Vegas day, the choice was obvious. Outside was a pleasant roomy space with many TVs. All the games were on, and our server was super nice. She was so nice that I really don't want this review to reflect on her. Now here's where the stars go down. Apparently there were some flies around (um it's outside) and so they turned on some fans to dispel them. Normally that would be fine, but these were super turbo fans( seriously it sounded like we were next to a jet airplane) and we couldn't hear  the games or each other. They did turn the one over us off after we said something. 
I did enjoy the truffle beet salad and the ahi burger was very good( and very messy), but our orders took forever and were sometimes forgot. I'm not sure who dropped the ball but they do need to work on these problems.  After getting the bill it was very obvious we were on the strip. We could have sat inside after all. Will we come back??? Unfortunately, I just can't say for sure.

Ok I'm trying to understand the beer garden, it's on the outside patio and smells terribly of gas from the heaters. It's really bad. Too bad to sit outside for sure and I can smell it from the corner across the street! Yuck yuck yuck !

Came here Sunday when they opened at 11am for some apps and burgers. The pretzel was very big and tasty with the cheese, the nachos had great flavor (although could've used a bit more beef) and the truffle fries were amazing. I had the classic umami burger and was very impressed. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the cheese was outstanding. I'll be back!

Great Ambiance, Awesome burgers, and Liz the bartender was super friendly. If you are military, police, and/or a Paramedic, you can get 25% off your meals. Awesome way to be recognized. I can see SLS becoming a major hotspot on the Vegas strip. I will definitely be back.

Been to Umami burger three times and probably would have rated it 4 first two times- pretty good burgers, always some sort of local special, or beer special, or whatever available. Service also delivered nicely every time, never had any issues anyone else is describing. In fact, it's probably one of quickest and most convenient "nice" burger spot on the strip. 
 But this most recent time I ordered Ahi burger. Holy cow, run and hide. 
 We all love ginger, I just think it should be a bit more subtle than thinly shaved strips atop your burger. And burger itself was absolutely inedible. It's as if a frozen patty was thrown on the grill in haste. Zero seasoning, zero flavor and it was still watery and cold! Come on, at least give it time to thaw out on the grill.
 I'm the sort that NEVER complains. I pay, smile and don't return. Call me passive aggressive. Voila.
  Why am I even rating it 3- my party's food was ok, service was quick and beer plentiful. Just wish Ahi burger wasn't such a bleh experience.

Concept restaurants are great and all, but you need to be able to execute without flaw to justify your ego. 

FOOD:
I get that at the flagship location that you don't allow any substitutions on your menu. Good for them. When i ask for something different on my burger, I don't want to argue or have to debate Stanford's Debate Team. I want a, "Sure thing!" and I understand I might get "That's gonna cost you a couple bucks extra" at which point I'd say "I'm worth it." OR if you don't want people to make changes, then tell them and own it.
