Avoid the nachos and the pickle plate. The nachos were put on the menu because people were asking for it and even the manager understood why we were disappointed. Question: If the manager knows its bad why are you serving it. Issues: only a tablespoon of the braised beef accompanied a slave labor camp's output of chips with "beer cheddar" "fondue" drizzled on about 7 of the chips. 

The pickle plate was also a let down. They obviously use a boiling method for the pickling and they over boiled the canned veggies. Carrots, mushrooms, beet, red pepper, an actual pickle and green beans. Pickling is an easy process, it just takes time. Why not just use better ingredients and something a little more exotic for your vegetable selection. Tried everything and pushed it away. Bachi Burger has a much richer pickle plate if you ever want one in Vegas.

SERVICE:
Kinda touched on this already, pushy about their concept, but this location really doesn't have one so it comes off as misguided. Our server was nice, but I was noticeably unimpressed with her attempts to stick to her script of no substitutions even though this location allows them... and I think she was just not in the mood to have to put out energy to make the experience good for us so she gave us a lot of space... for a while. 

The busser cleared our plates and even asked us how things were for the first time since we got our food and we were honest about how less than spectacular we thought it was. That guy winked at both of us about 22 times in the span of 30 seconds. It was magical, but not enough for us to change our minds.

The lead/manager/assistant manager/some guy with bill control powers came up and asked how our meal was, we were honest and he agreed that the nachos and pickle plate and the wings (he mentioned them, not us) should not be eaten here. He took those items off of our bill as we barely ate any of them.

OVERALL:
There's nothing here that you can't find somewhere else, better and nicer. And if a place is gonna stick to its guns about no substitutions, then it better make sure EVERYTHING on its menu rocks hard the way it is. 

And one more thing: you need to be a litte more Johnny-on-the-spot with the channels on saturday afternoon during football. I don't watch football, but i sure as hell don't watch Judge Judy for 20 minutes or need it broadcast over every speaker in the joint while i'm searching for some nacho meat.

I was so happy when I heard Umami burger was opening here in Vegas. Ate at the California location and i was in love. Do NOT expect this place to be anything like the original locations. Second, this place is NOT kid friendly so do not bring your little ones. A lot of drunk people and NO kids menu. 

I had purchased a groupon here as well (2 burgers and 2 sides). But of course our waiter had to put the 2 cheapest burgers on our groupon. -_-

I don't think I would ever come back here. It took 15 minutes just for us to get our check. Another 10 minutes just to get our receipt that I needed to sign. It seems like all the waiter and waitresses attention were towards the ones who kept ordering alcohol.

Only came here for the groupon deal they had. I say it's pretty worth it but had to pay a little extra more for tax of course. Went here with my girlfriend and we give the burger a 8 but we gave the fries a 10. Pretty good here and would come back when just Becuase of groupon.

Wow. This place is amazing!!! We are staying in the W Hotel and wanted a casual but delicious dinner and this place definitely delivered! We ordered two things off the secret menu - the spicy cow and the cheesy tots, and my aunt got the Cali burger and we shared the beet & goat cheese salad with arugula. Everything we ate was absolutely phenomenal! The spicy cow had a little bite to it but it definitely wasn't too spicy.  The cheesy tots were amazing and generally everything was just delicious. Also you must save room for the hot chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream!!! The service was great too - can't leave that out right! 
P. S. remember to tip your servers! 20% is standard!

Came here for dinner for the first time.  They offer a 50% off special for locals so I thought I would give it a try. When I checked in,  the hostess said they were busy and it would be a 15 minute wait,  even though there were plenty of empty tables .... hmmmm. After we got our table,  I was relieved to find a cool atmosphere and a friendly waitress.

I ordered the Cali burger with a Portobello mushroom for the meat.  I wish they had a veggie patty - they only have a veggie sloppy joe. My burger was great despite that.  It was cheesy and the roasted tomato is awesome! They also have a house ketchup that was delicious.  My bf ordered the umami burger and said it was good.  Similar to the Cali.

So, overall great experience except for the suspicious wait and lack of vegetarian options.

Great bar with tons of beer selection and food! Worth the walk down Fremont! They have good specials and a wide variety of drinks.

They've got Left Hand's Nitro Milkstout on tap, but I decided to go for the Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA. Awesome service as well! Come here!

The atmosphere here is a little different than the usual Umami at the LA locations and I honestly didn't mind that all. It's a little sports barsy compared to the intimate/trendy vibe of the other locations. I have been to several Umami's and the U-mini (cheaper but still as tasty spinoff of Umami) in Westwood and I think consistency in their food has always been key at their restaurants. Their menu is exactly the same as the California locations as well. 

Loved that we got seated at a massive booth right away, service was so also pretty good and our server took our orders right away.  We did get our waters right away.. However, we probably waited for about 20 minutes for our burgers to come out. It was a Thursday night and the restaurant was not packed at all. 

-Truffle fries were on point, and the server did give me the options for all the sauces (pretty standard)
- Truffle burger was great but I think is a little overpriced 
- Manly burger was also pretty good with the lardons and the onion rings however it is again, a little overpriced imo..

Umami has really got the flavor of the burgers down but size has always been an issue for me. I've always thought their burgers are a little too tiny for 15 bucks.. and it does leave me a little hungry still after.. I may be a petite Asian girl, but I can sure down a huge ass burger when I want to.

I can surmise this in 2 words. 
FOOD POISONING - I ordered a turkey burger with avocado and sprouts. I should have sent the burger back when it was barely warm on arrival. After 12 hours of throwing up and a trip to the ER  I would never accept food that was not warm enough again in particular turkey and top it off with the hi contaminant possibility of sprouts.  In addition to the obvious poor quality and standard of food, the server seemed more like a bouncer -- Big burly not very friendly and plopped the plates down on the table. Three girls, 3 turkey burgers- one beer, one side of fries one side salad--  bill was $70!!!! The restaurant also has an identity crisis- it's part burger bar / part sports bar /part Vegas Casino but the food sucks and the volume in the entire restaurant was way too loud. All the games playing were volumed at Super Bowl status, when there were no big games on it was just a variety of college sports. These annoying, nonrelevant games were so loud and distracting that it was difficult to hear sitting at the same table with somebody. Even if I didn't get sick, I would probably never go back based on the server and overall atmosphere the restaurant being too loud in an unnecessary sort of way

The. BEST. Garlic. Parmesan. Fries. EVER!  I still dream about those fries. We had the truffle fries too, which were good, but I kept going back to those garlic fries.  The burger was pretty darn good too. I especially loved the check in offer of the free fries.  We got the nachos too, which were good, but I wish I had skipped them and just ate my fries and burger.  My Manly burger was just yummy.  Perfection.  I would definitely go back.  It was reasonably priced for the quality of food.

My girlfriend and I were checking out the SLS so we decided to have lunch at Umami Burger.  I had read good things about the chain and was hoping for a good lunch.  Unfortunately Umami Burger did not deliver.   First, they tried to seat us outside in 105 degree heat even though there was plenty of seating inside.  You would think they would at least ask us before we are seated.  The next problem came when we went to order.  My girlfriend asked to add pickles to her burger but was told they couldn't do substitutions or additions because it would "mess up the flavor profile of the burger".    I've been to all kinds of restaurants in my life and that was a first.   I ordered the "manly" burger cooked medium.  When I got the burger the first thing I noticed was the size.  To call a burger this size a "manly" burger is a joke.  The next problem with the burger is that it had cubed bacon on it.  It was chewy and half of it fell off when taking a bite.  After taking a couple of bites I noticed that the burger patty looked pretty red for medium and was literally falling apart.   I took the top of the bun off and the meat stuck to both sides of the bun and was clearly RAW and room temperature.  My girlfriend's burger was cooked more but was still falling apart and mushy.  At this point was was done eating.   I spoke to the waitress and told her I wanted my money back.  She then proceeded to tell me that I didn't understand that their burgers just look raw because the meat is really fresh.  I was floored.  She took my plate and a few minutes later the manager came out and tried to get us to try the burgers again.  He gave us the same explanation about the burgers being raw because the meat is really fresh.  I have been to just about every high end burger place in Vegas and this was by far the worst burger I have ever had in my life.  I'd rather have a Big Mac from McDonalds. Then the manager has the balls to tell me that I just didn't understand their "fresh" meat.   At least my girlfriend didn't mess up the raw meat flavor profile with some pickles!  Eventually they comped us the burgers but still got $20 out of us for two Pepsis and an order of fried pickles.   If you're in Vegas and looking for a good burger do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.  There are plenty of burger places that will give you an excellent burger the way YOU want it.  At Umami burger you get a raw burger with a side of superiority.

We have been to the SLS a couple times since it first opened...we are locals and wanted to see the new property.

Umami is an interesting space.

We had the fried pickles...very fresh..very crispy...good flavor.

I had a caesars salad...it was okay...needed more dressing.

For dinner I had a turkey burger....again it was okay...tye bun was delicious the burger itself needed more flavor.

Our server was knowledgeable and very efficient. She is the reason I will give it a second chance.

Amazing burger place. I'm all about sauces and all of their sauces are made from scratch. Roasted garlic aioli, fresh ketchup, jalapeño ranch and spicy hot sauce. Order the truffle fries! The burgers are not too big, not to small. All yummy! The buffalo wings had the best tang to them! I had black bean burger! Delicious!
Dry. Not to order. Awful experience. They will comp your drink if you play their video poker.  But $20 dry nasty burger is awful.  I hope I'm wrong, but avoid this place!!

Love love love it! They have Unami burger in SF and it's yummy there too so since we are staying in the SLS hotel we had to come and try it and it was yummy here too. We loved it SOOO much we Came 2 days in a row for the sunny side burger!! Sooo good! The truffle fries where too much so we got the regular fries the second time. They give you 3 sauces they where delish. Also ordered a strawberry margarita and you can't taste the alcohol but it was still yummy. Very refreshing ..will probably eat here again before we leave

Not a great experience, waitress was in a rush and super rude. I don't suggest this place if your not ready to order as soon as you sit down, also she wouldn't give me a drink until a food order was placed! Just wanted a water

This was probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had!  I came here last week with my family while we were on vacation and staying at the SLS; we wanted a quick bite to eat and decided to stop in here since we'd heard good things.  BIG MISTAKE!  My father, husband and I all got food poisoning despite ordering different things.  My husband ordered the original burger, which he received completely charred despite ordering it medium well.  My father ordered the hot dog, and I had the tuna burger; other members of our party ordered other burgers, and we all shared a bunch of the fries.  To be fair, the friend food tasted mostly okay. My tuna burger was inedible; I expected it to be raw in the middle, but it was inexplicably rubbery and tasteless, too.  

Needless to say, any positive experiences we had (the service was fine, and the prices weren't horrible for what's around, I guess) were completely negated by the fact that half of our party spent the rest of our vacation throwing up and unable to get out of bed.  We all got sick within hours of eating at Umami burger, and none of us had eaten anything else questionable that day, so we are pretty sure of the culprit.  Totally ruined our stay in Vegas!
Had a great time! Perfect for food, football and sunday funday!! Would come back for any sporting event.
This place was amazing, service was outstanding and the food was delicious. Two words: truffle fries!

Great service from greeter to adorable blond server. Original burger plus fries and onion rings. The only criticism is the fries probably came out too soon and therefore weren't hot enough by service.  Great sauces, including ketchup. Could taste the beer in the tempura onion rings.  Homemade pickles on SO burger also a plus. Recommend to go and skip the casino.  That part was totally unimpressive.
Typical Las Vegas burger place. Never been to any of the other locations. Onion rings were on point, buger was decent.  Probably will skip over it in the future unless I stay at SLS.

Cool concept. Give away the kids college fund by eating dinner in a sports book. I like it! Lots of tvs-good atmosphere. The burgers are on the smaller side. No chance of choking here. But the lil guys have tons of flavor. The truffle burger was so good make you wanna go streaking thru the quad. But the beer prices...wow. $10 for a cider? How can you afford to lose your sports bet when you paying that! Def worth a look tho!

I vouched for Umami in my BurGR review, only knowing what existed in LA. Since my visit to Umami in Las Vegas I have gone ahead and altered that. 

It's been years since my visit to a Umami, but I remember the trendy vibe they'd have going on. It's a negative here, it's got the feel of a Hooters.

The sports book? They have a guy in a polo taking bets with lunch order style betting sheets.

The service was moody. One second they smile with your greeting, then they don't at your order taking, then they do when they bring you your food and then they...you get it.

Umami Stuff

The burgers were the only thing that I could close my eyes to and feel like I was on Cahuenga Blvd.

Truffle Burger: The truffle everything gave it a melty taste that faded into your taste buds quite nicely. The meat was cooked how I ordered it. Another solid one at Umami. 4/5

Sliders: I love caramelized onions. So to pack that in a bite size serving was nice. 
The overall was nothing short of what I would expect but nothing above. 3.75/5

Truffle Fries: I'm such a sucker for the word truffle. They were alright. I wouldn't say that their truffle cheese is the best match for everything but the fries were well fried and that didn't hurt the topping. 3.75/5

Boring Review

I felt no energy writing this and it might be because I pictured myself there all over again. The burgers are Umami burgers but the ambiance and service just did not feel like it has in the past at other locations. I would not recommend a stop at Umami Las Vegas but I will say their burgers are a must try. It makes sense, believe me, it makes sense.

After the reviews we were fired up to hit this place up when we rolled into town.  However......after ordering the Hatch burger and the truffle fries we waited forever.  When the food came both items were cold and uninspiring.  After about ten minutes we got the staff to pay attention to us.  We did get replacements for all and the second round of burgers were better.  The fries reminded me of gravy not truffle style, not sure what that was all about.  The 2 stars is due to the fact that they comped us the food.

TIP FOR the PLACE - WARM up the hatch chiles so it doesn't take away from the heat of the burger.

Ok I've been hearing rave reviews about this place so while we were on a staycation I said let's try it! We got it to go and ate in our rooms. The food was packed nicely and I like that they brand their bun. This burger wasn't bad but didn't live up to the reviews. Although they paint a pretty picture with imagery with the description of the "gourmet" ingredients, they actually sound better than they taste. If you want a comparable burger (or better) that live up to the hype. Go to Fukuburger, Bachi burger-or dare I say-Fatburger. Yeah I'd eat fatburger before I eat here again. So overall not a bad burger, but waaaaay over-hyped.

January 30, 2015 Friday - 6:00 PM dinner
2 adults 

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars
Service - 4 stars

Background - Wanted an easy meal and in our hotel.  So I used my open table app to get a table.  After getting their clearly we did not need to.  But I got my points.  I could have made my reservation through my television in my room.

Atmosphere - Huge sports bar.  ESPN radio was taking their stuff out and CBS Sport radio was setting up.  I expected a bigger crowd for 6 PM on a Friday night.  But it made it easier for me.  

Food
  Drinks - Ballast Point Calico in a bottle.

  My Meal
    Main Course - The Hatch, a burger you would expect to have an egg with that name, but it did not.  I think it was the type of green peppers used, but the menu did not call that out.  The meat was cooked to order, and the peppers gave a nice amount of heat.  The bun was soft and held up to burger and toppings.

    Side - Ordered a side of onion rings as everything is a la carte.  Our waitress told us the sides are large and one order would take care of us, and it did.  The onion rings were thick cuts and season well.  They came with three dipping sauces and all were excellent with the onions.  Sorry I do not remember their names, but the middle one had some serious heat behind it, the other was a garlic aioli. 


Service - Out waitress cover a huge portion of the restaurant which made it difficult to flag her down.  But other team members were always helping out.   The only problem was when we wanted to wrap up the bill our waitress was difficult to find, and the manager actually delivered us the bill.

Future - sure.

My server Mandy was Excellent two thumbs up I will go back but only if she is my server simply amazing. You don't get good customer service like that anymore it's was very refreshing. The food was delicious with a great atmosphere.

We had stayed at SLS and were too hungry to head to the strip and decided to try this place. I had the Truffle Burger and it was absolutely amazing!!!!! I seriously cannot remember eating a burger that delicious! The only downsize is the burger is a little on the small side, so if you're really hungry, it will not be enough. And for the price and size, the burgers do not come with fries or anything. I did order the Truffle Fries on the side which were also pretty good. Their fried pickles was okay. The pickles are huge spears, which is hard to share, would be better if they were cut smaller like in slices. Onion rings were good too, the batter was pretty tasty.

The service could have been better. Our server kinda had an attitude problem so we weren't thrilled with that, Honestly though, the food was pretty damn amazing. If the burger was a little bigger than a kids meal size and came with fries I would totally give it 5 stars! So because of that, I will give 4.

Good atmosphere. Been here both for lunch and dinner. Casual. Fun and great place to watch the sporting event of your choice. Oh and the food. Killer fries and a truffle burger that will cause you to screw the diet just to have more of this wonderful-ness on a bun.

I'm not a huge fan of burgers to begin with so that's that. 

I like the size of the burgers because they're all humongous but they get you full. I like the size of the restaurant and how many tvs there are. literally a TV on every table so good if you're a sports fan this would be the perfect place. We stayed at the SLS hotel and deff wanted some food in our system before we continued getting our drank on (based on prior experience) 

We got one order of the normal fries and another order of the fries with cheese on it. * Don't get the cheese on it. The fries are super skinny.

my boyf loved his California burger and I got the burger with the sliced green peppers I think it was in it. My brothers fiancé I'm not sure which one she got she complained about how soggy it was because she added guacamole in it but I mean she finished it soo I'm sure it wasn't too bad. Id come again.

We decided to try this place after checking them out on Yelp, however, must of the reviews here are a little too much. 
When we got there, we were greeted and seated right away. The waitress, I believe her name is Casey was very nice and attentive. Food was good, drinks were on point.Is it like this everyday? Probably not, but be realistic about what you are saying of this location. Most of us that come to Las Vegas is to get away from our reality, have fun, perhaps do new things, pretty much experience something different from our norm. Most of the reviews are correct in a few things like its a sport bar, hundred percent correct. Every food joint is completely different from each other, so don't expect that the wings here are going to top Buffalo Wild Wings or the hamburger is going to top In n Out. We all have a preference, be open minded. Come check them out and be a judge yourself. If you don't like them, great! get some cardio in and walk to In and Out or go the very well known, commercial food joints and enjoy. If you like them, now you know where to come next time.

Reserved a group of tables here for Apple Cup 2017 game. Service was good but prices are much higher than the quality of food & beer. $27+ for a pitcher of beer? Ordered nachos and sweet potato fries. Had to ask for sauces and fries were served with cinnamon/sugar but not described as such on the menu. Interesting sweet twist but was searching for savory. Bill came and was surprised with an unannounced $45 fee to reserve tables. Let me emphasize the place is huge and was empty that day. The servers even remarked they had nothing to do all day. Either the reservation fee should be discussed at time of reservation or waived due to inactivity in the bar so no reservation was necessary. Will not be going back.

I always stay at the SLS when traveling to Vegas. One of my favorite experiences is to stop in at Umami Burger. The staff are always attentive and welcoming. Amanda is usually behind the bar and provides a great guest experience. My suggestion for dining would be the namesake Umami burger and sweet potato fries. It never disappoints.
Ordered food for delivery from our room. We walked over. Order was even started when we arrived. Had to wait an additional 20 min. Never again. Nuff said.

We've been wanting to stop by Umami and try their gourmet burgers in SoCal, so when I saw the Umami Burger Bar at the SLS, I had to give it a try!  The Ahi Tuna burger was so delicious, I brought my hubby the NEXT day before we drove back to CA.

The second lunch was even better than the first! Since we don't eat beef anymore, we split a "Greenbird" (turkey) burger and an Ahi Burger (seared with fresh ginger & wasabi sauce) and both were outstanding. The sweet potato fries were good, although they were more than we could eat.

Mandy was our server and she was great !!   Not only was she super friendly and attentive, she genuinely made sure everything was to our liking and the food was cooked to perfection. She even put our tea's in "to go" containers for our trip home. 

Excellent service and innovative, tasty burgers,..especially for a chain restaurant in Vegas. Umami is definitely worth trying, and we'll be back.

Umami has always been my favorite burger joint since I had it in Santa Monica for the first time. California was always a place I loved to drive but I had to go to umami once I was there. Now Vegas has it at the SLS hotel, of course I ordered the Ahi Tuna Burger and my favorite tempura onion rings! Definitely worth getting. The only thing I'm disappointed about is the service. the ones in California are always busy yet the service is good, but here unless you are a big party be prepared to wait for a bit.

Great place to watch a game with their $2 draft Bud Light Beers and all the widescreen TV's. However, AVOID the chicken wings. They have two varieties, BBQ and spicy, both of which were not so great. Other than that, it was a good ambiance for watching any game.

Terrible experience! This review is for the bar only. Came to the SLS on opening weekend. Went up to the bar that was facing the casino because there were too many people at the main bar. It wasn't too crowded but I stood there for a minute while the douchey bartender flirted with the girls sitting at the bar and poured them free shots. He took my drink order, told me one price then charged my card for a greater amount. When I questioned him he rudely stated "Well I guess I just told you the wrong price." After me expressing that this was not an acceptable answer he proceeded to say "what do you want me to do, give you your money back?" Then pulled a few dollars out of his wallet and threw them at me. Having been to the SLS in Beverly Hills, I was definitely not expecting this type of service. I really expected better and hope that they improve.

I went to an Umami Burger in LA and now I've tried the SLS Hotel Umami Burger in Las Vegas. Great burgers! Totally different vibes! The one in LA didn't have the sports bar component. The Umami in Vegas is located next to the casino of the SLS Hotel. Right beside Katsuya restaurant. Very close distance to the monorail entrance.

The truffle burger was just awesome! I loved the touch of the charred U placed on the top bun. The meat was tender. Branded burger! My mom loved the ahi poke burger.  We split the two burgers in half so we could try both. She took a few bites of the truffle burger and wanted the ahi half back! And I wanted my truffle burger half back as well!

My truffle fries are totally delish! The fries were super thin with some cheese and garnish on top. Very easy to eat. On the other hand, the sweet potato fries were so sweet they should've been dessert! I felt they were overly coated with cinnamon sugar. We actually treated these fries as a dessert at the end of the meal. I found the fries reminded me of the Filipino dessert kamote cue (deep fried caramelized sweet potato).

The service was quick and pleasant. I felt the prices were a little expensive but it is Vegas after all. I ended up spending about $50 for myself and my mom. At the end of the meal the waitress said a new menu was debuting that day! She encouraged us to come back. Next time I'm in Vegas I definitely will!
Casey was amazing.   We insisted on sitting on the patio before it opened.  She came back from break early to serve us.

Was in town on vacation & a friend told me to check it out... Upon arrival one of the managers (Jessica) greeted us and was very accommodating... She went out of her way to make sure all of our needs were met... Very hospitable & the attention to detail was superb... The Truffle burger was out of this world... Extensive beer list quenched my thirst... Will definitely visit again next time I am in town & will highly recommend to friends & family!

Food isn't that great. Had the chicken fingers, truffle fries, and a burger (forgot which one). The chicken fingers were dry and heavily breaded, truffle fries were too saucy, and the burger needed more flavor. The prices for the food and drinks and were too high. Wasnt worth it. The atmosphere was great though. Its a sports book/bar/restaurant in one. There were TVs everywhere with sound. A good place for watching games. I would come back again but not for the food.

This one was located inside SLS hotel, which is just off The Strip. Staff were really friendly and helpful.
The food was better than okay, but not really what I was expecting. We shared the Umami burger and the Truffle Burger, which was my favorite. We also had truffle fries. 
The waiter was so nice! He didn't look weird at us for asking for mayonnaise. 
We sat outside, but the music was so loud that we could barely hear each other speak.
Food was amazing! We especially loved the beet salad and the ahi tuna burger. Our waitress Mandy was wonderful and very helpful about drink selections.

Umami Burger is super accessible within the SLS Las Vegas with plenty of parking. Their garage is huge and I can almost guarantee you'll find a spot. 

Umami itself has a really open feeling and lots of TVs. You'll get lost in many sporting events here. The patio is calling my name and I can't wait until the fall to enjoy some cold ones. 

The food menu is somewhat small, with a few salads and burgers but their beer list is ginormous. Seriously though. It's 3/4 of their entire menu. Awesome. Pour me a cold one! 

Our server was awesome. There were 6 of us and he rattled our orders back to us without writing a thing down. I ordered the Truffle Burger, lettuce wrapped and the plain fries. He asked me what temperature I wanted the burger cooked and I requested medium. The fries are shoestring and I'm a steak fries kind of girl, but they were fries and they tend to be good no matter how large or small. This batch was a bit saltier than I prefer, but I still managed to finish the whole batch. The burger was cooked on the med-rare side, so although it wasn't hitting the spot, I was starving and finished it without complaint.

5 stars goes to Sunny!! Ask for him and he will make sure to go out of his way to provide the best experience ever!! Also we had another server who was phenomenal her name is Saïda and we found out that she was getting trained by Sunny !!

The burgers itself are delicious.. The truffle fries are nothing short of GODLY.

Unfortunately the service was quite the opposite..

the first time we showed up we had placed an order at 11:00PM for a few of their signature jose andrees burgers.

we were standing around waiting, they said they could text us when it was ready so I left my # and we hit the tables. 

a few heaters later, no text.

some more heaters, still no text.

no text, no calls, no texts. you get the point..

we went back and had inquired about our burgers through an employee who said she would go and check, she left.

inquired again through another employee, he left.. never came back.

we saw them bring out several to-go orders and leave them on the bar counter and we had asked if either of them were ours.. the waitress said not yet and she, just like the others said she would go and check.

at around 12:15AM my friend said forget it, he hopped the line and started checking bags. WHAT DO YOU KNOW? our order was sitting on the counter and the completed ticket said 11:30PM.

Our burgers were sitting on the counter for 45 minutes, cold as a pair of rock solid fake silicon implants.

***we asked the girl at the bar, she said sorry, I can get you guys a free round what would you like? **I asked for a Hennessy on the rocks and she said SORRY, ONLY WELL-DRINKS. OR A BEER. I dont want to sound like a snob but keep in mind we paid $40 for two burgers and some FRIES?!?

the manager said sorry, ill see if they can make you a new set. after eating they were just nuked a bit because the bread was softer than a pair of real.. well, nevermind.

he apologized and said if we came back he would take care of us.

we ordered $220 worth of burgers to the rooms and the truffle fries were delicious. we also came back and dined in to watch the sunday games while gambling away our life savings and the waiter wearing the packers jersey on 12/14 was phenomenal.

either way we didnt get the manager, didnt want to be disappointed.

The food was less than average. Overpriced. The bun on the burger was stale. The waitress had no knowledge of beer despite this place being promoted as a "Beer Garden". Even with all the IPAs and other brews on site she suggested a Bud Lite as the best pairing for my meal. Worst dining experience in Vegas.

Umami Burger definitely has a great deal of potential, but it's not anyway good enough to currently compete in the Las Vegas Market. 

First of all, having a waitress who didn't know what a "Manhattan" cocktail was is a bad sign that they are hiring the worst of the worst to work there.

I ordered the Hatch Burger, and from the start when it came out, I was underwhelmed. The food looks a lot better in the photos, and frankly, the preparation of chopping the chills up -- with the seeds still in them -- shows they aren't aware of how to properly prepare a hatch pepper. 

The burger was cold, and nothing about it was remotely hot. The meet had clearly been sitting out by itself, and then the toppings added to make the burger. My client who enjoyed eating there the previous night, also complained about the same thing. 

Clearly the service is not up to par or consistent. Probably will not go back there again.

This is a sit down restaurant that I thought would be amazing since it's new, but my experience include a bunch of drunk guys next to us and very bad service.

The food took forever just for three burgers and it wasn't even busy. When we got our burgers, one of the orders was wrong. It's expensive for really tiny burgers. The lady also took my water and never came back with more water. Literally, they kept offering us free food to make up for their mistakes... it was pretty sad.

I don't think I would ever come back for a "better experience" as the waiter told me.

This place is amazing. I've heard about this place before and always wanted to try it. So happy I did. The food is a la cart. I got the Umami burger and my bf got the Manly burger. Both were so good! We shared the garlic fries which was good and their reserved list of drinks is amazing. Pricy but good. I was able to get a free ice cream sandwich due to a voucher so I got their Strawberry/ chocolate one. I was expecting something similar to a "Neapolitan" sandwich but this was more like ice cream in some donut shape thing. Honestly I like the ice cream part better. And I'm glad I didn't buy that. We loved this place so much we came back for lunch the next day. This time I tried the Chicken sandwich and my bf got the Manly burger again. Wish this place was closer to where I live!

I finally got to go there last night as part of a special event. I've driven by it several times and thought that it looked interesting.  I have to say the food and the service was spot on.  The waiters and bartenders could've have been any nicer.  The California burger which by the way is something I would never eat was to die for and their tater tots  were a meal unto themselves. I will definitely be going back here probably this weekend with friends!

I had high expectations for this place, but it didn't live up to the hype.  
For a 35 minute wait and having to sit out in the heat (even though the were many empty seats inside) the food was not worth it.  
I guess they don't realize how many great burger places we have in vegas.  
Food quality I'd say was better then fast food, but just a bit better then In and Out burgers.  Compared to some place like Bachi Burger, this place seems average. 
Our server was a sweet heart, but I think she was assigned to cover too many tables.  I felt bad for her because I could see her trying to give every one attention but just not being able to keep up.  She wasn't slow either. She was quick and accurate, but there were just too many tables. 
I have to imagine that the LA location must be better then this.

Saw this place on DDD and did not know they had a spot in Vegas until I was using Yelp to find a place to eat.  3.5 stars for the food and 5 stars for the service.  I wish I could remember our servers name but he was very friendly and knew the menu/drink specials inside out.  Finally got to try the Umami burger and may give it another shot this fall.

The food would be 3 stars but the service made it 4 stars.   Our cute waitress Tashja made the meal.  Super friendly and personable, but best of all she knew the menu and made great suggestions.  

The North Boulevard drink was Yummmm...pretty dangerous because you couldn't taste the alcohol but could tell more than one would get you pretty messed up.  Like happy lemonade.  Fried Pickles were great, super crunchy.  

I had the Ahi Tuna burger...yes, I went to a burger joint for tuna.  It was very good.  

Hubby had Turkey burger which he thought tasted a little weird.  Just eh.

Sandwiches are definitely not very big as others have said.

Great burgers and service. Tashja did a great job with her service to us, she was awesome to work with! I can't wait to come back to this restaurant just because of her! What an experience!! Thanks Tashja!

Dont go to this restaurant. The food taste like a plastic. And also it is expensive for nothing. Trust me guys even if you are very drunk you will not like it. And also the salad smell like nail polish. Out of 10 I say 1/2 why? Because too many Tv's. Macdonalds is waaay better

Great for watching the game. Had the "manly"   burger, tasted good. very juicy and had alot of flavor. Truffle fries were good as well. Atmosphere was good considering we brought both our young children.  Over all, would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good burger and a place to watch the game.
Great drinks, service and food.  Truffle fries. Yum.   Courtney did a great job!

This was my visit to SLS after much reluctance and disinterest on my part and it was even more lackluster than I expected. 

We came to Umami Burger on a Monday night during Monday Night Football. The place was packed and loud, but we were seated quickly. The table was a little dirty and the sad little paper menus were stained, too. 

I ordered the Jose Andres burger and a side of fries to share with my mom. The burger was a good size, but I didn't like anything about it. The meat was only good around the edges and the texture was a stringy, fatty and greasy. The flavors were just not what I was hoping for and was incredibly bland. The fries were even worse. They were dry, overcooked and flavorless. 

I didn't enjoy a thing about anything I ate at Umami Burger. Even worse than the food was the service. Our waiter practically whispered every word to us and made no effort to speak up when it was clearly noisy from the football shenanigans happening around the restaurant. Refills were slow, condiments were in tiny portions and offered nothing to enhance the flavors of anything. 

I don't have any interest in trying this place again.

Came in for a drink but decided to grab some food as well. I started with the black razzmojito, so good! Then ordered some sweet potato fries and the simple salad. Lauren was a fantastic server and had a great personality! Ask for her if you are planning a visit!

Sent to eat here with my family.  1st of all they had a locals discounts for 50% off. Well it only works on certain days and weekends, but know one knows when. We had 13 people and 9 were locals!! food was average. Only good thing was the truffle fries.

Food is great! Love the indoor
Outdoor area. Staff was polite and great attitude. Enjoyed our meal, the ambiance and the game!

I returned into town with a couple of my girlfriends for a birthday. We had a last minute dinner our party of 8 walked in and the hostess was able accommodate our party in a large comfortable booth. We had the Nachos and Cheesy Tots to start off with, along with a 100oz beer tower to top of a hot summers day! Our burgers came out at perfect medium rare temperature. The server was amazing. The manager checked on our table as well even sent out a birthday shot for our friend! Can't wait to return again!
The food was good the food was slow to get to the table and a bit over priced so I won't go back but the combination of flavors was a good experience and I'm glad I went
